description:
Customer service matters.  

In town on a business trip to San Francisco, before heading to SFO, I stopped by Super Duper Burger. 

While ordering, I was greeted by the kindest, most spirited manager (Super Duper Burger located at 783 Mission). Her name was Nancy. From the moment she took our order, she just had a glow that often times is lacking at fast-paced retail establishments...

I told Nancy about how my 10 year old son keeps a stack-ranked list of his favorite burgers, with Super Duper Burger consistently as #1, since the family trip to SF in 2015. Her eyes lit up and I could immediately see just how much she not only appreciated the story and my son's passion for her burgers, but she clearly took pride in where she works and to her customer experience matters. 

Nancy proceeded to serve our order and then asked me to wait for her while she got something. She came back with not only a stack of free vouchers but also a #12 order beeper (#12 is my son's soccer number) with the biggest smile and look of joy on her face. 

As my business partner and I finished our glorious burgers, I couldn't help but feel the great vibes Nancy sent to me and my son -- as a result Super Duper Burger is at the top of my customer experience list.
author: Preston J.

description:
We came on a Sunday around 2pm so we probably missed the lunch crowd.  It's a step above a fast food burger joint.  Nice vibe inside with good music.  It's pretty cramped inside and all the tables were full (I guess that's a good sign. Because it means that the food is good) so we got lucky that not many people know that there's a small loft upstirs with tables for additional seating.

We ordered 2 super burgers which consisted of 2 8oz patties with lettuce, mayo, secret sauce, tomato, cheese, grilled onions and bacon (additional charge for cheese $0.75 and bacon $1.25) and it was worth it.  We ordered another super burger with cheese but this one without bacon on ciabatta bread because the hamburger bun had sesame seeds and I'm highly allergic.  I also asked them to cut it in 1/2 because I was sharing this was my daughter and the full burger portion is pretty big.  The burgers did not disappoint - it was so juicy and the taste was really good.  If you're looking for a way to eat this burger without getting messy, there isn't one.  The juices just oozed out of the burger.   We also ordered the garlic fries $3.50 (and heck yeah it was soooooo good) made with lots of garlic and aged cheese...  you can definitely taste the garlic.  And an order of regular fries (which was just the right amount of crispiness) so me just right.  We didn't order any drinks but was given plastic cups for ice water.  

The condiment station had ketchup, mustard and pickles (those pickles were super tasty!). 

The burgers were better than what I imagined it would be.  Way better than Shake Shack (which I think is way overpriced and not filling).  I'd rank it a step above In-N-Out.

All in all, a good burger for $8.25 (plus $0.75 for the cheese and $1.25 for the bacon)  so a total of $10.25 without paying for the gourmet price at a restaurant and in the city, that's a deal.  We spent $48 for lunch - not too shabby.

I'm glad our hotel concierge recommended this place.  It was within walking distance (about 2 blocks) from where we were staying at The Intercontinental Hotel.
author: Ann C.

description:
Overall a very good burger experience. I was in San Francisco for a very short trip and since my stomach was still on east coast time I stopped in at around 3 PM on a Sunday. This place was packed! I certainly didn't expect to wait 15 minutes for my food but on the other hand that's a really good sign about the food if the place is crowded at 3 PM. 

The burger was very good just heed the warning on the packaging, "this could get messy" and it did. A very juicy burger that was really satisfying. The fries were okay, actually reminding me of fries from that huge world burger chain. Not necessarily a bad reference but the fries didn't stand out to me. 

I was a little unhappy that they were out of tea at 3 PM in the afternoon. They just don't understand what a tea addict I am; perhaps tea is not as widely loved here as it is from my neck of the woods. 

Great burger and I recommend you give this place a try.
author: William R.

description: Have been meaning to try burgers here for a long time and was very disappointed with the outcome! I hope it was because we got burgers to go but everybody about the burgers and fries were mediocre. There was nothing remarkable. The fries were soggy with large unmelted chunks of cheese and garlic. The burgers were extremely greasy. It was a pretty disappointing experience given my high expectations.
author: Yin H.

description: I recently visited Super Duper Burgers for the first time! I really like their hamburger buns because they're crispy/firmer on the outside and soft inside. (In n out's are a bit too soft in my opinion) the burger in general is good, standard. We also ordered the garlic fries but the cheese was not melted and it came out as an entire chunk. There's a ton of oil as well.
author: Jennifer Y.

description:
It's not In and Out, but they deliver an awesome burger. Super juicy and fresh.  You can even add an egg to your burger! The best part about this place is the Free Ayce homemade pickles. Best burger in the city. 

It gets very busy here at lunch, so be prepared for a wait. 

As a treat get yourself a chocolate dipped cone or one of the rich thick creamy milkshakes.
author: Joanne T.

description:
Stumbled across this location on the way to SFMOMA a couple weekends ago and was pretty impressed. Even though they have a couple of locations around the Bay Area, I've never seen or heard of this chain prior to my visit.

I ended up getting the Super burger, garlic fries, and a kid's size Oreo shake. For the price you can probably get a larger burger somewhere else, but I found the patty to be well seasoned and grilled perfectly to a medium rare. The fries weren't overly oily or salty but they were a bit dry. I definitely could have demolished a full sized shake, but the kid's size is great if you just want to have a taste to soothe the sweet tooth. 

Overall, I enjoyed my visit to Super Duper Burgers. The location was clean, staff was friendly, and was in and out feeling full and satisfied.
author: Josh H.

description: LOVEDDDD this burger place. Went with a big group. I ordered the veggie burger and garlic fries and there's not much else to say. Burger was fantastic and the garlic fries were a big hit at my table. Only thing is, seating can be tight but you may have luck upstairs. Would def check out if I'm in the area again.
author: Nika B.

description:
Came to eat here during Pride Weekend around lunch time.  They were super busy and yet their organization and system they have situated was proof of what ended up being a really decent experience.
There were a ton of employee's working the kitchen, a few were working the front registers, and one girl was trying to maintain the restaurant in keeping it clean ( A feat inevitably impossible for one poor girl during a crazy weekend event).  Nevertheless, the fact the employees stayed busy, stayed friendly, and really tried to keep a good experience for their guests really made me happy.
Of course their burgers were amazing.  I always get the Super Duper Burger w/cheese which is an extra 75 cents.  

I have gone to their other location where I did enjoy their burger very much, but the only issue I had was just how liquid greasy it was.  Here at this location the burger was not nearly as greasy and a lot more enjoyable, Kudos to the cooks here.  But in all honesty, whichever location you end up eating at, these burgers are definitely one of the better burgers you are going to get in the Bay Area.  Very filling, juicy, and comforting to eat!
We usually get the garlic fries with 3 different dipping sauces to choose from.  I enjoy the variety of sauces a lot!  I'm not sure i'm a big fan of the cheesy garlic fries though.  they are always also pretty greasy and usually end up ditching the cheese loaded on them anyways.  I guess if you are a cheese lover you'll enjoy this dish lol.
author: Tori G.

description:
I love me a good burger! Came here cos it was convenient and they have garlic fries. The fries were delicious! I got the mini burger while my hubs got the regular. The parties were juicy but the buns seemed kind of dry and you couldn't taste the sauce in the burger. 
This location had a loft seating area which was cool. The 2 bathrooms could be cleaner and there were no baby changing stations :(
author: Audrey C.

description:
This location is conveniently located near the Metreon theatre which is great for a quick bite before dinner and a movie date night. Don't let the casual environment here fool you. The burgers here are divine! So juicy and tasty. You can never go wrong with having a cheeseburger here. I normally get a combination which comes with burger and fries. I also load up on pickles that you can help yourself to. 

Some times, if I'm feelin' frisky, I order a beer to wash everything down. I also love their chocolate dipped soft serve ice cream cone.
author: Simon S.

description:
This review is solely for their soft serve cones!

Their signage in the front of the store totally suckered me in tonight, this location is conveniently located right front of the hotel i was staying at during my trip, so before going back into the room i decided hey why not?

The soft serve was a total BUST!

Imagine the soft serve you make yourself at your local Souplantation.. pretty sums it all up. Not to mention these things were hella expensive! Nearly $8 for two cones.. jeeze total rip.

So if you're like me and are huge fans of cheap & good soft serve cones... stick with McDonalds & IKEA!
author: Steven H.

description:
Super Duper is one of my go-to lunch places. It is fast, the food is delicious, and the prices are reasonable. I'd recommend this place to anyone.

The food, mostly burgers and sandwiches, are extremely flavorful and everything is reasonably priced for San Francisco (less than or about $10). French fries are delicious, and I love eating them with the chipotle sauce that you can get. Although I generally get the chicken sandwich, I like the idea of the mini burger combo. They have a couple of flavors for the mini burgers that sound really good (Caesar, 4-cheese, and a couple more). The employees are always nice, and your meal is always prepared quickly, even when the lines are long. Super Duper also has breakfast sandwiches and milkshakes (can get them spiked). There is usually plenty of seating, except maybe during big conferences, but even then you can usually find something in a few minutes or worst case sit inside the Metreon food court or Yerba Buena park.
author: Kristin A.

description:
Breakfast review:

For $5, they whip up a very good egg sandwich with bacon and cheese. It's a little less $$ and better meal if you swap out the cheese n bacon for avocado. 

They also offer sausage on the egg sandwich. 

Importantly, Super Duper FRIES on a griddle the egg they serve in their breakfast sandwiches and that by itself is worth a full star in the world of SF breakfasts where the eggs on sandwiches are perennially microwaved sponges. 

Not much else on offer here at brkfst, except coffee but you can probably get better coffee nearby.
author: Lanny B.

description:
I've basically been assuming Super Duper Burgers is the Shake Shack of San Francisco (Except they also have In-and-Out?). They're EVERYWHERE. Every time I walked a few blocks, there was a Super Super Burgers. 

I finally caved and went in on a Friday afternoon for lunch. You order at the counter, get a buzzer, and then pick up your food. The food comes out pretty fast. 

I had a cheeseburger with onion fries and a swirl shake. Probably too many calories in one go, but I was super hungry. I didn't really have breakfast that morning and it was about 1:30pm by then. I ate everything. 

The burger was good - not super, but good. The fries were the best. The shake was also really good. 

They also use Sir Kensington's ketchup, which is nom.
author: Michelle T.

description:
I haven't yet had their burgers but if they're anywhere as good as their breakfast sandwiches, you're definitely in the right place!

TLDR;
Breakfast Sandwiches: Tasty, hot + fast!  Get double bacon!
Soft Serve: Delicious, rich and creamy -- almost custard! Get it dipped!

----

I was in SF for the RSA conference and between all the hotels and the Moscone Center, there aren't that many places where you can pop in, quickly get a breakfast sandwich and then be on your way.  There are people that need securing!

Super Duper Burgers caught me with a storefront sign with "NOW SERVING BREAKFAST" and like a moth drawn to the bug zapper, I floated in the front door.

Ordering is standard for fast-casual.  Order, get a number, get called up, get food, insert into mouth slot.

The food itself was surprisingly good.  Maybe it's because I went in with low expectations but it was hot and fresh and not super greasy.  The next day they even grilled up some Jalapenos to go on the breakfast sandwich.  Apparently it's not common for breakfast but they rocked it.

Read between the lines: It was good enough that I went back the next day!

I also got their soft serve because I'm an ice cream hound and their cones did not disappoint.  It was cold, rich and creamy.  Almost rich enough to be a custard.  Of course I got that noise dipped in chocolate.  YOLO.

Anyway, it's cheap, fast, and super tasty.  Reminds me of P. Terry's in Austin.
author: Dan K.

description: My go-to location is on Market Street but after a date night watching Kevin Hart's "Night School", we decided to grab a quick bite to eat. I was really disappointed since both our burgers were drenched in grease. Usually when I have Super Duper whether it is the one in the Marina or the one on Market, it's a nice, juicy burger. I couldn't even finish this mini burger. Pls refer to my photo attached.
author: Vanessa Y.

description: This was my first visit to San Francisco and Super Duper Burger. I ordered a Super Duper Burger with cheese, and a side  garlic fries. They were amazing! Highly recommend
author: Gabrielle H.

description:
How can you go wrong with Super Duper? Fresh burgers, great pickles, plenty of seating. (I mean I do prefer In n Out, but alas those don't really exist in the city.) 

This super duper can get a pretty hefty line, but service is normally pretty quick, and straightforward. Burgers are wonderful and juicy, and fries are quite crispy, but not standout. The PICKLES THO, I'm obsessed with them, I can eat a whole little tray of them with 1 burger because they're just that good. 

Overall, great place to satisfy your burger craving for a great price.
author: Sophie W.

description:
How I miss coming to eat here at Super Duper! My last time here was when I used to work inside the Metreon food court. My first encounter with Super Duper was at Castro location with my son back in 2009. Now they are spread out all around SF downtown. Our family wanted to hang around the Metreon (Yerba Buena). My husband, kids and I were hungry. So we dropped by here last Thursday.

The price did went up a bit since the last time we were here. I remember we paid about $9.50 for a mini combo and now is $10.50. Cashier is very cool and patient with us. Ordered 2 mini combos with cheese. Lettuce, tomatoes, onions and sauce included. I sub mines for garlic fries and paid 75 cents difference. Got two soft drinks also with the combo. Our son didn't want anything besides fries and a kids malt milkshake. 

The guys at the front counter are friendly and always had a smile on their face. They are courteous and kind. I ask for a small plastic cup for my daughter to get her some water. I didn't want a glass just in case she drops it. 

4/5 our burgers was a lil oily but it was still tasty. The meat is cooked medium rare which is recommended. When I was preggo with my daughter I requested to be cooked well done before. Which is also an option for those who can't eat medium rare meat. 

5/5 fries are the bomb! I wish they had more aged cheese sprinkled on it. The reg. Fries are good too. It is not soggy or oily. The texture have a crunch to it. I went and grabbed some homemade pickles at the self serve counter. I actually went back up for a second time. IT WAS JUST THAT GOOD.

Would def come back but, not for awhile. Couldn't afford to eat a meal for two for over $20.
author: An C.

description:
Every time yo girl's in SF, she gotta stop by a Super Duper Burgers location. Delicious melt-in-your-mouth beef patties and crispy shoestring fries... Low carb dieting, be damned! Real talk, SDB has got to be one of my favorite burger joints of all time. Decent prices, quality (read: flavorful) ingredients, friendly staff, and quick turnaround time during busy hours keeps me coming back again and again.

My go to order is: a Super Duper Burger (2x4 oz beef patties) protein style with jack cheese and alllllll the veggies! Skip the bun so you can save the carbs and calories for the crispy and freshly cut fries! Cheers~
author: Christina T.

description:
The only thing Super Duper about this place is its' mediocrity.  I spent a little over $14 to have a combo meal which would've cost around $6 at the local Wendy's.  

First off, I will say the staff was excellent and deserve 5 stars.  All of them very nice and attentive.  I wish there was a way to rate different aspects of service on Yelp.

The 2 stars is strictly for the food.  I love hamburgers.  I've eaten a lot of them.  I had seen Super Duper Burgers on the Yelp map a couple of visits ago to SF and finally decided to go in.  I thought w/ all the great reviews this place had.......I had to check it out myself.  I'm just not sure what people see or taste at this establishment because it just didn't do it for me.

The hamburger was about the size of Wendy's Single burger, just a tad bit wider.  I'll give them credit, it did taste fresh, but that's all.  There just wasn't a "WOW" factor to this burger at all.  No spectacular taste or sauce that stood out.  Nada. Even the bacon I had added in was stiff as a board.

I did upgrade the fries to garlic fries due to the amount of good reviews I had read about them.  Nada, again.  Yes, they tasted like garlic, but it wasn't even a fantastic garlic taste.  One thing that stood out for the fries was they were very crispy -- I'll give them credit for that because I do love crispy fries.  I'll honestly say, the limited-run garlic fries McDonalds produces every so often have a better taste, so wait for those to come out again if you want garlic fries.  

Super Duper Burgers, I really wanted to like you guys based on the Yelp reviews.   Unfortunately, it's just not going to happen.  I'd have to say based on my visit, I'd rather go spend $4.00 less and go to Burger King.
author: Miss C A.

description:
I usually goto the super duper in Castro, always have had great service, hot food. Tonight went to a movie, and new we weren't going to make it to the one in Castro so stopped in. Unfortunately two of us have allergies, but usually I get mine plain, and he does no dairy. My super burger came with cheese, sauce, and all the fixings, his burger came plain. At first no big deal we just took my patties and switched the buns. 

 Well half way threw I started to get that itch in my mouth, and my tongue started to swell a little. My fault because I thought tasted  a little onion which I can't eat, but continued to eat. So I stopped, the opened up the patties and sure enough we had a lot of onion on it. So we weren't able to finish our meals as we had to leave. But all they offered was to re make our food, when all I wanted to do was get home and take a pill. So we were out $25, as our friends were to as they left with us. Think we will be giving super duper a break.
author: Cory T.

description: Veggie burger review: top notch as always. Standard taste across various branches. Fries and ice cream is yummy too
author: Saranyaa V.

description:
A group of friends and I were starving after we made our way through SFMOMA. I had heard a little bit about Super Duper Burgers but didn't really know quite what to expect.

I'm not one of those people who are a ride-or-die shake shack or in n out person but I feel like super duper burger is a great contender.

I got the mini burger which was the perfect size. The super sauce was delicious and really added to the perfectly cooked patty. I added bacon to top it off and next time will definitely be adding avocado. French fries were delicious. Free pickles if that's your thing (as it is not mine.)

The location itself was great, really close to the museum and had plenty of setting. Food was up quick and tasted fresh.
author: Stephen P.

description:
I am super duper sure you are going to love these burgers! 

Every time I come here, I get the Super Duper Burger with cheese (75¢), grilled onions (free!), a nice tall plastic cup of water, and about 10 sheets of paper towels. 

Each bite is so flavorful with a mix of fresh ingredients, juicy meat, and very VERY good sauce. Unfortunately, this leads to a rather messy experience (hence the paper towels), but a few minutes of saucy fingers and about $9.00 is a small price to pay for such a wholesome dining experience!
author: Jatin N.

description: This place is great lines are long but they have the expectation right in the front 8 minutes until ordering food is made fresh and delivered swiftly. I had the burger with grilled onions and fries. The burger tasted fresh and probably grass fed meat so said that now in our society that's something you have to ask or wish for but here its delivered. Food presentation is beautiful fries were no e and hot and even cones with dipping options for an additional fee. Nice variety of food they even have fresh donuts, milkshakes and ice cram cones absolutely loved the food and service came to eat out with the team will be bank had the Oreo milkshake which was awesome with cookie crumbs on the top
author: Bettina C.

description:
Three words: Super Duper Delicious. 

Their fries were cooked to perfection and the patty (medium cooked) was juicy and did not make the buns soggy at all; especially with their super duper sauce. YuMmMmmmMMMmmm. They have pickle jars on their condiment tables so feel free to grab as many as you like! The pickles did taste just a little spicy but it still tasted oh so good. 

Super Duper Burger is a great burger joint if you're around the area or if you're willing to walk a few blocks from Union Square after a day of shopping or sight seeing. It's also walking distance from SF MoMA, Yerba Buena Gardens, etc. 

During my visit, the place was pretty packed so I am assuming this is an SF favorite, or like my friend called it, "basic." Lol. Basic or not, I see why this is a possible SF favorite. They have other items on their menu such as: breakfast (only from 8AM to 11AM), chicken sandwich, veggie burger, organic shakes (which I wish I ordered, too!), garlic fries, beer, salads, and ice cream. Silly me, I didn't order an egg to go on top of my patty. *face palm* and *sad face*
So if you are an egg-fanatic, get the egg on your patty for that #EggPorn. 

*Giving this place 5 stars even though it was my first time, because after that first bite of my burger and fries, I knew I would be coming back here when I visit Union Square again.
author: Rachel C.

description: Super Duper burgers have multiple locations very close to each other. This one is near the Meteron theatre. The location is cheerful, employees are nice. Don't' be fooled with people waiting for food. They have additional seating above the counter. Menu is short and sweet. Had the veggie burger and impressed wit the crispiness of the patty which usually at most places is done half heartedly. Serving portion was good and packing was nice. Garlic fries were out of this world. Thoroughly enjoyed the hot fries. The only way they can top it is serving it with some spicy mayo. Chocolate milkshake was a wonderful ending. Overall - excellent food and reasonably priced.
author: Nilesh C.

description: This place is so good! I love love love the fries here, I think their seasoning is so incredibly delicious. I ordered the superduper burger with everything on it including cheese and onions and brought it home with me to eat. He traveled well and didn't get soggy or anything like that which is normally a concern of mine when I take burgers to go. Although the burger was really good, it did have a really thick Patty compared to all the other toppings or condiments that are in the burger. Every time I would take a bite it was mainly one thick medium well Patty but I didn't feel like there were any lettuce or tomatoes or pickles or whatever in the bite. Even the but was slightly thin compared to the thickness of the meat on the inside. I don't know if anyone else experienced this this was just my opinion.  Other than this, the flavor of the meat was really good and the veggies fresh and crisp. I really love this place and I'm for sure coming back!
author: Alejandra A.

description: No line at all and waited almost 30 minutes for a cold burger with the cheese partially melted. I deserve a refund. I tried to call and its just a recording saying they're super busy. I wasted my time and money here
author: wayz W.

description: This location is just ok. It's always busy with at least 10-15 people deep - waiting to order. Today we ordered 1 mini meal combo with cheese, upgraded soda to a strawberry milkshake SPIKED (they use GIN) and upgraded to garlic fries. 1 super duper meal combo with cheese, upgraded to garlic fries. The food is to be expected. Hot, Fast and ready to serve but this time the burgers and fries were LUKE warm and sorta on the soggy side and EXTRA greasy. The only saving grace was the hot patty and the bit of char flavor after being fried to a oblivion. The spike strawberry milkshake delivered. It's not a lot of liquor to kill your taste buds but just enough to change the taste of the strawberry milkshake. A nice finish to compared to the poor soggy food we ate.
author: Martine D.

description:
This is another Super Duper location, located near Target. I am quite surprised by the consistency of the locations I have visited so far, if I end up trying a third location and the burgers are just as good, I will be quite impressed with the Super Duper chain.

Had the ice cream here, and that wasn't all that great because it kind of felt like just a regular soft-serve ice cream dipped in chocolate, something McDonalds could probably do. That said, the burgers themselves were just as excellent as always.
author: Tyler T.

description:
Not so super. Greasy and burnt. I was very disappointed. I've cooked burgers professionally for decades and it's really not that difficult to cook a non-greasy burger. Greasy burgers means you're using crappy meat.

Regarding response from owner: thanks for the info but the fact remains the burger was greasy. "Juicy" is a great euphemism for that.
author: Paul A.

description:
It was my first time trying Super Duper and I was beyond excited except my experience here was kind of just okay. 

I ordered the mini burger with cheddar cheese and an order of garlic fries for $10.58. Kind of on the pricier side. The patty was definitely juicy and great but the overall burger was pretty greasy. The tomatoes, lettuce, and onions tasted pretty fresh though. The super sauce wasn't anything special in my opinion. It was kinda of sour but it wasn't bad. 

The garlic fries were extremely greasy and I could not finish it because it was drenched in oil. It did have a nice garlic flavor but the amount of oil there was just turned me off. 

Their ketchup sauce was pretty interesting. I think it was cocktail sauce or something ? It was pretty good though. Their service was fast and speedy. 

Overall I wouldn't come back unless someone else wanted us to go there to eat.
author: Cecilia Y.

description: Customer service sucked and employees were rude.  Evidently u get 2 free sauces with each order..... doesn't matter if you're ordering for 1 person or 4 and it's either $.75 or $1.50 for each additional sauces so make sure u order separately for each person
author: Mark A.

description:
Burgers yes, super duper not so much.  The homemade pickles were yummy and the burger while juicy did not have a lot of flavor on its own and depended on the condiments.  

The garlic fires were greasy and not crisp. The trio of sauces were really indistinguishable from each other and a waste of money. 

The Sir Kensington's brand ketchup was tasty; savory without being too sweet and definitely a flavorful friend to the burger.
author: Cindy G.

description:
I'm vacationing in SanFran while my husband is attending a conference and Super Duper came highly rated by our vegetarian friends as a place to check out while we're on the west coast. We were thrilled to have one right by our hotel and stopped by for a late night snack after a couple (ok maybe more) drinks.

As a new-ish vegetarian, I'm still sort of skeptical of veggie burgers but these were out of this world good. Lots of texture and cradled between 2 fluffy buns, hummus, and veggies. Sir Kensington condiments make ALL burgers better, and the garlic crow will probably defend me from vampires for days. Super Duper is living up to its name!
author: Nicole A.

description:
Delicious!
SDB was able to accommodate my low carb/Keto requests of a double burger with no bun, no veg, jack and bleu cheeses, and bacon. My go-to place in SF for a quick bite!
author: Stacey L.

description:
I'm so stupid. I went on a dinner run for me and my coworker during an event we were doing in Union Square. I thought the "other" Super Duper location was closer, so I went there, only to realize that it closed at 8:00 PM. Grr!

I power-walked to the Metreon Super Duper, and it was pretty crowded, but the line moves fast. For the amount of customers they get on a daily basis, they have such a well-oiled machine here. Ordering is easy (couldn't figure out how to place my order online) and I had our food within 10 minutes.

The mini burger (with garlic fries, of course) is just the right amount of food for me. Usually I get the chicken sandwich, but I was in the mood for beef this time. I'd also come here for an ice cream cone before. 

Service is always friendly, and there's plenty of seats, though they fill up fast. There's always outdoor seating around the Metreon, so definitely take advantage if there's nice San Francisco weather.
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Another Dreamforce lunch spot that totally hit the spot... 

This is only the second SDB location that I've visited but it's good to see that there's consistency in their food.  Mini burger was great.  The fries are still meh.  The chocolate Shake was amazing.  Still no Onion Rings... booooooo.  

They did a great job serving the mass of "Dreamforcers" that invaded downtown SF for the last 4 days and who were desperate for tastier lunch options.  

The restaurant is Efficient, Clean and Delicious.

Way to go SDB!!!

P2P = Awesome
author: Robb M.

description:
Great juicy burgers!  Pickles are not out on the burgers, you have to get those from the side counter where you get ketchup and mustard.  The pickles are awesome!  

What did I learn today?  I was comfortably full and then I ordered a milkshake.  That pushed me over the edge.  It was not a frozen as I would have wished for.
author: Ryan C.

description: Was visiting this weekend and we found this place online with great reviews so we rushed over for lunch. We ordered the Vegetarian burger with avocado with fries and it was the best we have had. The fries were hot and crispy. The texture was firm with the burger and it held up with the lettuce, tomato, hummus.  Simply worth the trip.  You can't go wrong here.
author: Keith M.

description:
A solid branch of a popular and increasingly prolific local burger chain. The burgers might look a tad teensy given the $8 that you're paying for a super burger, but you are in fact getting two juicy slabs of fresh beef that are sourced from local ranches that use humane practices and vegetarian feed. Combined with the other ingredients, this is quite satisfying, dependable, filling stuff. 

As if it wasn't all going to add a satisfying several inches to your waistline, they also serve scrumptious breakfast sandwiches as well as enjoyable shakes (although not the best I've had). Nevertheless, the burgers are the main go-to here, so if you're looking for something fast, fresh, filling, and dependable, Super Duper has it down pat.
author: Vincent L.

description:
Legit juicy delicious burgers! The garlic fries are better than AT&T stadium fries IMHO. Get the mini burger with cheese and bacon or the veggie burger which is super delish even thought I'm not a vegetarian! 
The shakes are awesome and not to thick of a consistency so totally drinkable through a straw! I love their food to say the least! However, the wait can be long especially when it's busy. The wait on average is 15-20 min and sometimes longer if you go during their lunch rush.
author: Kay H.

description: The burger patties are extremely juicy and can cause a mess. But that's what makes Super Duper Burgers great. I like how many options you have to customize your burger: from adding an egg to replacing the buns with lettuce (esp. if you're on keto).
author: Andrew Y.

description:
The best hamburger in town!!!!!
Perfectly seasoned and so juicy. Would give six stars if I could!
author: Kevin P.

description: Love this spot! I usually just go for the mini burger with cheese because it's the perfect amount for me. The burger is delicious and well seasoned! I enjoy the garlic fries a lot too, the fries are covered in cheese (I like cheese) and have the perfect hint of garlic! Overall, Super Duper Burger is always a great joint to come to when I'm in SF and I want a burger!
author: Kayla V.

description: Vegetarians rejoice! No longer will you be served thawed black bean patties (not here anyway). Garlic fries are a must, although would have preferred them a bit less oily. Fantastic ambience and quick service. Also very cool location, perfect to grab a quick bite between downtown shopping.
author: Ameya J.

description:
Ok so five stars as far as fast food joints go... I walked in, ordered a burger with garlic fries and left completely satisfied. The burger was fresh and full of flavor. The smaller of the two burgers is more than enough and I actually prefer it over the larger one. 

While you wait for your order they have a counter with homemade pickles. They are spicy and pack a bit of a punch. I end up eating wayyy too many of them as I wait but, who cares... they are pickles! 

They have plenty of seating, great burgers and unlimited homemade pickles... cheap and delicious!
author: Michael P.

description:
Best veggie burger in town!!

Love their,
1) Sunny side up
2) Chocolate swirl with chocolate dip cone ice cream
3) Fresh lemonades

Don't forget their dipping sauces!!

For meat lovers, they have all organic & grass fed varieties. Especially there double patty hamburgers are quite popular.
author: Deebs M.

description:
Oh man, this spot was delightful.  I'm not from San Francisco, I'm from Dallas... so we don't have any of these around us.  I didn't even know it was a chain at first until I started looking up more info about it.

Anyway, the food there is so freaking good.  I didn't know if I'd like it because I thought maybe it'd just be another boring burger, but it was not.  We ordered a mini burger with fries.  Decided we would just share.  Sharing is nice and all, but I think I would have liked my own burger due to how good it tasted.  The patty was juicy, the toppings were fresh, and the bun was soft.  The french fries were crispy, but also soft... just like I like them.  Some of the best fries I've had the pleasure of eating.

Basically, this place was dope and worth checking out. I'd be back if I lived near one.  Definitely going to come back the next time I'm out there.
author: Kacey R.

description:
I had never tried Super Duper burgers before until I moved to San Francisco for college.

For vegetarians, I love this place because you are able to feel like anyone else eating a delicious veggie burger! It is very busy like any other place to eat on market street! So wait can take a bit and sitting area is limited but I have never had an issue finding a table. 

I love this place! Although I do not frequent it often, it is a good place to grab a bite to eat
author: Nathalie M.

description:
On a trip from LA, and wanted to try some burgers in San Fran. Randomly ran into this place.

Great, great burgers. Freshly cooked, and well made. Very tasty burgers. Definitely would go back.
author: Adan M.

description:
What can I say that hasn't been said? It's friggin awesome. Juicy burgers. Fried onions on request. Interesting optional sauce. French fries that taste like they are made from an actual vegetable with vitamins. And unlimited spicy pickles. Wow. Don't you want some now?

My ho to is a mini bacon cheeseburger with fried onions. The chicken sandwich is also memorable.

If only it wasn't always louder than bombs.
author: Tim P.

description: Delicious burger... Reasonably priced all things considered.  Pickles are really good too.
author: Justin J.

description:
This one is close to the city college downtown campus. Good location to have a burger after class!
.
I ordered the mini combo. Including a drink, small burger and a small (midden) fires. The burger is really good! Juicy and fresh! More than better to add a bacon!
author: Yantong Z.

description:
I don't know why people rave about this place. I finally tried their meal and their burger is so greasy. I don't know if it's because they butter their bread or not, but everything felt and tasted really greasy and soggy. It was seeping through the wrapper and onto my hands. It was messy to eat. Their garlic fries are pretty good; tastes like any other garlic fries I've had though. 
The upstairs area at this place felt hot; not a comforting warm feeling from the rain but almost like unbearable heat. 
I'm going to stick with in n out burgers and fries from now on.
author: Kristin H.

description: Firstly, Siri gave us janky directions that had us walking all over the place. So we got there tired and sweaty and of course irritable cause we were hungry. The place is small and cramped and very loud. Nowhere to hang your bag and strangers are all in your business. Very greasy burgers but good tasting and homemade pickles are a plus. Wouldn't go back but glad to have tried it once.
author: Sanaa H.

description:
Coworkers and locals suggested I try super duper for burgers. Its another fancier burger joint to add the growing list of fancier burger chains, I.e. Shake shack, in and out, 5 guys. 

So I tried it. Meh. I got a mini burger and garlic fries. I don't get the appeal. The burger is ok. It's kinda salty. I can't even taste their special sauce. Biggest downside is the burger is not cooked evenly. See the pic I posted. One side of burger is pink and other part of patty is cooked through. Not appealing. First of all I didn't ask for med rare. And second, I don't feel that comfortable eating a pink burger from a chain. 

Garlic fries are pretty good though. Good hint of garlic flavor and plenty of cheese. 

I wouldn't come here again. Better than McDonalds, but not the top pic among all the fancier burger places available.
author: Jen B.

description: Tasty burger (took the super one), suprisingly great fries. Get a few free pickles as a side.
author: Pascal F.

description: Best burger and love the spicy homemade pickles. I know there shakes and ice cream are good but i haven't had it. Reasonably priced and so delicious. Get the combo!
author: Amanda K.

description:
EVENT: We're hungry... and we've been walking around... like walking around union square and all... here we are... we smell... burgers... BURGERS... *HUNGERS*

SERVICE: love the service! People are so nice and even gave us a free cookie!

FOOD:
Super duper burger - OMG! Take a bite and the juices just pours... like pourssss!!!
Cookie - I got a free cookie! So excited! 

OVERALL: I love it! Def will come back again for the super juice burger and the free cookie (if I get lucky! Teeehheee!) 4 stars!
author: Mindy Y.

description:
For my tastes, they're so very close to being the superest duperest burger. The patties on the burger were cooked absolutely perfectly - tons of stuck-to-the-griddle delicious crispy brown bits wrapped around just-cooked-medium juicy beefy perfection. As it was my first time in, I went with the standard burger with the usual veg and the uneven spread application let the burger down, there were bites that needed more seasoning. Some extra spread, or a bit extra S&P on the patty and I would've been on cloud nine.

The garlic fries are an A+, though - I wouldn't change a thing other than that I don't get to eat them every day. The regular fries are crispy but not exemplary, so definitely go with the garlicky goodness. The much-hyped free pickles could use more acid but are crispy and spicy. The spot is absolutely packed, and it's easy to understand why. An excellent quick serve burger, for sure - and so close to being an absolutely amazing any kind of burger.
author: Logan M.

description:
Ok I'm a loyal fan have been going for awhile now.
I crave these burgers regularly super juicy perfect condiments and pickles for days.
author: nancy w.

description:
Our experience here last night was solid across the board - 

Service was great. 

Burger was great, as was my veggie burger. It was more crunchy than I'm typically accustomed to in a veggie burger, but it was like a big, crunchy broccoli tot that I didn't want to end. 

Fries were solid - I had the regular and my SO had the garlic fries. Nothing we haven't tasted before, but done well.

Pickles were okay. Ketchup was legit!

Price was good for the quality of food.
author: Naomi H.

description: I love how dance you can make their burgers. Add egg, avocado, cheese, bacon, extra sauce no bun is my favorite!
author: Angela M.

description:
I love burgers, I really do. Veggie burgers, specifically. Most restaurants I've tried, their veggie burgers aren't their specialty, which is okay. But Super Duper's veggie burgers perfectly hit the spot. 

I wasn't super duper (heh) hungry since my two colleagues and I had just finished up at a work happy hour, but I knew I was going to regret not eating right away, so we decided to get food. A few of our other colleagues had suggested Super Duper and after looking on the Yelp app, we decided to check it out for ourselves. 

For a Sunday night, the line was at the door. It moves fairly quickly though, which is good if you're in a rush or have reached hangry level. How it works is you order from the counter, take a buzzer, and find a table or take it to go. Once your buzzer buzzes, you grab your food. Simple, easy, fast. 

You'd think for how quick the service is that their quality would be similar to McDonald's or Burger King, but NOPE, it was far from it. The bun was soft, but didn't fall apart, the veggie patty was actually really tasty, and all the sauces and veggies were a great touch. My gal pal got the cheesy garlic fries on the side and I would definitely recommend getting them if you're feeling really hungry. The fries portions are fairly generous, so if you don't have a big appetite, I'd get them to share. 

For a fast food joint, I was pleasantly surprised and impressed. I wouldn't say I'd come back again, but I'm definitely happy I tried it out. As far as veggie burgers go, Super Duper makes some super duper good ones!
author: Issabelle F.

description:
Strolling through downtown the day after Christmas, you never would have thought that so many restaurants would be closed. Luckily, Super Duper Burgers near the Yerba Buena Gardens came to save the day. 

Super Burger - A burger, done well. There are so many toppings available! My only gripe was that the patty itself needed a little more seasoning.

Garlic Fries - It seemed like the potatoes were fried in garlic infused oil, and I wished there was a little more garlic on top. Regardless, they are delicious!

Safe to say, I was definitely surprised, and will certainly be back if I'm in area!
author: Nick L.

description: Great food... even got to talk to a very nice mom and daughter while waiting for my order.
author: Dave D.

description: It's a pretty decent burger although the stand out here is the garlic fries! Topped w cheese and all and it's really garlic goodness!
author: Casie N.

description:
Unless you're down their throats for a well-done burger AND you check your burger afterwards, you will get a RAW burger!!  Crazy as it may seem, I've also had food poisoning although it was only once.  Yeah, crazy, huh--why come back??  I guess bcoz it's close to a location i regularly go to and it's open late at night.

Their burger size is PALTRY and really not as tasty as compared to the burgers at Calibur.

Their garlic fries have cheese and are pretty tasty.  You have to enter on the left door(when facing the store) since the line up to the cashier is on the left side.  Sitting is mainly on the right side.

It's an ok burger place, but not a burger place I would order from or go to to impress anyone.
author: Frugal C.

description: I've been craving burgers so my boyfriend and I decided to hit this place up before heading to a movie. We both ordered the super burger with all toppings (lettuce, tomato, onion) and a side of fries. We got our food within 10 minutes of waiting and they have homemade pickles and ketchup available! Just a warning, this place makes smash burgers so your burger is going to be incredibly greasy no matter what. I don't think there's any way of avoiding it when eating that style of burger. With that said, I kinda got disgusted when I saw that the grease from the meat was soaking all the way through my bun. I found the flavor of the meat to be good though. The quality of everything (buns, meat, veggies) was great as well. The burgers here come with a special sauce like at in n out but honestly I couldn't taste it through the grease. Also, the fries were over salted. Overall I guess it was a positive experience since it satisfied my craving but I probably would not come back.
author: Kelly Q.

description:
Living in SF, I've become accustomed to the whole local-organic-housemade schpeel, so I was quite desensitized when I came across Super Duper's marketing. I even had snarky thoughts of artisan beef, gluten-free eggs, and vegetarian-fed buns. However, during my visit I ended up being super duper blown away by the true commitment to quality and sheer deliciousness.

I was a fan of the $6.50 vegetarian burger +$1 for avocado (back story: I actually don't like burgers because they tend be greasy and make me feel gross, but I'm obligated to accompany the boo whose love for burgers rivals Thrillist). 
- The bean-based patty was remotely similar to falafel except more grainy, and it came together perfectly with the creamy hummus and super sauce, standard burger condiments including refreshing cucumbers, and a toasty bun.
- When they say artisan bun, they are serious--the bun had that perfect amount of crisp on the exterior contrasting a pillow-soft interior. 
- The proportions were on point as well, with an excellent balance of flavors. 
- (Surprisingly, the burger fit in my mouth and I didn't have to eat it horizontally, though I don't know about the double)

I also recommend the $3.25 small vanilla shake, which is essentially creamy soft serve in a cup. For better or for worse, SF has trained me to consider Straus Family Creamery's organic products as the standard for dairy. 

Pro tips:
*Get the kids size shake! As specified on the menu it's not just for kids, and allows for indulgence that will fit in your post-burger stomach
*Note that vegetarian-fed doesn't mean grass-fed (this is when my skepticism of SF artisan-ness comes in useful)
*The prices are in the range of fast-casual in the FiDi; it's worth it as Super Duper is a distinctive notch up from In-N-Out and not as exorbitant as the pretentious craft burgers at fancy restaurants
author: Edna C.

description: Still going here, maybe once a month or so. Our last visit was on Black Friday and even though the entire downtown area was a zoo and the Super Duper line was out the door, we still went from arriving to finding a table and eating our fries within 10 minutes. If that's not a testament to upholding quality while keeping a rapid pace of customers satisfied, I don't know what is! And props to the interior designers too, there seems to be exactly enough seating available to get everyone settled in comfortably. Thanks!
author: John B.

description:
Always go to eat there but today was the worst 
We had lunch with a friend and the fries were cold, the burger was dry and over cooked, burnt meat. Even the bun tasted off(( I wish I cold say I loved it but we didn't. 
Money wasted and the food upset my stomach, made me feel nauseous
I'd like refund
author: Maria M.

description:
We have been passing by here way too often but this is my first time here. What a shame! I meant the food was so good. I wished I should have come much easier. 
We definitely will be back more often.
author: Meichelle L.

description:
The burgers are on the oily side, but they are really delicious. like that they have a mini option if your're not trying to go into a food coma after the meal.

They have garlic fries which is also a plus, and great condiments. Def one of my favorite burger joints!
author: Jessica S.

description: I lived in Asia for a bit and they lacked a real good burger. My brother took me here randomly while visiting and I loved it so much I went back there 3 times in a week. Everytime I visited SF, this was my go to spot. I'd go hiking by Muir Woods and they have one right by there as well. I finally tried their breakfast and it was 10x better than McDonald's. I didn't feel that gross heaviness afterwards. Their burgers are so juicy, garlic fries are phenomenal and you can't beat homemade pickles. If you have space try to grab an organic chocolate dipped ice cream cone or fresh donuts to go!
author: J P.

description:
Pros:
Super burger Taste good with two local beef patties with free lettuce, tomatoes and onions. 
Fries are non gmo but not organic. 
Have a few small items thats organic like shakes and eggs. 
Free range ORGANIC chicken!

Cons:
A little pricey at $8.25 for non organic burger.
Beef may not be grass fed organic. 
Non organic but local buns. 


Overall may come back if most items are non gmo or organic but a good start.
author: Organic T.

description:
Super Duper Burgers has a good recipe of success going for them. At first I was a little skeptical but I can see how they are a winner. 

I had the mini burger with bacon, cheese, and extra onions. With the current prices of dining out for lunch, I'll be broke if I don't choose wisely. Unless I stick with McDonalds (yuck) I'll be spending more than $10 a day on lunch. I should be eating better and knowing that the meat is not GMO with additives gives me the warm and fuzzies. Definitely get the garlic fries loaded with tons of parmasean cheese with your burger. I guarantee you'll enjoy them. Also the unlimited home made pickles is the selling point for me. They are crisp and have a nice crunch to them.
author: Tim G.

description:
One of the best burgers and fries ever! My friends and I came by to grab a quick bite before our NYE. I wasn't too hungry, so just got the garlic fries ($3.25). When I finally got around to eating them about 20 minutes later, the cheese had melted. I would've preferred them fresh, but they were still good.

This particular location is huge though with a second floor seating as well. Solid spot for something quick to eat.
author: Cindy Z.

description:
I would love to give Super Duper Burgers 5 stars as I really like the food, but I am genuinely concerned about this establishment's food safety.

A few months ago I bit down hard on a bone fragment in the ground beef and broke one of my teeth. I had actually experienced small pieces of bone in the meat previously but had thought nothing of it until this incident. I had to get extensive dental work to fix my tooth. I thought this was a one-off issue and let it go, but just last week my friend and I went to Super Duper Burger and he bit down hard onto a HALF INCH METAL SCREW IN THE GROUND BEEF.

I hope they take this review seriously because their burgers have now caused at least two people bodily harm within one year, causing significant, negative financial impacts. Please do better for your customers. If you can demonstrate that you've made positive changes I would be more than happy to delete this review.
author: Bryce A.

description: Can't believe I just tried this on the last day of my holiday. Great burger at a good price. Garlic fries are really good too!!
author: Jamie M.

description: First time at Super Duper & I was super impressed ! Basic burger menu with junior or super size! I also got the garlic French fries and they were delicious. Definitely a clean/ yummy fast food restaurant. I'll definitely come back.
author: Amy C.

description: Honestly I like in n out burgers more. however, super duper burgers fries are a lot better than in n out fries. So, you win some you lose some. It's nice they have a combo deal, but their burgers are really on the level of in n out or habit burger. Except you can get beer here which adds to the vibe of the place. Also pickle slices are a nice touch.
author: Tatiana T.

description:
New discovery!
They have super big burger and I love the amount of onions that are in the burger. I got the cheeseburger, and the meat is juicy and tender. I recommend adding jalopenos for a kick. I also like how the french fries are non-salted, crispy, and warm. The best part is that they offer free sides of pickles that are self-served, and the pickles go super well with the burger. I think Super Duper is next after In-N-Out :)
author: Brenda Jiwon L.

description:
Super Duper Burgers is the happy medium between quality fast food burgers such as In-N-Out, and high end dining burgers. 

Super Duper's burgers are incredibly juicy, which makes them unique and obviously, delicious. They're a real winner in my book, just remember to get extra napkins! **Tip** It's not on the menu, but they do offer to lettuce wrap your burger instead of buns if you ask! I was thrilled when the cashier told me that it was no problem at all. 

The establishment itself is casual, but still nice and clean. There are free pickles which they claim to make themselves. All in all, I dig Super Duper Burger and will 100% come back if I'm ever in the area - thankfully they're all over San Francisco!
author: Mars S.

description:
Overview: Super Duper Burgers is a fun, popular, trendy burger joint right next to the mall in SOMA that serves big juicy beautiful burgers and garlic fries for higher than normal prices.

The Burger: It's basically a sit-down restaurant quality burger in the same awesomeness level as places like "The Habit" and a tier above places like In-N-Out. Big juicy patties, nice fluffy buns, and great fresh veggies. You'll have to make sure to practice widening your jaw to get it in your mouth nicely.

The Establishment: Crowded, a little greasy, and very loud. Don't bring a date here but a loud baby would fit in quite well.

Conclusions: Vastly overpriced food thanks to its close location to the mall, movie theater, and Moscone Center, but it is a darned good burger.
author: Andrew H.

description:
I can say this is one of the best chain burger joints I've been to in San Francisco. 

Restaurant was clean.. Lots of different places to sit and enjoy your meal. My husband and I prefer a window seat and there is always space available.

We ordered a mini burger which is like a double burger, but with in patty. Burger was juicy, buns were toasted. I asked for extra extra, not a typo, but double the red onions! Ugh! Soo good!! Believe me, I'm a big eater and this was just right. I also got the garlic fries. To my surprise there was cheese on top! So it was like "Garlic Cheese Fries!" I love surprises like that! It was so delicious! The only thing I would like to see happen is if they put cheese on the fries on the bottom so I can get garlic cheese fries in every bite!! I won't give them a minus star for my greedy gluttonous! Not sure if gluttonous is a word, but you know what I mean! 

Prices were very decent! Staff was friendly! We will definitely be returning! Super duper is absolutely super duper!
author: Darlene M.

description: I've been here so many times and, like many other places, I'm genuinely surprised I haven't reviewed it yet lol. Super Duper is definitely one of my go-to places, particularly this one since it's so close to AMC. It always hits the spot and it's one of the few places in the neighbourhood that's open late(ish). The milkshakes are thick and not to sweet, but very filling so I don't tend to get them very often. The soft serve is tasty (whenever I get it, I get the kid-size cone lol). I've found that the perfect amount of food for me is a mini burger and fries that I can share with another person, preferably the garlic fries if that other person is a fan as well ;) The only bad(ish) experience I've had here is when it closed early and without warning. I guess the staff wanted to go home early :/ Or when they run out of the homemade pickles, because maaan those are good pickles.
author: Bianca C.

description:
First impression (of the burger): looks small.

Then unwrapping it & first taste: oh that's good. Meaty and juicy and grill-y and just salty enough.

Then: nice fresh crisp lettuce and juicy tomato slices and that bun is tasty & spongy.  Grilled onions add a nice touch. Every bite is full of flavor.

Quality over volume.  I like it!

Fries: also pretty good: crisp fries of the coated variety. Not as fresh tasting as the burger but A-OK.  The artisanal ketchup is tasty.  But the burger is the star of this show.

Not enough calorie budget for the shakes or soft serve today, maybe I will have to come back!
author: Larry C.

description:
Killer burgers, crispy fries, and delicious sauces. They even have soft serve ice cream - yum.    

The 'mini' burger is a good lunch size. 1 patty on a toasted bun. The bun was firm, not soggy. The patty was smashed thin and grilled on he flat top I think. I had mine with avocado and tomato (cheese and avocado were extra).   

Good portion of fries. I added the '3 sauces' and they were good. Creamy and spicy.   

Free pickles was a bonus.    

 I spent $14 on lunch. Waited less than 5 mins on a Tuesday.
author: Chris C.

description: The best chain greasy burger here in SF. They sell milkshakes and donuts (maybe only during breakfast time for donuts) too which is always a plus! It's simply a reliable bet for a cheeseburger and fries.
author: Leo I.

description:
I've been a fan of this chain since eating at their original Castro location in April 2010.  Logistically, I love counter service fast casual since you get better-than-fast-food cuisine without the hassle of a table service ordeal.  Also, their burgers are simply amazing.

Super Burger w/ Cheddar Cheese: This is better than any fast food burger (sorry In-N-Out) and beats many wait service joints.  There's a real distinct sear around each moist patty making for a great flavor and texture contrast.  The bun is just the right thickness and texture to accompany the burger without becoming a distraction.  The secret sauce isn't that noticeable to me, which is a good thing because I'd rather taste burger than sauce.  In my opinion it's best to get cheddar cheese, all the free toppings and jalapeños,  Just the right size to fill you up, but not make you feel gross afterwards.

Fries: Not quite beating the benchmark of McDonald's fry greatness, but they seem to definitely have upped their fry game since opening.  A nice thin thickness with every fry being crispy, but not overdone.

Pickles: All the pickles you could ever want, for free.  They're a great appetizer to get your mouth primed for the burger as you wait.  During the meal, their sourness helps cut the fatty richness of the burger.
author: Adam B.

description: Too greasy and not as much flavor as I expected.  Goes for both fries and burger.  Nice open atmosphere but the square, metal chairs are brutal - they scream to "eat and get out!". Staff and service was great though
author: Mike J.

description: I like burger places that do mini versions. I can never finish a whole one but the small ones I can do. Nothing to complain about, super juicy burgers. The garlic fries are something that you have to try. We came here during the lunch rush so the line was super long, but we got our food pretty quick.
author: Vanessa N.

description: A pleasant surprise, outstanding flavor for a "fast food" restaurant. I had the double burger with organic egg and Gorgonzola, mind blowing! The IPA beer pitcher was a nice  addition to the experience! I will return for sure :)
author: Christian D.

description:
SuperDuper better than In-N-Out better than Shake Shack. 

Got a super burger (two patties) and garlic fries. The burger is really tasty and the meat is firm, but it's kind of oily...(I assume that's why they're so good!!). The garlic fries isn't my favorite, maybe because I'm not a big fan of the cheese on top, which makes the fries isn't that crunchy... next time, I will just get a mini burger and normal fries.
author: Yuliana Z.

description:
Decent burger (and a veggie option) in San Francisco for under $10. 
Solid 4-stars! 

I came here for lunch with some coworkers because they were craving the pickles. The pickles are good (slightly spicy and unlimited) and our food came out quickly, making my first visit a positive experience. We were lucky to order right away and find plenty of seating. Looks like if you get there between 1130-12 during the week the line gets long quick and the seats are scarce.
author: Tarah P.

description: This is a yummy, juicy burger. Mmmmm! Service is very good, even the guy wiping down the tables had a smile on his face and was content in his work. A real joy to support an establishment like this. Burger comes with a 4oz pattie, and we also both added blue cheese and bacon for about $1, $1.50 each extra. Mini burger was $5.75 on its own. Many additional extras for no surcharge. All good, yummy stuff. I like True Burger in Oakland and this was on a par in terms of the brioche type bun, juicy meat and garlic drenched fries!
author: Zoe L.

description: We had no place else to go as everything was closed and what a surprise.  This place is amazing and the food is killer.  Best chicken sandwich I've had in a long time.   They have a jar of pickles that were so good I couldn't stop eating them.  What a great surprise after traveling all day.
author: Cheryl B.

description: The Asian Cashier lady took wrong order without apologizing.. attitude is off! Makes me went up and down the stairs to fix her mistake! After i left, she talked shit with her coworker, on board training needed! No more Super Duper Burgers for me again!
author: Maggie C.

description: This place is super, duper good! I know this will always satisfy my burger craving, because their patties are really juicy and delicious. It's not such a large burger you feel gross afterwards, leaving you room for some yummy garlic fries! I definitely, definitely recommend paying a bit extra for cheese, because what is a burger without cheese?! Their homemade pickles are a nice touch, but honestly, I think the conventional kind wins. Also the downside of the patties being really juicy is that it'll often seep into the buns and make them soggy.
author: Ke C.

description:
I like the organic egg sandwich with bacon and the one with sausage I have had for breakfast. It's not salty, it's juicy and soft. Also, I've tried their homemade mini donuts and their delicious super Burger.  I really recommend it. 
Keep doing well
author: Anny Z.

description:
Mmmmmmm
Juicy burgers, tasty fries, sustainable everything (all their trash is compostible) and EXCELLENT SERVICE (a rarity in SF). Do yourself a favor and try this.
author: Madeline M.

description: Decent burger but I've definitely had better. I did appreciated the good service (friendly cashier) and the food was quick to come out. I ordered the small burger with cheese and bacon. The burger meat and bacon were great. I wasn't blown away by the sauce. The fries were very crispy but needed seasoning.
author: Jamie W.

description:
I love Super Duper! My friends and I go frequently for dinner. I even hosted my birthday party here one year. They have plenty of seating including additional tables on their indoor balcony. I appreciate that you order at the counter - it's great for when you have a large group of people and don't want to bother with splitting the bill.

Food wise I like their mini burger with caramelized onions (yum!). Check out their additional toppings - they have free ones you can request, make sure to read the menu! My other favorite thing to get there is their ice cream. I love that it's made with Strauss milk! Their strawberry shake is amazing and their kid size cone is a great deal (and better for portion controlling!)
author: Christine L.

description:
A basic burger under $10? Excellent. While it's no shake shack burger, super duper burgers excels at making a super crisp patty. The burger is a bit greasy though, so don't plan on doing anything active afterwards. 

Also! They have the cutest cake donuts during breakfast hours! If you get there for early lunch you may be able to snag one, gratis.
author: Lydia N.

description: My boyfriend and I ordered a mini burger, super burger, two fries, one fountain drink and one milkshake and it came out to $29 something dollars! Granted, that is similar pricing as Shake Shack, but at least the food at Shake Shack is worth the $$. Here, no. Our burgers were super oily. Also, the burgers did not have a pleasant taste (tasted slightly acidic). Nothing special about the fries. Didn't like their ketchup either--it had the consistency of a tomato puree and was slightly sour for me (I like my ketchup slightly sweet). My boyfriend is a vanilla milkshake connoisseur and this is his least favorite one so far. The consistency was off. One thing I did like was their buns. They were toasted and stayed crunchy as you ate the burger. Overall, would not come back here again.
author: Mary D.

description:
I've almost been to all the Super Dupers, and this one is so far my favorite location. Similar in layout to the one on Market, this Mission location is less crowded and in a less skeezy area. One block seems to make a world of a difference. 

If you haven't been, Super Duper is SF's answer to Shake Shack - big, tasty, burgers, heavenly garlic fries, spicy chicken sandwiches, beers on tap, and spiked milkshakes. Can't forget about those free pickles, too! If you're dry on date night ideas, pop into this spot and head to the Metreon for a movie - if your date isn't into this, you'll know it's time to move on.

I usually go for the Veggie Burger or the Spicy Chicken Burger (both around $8) - fries are shareable, and they have a soda fountain with unlimited refills. If there isn't a private party upstairs, grab a spot at the railing and get your fill of people watching. :-)

This isn't a fancy place, but it's cheap (for SF) and always works in a pinch. Check em' out!
author: Laura B.

description:
My friend and I stopped by for a burger.  There was a line but it went by pretty quick.

I ordered the super combo.  They warned the burger was going to be juicy.  Holy crap they weren't kidding!! They should serve bibs!!

The fries were good too.

Bibs, bring some!
author: Bryan S.

description:
finally made it to a super duper for lunch because I ran out of new places to visit in the area. Im not a huge fan of fast food, but some of my coworkers rave about their burgers and pickles.

There is an upstairs with more seating, and the line here moves relatively fast. You come pick up your order when your little plate thing buzzes. They have two different sizes of burgers (or the patty that they put in it) which was great! You can put lettuce, tomatoes, and grilled onions for no cost, and cheese/avocado/egg/bacon are 50 cents to $1 extra. The burger itself was ok - could do with more sauces and flavors. I thought my burger was a bit dry though some people thought it was too greasy. The fries were decent - nothing spectacular. 

The cool part: unlimited self serve pickles. Puts your sodium intake in danger but hey, you're already at a fast food place. Go hard or go home.

$10 for a single patty burger with cheese + fries. Decent meal.
author: Grace P.

description: Asked a few people off the street about this place, one guy said it was really good, if you liked "greasy".....boy was he wrong. It wasn't greasy, it was JUICY! I had the mini combo, a 1/4 lb with fries....can't wait to come back when in SF.
author: Blanca S.

description: Watch the movie and stop by at Super Duper and show your ticket get free fries! But not here today for some reason (according to the manager lady in orange shirt) just ordered burger with strawberry shake *sad face!
author: fumiko n.

description:
Lunch at 11 AM during the week:  a very leisurely experience.  No waits in line, food comes out pretty quickly.  Ambiance is fairly quiet and you can have a regular conversation with your indoor voice at the table of your choice.

Lunch at 12 noon:  crazy lines, longer wait times, using your nightclub voice to talk to your friend while squeezed at a shared table

Either way, the food is delicious.  My mini burger (with bacon, no onion) was tasty; the meat was flavorful and the lettuce and tomato were super fresh.  The fries were perfectly cooked, crispy on the outside.  And you can serve yourself as many spicy pickles on the side as you want!

After lunch, I got a mini vanilla & chocolate swirled cone for dessert, which was the perfect end to a nice meal.  The cost is pretty low but the food is high quality.  Just be prepared for the crush during the meal rush.
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
Still satisfying after all these years :)

Jorge delivered exemplary customer service. Super duper may not be a fancy joint but good service is essential and noticeable regardless of the atmosphere. Jorge's service inspired me to write this review. High five Jorge!

The mini burger was mighty flavorful. Lettuce, tomato, and red onion was freshly crisp. Highly recommend adding the aged white cheddar and their thick bacon. Slam dunk! 

SD strawberry milkshake was pretty good! As promised, they use fresh strawberries. I cannot stress enough how much I LOVE Straus organic soft serve. I'm particular about dairy and it was a real treat to enjoy a real milkshake. 

Can I just shout out the French fries for a hot minute?! DAMN! They mean it when they say their fries are MADE TO ORDER! Pipping hot and crispy. Ketchup is not Heinz and uniquely zesty. HOLLER! 

Kudos on the house pickles. Nice touch.
author: Rosalyn W.

description: Burger definitely better that in and out... hands down. Vegetarian fed beef! We ordered mini burger and the garlic fries. Very juicy and tasty,  sized just right. How come there is no branch in LA?? We ordered extra for to go... will be coming back for sure when we are in town.
author: Lani P.

description: Deliciously memorable. Everytime I'm in this area and starving. I think it's an automatic answer to eat at Super Duper. The meat here is so good. And the milkshakes can be spiked!
author: Beatrice T.

description: Great burger chain - really yummy! A bit on the greasier side, but hey, that's probably why it's so good.
author: Lillian B.

description:
Pretty relaxed and basic environment, employees are chill and friendly. The menu is simple to read, with many different options. This place has burgers with a bunch of toppings, salads, cookies and soft serve. 

I ordered the regular burger(4oz) with every free topping. Quality of the beef is really good and everything was delicious, but I only have two complaints. The lettuce in the burger was really overpowering giving the burger an overall basic taste and overpowered the rest of the toppings. The other complaint was the ketchup, it was a different texture and flavor than your ordinary ketchup. It had a hint of Sriracha, in my opinion.
author: Jeremy G.

description:
They have awesome burgers but the fries are to die for!

We got the veggie burger with "everything on it (except tomatoes)". You can add cheese and avocado. Their burgers are
the perfect size as well. The garlic fries are so flavorful - they add Parmesan cheese on top and the dips are delicious. We had to wait just 10 minutes before our food came out. 

It's a bit of a small place so we had to wait around to get seats. 

If you are looking for a decent place for burgers, this can be your next burger joint!
author: Anu R.

description: Visited the joint 08/22/18 @ 5:30pm & ordered a double burger grilled medium rare to go. Lady took my order. But asked this cocky heavy set Spanish dude whom was behind the counter (and actin like he's in charge) to have em' make the burger medium rare. He spoke w/ the cooks personally & afterwards assured me it'll be done.. I saw the cooks nodding their heads like it's cool... However, when I got home & ready to tear up the burger, I immediately noticed that it was burnt & chunks of the patty breaking off.... I asked myself "wtf is this???!!!!!!!" Was already home so couldn't bring this shit back.. I was thinking there goes $11. Sadly, it seems their workers couldn't flip burgers right!!!
author: Forrest G.

description: Service was nice, and the fries were good. The burger, however, was incredibly greasy which made it off-putting and hard to finish. I ordered the mini burger with cheese, and I was left feeling queasy and a bitter taste in my mouth from how greasy it was. It's a bummer because this place has such great reviews and I was looking forward to enjoying a good burger.
author: Vivian A.

description: Great food, great atmosphere. I had the super burger with avocado and bacon: super juicy, and flavorful. After a long day of walking Super Burger hits the spot.
author: Andrew D.

description:
Was in town for a conference and my business partner and I ate here everyday!  He's an avid burger person; me not as much but I have to say it was very good!

Be prepared to wait in line, but it will definitely be worth it.  The first day we got the super duper burger, but that was too much so went to the smaller burger with fries and it was much better, with no waste.
author: Tim B.

description:
This is my favorite super duper burger. It's a bit hidden in comparison to the other establishments. It's also a bit smaller than the other ones as well. 

There's always foot traffic but that's not a bad thing. The wait is normal for any type of burger joint but it is far less crowded than the one on market. 

I always get the super duper burger, I feel like it's a must. The garlic fries are really good. Their shakes are better than average and their beer selection pairs really well with what I usually order.
author: Mark G.

description:
Got takeout one evening after work, and boy did I love the vegetarian burger. One word - hummus!  Okay make that three and add - garlic fries ( they were a lil oily but tbh if you're getting an order of fries you're probably okay with the grease, for that night at least :P). Definitely worth the extra calories. Although I got takeout because I had a long night ahead of me, the place is big enough to have lotsa tiny tables you can sit and eat at. 

Friendly staff, excellent burgers. I'd love to come by again when I'm in town.
author: Vidya R.

description:
I am from Southern California, so I am used to having burger and sandwich places around everywhere. This has easily become one of the best burgers I have ever eaten in my life!!!

The burgers are juicy and delicious. I personally enjoy the blue cheese option with the double burger. While their secret sauce is good on their burger, I prefer spicier things, so their chipotle sauce is a fantastic option on the burger. Their fries have a sea salt mixture on them and it is fantastic to get the dips with them (which includes their secret sauce, chipotle sauce, and their homemade mayo).

If you are interested in getting a delicious burger with incredible flavor, this place is definitely a must!
author: Michael W.

description: Got the veggie burger, this Patty is more on the grainy side if that makes any sense, definitely not a meaty taste. Also got the Garlic fries, more like cheese fries, but hey nothing wrong with that either. Overall, it's okay.
author: Jaqueline V.

description: Absolutely love this place. We went into San Francisco to go shopping, but really our sole purpose was to grab a veggie burger at this joint. The crispy veggie patty with cucumber and avocado is a tasty combo. Bonus points awarded for the all natural condiments. We added kid shakes (even for the adults) around the table to make this visit particularly super duper. If you want an indulgent meal after an afternoon of walking around the city go HERE!
author: Andie B.

description: 20 minutes for two burgers and they served tons of people who came after me. I had to ask them before they refired my food which then only took 5 minutes.
author: Johnny L.

description:
The veggie burger...Sooo good. Didn't feel heavy or nasty. One less star cause the regular super duper burger was greasy and too heavy (friend says) 

I'd come back for veggie burger and jalapeño on the side. Yum!!!!! 

Thanks for the tasty burger
author: Tiffany T.

description:
Not bad... 
Juicy burgers but their Cheese garlic fries are lack luster without much cheese or garlic.
author: David H.

description:
Service here is very nice which helps with the underwhelming food. Ordered a mini combo from here and I wasn't very satisfied. The burger was quite oily. Like oil really seeped through the to-go bag and onto my jeans!!! The ketchup is literally tomato sauce and I love pickles, but theirs didn't do anything for me. The fries on the other hand were delicious and I got a large portion of them. 

Glad I tried it once, but I don't think I will be coming back again for a burger fix.
author: Cheryl C.

description: Craved a burger, a real burger and found a go to spot here. Great tasting and loved the fries too. Decadent shakes and malts but one can get just have ice cream. Homemade pickles are a specialty (as evident as the rows of bottle pickles). On Mission so you'll have to park in a lot but if taking public transit, a worthy stop.
author: Michele T.

description:
I like this Super Duper for a couple of reasons. #1 it's across the street from where I work, so whenever I want a quick burger, this is a great place to go. #2 Super Dupers serve up a pretty good burger, pretty consistently.
