One thing I don't like so much here, the doughnut chef. I used to go to the Super Duper on Kearny Street. Their doughnuts were awesome, small, fluffy, like a miniaturized version of a Dunkin' Donut. At this location, the donuts are skinny and anemic. Like a rolled up noodle. It's not the same.

In short, come here for the burgers. But if you like donuts, look elsewhere.
author: Tony L.

description:
I finally found my forever cheeseburger!!!!
So yummy and juicy and I damned near climaxed as I ate it with my eyes closed, moaning with my food porno O-face. Meaty beefy juices of joy.

This is the best burger I've ever had in SF, hands down, sorry not sorry to the other burger joints. Great fries and house made pickles.
 Friendly service, nice sit down joint and very reasonable prices. If you used to eat nasty big chain burger places such as the usual suspects but stopped to eat cleaner, DO NOT sleep on Super Duper Burger! Get your @ss over there and get your cheeseburger with fries now. You know you want to. Phuck your low carb or paleo diet. Can't you smell it? I just wolfed one down. Mmmm. Don't be jelly. You might be if you're hangry or drunk and starving or have the munchies right now, hahahahahaaaa. That onion-y, cheesy, pickle-y, beef- burgery, secret saucy smell? Well this review is your fast food burger scratch and sniff. Don't say I never gave your a$$ anything. You're welcome.
author: Huwansta N.

description:
Till date I have visited three of their locations (Mission st., Market St. and Westfield Mall,San Jose). I am really happy with the consistency of food quality and taste everywhere. The staff is very nice and the service is quick too. I am a regular at Mission St. location but since last two times l got very oily and cold garlic fries.Also, the veggie burger that I ordered last time was cold. Since I was there on a weekend during heavy rush,I didn't make a complaint but it would be nice if they can keep their quality maintained even in the peak hours.
Overall a fantastic place to have quick,tasty and filling food.
author: Nikita J.

description:
Best burger in SF. In n out is my favorite fast casual burger and I'd say Super Duper is second. 

I usually always get the two patty burger along with fries and a milk shake. The cookies and cream milk shake is a must get - perfectly made and not too thick where you can't drink it from the straw. 

If you're in SF and you're craving a burger then come here.
author: Jonathan C.

description:
Came here on a busy weekday for lunch. There were probably about 6-7 people in front of me in line. The line moved relatively quickly because there were 3 people taking orders (thank goodness). I waited about 10-15 minutes for my meal, so I didn't wait that long. It was clearly an operation behind the counter. Super Duper knew they were going to get a lunch time rush and had enough people cranking out those orders, which is super appreciated. 

Overall, my 2 patty burger tasted pretty good. I got the normal fries and they were cooked exactly how I requested. I think they give you a smaller portion of fries when you order to go versus eating in. 

I thought that for the price, portion and flavor, you get a pretty good deal here. I would come back here for lunch and dinner.

Select Super Duper locations serve breakfast. The egg breakfast sandwiches aren't half bad either. For $4.75, you can get a egg sandwich with bacon and cheese. Not a bad deal.
author: Carolyn Z.

description: These burgers are so worth the money and wait! And might I add not a long wait at all!! Get customer service! And great freaking food! Will definitely be back!!
author: Lyric W.

description: The hamburgers are really yummy and the fries too but they need to do something about the ketchup is seriously bad and fries without ketchup are just sad
author: Eliane C.

description:
So the last time I came here, it went something like this:
Lunch time, walk 15mins to get to Super Duper Burger, wait in line 15mins, wait for food 15mins, walk back to office faster 10mins, stuff burger and garlic fries in my face for 5mins.

The Super burger is very delicious. Juices drip out as you bite into it. The whole package is well put together for about $7.75 now. Add the garlic fries for an additional $3.25. Thin cut crisp garlic fries, my favorite! So without a drink, you'll spend in the $10-13 range which is not bad for this area. I have to say that I was not full after this meal, but the taste still gives it a worthy 4 star rating.
author: Mike O.

description:
Fresh food.
 Appears to be clean .
Ordered a veggie burger that was okay I am not a vegetarian but wanted to try something different the veggie patty all are Organic with cucumber hummus tomato onion and lettuce.
With a side of garlic fries overall not bad we ordered three burgers two chicken sandwiches three fries came out about $65.
Best thing about this place is looking out the window at all the freaky people walk bye.
It's right in front of a bus stop.
author: Adam H.

description:
This restaurant is super duper delicious! I found it on Yelp and decided to give it a try since the reviews were great! 

When I arrived at the location there was a line almost to the door, but it moved very quickly, I was at the register in about 3-4 minutes. I ordered a mini burger with a side of fries and requested that my burger be cooked well done, seeing as though medium is their cooking style. There was no issue with cooking my burger at my desired temperature. 

After ordering, I stood and waited for my buzzer pager to go off. Although the line to order moved quickly, the wait was a bit long. It took about 7 minutes for me to get my food. But the burger was definitely worth the wait. 

My burger was cooked to perfection and had a wonderful taste. The only downside, and my reasoning for 4 stars, was that they put lettuce and tomato on it when I asked for it not to be on there. But, no big deal! The fries were also delicious and very well seasoned. The mini burger is definitely filling, so don't be afraid! You're getting plenty of food!
author: Victoria T.

description: I was staying at the Marriott Marquis across from the street from this place. I decided to grab a burger there on one of our lunch breaks after seeing all of the great reviews. You enter and join the line (there usually is a line) on the left. The menu has a few different items, but most people come for the burgers and fries. You can get the double burger which is 2 beef patties or the mini which is only 1 patty. You can choose various toppings like cheese. There are a bunch of other "free toppings" including lettuce, tomato, onions, and jalapenos. You pay and they take your name for the order. I ended up getting a double burger with all of the free toppings and I added Avocado (for $1.00) for a total of about $10. After about 5 minutes my name was called. There is a small condiment area with ketchup and mustard as well as pickles. There is a decent amount of seating there but I wouldn't bet on snagging a seat during peak lunch times. The burger was really good. I would definitely rate is miles apart from fast food places including In-and-Out. It was really filling as well with all of the toppings. The staff was very efficient. I would definitely return again if I am in the area. I believe they are opened until 10 PM.
author: Jason P.

description: Used to walk out here with my coworkers out for lunch. Their burgers and fries was suuper good!
author: Yennie L.

description:
Do you love burgers and fries? Look no further, Super Duper Burgers is one of my favorite burger places ever! This location is hands down my favorite. It's in a perfect spot to eat at after a long day of shopping at the Westfield (about a 5 min walk) and it's right next to the Metreon if you want to catch a movie before or after! I usually get the mini burger which is a 4 oz patty since I get full very easily. But when I'm really hungry I love getting the super burger with avocado and cheese with everything! Service is always super quick even on a Saturday afternoon. They also have beer, milkshakes, and  free home-made pickles!

It does get really pricey, between my boyfriend and I we got two super burgers, french fries and a drink and it came out to $26. The base price of the super burger is around $7.75 but adds up when you want to do add ons such as bacon, cheese, avocado, mushrooms (ranges from $.50-1.50+ per add on). Only complaint was one of the sauces among the three dip fries was just plain mayo.. but at other Super Duper places it's been a different sauce that wasn't just mayo. I live in the East Bay, oh how I wish they would extend it out here!
author: Chelsea T.

description:
For quite a long time, I never really found hamburgers to be that appealing. Burger king...bleh.....McDonalds...yuck....In & Out wasn't worth the long lines...

One day while browsing yelp* I happened to see someone check into Super Duper. Hmm, let's see what they look like in the gallery...

Hey this place looks like it's worth trying! BOOKMARKED.

After spending a few hours at the auto expo, I decided to check my bookmarks for a nearby place to grab a bite. Super Duper is around the corner, it was packed, but I was willing to endure to give it a shot.

Ordered the Super Burger with bacon, cheese, fries, and a Racer IPA (About $16). Wow, messy, gooey and DEE-LICIOUS! The IPA was served immediately on tap (Yessss!) and the burger about 5 minutes afterwards. There's even an upstairs area for seating and I never have to wait for a place to sit.

I like that the patties aren't thin little wafers like In-N-Out, the fries are always fresh hot, & IPA on tap is the shiz!
author: Edward B.

description:
In San Francisco for a little anniversary getaway. Just came out of a movie and walking back to our hotel and decided to grab a quick bite. Happened to come across Super Duper Burgers. What a great place for good, organic fast food!!
I had the mini burger combo and it is plenty of food. My wife had the chicken sandwich with a spicy chipotle aioli sauce that is very good. 
This is a lively joint with a great staff that is friendly. They do a great job of keeping the place picked up and relatively clean. 
This was a great find!!!
author: Ralph T.

description: Grabbed dinner here while in town for business, it was right across the street from my hotel and I was craving a burger! I got the super burger and the fries with the trio of dipping sauces. Outstanding burger, juicy with good flavor. Fries were good as well and I love all three of the dipping sauces! Sorry no pics, I scarfed it down before I could get one.
author: Melissa H.

description: The kids and I loved this place. The burgers and garlic fries were great. I would definitely recommend it.
author: Shawnda H.

description:
I was up in Norcal with my family to drop off my sister at Cal after winter break. I went to visit my friend at UOP while I was up there, but we had no idea where to go for lunch since she had just moved to Norcal as well. So, I asked a friend who goes to San Francisco State for suggestions and she told me about this place because she knew they had good veggie burgers (I'm a pescatarian). 

Definitely was one of the best veggie burgers I've ever had. I would definitely recommend to my vegetarian friends who are looking for a good burger. I loved the fact that they try to use organic ingredients too (their patty is organic with hummus, cucumber, and Super Sauce). I didn't get the fries but managed to steal some from my friend's plate and they were delicious! Loved their ketchup too. Both my sister and I agreed that the fries and ketchup tasted better than In-n-Out's, which we were used to eating from SoCal. 

The staff was super friendly too, and we enjoyed our experience so much that we told our parents to come get lunch there as well. They did. And my dad loved their homemade all you can eat pickles so much that he even got seconds. I didn't even notice they were there! Will definitely try them if I get the chance to go back again.
author: Ai O.

description: Went here for some fast food, and was not disappointed in the quality!! The garlic fries are to DIE for! Def come try this if you are in SF!
author: Sarika S.

description: This place is lit-git, burgers are nice and prices are good, than you for making me fat
author: Edwin G.

description:
Spending time downtown can be very tiring so I make sure to come to Super Duper for an energy boost that comes in the form of a burger with a side of fries. 

As seen on the menu, the choices are short and simple. My go-to order is either the Super Burger (2 patties for $7.75) or Mini Burger (1 patty for $5.50) and garlic fries ($3.25). With the addition of the Super Sauce, the burgers are juicy and delicious. For extra goodness, slap some pickles in the burger or enjoy them on the side. The order of fries are good for sharing since the burgers can be quite filling. 

Service is quick. I usually wait somewhere between 5-10 minutes for my order but time flies since I'm looking for a seat and grabbing pickles in the meantime. Additional seating can be found on the upper level.
author: Katie C.

description: Came to get garlic fries and the fries were good but the rating is poor because of the worker working the register. The server Ollie was super rude and rushing us to pay and made no eye contact at any of his customers during his transactions. He kept looking away as if I was wasting his time and spoke to us like we were wasting his time just because we only ordered fries. Terrible customer service but good food.
author: Polly C.

description:
I usually go all out for most special occasions, but last year for my birthday, I just wanted a really, really good semi-fast food burger.  Since I couldn't go to Shake Shack, Super Duper was the next (closest) best thing.  I love the mini with an egg, which is really a misnomer because it is far from mini on taste.  This place is a family favorite and I wish there was one closer to me so I could try out their breakfast before work one day.  Don't let lines discourage you.  They are fast and the quality is in there.  Seats open up pretty quickly too.  Makes sure you get the fries and shake too!  

Remember, almost everything they serve is compostable so don't contribute to landfill here.  Go earth!
author: Maria S.

description: Burgers are great, love the pickles and shakes. It's always clean here and staff is very knowledgeable about the different meats and burgers.
author: Monique C.

description: Really greasy hamburger and it didn't have much flavor. The bun was soggy and unfortunately I wasn't able to try the fries because they forgot them in my order to go.
author: Mitch M.

description: Came here while on a business trip. After a long day of seminars wanted something quick and yummy and this place delivered. I got the mini and it was juicy and delicious. Also got the garlic fries and they really mean GARLIC! Fast and friendly service and easy seating.
author: Mallory W.

description:
I can't believe I never tried Super Duper Burgers until last week. I've been missing out! 

Similar to other reviewers, I really like how they give you the option of having a mini burger or a regular super duper burger. The burger + the sauce + jalapenos were such a great combo together. It was juicy and plain delicious! 

I regret not ordering their garlic fries.. will definitely do so next time!
author: Joyce W.

description: Great place to grab a quick bite to eat! Fast and delicious! Staff are friendly and food is always tasty. Oh, and if you have room grab a organic soft serve cone- you'll be happy you did!
author: Danielle H.

description: Good burgers, good fries, enjoyable quality ingredients. If you have enough room, the soft serve they have is pretty good as well. I like pickles  on my burgers and they have pickles in the condiment section and I could take as much as I wanted, so I really appreciated that. Would come again.
author: Thomas C.

description: Good burgers and fries. The line is usually pretty long. The service is quite fast. I recommend.
author: Shenna J.

description: Good food, great atmosphere. Not so much a sit down, but you know what you are getting when you go to a burger join, and SDB has it all. Will definitely return.
author: Jeff O.

description:
Pretty damn good.

I just happened to be walking by and smelled the burgers cooking. I yelped the place and decided to give it a try. Fries were cooked well too. Ketchup wasn't "brand name" but it tasted better than the brand names to me. It's a chain so I will have to see if they come to the east bay (like Gott's)
author: James L.

description: Totally loved the place! It was a little crowded but it was awesome! I ordered the regular double patty burger along with a beer and just had a great time. The flavors of the drink and burger went very well together. And the price wasn't that bad considering it was San Francisco. The best part was the quality of the food! The fries were pretty decent and the milk shake was bomb. Really sweet!
author: Kay T.

description: Super Duper has some SUPER DUPER burgers. If you order the "SUPER DUPER" it will have you in a food coma! The beef patty is delicious, although...a little too greasy. It's so greasy the bun turns to mush. That being said, opt for the mini burger. Your tummy will be satisfied and you won't feel like your arteries are clogging. Garlic fries are pretty good. Not the best I've had, but pretty good. Would I recommend, why yes I would! Really like their spicy pickles too! :)
author: E C.

description: I love the fact that Super Duper Burgers is very fast when it comes to their service. If you are insanely hungry then you can always depend on your quick-service. The only thing that has being a problem for me is getting my own order, believe it or not nearly half of the times I got someone else's order or an extra item I had not ordered. Not as long as a fancy restaurant but long enough for it to be unpleasant. I usually get their Super Duper Burger with Bacon or the Mini Burger with Garlic Fries. I love the variety that they have here and this is a highlight to this food chain. If you're in the area then I recommend you checking them out.
author: Juliet L.

description: Best super duper around! The burger was juicy, the garlic fries had yummy cheese and service was friendly and helpful! The burger appears small but the patties are a hearty serving and the dips are all tasty! I didn't try any ice cream here but I have at the other locations and they're always good.
author: Guisela L.

description: Review from my husband (I did not eat here): Great quick bite. Very filling and fresh! Comparable, and even slightly better, to Five Guys. He recommends to have it cooked medium well, otherwise it is very pink. He got the Super Burger with bacon, cheese, and jalapeño. He would eat there everyday if he could. Be prepared for messiness.
author: Kaitlyn N.

description:
It's a nice burger place... A lil different but yummy different... 

Tried their veggie burger and the twist here was the hummus... It tasted really good... Won't say it was the best burger I ever had but it was good and I might be a lil biased since I was starving when I had this... 

Also their Garlic fries are super yummy... A little too oily but super delicious... 

Not the place for people on a diet... 

One thing I noticed on their menu was wine on tap... super duper weird and unique... never saw that before... have seen places serve beer on tap but never wine on tap... I didn't try it so no idea how it is...
author: Rupa S.

description: First time here and was pleasantly surprised! I wasnt expecting much from here but the burger was perfectly cooked and a bit crispy around the edges. The taste is similar to Shake Shack but much better! The mini burger was $5.50 and the bigger one was $7.50. The garlic fries were full of flavor! It was about $3.50. I would definitely come back when visiting norcal. It is a bit different than In n Out but I would say very similar in taste and more expensive. I would def recommend everyone to try this place!
author: Sara K.

description:
They do use all organic and locally sourced ingredients so that really clears up any hesitation I previously had.  That certainly doesn't mean it's all health food by it does mean you're starting off with great ingredients!  

Thank you to Ed and Nancy at Super Duper for clarifying.
author: Brooks M.

description: Six star for the patty + 4 star for the bun = 5 star burger! Super Duper Burger lives up to its reputation and IMHO it's even better than Shake Shack and In and Out. The patty is soooo juicy that it melts right in my mouth with excellent flavors. Sauce and cheese in the burger complements the meat and bun seamlessly. French fries are very homemade-like in the good way. Highly recommend it for tourists visiting SF and locals who are looking for casual lunches / dinners.
author: Frank W.

description: I am usually very fond of Super Duper especially during my time when I was working at Target. And today (May 22, 2017) at 8:50 PM, I ordered a mini combo with a regular vanilla shake and a super combo to go. The service was extremely fast the meal came out within 2 minutes. When I got home (about a 5-minute drive), I was very disappointed with the burger. It was bland and very dry as if they gave me one that was left sitting on the counter. There was very little super sauce on the buns and the fries were stale and dry as well. Overall, I don't think I'll be coming back to this location as I received better service and food at the 721 Market St location.
author: Judy C.

description: At 18 dollars plus tip for my chicken sandwich, fries, and a soft serve I expect them to at least get my order right. Unfortunately this was not the case. They weren't even busy! To be fair, it's partially my fault for just pocketing the receipt without looking. The kitchen and the cashier both managed to screw up (cashier on my sandwich, the kitchen didn't give me my fries!!). The location on Market is much better. I've never had any issues and should have just walked the extra 4 minutes. Oh well, next time!
author: Cris S.

description: Awesome fast food burgers! I ordered the super burger. I would get a mini burger next time. The super burger was enormous. The garlic fries are unbelievable. I saw another guy got an egg on his burger. It looked great. This place blows In N Out out of the water. I loved this place.
author: J W.

description: Enjoyed my meal very much, only giving it 4 stars because I wished they gave the option of a turkey patty. However, I think it's great that they have a veggie burger and a chicken sandwich! It allows me to have options since I can't eat beef. Delicious food and I am definitely looking to come back :) Garlic Fries are to die for!
author: Jennifer Q.

description: This is one of my favorite local hamburger shop. The best thing in here for me is vegetarian burger. But let me tell you this, I'm not vegetarian, definitely. I LOVE MEAT. But the vegetarian patty in here, so good. I couldn't believe it first time. I don't even know why I ordered it, but It was delicious. The first place that vegetarian food was unexpectedly delicious.
author: Daisuke F.

description:
With a name like Super Duper Burger, obviously any burger lover would flock to the place. That's exactly what I did.

The inside has that very fast casual look and feel that you would see in a Chipotle. There is an upstairs and downstairs dining room, both full by the time we walked in. A good sign!

At the register we laid down our order, mine being the Super Burger (two 4 oz. patties, super sauce, and all the usual burger toppings) plus cheese (and extra 75 cents). Ollie took our order. He was extremely friendly, and once we found out this was our first time dining here he told us the low down about the place. He even included the part about their beers and a happy hour. If we weren't on a time constraint that is something that might have been looked into. 

The burger was good and messy, plus cooked the way I wanted it, rare. I'm not sure what the Super Sauce is but it did taste good. We both ordered regular fries, yet there was still a garlic flavor that elevated them. Everything tasted awesome, including their homemade pickles they have at the condiment station. 

A place like this very well deserves the name they have given themselves.
author: Jonathan R.

description: Consistently good burgers. I wish they had soda refills in the balcony area.  Today the tomatoes were worthless, barely red (somewhere between green and pink, and is Late July not in good tomato season?)
author: Amy W.

description: This is by far my favorite "fast food" burger spot. It is my go to and I live right near by! The service is always amazing and I can't recommend this place more!
author: Thomas H.

description:
Decided to try something new since most restaurants were closed on Easter Sunday. Ordering was pretty simple and I was given a buzzer once I paid. 

Super Burger has 2 4oz patties. Patties are smaller so the burgers are very manageable in size. Added a slice of cheese for a whopping $0.75, but the burger can't be complete without it. I also really loved the grilled onions that added a slight sweetness.
I love that the garlic fries have some aged cheddar cheese on top that makes it extremely flavorful. 

Overall, meal was slightly more expensive compared to something equivalent at in-n-out, but the garlic fries and thicker patties makes it unique.
author: Edward W.

description:
Super Duper Burgers ended up being the second stop on our second date with my guy. Honestly, it's a weirdly impressive-yet-casual burger joint. Younger-me was just amazed that you could order some pretty solid beers at a burger place (oh, how the times have changed).

Service is fairly fast, for the amount of turnover they had. The place is quite clean, and it's easy to pop in for a quick bite, an ice cream cone, or a drink. Prices are a little high, but so is the quality, so it seems worth it in my book!
author: Claire S.

description:
Good location | Good food
$$

Came here after walking around SFMoma. First time for us but not for our friends. 
We ordered the chocolate milkshake and veggie burgers. YUM!! Good size portions, didn't feel like I had a food coma afterwards but was full enough. Next time I'll come back here and order a beer with my food. 

Closeby are museums, breweries and shopping. 
Parking lots -- SFMoma lot on 147 Minna St or Fifth and Mission, which is only a few blocks further down.
author: Lauren F.

description:
yum yum yum. who doesn't love a good burger? Came here for lunch today while on break at work. I had only been here once before but I had only tried a milkshake (Cookies & Cream - amazing btw). 

This time I ventured out and got a burger. I ordered the Mini Burger because let's be real, the "Mini Burger" is actually just a normal sized burger (1 patty) vs the double patty or the "Super Burger." This burger came with lettuce, tomato, onions, and super sauce, plus i added cheese. I also ordered garlic fries and a diet coke - necessary pairing with any burger. 

This burger was really juice and really yummy. It is a good amount of food though, i don't know if i would ever order the double patty but hey that's just me because you gotta save room for dessert! Unfortunately this time I did not have room for my Cookies & Cream milkshake, but next time it will happen.
author: Ilana B.

description:
I LOVE SUPER DUPER. wow I was blown away.

Everyone thinks of In and Out as the signature Cali chain, but Super Duper beat them by far.

I've never had an affordable, chain burger that was cooked like a gourmet burger (medium rare). It was fantastic.

I had the mini burger and it was more than enough. The fries were good too. My vegetarian friend who I came with said her veggie burger rocked as well.

I dream about this burger it was so good. Hope to come back next time I'm in the area.
author: Sarah S.

description: Great great spot. Delicious medium cooked Patty. Have two options of mini order aka single patty or double. Must go place.
author: Sumbal A.

description:
Their burger quality is exceptionally desirable.  I would say their burgers are a cross between fast food and gourmet. The meat is really thick and juicy which gives it the gourmet feel and the fast food part is everything else in the burger.
I ordered the mini burger which is just 1 meat patty and added jalapeños and grilled onions on it. Didn't have grilled onion in it but I was too lazy to go and tell them. Really good size where the burger fit right into my hand.  The only thing I noticed was that they kind of skimped out on the lettuce.  Just one small piece was in mine and I didn't find that enough for me.  
Their garlic fries were delicious though.  A little oily at the bottom of the tray it was in but their was the garlic flavor on every fry that I ate, which is what you want for garlic fries!
author: Tiffany Z.

description: I had dinner here while walking about in San Francisco after working there for the day.  The atmosphere is very comfortable, and the staff was very nice, as well as helpful to understand menu options.  The burger I had was great, flavorful, juicy and fun!  It was also nice to be able to have a glass of wine at a burger place!
author: George W.

description: Got the Chicken sandwich I believe and was soo good. Cashier didn't seem to love her job but she was funny and gave really honest opinions lol. Great place.
author: Alfredo P.

description:
First place I've tried in SF during my visit from Seattle! 
The burgers were J-U-I-C-Y. So each bite I took, it was extremely flavorful. 
If I could remember correctly, I had gotten something with mushrooms and it was BBQ, I believe. Atmosphere was chill, It was a little crowded; so you know this is a popular place for burgers. The price was moderate. Wasn't expensive nor inexpensive. Bathroom was very small.
author: Jessica Y.

description: Burger joints used to say have it your way, well these guys don't just say it it's in their DNA! I asked for no bun, Super Burger, avocado, fried egg and got it with juicy goodness. Meat is not flavored so the juiciness is all natural protein. We ate garlic fries also awesome. Place was crazy busy but food was served fast and good. Clean dining experience and service was most excellent!!!
author: Ed R.

description: Best hamburger I had so far in the West coast... this is the Californian equivalent to shake shack...
author: Avner Y.

description: Mediocre burgers but absolutely excellent garlic fries with 6mo cheddar shreds!  Crispy on the outside and soft on the inside -  likely because they are soaked in garlic oil.  Lol definitely can not eat these daily but are a yummy sinfully garlicy treat! Are garlic fries a thing in san francisco?
author: K L.

description:
Our group ate there a couple different times in the 5 days we were in town.  The first time, we all ordered separately, and everyone got their food in a pretty quick amount the time.  Well, except for me and my husband.  I ordered a chicken sandwich and garlic fries and he ordered a cheeseburger.  After 15 minutes went by and everyone was just about done eating, I went up to the counter and talked to the lady helping expedite.  I say helping loosely.  She mostly stood at the end of the counter talking to a guy he must work there or manage.  Sooo when I talk to her, I ask if my order got lost or something, so she looks at my receipt and says oh. You ordered chicken, that takes longer.  Then she asks the kitchen and I see them look at my ticket that is at the very front of the line, which is a good 3-4 feet away from the other tickets.  So, I wait another 5 minutes before our food is done.  So instead of being honest with me and telling me that our order got misplaced, she gave me a line of crap before even asking.  I'm a manager in food service and have found that as long as you are honest, people are pretty chill.  But I guess others don't feel that way.  
But I must say, the food was amazing. It was absolutely delicious and I would definitely recommend the garlic fries.  They are fantastic. 

I do have to say that on the second trip, my chicken sandwich only took like 5 minutes!!  They just have had some fast cooking chicken that day!!!   

So all in all, it was a pretty good place to eat.  Very busy, but good.
author: Jennifer C.

description: This place is pretty crowded during peak lunch hours. We usually take burgers to-go and that works out well. Their burgers are delicious. Even their veggie burger was yummy. The garlic fries are enjoyable. This is a good place for grab and go. It can be quite noisy to sit down and eat during lunch hours. Most people at my work like their burgers too.
author: Tejashree M.

description: Garlic Fries... That's all I have to say!!!! Well, the burgers are quite good too. I was also rather fond of their homemade pickles that had a spicy kick. The ingredients were fresh and food was served immediately. Great service and ample room at this establishment.
author: Alex C.

description:
if I were to choose from Super Duper or In and Out... I will choose Super Duper!! why? Organic everything and more tasty! Unlimited homemade pickles! Yes please?  plus you can add egg and avocado for a 5 star experience!! Garlic fries here is the best most especially when hot.

I work in the city and there are two branch near me, one in Market street and these branch.. And I prefer this than the one in Market, because it is more crowded there and I feel like this is cleaner than the one on the opposite side. 

Line can be bad at lunch time, but they serve fast.. 

For vegetarians, they have veggie burger and it's not bad.. I like it as well but I did not finish the whole burger.
author: Pauline P.

description: Good burger, HORRENDOUS service.  A good burger for $15, and service that is worse than  McDonald's!!!
author: Tomas S.

description:
"Over priced for what you get. The super burger is mostly meat, the sauce barely exist, and the meat is not seasoned enough.
Adding salt to the wound, the ice machine was broken and the soda was warm. 
Oh yeah and the burger is tiny." -Addasi
author: Ahmmad S.

description:
This spot is always popping. Especially around dinner time.

So asked the guy about the "Super Burger" and he explained it was 2 8oz patties, and add whatever I like. So I did add everything (lettuce, tomato, bacon, cheese, jalapeños). Ordered fries too. Fries were legit. Piping hot, nice with the Kensington ketchup the offer. Also grabbed some of their homemade pickles. 

Ugh so sad. The burger. The Not-So Super Burger which was definitely not super. So sads. I mean it was flat, one piece of lettuce, special sauce was good, bacon was just thrown on the bun and it was flat (oh said that), no super-ness about it. 

I like Super Duper a lot but this visit turned me off.
author: John M.

description:
Super Duper is one of my favorite burger places in Bay Area! I always went there when I want some burger, or garlic fries, or milkshake. They never let me down.

The service is great! You might argue that they don't offer service since it's a fast-food like place. Yes, but the cashiers are nice and greet you with smile; from time to time, staffs come to your seat to pick up trays and wastes.

The environment is clean and organized.
author: Ya-Lin H.

description: The name is enough Super Duper Burgers, what else can I say! We all enjoyed, very juicy and flavorful with some great sauce. Definitely coming back and recommend.
author: Roheen S.

description: I got a super burger today. It had 2 patties that looked different and less appealing from the double patty burger I got maybe a year ago. It seemed more greasy today. A little overpriced. I ate it and it was pretty good. Patties are thick enough and juicy enough with just the right amount of salt.
author: Denise C.

description: Delicious burger. I had the Mini with everything and an egg add-on. There are a lot of options available. The beef was juicy and flavorful, the veggies fresh, egg cool spot on with soft yolk. No need to anything else. The garlic fries were crispy- garlic was not overwhelming. I washed it down with water, but there are shakes, fountain drinks, or beer and wine available. Service was quick.
author: Moeketsi M.

description:
The good:
-burger with bacon
-friendly service
-upstairs seating is kind of neat
-sure beats anything served at the Moscone Center

The bad:
-garlic fries were unimpressive
-homemade pickles were bleah

Stopped here as I wanted something different than what the Moscone Center was passing off as food. Ordered a Mini Burger (one 4oz patty) with cheese and bacon, and garlic fries. They cook to order, so that is a plus, a step up from many fast food places. I picked up my food and then grabed some ketchup and some of their homemade pickles. The burger was good. The bacon really made it. Doesn't bacon make everything better? The burger was cooked medium as they tell you unless you specify otherwise. It wasn't the best burger ever but it wasn't by far the worst. The disappointment was the pickles and fries. Maybe it was an off day, but the fries didn't seem cooked enough and they lacked garlic. There was a hint of garlic but not near what I was expecting. They just really lacked flavor. I have also had homemade pickles, and these tasted more just like cucumbers. 

They do have ice cream and serve beer. This location also serves breakfast. None of which I tried. 

I'd probably stop again if I was in the area, but it's not a place I would travel out of my way to go to.
author: Larry S.

description: Eaten here twice in 3 days and BOTH times they cant get a simple burger right - seriously?? What is so difficult about a burger with meat and cheese only?????
author: Sean G.

description: I came here to try there burger while I was near union square.  The overall atmosphere of the restaurant was that if an upscale McDonald' with a decent amount of seatings for customers.  I ordered the super burger w/ bacon and fries combo. The fries were crispy and seasoned well. The burger came with two patties lettuce and tomatoes. Although it looked small at first, it was the right size to be filling. It was juicy and had good flavors that mixed well with the rest of the meal. My only issue was that it was greasy to the point where it was dripping everywhere. Overall, this is a decent burger joint and would recommend going here if your near the area.
author: Giorgio G.

description:
Bam! Lunch was nailed quickly, efficiently and deliciously! That's right, got in line just beyond the "5-8 minutes to order from here" sign and in 20 minutes, had a Super Combo in hand. Double patties, lettuce, tomato, onion, special sauce and garlic fries - took about 10 mins from ordering to eating. Oh yea, that works for me! They also offered free pickles, slightly sweet, not sour and bite sized chunks. Garlic fries had garlic and cheese throughout, not just dumped on top like some places so they knocked those out of the park as well. 

My coworker said - how would you rate this compared to 5 Guys, In-n-Out and others on a 10 point scale. Solid 8, maybe even an 8.5 given that I couldn't compare it to an In-n-Out Animal Style, Double Cooked Bun, mustard grilled patty! But when you go with an exact match, Super Duper edges them both based on meat quality, speed of delivery, and the fry experience! 

Coming back next time into the city!
author: Kevin K.

description: Quality burgers. My boyfriend and I are very picky burger critics and this chain restaurant exceeded our expectations. I got a mini with everything on it and fries and he got a super burger with only meat and cheese. Both of us were pleasantly surprised by this low cost date.
author: Andrea M.

description: The super duper burger has juicy patties packed with great flavor. The garlic fries is aromatic and satisfying. Examples of simple things done right.
author: Dex Y.

description:
Consistency at its finest. Each is the same quality, taste & standard of cleanliness. See a mess? Notify the staff and they're on it! 
Great spot for a group - particularly before catchin' a movie next door!
author: Nick S.

description:
My office celebrated National hamburger day by getting takeout for the whole office. Since I was one of the people to suggest having burgers for lunch, someone volunteered me to go get them. I stopped by this location on Thursday, May 28th around 12 noon. I ordered pickup for 15 people: 15 burgers, about 10 orders of fries and a shake.

My order consisted of:
*Mini burger: 4oz patty with super sauce, add Cheese, Roasted portabello, Organic egg
*Garlic fries: fresh garlic and 6 month aged cheddar
*Add three dips: Super sauce, Housemade mayo, Chipotle

The burger was the perfect size! I loved the addition of the mushroom and egg. I wish the egg was oozy, but I'm not sure if Super Duper does that. Would have made the burger that much more delicious. The garlic fries were great too! Loved the cheese. Would pass next time on the dips. Super rich and didn't really add anything to the garlic fries in my opinion.

My one complaint about Super Duper is they don't take advance takeout orders. I wish they did as it would have made the ordering process easier. I know we had a huge order, so I typed everything out in list form as to who wanted what. I figured it would make things easier. But the cashier looked super overwhelmed by the listed and asked us to read it off instead. This ended up in some errors in our order. Plus, she said each burger would have it's own ticket describing the burger. Unfortunately, some burgers shared tickets (like 3 to a ticket) and it got super confusing. Getting condiments for 15 people is also another thing in itself. I think everyone waiting to get ketchup, mustard and pickles hated me.

Other than the typical issues that arise out of placing a huge order, I enjoyed celebrating national hamburger day. Super duper delivers a solid burger!
author: Elena N.

description: There is nothing bad about this place. I repeat, there is nothing bad about this place.
author: Jasmine C.

description:
This Super Duper location almost the same layout as the one nearby on Market St next to 7-Eleven, but slightly bigger and, for the times I've been there, less crowded.  I do like the fact that this location is at The Metreon so that I could stop by before or after a movie.

My usual here is a Mushroom and Jack Cheese Super Burger with Aged Cheddar & Garlic Fries.  So Good!  (http://bit.ly/OCdYkD)  It's pretty funny though how I'm always tempted to get the Super with two patties, when their Mini Burger with one single patty  would be just enough.  The Aged Cheddar & Garlic Fries are pretty heavy and could actually pass for a meal on their own!  

Service has been hit or miss here for me though.  On one occasion, I ordered my burger which was a simple Mini Burger with Jack Cheese and for some reason the cashier didn't pay attention to my order and asked if I wanted everything on it, so I had to repeat my order again.  Well after a long wait, I got my burger and it was literally a plain Mini-Burger with nothing.  Just bun and meat.  That was sad, and unfortunately I was too much in a rush to go back and have it fixed.  So yeah, that was one mishap, but most of the time I haven't had any problems.

I can't complain too much about this Super Duper location.  The burgers have been solid and satisfying and it's one of the few "fast food" spots where you can throw a runny fried egg on your burger.  It's pretty pricey compared to In-N-Out, and way more expensive than Five Guys when you add a bunch of toppings, but you can definitely taste the quality of the ingredients which are pretty good.  I highly recommend this location of Super Duper if you're looking for decent option to satisfy your burger cravings.
author: Rodney H.

description:
It's good....but not out of this world great. This review is more like a 4 1/2 stars. Kind of reminded me of Shake Shack.

Ordered the mini burger with "everything on it." And that means lettuce, tomatoes, onions and their special sauce. To me, that sauce was like the In n Out spread. The mini was perfect for small eaters. My boyfriend got the normal sized burger....same patty/bun size but the only difference is he gets two meat patties. NOTE: their patties are cooked medium. If you want it well done, make sure you specify that. That's what I did. Also, any additional fixins like avocadoes, bacon or bleu cheese will cost you extra. I think $1.50 more for EACH special item.

Only reason why I knocked off half a star (remember, this is technically a 4 1/2 star rating) was because the burgers were dripping in grease. I know someone have mentioned that before but man...they were right. I had to use a least 3 napkins to soak off all that grease. 

We also got their parmesan garlic fries to share. Honestly, it's small enough for one serving size. If I was hungry that night, I would've told him I want one all to myself!!!!!!!! =)
author: Cynthia L.

description:
I have eaten at Super Duper at least a dozen times. This is my first review after my conversion to wimpy, communistic, patchouli-smelling vegan.

Quick note for meat eaters: I highly, highly recommend ordering your next Super Duper burger with one meat patty, one veggie patty. This approach halves the aggressive quantity of saturated fat, solves the "grease" problem that many reviews complain about, and adds a bunch of rich flavors that are missing from the standard, hamburger.

Ok, on to the vegan veggie burger. It's really, really good. The server I spoke to was super cool about guiding me to a vegan version of the burger served on ciabatta bread (the standard buns aren't vegan). She also said, "you'll want no special sauce, since that contains mayo," and she was right. I love it when staff are educated and joyfully accommodate special requests. Major kudos for the super friendly attitude. That alone makes me want to return to this location.

In case you're wondering, here are the ingredients in the veggie patty, based on internet research: 

* Organic cooked brown rice
* Water
* Organic corn
* Organic carrots
* Organic onions
* Organic green peppers
* Organic rolled oats
* Organic red bell peppers
* Organic soy protein isolate
* Organic canola oil
* Organic high oleic sunflower oil
* Contains 2% or less of  broccoli, sea salt, carrageenan, organic soy sauce, organic onion powder, konjac flour, organic garlic powder, organic spices

The ciabatta bun was toasted a nice medium brown, and the seasonings, lettuce, tomato, jalapenos, grilled onions, and other ingredients on the "everything on it" sandwich provided me with a filling, savory, handheld treat. I'd have added avocado to kick it up a notch, but they charge extra for that and I was curious how good the "basic" veggie burger would taste. 

I arrived at lunch hour. This location was hopping, with a big line that moved fast, with on-the-ball cashiers, and plenty of seating, even at rush hour. 

Final note -- I appreciate that Super Duper is trying to offer a "better burger" and think that they achieve this goal. If you must have a burger somewhere, this is a great choice. But consider the veggie burger on your next visit, and do cows (and your body) a kindness.
author: Vladimir C.

description: They serve a serious amount of meat in their burgers, which I obviously approve of. Trust me, you will not leave this place hungry. The patties were cooked well (medium), but they were a tad too salty. Nonetheless, I was quite satisfied with my meal's taste, portion, and value,, but I'd rather eat Burger Lounge in San Diego. But, Super Duper is better than 5 Guys if that's any consolation.
author: Suzanna L.

description:
Burgers are easy to find but difficult to find made this well! Easily in the top 5 burgers I've ever eaten. 

Not to mention everything is fresh including house made pickles!

The soft serve ice cream is a delicious post burger treat.
author: Brigitte O.

description:
After we walked around for many hours sightseeing many city blocks, we came across with super duper burgers serving organics soft serve ice cream cone. 

We decided to enjoy a nice swirl chocolate vanilla soft serve, which was yummy, creamy texture and the right sweetness, just like we need for a little sugar boost. 
Service was friendly and nice. They've main dining area and a loft dining area. 

We will be back. I would recommend this place.
author: Claudy H.

description: Don't get me wrong,the burgers are good. But lets be honest, you can get nearly the exact same thing at Wendy's for half the price. You probably wont have to wait in line for 20 minutes at Wendy's.
author: D. H.

description:
As good as it gets for sure! So happy to see Super Duper still doing well and tasting as good as they opened day one. I love the mini burger with bacon and cheese, even avocado sometimes, with all of the toppings + fries. 

Dying to try the breakfast sandwich too!
author: Frankie I.

description:
Pretty famished after a thorough tour of the spiffy new MoMA, where I elected not to pay $11 for a pre-made sandwich on the rooftop terrace so that I could finally investigate Super Duper Burgers.

By the time I got back to the car (5th and Mission garage literally a block away), my Super Burger (to go) had disintegrated the entire bottom bun, which became so mushy with grease there was no saving it. Had to flip over and eat like an open faced sandwich. Quality of the patty and produce was excellent and fries were good.  

Will probably order a mini-burger or eat on the premises next time and deftly maneuver lettuce to shield the bottom bun.
author: Cin-Yee S.

description:
I'll keep it simple:

BURGER: if I were to compare it to In N Out, this place tastes more "whole" in a sense that it tastes organic. I would give the edge to this place.

GARLIC FRIES: best fries I've had at a burger joint. Most garlic fries are extremely salty. Ohhh and the smell and taste of the cheese is amazing!!

COOKIES AND CREAM SHAKE: OMG!!! 
Stupid good. I like my cookies and cream shake more creamy than sweet and this place delivered. 

Super Duper is missing a star for customer service. The people that work here seem like they don't want to take your order and make you feel not welcomed. Thank God I'm not the type of person to shy away from this great tasting place.
author: Eugene P.

description: I wasn't expecting this burger to be so good... needless to say my boyfriends and I will be back many times. Cheap & delicious enough to have reportedly!
author: Dylan H.

description:
On my recent visit to San Fran, my friend and I were starved after a night tour. We were simply looking for something still open and near our hotel.

I had a beef burger and my friend had the burger. My burger was extremely bland. I would have needed to add a lot of toppings in order to add flavor.

In a pinch, it worked but I wouldn't choose to go back.
author: Diane R.

description:
The burgers here are actually AMAZING...doesn't even compete with In-N-Out/Five Guys/other burger joints. 

Came here the other day with my boyfriend -- I got the mini, he got the super size burger, and we ordered garlic fries to share. 

If you want the ultimate burger experience, I definitely recommend getting the super size... it's a totally different experience biting into two, thick patties (as opposed to just one patty if you order the mini). But of course both options are deliciously juicy! All the ingredients are really simple but really good quality and flavorful. 

The garlic fries here were unfortunately not as amazing as the burger :( The garlic seasoning was pretty on point but the fries were kind of limp/dry...
author: Jennifer T.

description:
I liked it, the burger had a good beefy flavor although could stand to be seasoned more. I chose to add bacon and avocado and the bacon was good but the avocado was so skimpy as to be almost not noticeable. The fries were excellent. Burger wise I think I like some of the other burger joints like 5 guys a little better but these fries were so good and plus, beer on tap. I want to go back to try the ice cream cone, except I'm not in that part of the city very often.

Revision: I was back in the city by Moscone and stopped in again. I'm bumping my review up to 5 stars. Everything that was good last time was still good (omg the garlic fries) but this time there was just the right amount of bacon and avocado, and the burger was perfectly seasoned. The liner on the tray mentions perfectly toasted bun and I agree, that bun was great. And did I mention beer on tap??
author: Bob M.

description:
The soft serve is delish! I am normally not a fan of chocolate ice-cream because there's only a hint of chocolate flavor. That said, I l-o-v-e-d the chocolate soft serve at Super Duper Burgers because it is so chocolatey! You can even see the tiny bits of chocolate speckled throughout the ice cream. 

Treat yourself to a soft-serve and take a walk in the Yerba Buena Gardens next door. That way you don't feel too guilty you've indulged in a sweet treat and you'll have a bunch of people eyeing your soft serve & asking you where you got that delicious treat! =)
author: Ruby C.

description: I had a Veggie burger with Garlic Fries. Burger tasted pretty good and the fries were amazing. The fries are deceptively heavy but well worth it. The place was busy and a line stretched to the door but it moved quite quickly. Wait time after ordering was about 5 minutes. The unlimited spicy pickles were great.
author: Neil L.

description:
I like places that incorporate a loft area into the seating arrangement.  This location does just that.  

Bacon-cheese single patty $7
Shake $5.  
The pickle(s) was a nice compliment to the meal. 
I enjoyed the Bacon. 

A picture speaks truth.  Check out my photo of the burger.
author: Andrew H.

description: I thought pretty good but there are few great players in this category; shake shake for example.
author: Greg S.

description: I decided to try it out because it was so close to my hotel. The mini burger with egg and grilled onions plus a side of garlic fries were delicious. Great atmosphere.
author: Caitlyn W.

description: This place lives up to its name. Their burgers are great and lie somewhere between fast food and gourmet. Although a bit on the greasy side (there was a giant oil stain on my plate where it had been sitting) the burgers are more than satisfying. The fries are also delicious and the right level of crispy. Even the ketchup is good and has a bit of spice to it. My only problem with this place is the smell - it's a bit overpowering and I always leave this place smelling like burgers for the rest of the day.
author: Sara S.

description:
Gawd, I LOVE THIS PLACE!!

1. FIVE star burger!
2. FLAVOR from organic ingredients and ground beef onsite.
3. Management REALLY cares about customer satisfaction.
4. Clean restaurants.

I have my go to places for my burger fix in all major city's if I'm ever in SF this is IT!
author: Trey C.

description: I am loving this spot!!! Great for a quick bite!  Got dinner before heading out to the bars!  They add a shot to your shake too!  Very affordable and quick service
author: Travis B.

description:
Super Duper is awesome! In my mind, it's definitely better than In-N-Out or Shake Shack. The burgers here are juicy AF, and big enough that it hits the burger spot, but not too big that you slip into an instant food coma. 
The staff are very friendly and efficient, and orders usually only take about 5-10 minutes, even during the busy hours. 

Tip:
Avoid coming here during peak hours (12:00-1:00 and 5:30-7:00), bc you'll probably end up waiting in line for 10-20 minutes. If you can't avoid it, don't worry, the wait is worth it. And if you order a beer during their 5-7pm "Happy Hour", you'll get a free order of fries!
author: Rie U.

description:
The best burger I have had in years, hands down. I love the flavor. I know it can't be good for my ticker but on occasion I will treat myself for sure. Oh and they have soft serve  ice cream with the hard chocolate coating. How cool is that!?

Thanks for the great meal!
author: Tim N.

description: We were starving. We got the burgers and were immediately disappointed with the size. Like in n out size without the taste. Just felt like a plain greasy slider. The meat is on the medium rare side which always results in soggy buns no matter where you go. The bacon was thin and sad looking. I liked the pickles. Frys were average. Water was good with lemon. I don't care for non gmo or organic food. I was looking for a bomb ass crispy manly burger.
author: Carlos V.

description:
Their name says it all.  We liked this place so darn much, we went there twice in one day, after the day we tried it the first time.  This was our favorite burger in San Francisco based on a number of reasons that I will share with vivid detail.  
   The atmosphere is nice and the service is fantastic.  The cashiers were very helpful and friendly.  They set up the atmosphere right off the back.  They were very knowledgeable and were willing to make great suggestions.
   They sell beer.  That's a huge plus for me right off the back.  The interesting thing was that their selection was different at both locations we tried, cool points from me.  
   I really like small sides and they have a jar of pickles you can pick from, as much as you like.  Thank you for that.  I don't know if that's a SF thing because the other joints we tried nearby did the same thing. 
   Down to the main meal.  The burgers are good, like really good.  It's one of the best decent price burgers I've tried.  Really, they're good.  I don't go to a place several times within 24 hrs unless it had something good to offer. 
   The meat is full of flavor, perfectly cooked, good size, juicy, fresh ingredients, and soft bread.  Good balance.  The fries were also good.  Not too salty, not too skinny or thick.  I'm making this sound like Goldie Locks, but this place provides products that are all quality.  It shows itself in the taste and flavors.  
  If you're in SF, check it out.  Especially if you're on budget and don't want to cut down on quality.  I'll be coming back to this place for sure.  It will be one of my must stops when I'm In the city.  Thanks Super Duper Burgers.  You made my belly happy several times.  You guys really are awesome.
author: Carlos T.

description: Tried it for the first time, and I'm impressed. I'm a loyal In-n-Out patron, but Super Duper is  definitely worth the extra couple dollars.
author: TJ C.

description: The burger had no flavor At ALL. They only have one size fries and drinks. The fries are so boring and plain. Oh and even the ketchup was watery. They give u free pickles that I guess are made there which are also not so great. NOTHING I ate here had flavor. I don't understand how this place gets the HYPE it does. I don't know how u can fail at making a burger. If your  thinking of trying this for your first time don't waste your time. #Fiveguys I'm thinking you as I write this.
author: Manar A.

description: Had a super burger with vanila shake and garlic fries. Burger was salty and greesy and fries as well. Beer cost about the same for the shakes so would have been better with beer.
author: Baikal P.

description: Love going here and food always taste great. Mini burger is my favorite. But chicken sandwich is delicious aswell
author: Leel W.

description: I'm a fan. I decided to try out Super Duper Burgers after walking past it for months and I am glad I did. It is a convenient and satisfying stop for a quick burger and fries. I have been twice, and both times the cashier was very friendly and helpful. I got the regular burger and garlic parm fries and was happy with my choice. I'll keep coming back when I'm in the mood for a low-maintenance burger and good fries.
author: Cameron R.

description: Got the mini burger combo and it was the perfect amount of food. Great burger and fries.
author: Lauren M.

description: Casual and fun, I came here with my friends before we went out.  The burgers were big enough to split which made the price much more worth it. I enjoyed my IPA, and the other drinks were great, but the alcoholic milkshake was quite underwhelming for all the fuss, I wouldn't recommend it.  You order from the counter and there are 2 levels of self seating-- overall a pretty young place, but I did see a few families as well.
author: Amelia D.

description:
After a couple days of eating salads and wraps for lunch, I needed a break.

I went to lunch with a coworker and he asked me what I wanted to eat. I said burgers and he took me to Super Duper Burgers.

I ordered a double-decker with everything and sauteed onions. I also got a chocolate milk shake.

Holy cow. (haha)

The milkshake was possibly one of the most creamy and choclatey one I've ever had. I tasted peanut butter but that would just be me...so if you're allergic maybe just double check? I don't know.

The burger I got was not a super duper experience but it was better than average but nothing mind-blowing. It was too "clean" and healthy for me :P the patty was juicy and the bun was tasty. I personally would've appreciated it a bit more if it had some more butter on the bun or something.

I will be back
author: Roxanne L.

description:
After a visit to the movies with friends, we were looking around for a close by place to eat. We looked up the closest fast food, and were surprised to find this place. Personally, I would have settled for a burger king burger at the time, but was exited when we saw how this place looked like a genuine restaurant. 
The Mini Burger meal, is what i ordered, and I was not disappointed with it at all. It was served quick, like you would expect with fast food, but hot and fresh, unlike other fast food restaurants. 
The burger was really good too, in fact arguably one of the best in the City. I beed to try other locations but the experience I had was very good. (To think my friends only got fries).
I'll definitely be back, and would recommend it to anyone in the area.
author: Seamus G.

description:
I came here a couple times within a 3 day stay in San Francisco haha, yummy!

LOCATION/WAIT/PARKING:
It is located in the SOMA district. It is by the Yerba Buena Gardens.

Both times I came here it was relatively crowded, but I did not have to wait too long for my food to be ready. You go up to the cashier and order, then wait for your order to be called. I always did take out.

I walked from my hotel, so I did not have to deal with parking. It seems like with any city the parking can be tricky. It is near a shopping center/movie theater and I believe they had a parking garage and there is of course hard to find street parking available nearby. 

CUSTOMER SERVICE:
Both times I went there was great customer service. Super friendly and helpful people. Keep it up!

FOOD:
Mmmmm Yummy. PLUS, I highly appreciate how they use as much organic and more natural ingredients as possible. 
Both times I ordered the Mini Burger, which to me is a normal burger size haha. I added lettuce, jalapenos, onions, and avocado. So yummy!
I also ordered a side of fries each time. One time I had the garlic fries and the other just the normal fries. Both were delicious. I also tried the 3 Dips: super sauce, housemade mayo, and chipotle. All were very good. 
I also treated myself to the Organic Chocolate Shake, Soooo good. 

They also have great vegetarian and salad options as well. 

Next time I'm here, I want to come back!
author: Summer C.

description: I came here tonight for a quick bite with some friends. As we were eating, a homeless man came in and grabbed some leftover fries from a table and left. Someone, either an employee or a manager (short, with a light pink shirt) chased the man out of the restaurant. The homeless man seemed not in his right mind, but the employee started laughing and provoking him. This was extremely upsetting for me. I understand him asking him to leave, but the way it was done was so disrespectful and tactless. I work for a nonprofit in the tenderloin so I can understand that situations like that can be upsetting because people from the street are unpredictable, but after what I saw I definitely won't be coming back here. I believe that we should be a culture that is loving and valuing of the individual, including the individual that is experiencing homelessness. That really matters to me. Needless to say, I really was disappointed in how this man was treated and nobody should be mocked or humiliated.
author: Kelsey G.

description: Got food poisoning here, ruined an entire west coast trip.  STAY AWAY if you don't want to spend the next 3 days throwing up everything that touches your lips.  Also, the restaurant is dank an dirty so there's that.
author: Billy C.

description:
Homemade pickles and mayonnaise  and all so good on top of a super duper juicy burger!   So good after a long day walking around the Embarcadero. We were relieved when we found this spot open later than most restaurants in the area.  
 This burger was the real deal, definitely fresh and juicy.  The bun was a soft and delicate and all toppings were great.  Over all a great burger!
author: Lisa E.

description: Burger was pretty good just doesn't compare in value to others. I'd go with five guys or in and out over this joint.
author: Kurt S.

description:
I would eat here every day if I could!

Like a fast food burger but absolutely delicious. Better than In n Out for sure. Juicy and delicious. Vegetarian friend says she loved her veggie burger, so it hits all the marks.
author: Michelle W.

description:
The burgers was stunning!
I ordered  Mini burger and garlic fries thought The burger will be small but trust me it will absolutely fill ur stomach.
Garlic fries was good as well, very flavorful but I think they didn't fried the fries immediately cuz is a bit cold already. I would rather wait for longer time to have hot garlic fries. Overall it worth my money.
author: Emily H.

description:
Lives up to its name! 

The mini burger is more than enough to fill me up. I always get the grilled onions just like I do at In N Out, and it definitely adds another flavor dimension. The ingredients are all fresh and the burgers are aesthetically pleasing so you know the chefs took care in making them. 

Garlic Fries W/ Aged Cheddar - Perfect side. The cheddar is sharp and flavorful, and makes you want to keep on eating. 

They also offer homemade pickles in the condiments section, and I always grab a bunch because they provide a refreshing break from the heavy burger and fries.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
This probably my favorite hamburger restaurant in SF. I love the food and the staff is always patient even when the line is crowded.
The best things are the food and the staff. Free pickles while you're waiting for your order is also a plus. The worst part: your hamburger vanishes very fast.
Last time we were here garlic fries looked more like regular fries but they were also pretty tasty.
Their chicken sandwich is worth the price if you need a healthier option.
author: Alejandro G.

description: I got the chicken sandwich and although the sauce was really good, I found the chicken to be really dry and hard to swallow. My brother ordered a beef burger and it was much juicier. Probably going to get a burger next time.
author: Samantha C.

description:
I'd probably do 3.75 stars if I could. The burger was good. Definitely cooked pretty well despite their claim to cooking them medium. The super duper burger is a good way to go, I could have had one to myself but shared. The fries are decent and I totally recommend the chipotle dipping sauce. Oh, you can get the burgers lettuce wrapped which is awesome.

This place is pretty highly rated throughout San Francisco. It's worth a try but it wouldn't be a go-to for me.
author: Jess A.

description:
I was hesitant to try Super Duper Burger because given the rave reviews I didn't want to be disappointed. And after all, it is just a burger joint. In the end, I'm glad I exhausted some calories walking here from the hotel as opposed to getting delivery.   Let me start off and say, the burger was delicious. Moist, juicy, and well seasoned without being salty. I could taste the caramelization on the meat reminiscent of those delicious bits at the bottom of your pan you pick out and eat before forcing yourself to deglaze. Imagine that feeling, but multiply it across a burger. 

I also liked that they have just about every burger related topping you can think of, most free, but the few paid toppings are inexpensive ranging from $0.50 to $1.00 extra. They also have an option to get a fried egg on top, which adds a creamy decadence. In the future though, I would probably get the larger burger as opposed to the mini for this option. 

The bread was soft and fresh, but still toothsome. It had that slight yeasty taste of good bread you would find at your local pub. Very appropriate. 

The garlic and cheese fries were a perfect accompaniment, albeit a bit cold by the time I arrived at my hotel. They are quite garlic-y though, so I wouldn't recommend this as a first date spot!

I topped off my meal with a strawberry milkshake which they advertise as fresh strawberries. While this was not false advertising, and granted the shake was delicious, at $5.50 for about 8 ounces of shake with a small dollop of strawberry purée on top (e.g. the fresh strawberries) I thought this was a bit overpriced. Again that's not to discount the fact that this was a great shake. You can add malt for $0.50, which I did. 

The highlight of the meal was the fresh made spicy dill pickles at the condiments counter. Being Korean, I'm almost embarrassed to admit that I walked away with 2 containers of pickles!

All in all, this could become a real staple for when I'm staying around 3rd and Market.
author: Adina P.

description: Really liked the fact they had a smaller portions burger, really good burger and the right size so didn't get too bogged down.  Next time I'll try the garlic fries
author: Jason H.

description:
Yelp defines a five-star rating as "As good as it gets!", and that perfectly fits Super Duper Burgers: it's just about the best fast-food burger joint you could hope for. 

I ordered the super-burger, which is actually two quarter-pound burgers on a bun. (Don't be fooled by the names they use. The quarter-pound "mini burger" is the size of a normal burger, not a tiny slider.) I asked for my burger to be cooked medium-well, with nothing on it except grilled onions. After a lifetime of asking fast food places to desist from covering my burger in "special sauce" or pickles or tomatoes, with limited success, it was a pleasant surprise to receive my burger just as I asked for it. It was the juiciest, greasiest burger I have eaten in years, and I mean that in the best possible way. The fries were the thinly-cut fast-food style, and were very tasty and cooked just right - not limp, but not burnt, either.

But the highlight of the meal was the vanilla soft-serve ice cream cone with chocolate dip. The soft-serve serve was excellent - simultaneously both creamy and light, and not too sweet. The chocolate dip that hardens as you start to eat it reminded me of Carvel soft ice cream in the Bronx (back in the old days). Although if truth be told, this was better than Carvel.

This place gets very crowded at lunch time, but the food arrives quickly after you order it, and in any case it is definitely worth the wait.
author: Max S.

description: I wasn't hungry so I ordered garlic fries which are super delicious but they are oily which made me think about eating.
author: Venkatesh G.

description: Just normal super duper here is. Nothing special but super duper is always good. Staff were friendly and store was clean. I like this place.
author: Changmin L.

description: Pretty tasty burger. They forgot my onions but still tasty. Price is a bit steep but I guess that's San Fran for ya.
author: Carol S.

description: The free pickles are awesome! Their garlic fries are a must. Organic ice cream is rich in flavor.
author: Kalin M.

description:
Duuuudeeeee..... Y'all need to open one in Berkeley. College students will run over a bitch for this burger. 

It can get super crowded in there especially at night (not surprised, this place is poppin). But the wait is worth it. I usually get their mini burgers. To me, they're a good size. The meat is fresh and nicely medium. Favorite fast food fancy burger restaurant.
author: Frances T.

description:
Best location. Best service. Super duper is the big step up from In&Out and it's still pretty California. 

Juicy burgs and pickle bar included! They also serve beer and garlic fries that will kill a vampire in one bite.

It's clean and fun and the tourists love it and so do the San Franciscans. What really is not to love though.
author: Priti K.

description: The chicken with egg on top was excellent. Decent garlic fries too. I liked the sustainable for here servings. I was actually going to eat at the salad place next door, but it was a wasteland of plastic containers. Way to go Super Duper - you won my business with sustainability and good grub.
author: Khalid N.

description:
Very good. 
 
Ordered the mini burger with an egg....personally I like the egg not as runny. But over all 4/5 

Love the garlic fries.  Husband thought it was too garlicky but I thought it was perfect. 

Strawberry milkshake very good. Wish it was bigger 

Love love the pickles.  I might go buy a jar to take home.
author: Linh L.

description: Going into super duper, i heard either that it was super amazing or just another good burger. And i think im gonna go with the latter after my visit, and thats not a bad thing. I had a bacon cheesburger with garlic fries. It was a good burger, the burger sauce was great and the patty was nice and juicy, and crispy bacon is always a plus. Garlic fries were good but when it came down to it, it was just another good burger. Super Duper is worth a try but dont expect something revolutionary
author: Adrian E.

description: Food was great. Right in the center of Amazon central. Anyplace cops and firefighters frequent, its got to be good!
author: Sam L.

description:
I generally love super duper, all the locatoons, the food is great and usually the workers are awesome. 

Maybe I just had a super duper bad experience with a side of parallel universe stuff.

The service was exceptionally poor. There was a high level of incompetence. 
The condiments and the garbage station seemed to be over lapping space, almost intermingled. Gross.

I think I'll stick to the original location, this one is less then super duper.
author: Ben M.

description:
Always nice to have a good ole burger from Super Duper from time to time.  Also brings back memories when I first started school in the City and I remember going to the Castro location and instantly falling in love. 

I recommend getting a milkshake, if you have room in your belly, otherwise take it to go!  Well worth it!
author: James R.

description:
Super Duper has the potential to win the SF burger game only because they prioritize organic ingredients and home made pickles.

In the world of mass manufactured GMO franken meat and zero information on sourcing and origin of your food, Super Duper proprietors spotted an opportunity and because of that were rewarded by the discerning consumer.

If you're downtown SF and looking for a burger - look no further than SDB.
author: Oleg H.

description:
I ordered a mini burger with added cheese and bacon and it was juicy and crispy at the same time, just the way I like my burgers! 
It was a little bit salty but that could be because of the cheese and bacon

My boyfriend said the homemade pickles were delicious. I think he ate about 3 whole pickles. I don't know, I don't like pickes! 


Tibyan, the lady who took our order, was very friendly and cheery! 

And, the cookies and Cream shake was very scrumptious!!!
author: Majileen C.

description: This Super Duper has amazing food and customer service. The Ollie guy at the counter is probably still in college, but he should be something similar to an account executive instead, or at least get promoted.
author: Alexandra H.

description: Another great time at Super Duper Burger! First time ever getting the chicken sandwich and fries. Was really good! Though the line was long, all the employees did a great job dealing with the crowd. Great place
author: Rhett B.

description:
Horrible horrible service 

Why would they give us buzzers if they don't use them? A Mexican woman in a burgundy shirt tells me she's the manager on duty and that she was about to buzz our number. However 2 of the members in my party were waiting 30 minutes. 
When I asked why that was the case she ignored me. 
When I asked her name she ignored me 
She gave me a business card. Said she wouldn't talk to me. I asked why because I was trying to have a conversation and get an explanation from her 

Totally unacceptable. 
Totally unprofessional 

Never coming back again. 
And she forgot my friends French fries. 
Get it together!
author: Alyssa P.

description: Very yummy burger and loved the homemade pickles. The fries were fine, but not amazing. The milkshake was also very good, very creamy. Fun place to eat.
author: Melissa C.

description:
While Brian and I were chilling on Beard Papa's outdoor seating, we were looking for a place to immerse our fatty selves into. While browsing on Yelp, all of a sudden I hear Brian exclaim, "OH YEAH! I'VE BEEN TO SUPER DUPER BURGERS BEFORE!" 

Well, shoot why didn't you tell me about this place sooner... Let's go!

Brian and I came to Super Duper Burgers about 30-45 minutes into the lunch rush hour. There were about 5-7 people in line in front of me waiting in line to grab their hands on to the famous Super Duper Burger while the restaurant was SUPER DUPER filled with people on almost every table. While the line moved rather quickly, I noticed they use organic products to make their meals on the menu. Another thing I realized is that you can spike up the milkshake if you wanted to. (I wonder what kind of alcohol they put in there...) The lady taking my order looked rather stressed out by the chaos what was happening, but I ordered a mini burger combo and substituted the regular fries with their famous garlic fries.

After I finished taking my order, I filled up my empty glass with some Dr. Pepper and thankfully found a seat toward one of the corners of the wall. Despite how busy the place was, before I could even catch my breath from the boisterous atmosphere in T-minus 8-10 minutes, my pager buzzed. Well... That was fast for a busy lunch hour rush. I grabbed my metal lunch tray with my burgers and fries and  finally took at bite into the famous burger most Yelpers are hyped up about.

The burger itself was juicy goodness. I saw the juice from my burger oozing out as I took a bite. The vegetable and sauce ratio on the burger was just enough to enjoy the quality meat. The quality of the bun was another wonderful factor about the burger. It's spongy and soft almost like an In-N-Out burger. On the other hand, the garlic fries were just enough to compliment my mini burger. I liked the cheese garnished on top of the fries and the flavors weren't overwhelmingly salty.

On a side note, Brian and I had a pretty decent lunch at the Super Duper Burger.
