Here's a good tip to follow whether you should order a mini or super duper burger: The mini burger has one meat patty and cheese. The Super Duper Burger has two patties and two cheeses. If you're a small girl like me, I'd stick with the mini! On the other hand, I would not mind hopping on the BART again to fetch me some of Super Duper Burgers.
author: Aubrey D.

description:
YUM! Omg how did I not go here in the couple of years I've been here?? After so many rave reviews and loud "You HAVEN'T been to Super Duper??!?!?!" from all my friends, it was finally time to check this place out! 

On a Saturday around 1:30pm, the line wasn't long but it was pretty busy! We ordered pretty quickly and got our food in less than 10 minutes (they give you a little buzzer thing when your foods ready).

WHAT WE GOT:
1) Mini Burger (with cheese, super sauce): umm..this is the perfect size burger for someone who gets super full from eating a full-size burger (me, me!). The patty is 4oz, and is a bit smaller than a regular burger, but I swear it somehow looks so much more cute and perfectly portioned! Loved the super sauce with it, cheese nicely melted in the burger, and the patty wasn't overcooked or burnt--it was...perfect. 
2) Garlic fries with super sauce on the side: If you know me, you know l love fries. Garlic fries?? Even better. Super sauce with the garlic fries??? I'm in heaven! I shared this with my sister, which worked out pretty well with how full we got at the end. If you have a bigger appetite, you can get away with getting the fries and burger on your own (kinda like the same portion as in n out)

My friend got a super burger (2 patties) with a sunny side egg and some fries and he was pretty satisfied and full by the end as well.

To note: They have pickles on the side that you can scoop out onto little mini trays--they're pretty good if you like pickles! 

Everyone compares this place to In n Out--In all honestly, I don't think one is better than the other. I love that In n Out gives the option to make fries well done, buns well toasted etc. etc. but I also love that Super Duper has the "mini burger," several other options, and garlic fries. They're both different in their own burger way, but I know next time I'm around I wouldn't mind going here for a meal!
author: Shannon N.

description: Super delicious. I got the chicken sandwich, my boyfriend got a super burger... We got fries and could not eat anything after finishing because we were so full. We were visiting during super bowl weekend and it was extremely busy! But the line moved very fast. Our cashier was friendly and helpful. I would give it 5 stars but it took 25 minutes to get our food which is a little excessive.
author: Tania H.

description: I just moved to SF recently and I've been looking for a great burger place.  I think I've found it with this one. The patties were so juicy and their sauce was to die for. I liked that they also make their own pickles and that they are self serve so I can get as many as I want! A for sure go to
author: Kailee N.

description:
I can't believe I have had Super Duper Burgers bookmarked for over an year before I finally got to try it over Valentine's Day weekend 2015. 

Upon entering, Super Duper Burgers on the inside looked to me like a more hipster & sleeker version of In-N-Out. The menu is fairly simple to understand. There's the Super Burger (8 oz of beef) or the Mini Burger (4 oz) along with the good ol' Chicken burger. Grilled with all natural Neiman Ranch beef, these Super Duper Burgers are cooked perfectly. The only annoying thing is the extra surcharge you have to pay for cheese.

The garlic fries here are a real winner too. They are made with fresh garlic and sprinkled with 6 month aged cheddar and I could honestly two orders of these garlic fries if i was starving. If you order everything as a combo( burger-fries-drink), you save a little bit of money as well.

I can't wait to come back to Super Duper again as I now understand why they have gathered quite a cult following.
author: Philip M.

description:
I came upon this burger joint as it is located directly across the street from the hotel I was staying at. I came for a very late lunch so it was not crowded at all. You place your order at the register and they hand you a buzzer which goes off when your food is ready. This gives you plenty of time to find a seat in their 2 level establishment. 

I ordered the Mini Burger with cheese which is a 4 oz. beef patty that definitely filled me up. The burger was reminiscent of a Shake Shack burger, which is a positive because I loove Shake Shack. The burger was fresh and made medium rare- definitely hit the spot for my burger craving! I also got the garlic fries as my side and OMG it was soo yummy!! I loved the fresh garlic that topped the fries and the cheddar cheese that covered it wasn't overwhelming at all. Also, don't forget to try their free homemade pickles! 

This is definitely a great, casual lunch spot to try out if you're ever in the area and have a burger crave!
author: Diana S.

description:
Their pickles are so good! And they are free? Okay, just stock up some on that tray.

Came here for a weekday lunch, the line and the wait weren't too bad! There are always seats upstairs, if the downstairs is too crowded. The location is pretty good, especially if you are watching a movie at Metreon, shopping in downtownor just working in the financial district!

The burgers here are cooked medium rare and quite delicious! Well, it's not head-over-heels delicious, but is still able to satisfy my cravings. Definitely do order the garlic fries! It was one of the better garlic fries I have had that in awhile!

Watch out for that dripping juice from the burger, you wouldn't want it on your clothes! If you do get grease on your clothes, rub some salt on it.
author: Solongo B.

description: When I'm in the area this is the ONLY place I go to. Great food, great service, friendly staff, clean environment.
author: Joe A.

description:
It's been years since I have revisited Super Duper Burgers and now that I am prepared, (aka not forgetful) I went to the Metrion location with the family. I ordered a Super Duper with everything on it, add an egg. My wife and my friend ordered a slight derivative of my sandwich. We all accompanied our burger with their garlic fries. 

As what I have remembered from the previous encounter, Super Duper burger is yum-o. That over easy egg just adds character, texture, and flavor to a properly cooked beef. The bread was delicious and the other supporting casts were okay. By the way of appearance, crunch, and taste, their fries were nothing spectacular. However, matched with the mild garlic and aged cheddar and you have a good sidekick with the burger. I also had a honor in finishing my daughter's chocolate milk shake and that was pretty good as well.

Coming from the boonies (far East Bay), Super Duper Burger is a place visit if you are close to one location. A destination? Close, but not quite.
author: Paul V.

description:
Following a great experience (Downtown), an underwhelming one (Marina), and a pretty good one (Marina again), I almost felt compelled to check out another Super Duper.  I have no doubt that my one bad trip was just an an aberration, but I just had to be sure.  You know, to help with quality control.  Because that's just the kind of guy I am - willing to force myself to eat tasty burgers for the sake of others.  ;)

Just like the other two I've been to, this Super Duper has a great look and feel with a friendly staff to boot.  However, what sets this location apart is their Happy Hour special - free fries with beer or wine between 5:00-7:00pm.  Pretty awesome, even though we were actually here for lunch on a Saturday instead.

For consistency's sake, I got my usual Super Duper order - a MINI BURGER with Jack Cheese, Bacon, and "Everything on It" with a side of GARLIC FRIES.  Other than a splattering of sauce on the outside of the burger, everything was as I had expected.  The patty was deliciously juicy with a great char, the condiments complemented everything well, and the fries were amazing, as usual.  You can't ever go wrong with crispy fries and loads of cheesy, garlic flavor!  Love the aged cheddar they use...

Although Super Duper may not be the best burger in SF (the patty needs a little something), they're close, as well as the epitome of a "solid burger".  Plus, they're reasonably priced at ~$10 ($6.50 for my burger + add-ons, $3 for the garlic fries), which puts them at the top of the mid-level price point.  Super Burgers go for $2 more, but a Mini Burger is more than enough.  Now I just need to finally update my review of their Marina location and to try their soft serve!  And to try their other locations.

You know, for quality control.
author: Mike L.

description:
Super Duper (adj.): very good; marvelous. 

And that's exactly what the burgers at Super Duper Burgers are like. Since my friends and I were watching a movie at the Metreon across the street, we figured we'd grab dinner at Super Duper Burgers. The whole place (both upstairs and downstairs) was packed and the line was pretty long. Don't worry, it moves fast!

- Super Combo ($12): Super Duper Burger (two patties!) + Fries + Drink
- Add cheese for $0.75, add bacon for $1
- Free toppings: lettuce, tomato, red onions, super sauce, jalapeno peppers, and grilled onions.
- Garlic fries are a MUST! So garlic-y! Make sure you bring gum, cause I forgot... oops.
- Fresh lemonade is made with brown sugar, but it was pretty underwhelming. 
- Unlimited pickles for your taking! Granted, they're not the best pickles, it's nice to have the options of pickles to eat alongside your burger.

I wouldn't say these are the best burgers ever, but it does get the burger cravings satisfied. I'm not a huge fan of the bun, but the patties are so juicy and moist - to die for! I also like that they serve beer ($5) and wine here. And spike your milkshake for $1.50!? I will definitely be back to try that!
author: Christine S.

description: Walked by this place numerous times and others had told me that that this place was good. Had the double cheeseburger w/ fries and a drink combo that is advertised while standing in line.  My sources were very reliable, as this place was very good.  Fast & kind service, and they have homemade pickles one can try.  The line is usually quite long at lunch time. Will go back.
author: Jim I.

description: Interesting burger place -- reminds me a lot of Shakeshack. I got the super burger with garlic fries; the burger was smaller than I expected and the garlic fries were way too flavored. The homemade pickles were actually quite good (although they look kind of nasty). Overall, it was an average burger place that was somewhat overpriced -- not a shitty experience but not exactly great. Service was also kind of slow.
author: Peter W.

description: Stopped by on the way from Bart to At&t park. Got to say this place is really good,  no complaints from anyone in our group.
author: Casey C.

description:
There are two Super Duper Burgers within a block of each other and this one is by far the better one. It's cleaner, better decor and more friendly staff. 

I decided to have a quiet night in, so stopped off here after getting a bottle of wine. I decided to try the chicken sandwich as I don't really rate their burgers and was very pleased - it's a lovely fillet with some seriously grill action on it. Get cheese. I also got the garlic fries just so I can repel everyone on my flight back to the UK today. 

The chicken sandwich seemed to take longer than a burger so that might be a factor if you're in a hurry. Otherwise, it's a good choice and is way better than their standard (bland) burgers.
author: Briony C.

description:
Since moving to the city, I've had Super Duper a few times now. I've tried both their chicken sandwich and their classic burger. Personally, I feel like Super Duper is good, but it's a little greasy...Then again, I am really partial to In N Out and Super Duper just isn't as good. I do like their shakes better than In N Out's though, so I'll be back again if I want a shake.

I also really like the interior of the restaurant and service is fast!
author: Trisha V.

description: Perfectly fine. I thought this was more of a one-off spot based on Yelp, but when we were on the way, we realized it was a chain. The food was good, but more expensive than we would have likes, and the buns were extremely crumbly to the point of being basically useless. It's a good enough place to grab some food but nothing to write home about. Feels a bit like a Gott's with the same high prices and slightly less quality.
author: Olivia H.

description:
Super duper greasy, but super duper good. Unfortunately, it always makes me feel like I've eaten a super-duper gut bomb.

The burgers are dripping with grease, which as you might guess means they're delicious. They're also sloppy and require lots and lots of napkins. I got the garlic fries as well, and while the order may look small, you can trust me when I say that they'll be more than enough. I left about half the fries still in the bag, simply too full to finish them. And I can eat.

I like Super Duper Burgers, but I think it makes more sense to eat late at night, after you've already made a few other bad decisions. For my money, this is great drunk food, and not something that should be eating during the daylight hours.
author: Matt E.

description: Big space. Fast Service. Good Value. I come here with my roommate at least once a week. The burger can be a little oily and sometimes it might be too rare, but you can take it back for another one (awesome service). The chicken sandwich has little bit of kick to it. I like the layout   and service in this location better than the one on Market.
author: Dion L.

description:
Great Burgers and amazing pickles. Love the vegetarian patty.
This place has a long line on weekdays but it moves pretty fast.
author: Deepthi S.

description: I usually go for the chicken burger at Super Duper Burgers! I got it here as well, and the service was quick, the food came out fairly fast, and there was just enough seating for our crew! Hit up those garlic fries as well if you want some carbs on carbs.
author: Michael K.

description: Nothing special about this place, nothing special about this burger. It's a burger. Didn't have much flavor to me. There were a decent amount of options to choose from for the burger. Beer selection was ok. Place was clean but again, nothing special.
author: Jeff N.

description:
Having heard great reviews about this place, I finally had the chance to try it when my husband decided to have dinner here. So, I was pretty hungry but I figured the Mini Burger would be good enough to fill me up instead of ordering the double patty and I even added an egg on top. My husband had their Chicken Sandwich then we shared an order of garlic fries. First, you place the order at the counter then they give you a beeper to let you know when your order is ready.

They cook the patties medium unless you say otherwise. The bun is very soft and the actual meat was flavorful but it was too small for the price we paid. The egg was cooked sunny side up which was a bit disappointing because I don't think you should cook it in that style when you put it on a burger. I should've been specific about how I wanted it cooked but I assumed they would make it the way where it won't run everywhere else and no yolk is left to eat with the burger. Every other place I've been to always had it over medium/over hard. The garlic fries were a little greasy which made it soggy but the amount of garlic was plentiful and fresh because it sure cleared up my nose. 

It was good but I was just disappointed since our meal came up to $20 (no soda or any drink) and I was still hungry. My husband liked his sandwich so I'm glad he was satisfied. I immediately regretted not ordering the double patty but at least I could say I finally tried this place.
author: Candice J.

description:
Cant believe I never made a review for this place.

Came once back in 2012 (hella long ago lol) with the hubs since he loves burgers. I like that this place is spacious as well as clean.

Their menu is fairly small, and the sizes of burgers are mini or super. I do not suggest going for super, theyre HUGE. The mini alone will make anyone full. I don't like onions or pickles and thankfully they dont add that stuff in there unless you ask. They have extra additives, but be warned: Your burger will look funny.

Fries are good. GARLIC FRIES? Different story. These are God's gift to Super Duper. Burgers be on point, but their damn garlic fries were a gift from the world's cosmos. Thinly sliced potato fries coated with freshly chopped garlic(not powder) and herbs with a nice oily glaze... and they're cheap as hell! ($2.75 i believe). 

Service was quick, and they're quick to help you out. You can always ask for more toppings for an additional cost. This location is nicer because it doesnt get overcrowded.
author: Jerianne G.

description: Really really really really realllllllllly good burgers and garlic fries were fire!!!!! A lot diff from all the other garlic fries I've had. Def will be coming back here and have recommended it to others. Really good!!!
author: Roma K.

description: 4.5*!  For a fast food burger joint, this is probably one of the best I've had.  I was only in SF for a week so I didn't get to try more places.  I would definitely go back next time I'm in town.
author: Alan W.

description: Love the consistency of Super Duper. Can count on all of their locations to produce that satisfying medium burger on those incredibly toasty buns!
author: Yad L.

description: We came for ice cream and stayed for burgers lol.  The dipped cones are amazing. The chocolate shell is the real stuff, thick layer of goodness. The kids ate it all. We also got a double w cheese and egg... which was awesome,  the lettuce was super green, tomatoes red and all the colors were fresh and bright... almost looked fake, lol.  Fries were good too.  Only thing that was meh was the pickles... but I am quite picky on the right pickle
author: Anne C.

description: Burger and soft serve were good, but forgettable beyond that. Garlic parm fries better than avg. Friendly service.
author: Jen J.

description:
I got late lunch here earlier today. Around 4ish pm, it was very busy! 

I caved and bought a super burger with grilled onions, grilled mushrooms, and blue cheese...and I got a bacon sugar donut on the side. I shared garlic fries with my boyfriend who got a super burger with bacon, cheese, and avocado which he seemed to love.

The burger was juicy but not necessarily flavorful. There wasn't enough blue cheese for my taste but I loved every bite that had a juicy chunk of cheese. The mushrooms made it more flavorful for me and gave me more texture. They forgot the grilled onions but I never asked about it again. Expect epic post-meal grogginess because it's a pretty heavy meal. 

The donut was not very good......too oily and not enough bacon pieces. 

The fries did not look as juicy as they used to. They weren't as crispy and the cheese was different. Not as garlicky. I just ate them with ketchup cuz they were still pretty good BUT...my boyfriend bit down on a chunk of plastic. Probably a little bit smaller than a quarter size chunk. 

We told the staff and they were really quick about giving us replacement fries and a refund on our meal. They were nice and seemed really sorry (they get an extra star for customer service) but it really did ruin our meal.

EDIT-

Actual location was:

721 Market St
San Francisco, CA 94103
b/t Ofarrell St & Kearny St in Financial District, Union Square, SoMa
author: Sofia R.

description:
Late night snack? Super Duper burger was calling my name. I had a week full of fattening food so I went for the veggie burger. I didn't expect it to be as good as it was. Great consistency and packed with flavor plus the hummus added moisture, and cucumbers some crunch. I also added on jack cheese and avocado. The avocado made it - be sure to add that to your order. Just enough to fill me up (so there wasn't a need for the French fries I was lusting after).

I also stopped in here for a vanilla choco twist soft serve kiddie cone. It's organic - so that's a bonus. I can't say I've ever had organic ice cream. It tasted the same as non-organic, but I suppose the milk isn't packed with hormones (?) and of course still creamy, rich, and delicious. It had been quite some time since I had a nice cream cone so I savored it. All I wanted were some rainbow sprinkles to sweeten the deal. 

For a quick, delicious bite to eat go for Super Duper every time.
author: Breanna B.

description: The super burger with cheese added was really good! Very juicy burger and the melted cheese "glued" the two patties together perfectly. It's a really heavy burger that will make you insanely full, so beware. I also like how the red onions were sliced thinly to add the perfect amount of onion to each bite. The pickles were great as well - very fresh and have a surprise kick to them. Very friendly staff, the line was long but moved fast, and the food was prepared very quickly too! I liked the overall burger here a little more than In n Out and Shake Shack, but In n Out has the better bun and sauce and Shake Shack has way better fries. Whichever you prefer, this place makes a great burger!
author: Kelly B.

description:
I always get the mini combo with garlic fries, and my husband gets the super burger, both with "everything on it" + avocado and an egg. 

The burgers and garlic fries are delicious, however, every time we come here, they always seem to forget the avocado, or egg, or both. I mean, once or twice is understandable, but we've been here a few times now, and they never seem to get our order right.

Also, their cookies and cream shake was pretty good before, but for whatever reason on my last visit (last week), it wasn't as tasty. Barely tasted anything but milk. I even had my husband taste it, just to make sure. Maybe we just came on an off night, because their shakes were always so good.

Overall, super duper burgers is still one of my favorite burger spots. I will always come back, no matter how many times they forget my avocado and egg lol
author: Esther C.

description: Juicy, grass fed burgers, for the cost of fast food. Locally owned and operated. The flavor is incredible. Quality...Quality...Quality.
author: Hyon L.

description:
I've reviewed the other Super Duper location (on Market) and basically: DELICIOUS and JUICY burger (junior size is actually quite satiating) and amazing (free) self-serve pickles. Strauss soft-serve. YES. Fries. Fucking awesome again. Basically, this place lives up to the hype.

The only thing that makes this place better is HAPPY HOUR 5-7 (free fries w/ beer or wine!). Me and a friend dropped by here after the wait was ridiculous at Tropisueno for their HH (sigh, I'll never be able to try their HH..) Alas, there was no line or anything here at 6:15 or so on a Friday and plenty of seating everywhere. We didn't even know it was happy hour! Ended up being $12 for 1 beer, 1 wine, 1 normal order of fries and one garlic fries.
Yum yum yum as always. DO IT.
author: Emily C.

description:
Everybody here is so _nice_!

I alternate between the mini burger and the veggie burger, both with added avocado and grilled onions. If I had to nitpick, sometimes they forget either the grilled onions or the avocado, which is a bummer at $1 extra (the grilled onions are free, so it's hard to get too annoyed at that). As a result, I think *one* extra/special request is pretty reliable for this place, but two is pushing it. 

Otherwise, the basics are really solid: nicely toasted buns, fresh ingredients and quick service. A bit on the greasy side (don't forget to grab a napkin or two), but... it doesn't stick with you the way a greasy spoon diner burger does.

They also offer a small selection of beer and wine, and a tasty lemonade for lunchtime. All around great spot for when I'm hankering for a quick lunch (even when crowded!) or dinner.
author: Krista L.

description:
I decided to hold my daughter's post ice skating birthday celebration at this location. Nancy was super friendly and accomodating. On the day of the party, her assistant Mervyn was there to help me out. I cannot thank Mervyn and his team enough for the exceptional customer service. All of the food came out in a timely manner, the food was delicious, and everyone had a wonderful time.

Thanks Super Duper for the best party ever!
author: Karen C.

description:
I like that they have both mini-burgers and regular burgers, so I can modify my order according to my appetite.  Their burgers taste good and I like that the juice oozes-out as you bite into it.  Their fries are good and so are the garlic fries.  Just make sure you don't have an important meeting after lunch.  Or better yet, make sure whomever you're meeting with enjoys the garlic fries too.

I think finding seating at this location is easier than the one on Market.  The upstairs seating area helps as well.  Expect a line whenever you come here, but I think it moves pretty well.  

Don't forget to help yourself to the pickles at the condiment counter.  You won't be upset.
author: Lon H.

description: Yum! Not only does this place smell amazing but the food is to die for. The burgers are pretty thin so their "super" burger is very doable, and you have to get one of the organic shakes - literally melt in your mouth. They have a few locations in SF but the one in Mission has the good jams.
author: Cayla H.

description: This place hands down has one of the best burgers I've ever had. Truly melt in your mouth hamburger patties. The buns have just enough crisp and they're nice and buttery. You can tell they use excellent quality ingredients. The fries were excellent as well!! The customer service was friendly and fast. Their decor is great, very modern and clean. Highly highly recommend!!!
author: Meg M.

description: OMG this was the best burger I have had in a long time. And the fries, the garlic fries were amaze balls. I know you could probably smell my breath a mile away after but it was worth it. It's kind of in-n-out style fry but better if you can believe it. The burgers were phenomenal just the way they make them and the pickles which are made in house pair great with those greasy burger, they cut the fat nicely. The only downside is that you can only find this place in downtown SF. Not even one in the Airport(we were hoping to take some home) All in all it's a must when coming to SF.
author: Lorren W.

description: Super! We recommend the veggie burger, plus avocado and trimmings. Tasty! The lemonade is good, too -- not too tart, not too sweet, just right.
author: Bob W.

description: All things considered, taste, quality, price, and customer service  etc I have to give them 5 stars.  I loved the garlic fries. The burger patty was cooked perfectly and the sauce was also great.  Not to mention the line moves quickly.  Good stuff, I'll be back
author: Kevin K.

description: Having lunch at Super Duper was a pretty okay experience. I got the super burger and although it was quite tasty it was also quite oily. I enjoyed the few fries that I stole from the people sitting next to me, and the free pickles were also pretty great. Overall, a p.good burger place.
author: Zaid E.

description:
Love, love, love this joint. Despite the lines, the hard to find seating, the food is totally worth it. When I come to San Fran for business trips, I make it a point to go here. 

The ingredients are fresh, everything is cooked properly and there is quick turn around.
author: Kevin F.

description:
Looking for a good burger after a day of work, shopping and or exploring downtown? It's Super Duper time! A garlic fan? Then the garlic fries are a must have!!! Add everything from grilled onions to an egg to avocado to your burger... Or wait for it.... BAAACON! 

The lines can get long at times but your wait won't be more than 10 mins unless something goes horribly wrong... Veggie burgers and chicken sandwiches are also on the menu for the non red-meat eaters. The milkshakes are also a treat and you can get them spiked (w/ soju) for $1.50 extra. 

This place is in my top 5 of places to grab a burger in the city while on limited time, so give it a try and you won't be disappointed!
author: Josh H.

description:
By far my favorite casual burger spot in SF. Delicious patty with a bit of a crisp to it, and there's something about the toasted sesame bun that's magical. I love ordering mine with the jalapenos and mushrooms.

I'll admit, though, that the burger patties are on the thinner side, so if that's important to you, you may be disappointed (or want to order an extra one).

A friend has had the veggie burger and was a fan too.
author: Sravanthi K.

description: Burgee is really delicious! Handsome receiver! Price is pretty reasonable! Everything is good!
author: Watson W.

description:
Super Duper Burgers IS super duper! Bet that's never been said, huh?

Before heading to the SF Giants vs SD Padres game we were in search of food. The closest place with quick service from where we were standing that wasn't fast food was Super Duper Burgers.

We ordered one mini combo ($8.50) plus an extra mini burger ($4.75) because the order of fries on the trays nearby looked big enough to share so no need for two combos. The mini is a 4oz all natural beef patty with whatever toppings you so desire. There's "everything on it" aka lettuce, tomato, red onions, & their super sauce plus at NO ADDITIONAL COST to you there's jalapeños, grilled onions, & pickles, too. This mini burger just became the best burger, eva.

What goes with the best mini burger eva? GARLIC fries, that's what, & they were so good I didn't care how much garlic I consumed because I'm not a vampire. So my breath wasn't refreshing but you know what refreshed me? A soda pop. Saved the beer drinking for the game because why pay $4.50 for a pint here if you can pay double that at a baseball game?! ;-)

The difference between the mini & the super burger is one extra patty between the buns & of course $2. Don't like beef? They have organic veggie patties, natural free range chicken boob sandwiches, & super salads, too. Don't like soda pop? There's iced tea, fresh lemonade, beer, wine, & organic milk shakes.They'll spike the milk shake for an extra $1.50. Nice SDB; same idea as The Ice Cream Bar.

SDB was an awesome find for us & it's definitely worth checking out if you've never been here either. Everything from food to service was su.. stupendous.
author: Sarah C.

description: Wishing I can give zero stars for the rude customer service I encountered with the tied  curly haired woman giving out the food recently. I came here thinking I would purchase a fresh lettuce wrap and informed the register multiple times to please remove any sauce from the order due to allergy restrictions. She informed me this was okay. When I was given my order by the woman, I checked only to find more sauce all over the lettuce, so I informed the woman to please exchange my order to no sauce. She proceeded to argue and tell me that there were no sauce, and she even opened it to show me, only to see for herself that she was wrong. She did not apologize for her mistakes and kept insisting to argue, until she realized there was actually sauce in the lettuce even after informing her multiple times. She could have simply been polite and showed curtesy towards the customer purchasing the order, and instead persisted to act rude and obnoxious. I highly don't recommend this place if you're looking for great customer service. This type of attitude will make you lose your customers. I highly prefer going elsewhere, preferably the Marina where they offer great service without the hassle. I WILL NOT BE RETURNING AFTER THIS INCIDENT.
author: Maliyah B.

description: I'm from southeast and wasn't familiar with Super Duper Burgers. Excellent choice for a good ol burger! French fries were freshly cut and a shake to top it off. Get there early because apparently other folks like it, too!
author: L M.

description: Got home and had a burger at a local chain. Sooooo sad I don't have a Super Duper Burgers near me - what I had doens't hold a candle to them!
author: Melinda K.

description:
This place is on Market not too far from Westfield. The place itself is spacious and the flow of service is pretty efficient. This was my very first visit and as soon as I walked I saw their Menu advertise "organic milkshakes" personally if I'm gonna have a milkshake I'm not sure I'm worried about whether or not it's organic nonetheless they look delicious. I ordered one and loved it. Along with the shake I ordered a mini with cheese and avocado and fries. 

Everything tastes fresh, their homemade pickles were tasty and the milkshake was rich and creamy. My only complaint was the bun. It was much too thick for the mini patty and seemed to soak up all my *special sauce * and avocado. 

All in all the experience was good. Burger tasted pretty good. And restaurant was clean.
author: Genoa D.

description: Walked in on a steady Wednesday. My first time here. Burger was very good. Fries were basic. A little pricey for a burger and fries ($14). Will probably come back again.
author: Christina S.

description:
My go-to place for a cheat meal. The burgers are beyond tasty, the fries with 3 dips are also delicious, and I wash it all down with a chocolate malt milkshake. 

This is also where I send anyone when they are on the hunt for a good burger. It's quick, easy, and delicious.
author: Jonathan T.

description: My family and I just had dinner here the other night and was pleasantly surprised at how delicious the burgers are. The fries were great and portion size was nice. The veggie burger was very good. Best of all were the pickles, they are jarred fresh and crisp. Would totally go again.
author: Calista P.

description:
The first time I went here, I asked for a super burger with no onions and avocado, and ended up getting no avocado but onions, when I told them, they were extremely friendly and sent my properly made burger to where I was sitting. So despite my long wait, I was extremely satisfied with the visit.

I find their burgers comparable to five guys, take a long time and taste pretty good, but I totally enjoy the avocado on my burgers. Their burger is a bit greasy, but they're the best food option in the area after 9pm.
author: Alfonso C.

description:
All I can really say is that super duper is "my favorite place to go"
They're chicken sandwich is the best!! I recommend they're burgers to everyone !
My husband and I come here every Friday! This place is better than any other burger restaurant
author: Juanita M.

description: Great food, juicy burgers, and nice location. The staff was very pleasant too. Nice stop after MOMA.
author: Alex M.

description:
In a shady area, but I'm brave, so I came anyways. I tried the chicken sandwhich with chipotle aioli sauce. It was good, but the garlic fries were very disappointing. It was mostly just regular fries with a bit of garlic flavor, & a glob of melted cheese on top. I would get the sandwhich again, and also try their veggie burger.

-1 star for location 
-1 star for disappointment
author: Melissa S.

description: I was shocked I walked thinking this place would be an average burger joint but was surprised.  Must try if you are in Frisco.
author: Pj N.

description:
What happened to this place?  We've been here at least 20 times, but had not been for awhile and stopped by here last night.

We first went to the one on Market street, one block over, and they were out of burgers. So we walked here.

This location was out of tomatoes and lettuce.

They can't figure out how to keep their kitchens  stocked?

The burger flavor was okay, but boring without additions,   The garlic fries were disgusting.  There was literally a pool of OIL at the bottom of the container and they were not cooked properly.  

We had a nice time at the Strand seeing Chester Bailey, so the evening wasn't a bust.
author: Foodlover B.

description:
I don't write too many reviews on yelp, but Jorge's phenomenal customer service was worth a review (somebody give the kid a raise!). It was my first time ever trying Super Duper and Jorge explained how the restaurant works and recommended his favorite burger to me after many minutes of not being able to decide what I wanted to order.

As far as the food goes, their burgers are great and tasty! I had an egg on my burger and it was easily one of the best burgers I have had while visiting San Francisco. 

Great customer service coupled with a great food means I'll definitely be coming back for more!!
author: James Z.

description:
What a meal. For 15 bucks I had pretty much one of the deluxe meal. The meat is fresh and the quality of the cheese is outstanding.

The milkshake is unbelievable: not too sweet and still can be flavourful.
The fries? Unique.

The combination of the aged Cheddar with the garlic is well thought.and if you want to add a kick to the whole, add some chipotle sauce.

You want a great burgher in SF?
You gotta check in here.
author: Renato L.

description:
I really like the burgers here. Actually, they're so good that they're a little dangerous. I mean, you're in SF with all of these great restaurants and seafood... and you're drawn into a burger joint?!?  Honestly, though, it is worth heading in here if you're in the city for an extended period and just aren't in the mood to wait for an hour to get a table, or don't want to spend $50 on dinner.

Get the burger. I know they have chicken, but the place is called "Super Duper Burgers" ... they know what they're doing. Each time I have been here, the cashiers have been friendly, welcoming, and helpful. Most of the time I get a combo with fries and a drink, but sometimes I have just gotten the large burger and skipped the fries. 

The milkshakes are absolutely worth trying. You're already getting a calorie-bomb burger... what'a another couple hundred, right? You can add malt for $0.50. Apparently, they will also spike them with booze for an extra $1.50... maybe next time. 

When they say "garlic fries," they mean it. There is a lot of garlic flavor in these babies. They also top them with cheese, which usually has a hard time melting completely. I think that is unnecessary, but it does make them look prettier. Maybe it's a garnish  :)

The vegetarian in our group had the veggie burger and said the patty was tasty. The others had chicken sandwiches -- they don't eat beef -- and said they were very good, too. The free pickles were popular as an accompaniment and a bit of an appetizer.
author: Doug B.

description: 3.5. Solid go-to for a delicious double patty cheeseburger and milkshake. Extra props for the high quality shakes. They use Straus organic ice cream. The shakes are really great here. Milkshakes = do it. Burgers = do it.
author: Jeff B.

description:
Awesome burgers - the meat is flavorful, not overly greasy, just the right amount of sloppy. The buns are delicious. 

Chicken sandwhich - chipotle aioli is delicious, lots and lots of moist pieces of chicken. 

And they have unlimited pickles!! For a pickle lover this just seals the deal. 

Will definitely be back to try those milkshakes I was eyeing up the entire time I was here. 

Be prepared for a massive food coma afterwards.
author: Kailin L.

description:
Food: tasty! Prices: high
Atmosphere: busy-not many options to find a seat during a rush. 
The burgers are AMAZING. Garlic fries? Hell yes. Their milkshakes are delish too. 

Overall:
If you're visiting during a busy time-be prepared to have no where to sit, and a heads up for parents-the kids shake for $3.25 is literally a teensy 8 oz. cup (if that-fit for a toddler!) 
So they are a bit overpriced, but to be fair, lots of things are in the city-quality of food is worth the visit though.
author: K C.

description: Just greasy burgers and fries. Their chicken breasts are tender. Asian lady at the counter who handles money is very rude.
author: Eri F.

description:
I've been hearing a lot about Super Duper Burgers from relatives up in the Bay.  I guess they have quite a few of them around.  The location I went to, there's actually another one like literally one block up.  When I told someone to meet there, they went to the other location.

Let me start off by saying, this place gets pretty busy.  We went for lunch on a Saturday and the line nearly went out the door.  It goes pretty fast though but it's highly popular.  

I ended up ordering the Super Burger that comes with two patties with super sauce and cheese and bacon for an additional charge.  As for my side, I went with the garlic fries.  I'll start off with the burger.  Man, was it tasty.  They use fresh ingredients so my burger had red onions, lettuce, tomatoes, and house made pickles.  The burger was tender and juicy and had a really great flavor to it.  The portion of the burger was pretty decent as well, yet since it was so good.  The garlic fries were really good as well.  They had a bit of a crunch to them and didn't have an overbearing garlic flavor.

The restaurant also offers free pickles near the condiments.  I went wild on those!  One of my favorite burger spots in the Bay.  I'm definitely coming back in a few weeks when I visit SF.
author: Christian M.

description:
Not joking at all... The BEST BURGER IN THE WORLD! I've tried everything on the menu including the salads, veggie burger, milk shakes and garlic fries. The entire menu is all really good.

If you're not counting your calories, here's what I recommend:

- Mini Burger with everything on it, + egg, avocado, bacon and jalapeños
- GARLIC FRIES
- Cookies and Cream Milkshake
- Don't forget to grab some pickles!
author: A. C.

description:
Super Duper Burgers is Super Duper. *insert laugh. 

Anyway, after a night on the town with coworkers, we stopped in for some refuel. The line might overwhelm you, but it's there for a reason. These burgers are amazing. First: all burgers are cooked medium--slightly medium rare. This ain't no pre-made burger factory. Get everything on it, and love it.

I opted for the single because two patties with bacon and cheese after 8:00PM sounded like morning heartbreak to me. But if you can handle it, you do you. 

I hate I missed out on the spiked shakes though. I saw some whizz past me and they looked awesome. 

If you're in San Fran, try them out. I ate some amazing plates while I was there, and this was the most memorable. This girl's got a thang for good burgers.
author: Erika W.

description: Awesome burger. Had their traditional choice with the garlic fries. Amazing taste, especially the patty.
author: Bruno P.

description: So far it's our favorite burger place around the neighborhood, but shake shack and in n out are definitely better.
author: Peter C.

description:
Super Duper Burgers is proof that burger joints can really care about their customers! Their burger prices are definitely fair and equitable for other burgers at fast food places. A meal with burger, fries, and a drink is about $13 and it definitely fills you up. These aren't the best burgers I have ever had but they are still pretty damn good! The fries are ok too. A really cool thing they do is sometimes while you are waiting in line they will give you a free mini-donut! Really cool thing for them to do and the wait to get your order isn't that long either. I do like this place and will definitely be back. 
P.S. they sell their pickles in whole jars for $30 and if you return the jar you get $10 back.
author: Itzak H.

description:
I was very interested in trying Super Duper burgers after a friend had strongly recommended it, saying it is one of the best burgers.  I ordered the mini combo that includes a 4 oz  patty with French fries and a drink.  I added cheese and a cookies and cream shake.  

The burger patty is definitely one of the best I've tried.  It's juicy and cooked to perfection.  I could really taste the flavor of the beef and seasonings.  The bun was nicely toasted and soft on the inside.  The one thing that made it iffy was the sauce.  It didn't completely wow me, which saddens me.  Overall though it was pretty good.  The fries were only alright, lightly seasoned with salt.  

Without a doubt, I will be back!  But this time, I'll add a fried egg and maybe try the garlic fries that everyone raves about.  Until next time Super Duper!
author: Christy Y.

description:
Super greasy burgers that aren't that great. Garlic fries were spongy and way too much garlic. There was stuff in the chocolate shake, almost like they accidentally put something else in the glass and realized it was supposed to be a chocolate shake but left whatever the put in. Bathrooms were also as disgusting as their food. Oh, and they were out of various things...one of which was their pickles that we wanted to try.

Poorly ran. Nasty food. Not worth any time or money.
author: Jason R.

description: Decent Burger and fries near my office. I like the buzz and the food is pretty darn good. Not cheap but the quality is very good.
author: David G.

description: Super fresh ingredients. Made to order. Spiked milkshakes?!  Yes!! Garlic fries are made perfectly. The staff was so friendly. Upstairs seating made for a great atmosphere for people watching, talking and enjoying one of the juiciest burgers I've ever had. Quick service.
author: Gia M.

description:
.
Super Duper is right!!! Best burger I've had and Staff is friendly and awesome...
author: Kellie M.

description:
Super Duper is my favorite burger -- for most of my life, the In N Out Double Double was my fav, and while I still love the Double Double, the Super Duper with blue cheese is what I crave the most.

The mini burger is hardly mini - it's a quarter pounder, and it's super super juicy. I have a pretty big appetite, but the mini burger will satisfy me. Now when I'm freaking HANGRY, the Super Burger with blue cheese and bacon is the way to go, and it's guaranteed to fill me up and then some. The meat is sourced from Niman Ranch and Brandt, and is full of flavor and is incredibly juicy - as in flowing down your arm and making a puddle on your tray juicy. It's probably not a low calorie food, but it's so worth it.

While you wait for your order, try the pickles. They're all you can eat, and are pretty tasty.
author: Allen T.

description:
I normally like their burgers a lot.
But I wish it was more consistent is my only gripe.
Sometimes I get a lackluster, dry burger which is the complete opposite from what I'm used to getting here.

On a side note, at least the pickles are good every time and you can get as many as you want - within reason :)
author: Jo M.

description:
Homemade pickles?! Aww a burger spot that comes with TLC, I love it already.

Burgers are excellent. Not the best I've had, but up there. They taste "clean", like a sandwich my mom might make. Simple ingredients, fresh taste. Veggies are nice and crisp, not wilted. Don't get cheese, it tastes better trust me. 

Garlic fries are good! Just don't plan for a make out sesh afterwards. 

I'm craving more as I write this review. Will be back!
author: Neesh Q.

description: Came here 3 times while on my trip to San Fran. Getting straight to the good stuff- great customer service and an in expensive place to eat some good food. I suggest you skip the regular fries and make sure to get the garlic ones, I was expecting a really bitter salty cheese taste as it states that it is aged cheese but the garlic and cheese work together perfectly. As for the burger, it was decent, not a lot of seasoning so you could taste the meat but for some reason the special sauce is lacking- can't even tell it's there. The shining star of the show is for sure the vanilla milkshake, of all things this was my favorite. Make sure while visiting you at least get a kids size(and yes they let adults buy them too!) so you can give it a try!
author: Samantha L.

description: I hate pickles with a passion, but this is the only place where I will devour their homemade pickles. Aside from that, the burgers are super juicy and always made to order. Hold off on the spiked milkshakes... not very "spiked" (they use soju) and are just meh.
author: Brie R.

description: One of the best burgers I've ever had! The meat was so tender and the buns were toasted differently. With their sauce and French fries, it was a match made in heaven. Came here for the first time at around 10pm with my sister and it's located in a business district so not many sketchy people hanging around. Staff could be better but the food made up for that.
author: Sophia H.

description: Yup, went back this time to go back to try the double burger. Boy it looks so much better than the single patty and not as oily looking from the first time my friends ordered the single burger. The double party was excellent. You can taste real beef and thicker meat then you would see at a normal fast food burger place like in and out or mcdonalds. Yes, I will go back next time when I am in the area. I couldn't help myself and bought a chicken sandwich again to eat the next day. It the second best fast food chicken I have come across that I can actually get to. Also I just can't get enough of their homemade pickles! Yummy in my tummy!! :-)
author: Priscilla L.

description:
you were my favorite burger in sf.  

ordered via postmates and discovered a lil creepy crawly in my burger (see pics if it wasnt deleted).  i was going to add more grilled onions to it (thank god for my son not liking onions, otherwise i wouldve never opened up my burger).

i dont know if ill give up this location or super duper all together. im a little distraught rt now.

*i poured out a lil liquor (in my belly), to get rid of the disgust that could have been.
author: Lady K.

description: This is probably my favorite burgers I have ever had. We ordered super burger and mini burgers. The beef insider is juicy and favorable! The garlic fries are covered by garlic and cheese, everything is awesome.  I will definitely come back again!
author: Peizhi Z.

description: This place gets very busy around lunch time, but at least the lines move quick, I've had to wait outside the door in the past and still managed to make my way to the front in around 7min. The burgers are decently priced; considering the size and are always  excellent quality. No matter what you eat here, you are bound to be happy, but if I had to suggest one item worth trying; it would be the milkshakes, they are outstanding :)
author: Joseph A.

description: Easily accessible from the hotel, Super Duper Burger is a great stop if you're really hungry for something familiar and kid-friendly. The place smells like garlic - because of their garlic cheese fries - plays great oldies in the background and serves burgers and shakes like most burger joints. The patties are much more on the authentic, home-grilled side, but the buns are dry... And for someone who LOVES juicy burgers, I was a bit disappointed. The price point is appropriate and the service is satisfactory. Just wish there was a bit more culinary creativity demonstrated in the flavor! Overall, Super Duper wasn't super or duper... But I left with a full belly (and more $ to keep exploring SF eats)!!
author: Courtney S.

description: Really enjoy the ambience here. Pickles were outstanding the burgers were great would highly recommend. They happened to be giving away some homemade donuts they had a wonderful nutmeg cinnamon taste
author: Wayne A.

description: Their veggie burger was pretty average but their garlic fries and homemade pickles are so worth it! I stuffed at least three containers of pickles into our To-Go bag. The ketchup also has a kick to it which goes really well with the garlic fries. I would say that this restaurant is perfect if you want to grab a quick bite in between activities.
author: Sneha K.

description: I'm from LA so my boyfriend and I was just walking around the city and decided to come into this place. Workers are really friendly and the burgers are DELiCIOUS !!!!
author: Rachel C.

description: Went by here today for lunch after reading such good reviews on Yelp. I ordered a super burger and fries and then just got a water cup. I got some of the homemade pickles as well which were quite good. The burger was fantastic! I made sure to get grilled onions on it as well and it was just right. It had a nice amount of flavor and was quite juicy. I would say the fries were good, but nothing to brag about. The price wasn't too crazy on it, but was definitely about the price at any decent burger spot. Overall, it was a really great tasting burger that I would definitely recommend anyone stop by and try. On a quick side note my friend ordered the chicken burger and I would definitely try it as well next time because it looked great too!
author: James R.

description: This is my first time here and I have to say I enjoyed the Breakfast deal they have to offer. The breakfast sandwich was so good and I even added sausage and cheese and it tasted hot and fresh!  The chocolate mini doughnut was sooo good! I really enjoyed this place next time I'll have to get the 3 doughnut special instead of one because one wasn't enough!
author: Jessica U.

description: They have seriously good burgers. Good place to eat with friends and love the atmosphere. Really enjoyed the place to eat burgers.
author: Deepesh A.

description: I used post-mates to order food from here and the burgers and garlic fries are so delicious! It's close by to my work also easy to get to. I would definitely recommend ordering food from here if you happen to work downtown and you're on your lunch break!
author: Sandra N.

description: super duper good!! i was skeptical their veggie burger because they can be a hit or miss. i ordered it the first time with avocado, and everything on it except the hummus and cucumber it usually comes with. delicious, a healthier alternative, and a friendlier alternative. order it next time with egg if you're into that gooeyness :)
author: Seazzia C.

description:
OMG. THE. PICKLES. 

Legit I ate a couple pickles on their own- they're THAT good. I'm a fan of pickles so it may seem like I'm biased, but my sister that isn't the biggest fan also likes them! 

Also, the quality of the burgers is amazing. It's a wonderful, juicy beef patty packed with all the great things that (in my opinion) make a burger - I got a mini burger with all the toppings. 

I must go back. The only downside to this location is that it was slightly difficult for my large group to find seating that kept us in the same area. However, it was around 5:30 on a work night, we're a large group, and it's right in downtown SF so seating chances were bound to be slim for us anyway.
author: Nadine F.

description:
Talk among yourselves. Here, let me give you a topic. Super Duper is neither super nor duper. Discuss. This is the third location I've tried of Super Duper Burgers, and I have to admit I was disheartened to see them open at the Metreon, a mere block away from their other location. I expect that kind of commercial maneuver from La Boulange, but it made me think that Super Duper more accurately described their marketing plan rather than their food. The set-up is familiar with the burgers made to order with a complicated division of toppings where some are free but others like avocado or an organic egg are a dollar extra.

I came in after having one too many at Rickhouse and thinking I should eat something before I start staggering home in the SoMa wilderness. I decided to go for the Chicken Sandwich which costs $6.50 if you have the chipotle aioli slathered on the bun but $7 if you go for some melted jack cheese and $8 if you want to add bacon strips. See what I mean by 'complicated'? Anyway, even if I would have had trouble walking a straight line, I was still sober enough to know if I asked for cheese, it would cost me $7. Fries. I needed French fries. Now that gets complicated, too. For an extra 75 cents, you can get minced garlic and aged cheddar sprinkled on top.

Now for another dollar, you can get three dipping sauces including the aioli which came free with the chicken sandwich. Still with me? I just wanted fries, and I figure I could squirt my own ketchup into the little plastic cup. The sandwich is really not that much different than what you would find at McDonald's except the focaccia bun made  it a cut above, even if the combination of fresh tomatoes and super sauce (whatever that is) makes it hard to manage (see photo). The fries, on the other hand, were as arid as an anorexic camel in the Gobi (see photo). There was never enough ketchup to moisten those spuds up. Marginally disappointed, I left feeling full but unsatisfied and still a little too drunk to care.

FOOD - 3 stars...probably would have marked it down if I was sober
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...more spacious than the other places but still felt crowded
SERVICE - 2.5 stars...automatic pilot
TOTAL - 3 stars...neither super nor duper
author: Ed U.

description:
Great burger! I was in town for a convention so it was super crowded. The fries were good. 

The home made pickles were OK. not your typical mass market dills. My malt was OK, but the organic chocolate ice cream was a bit chalky.
author: Thaddeus L.

description: Pretty fast and tasty burgers and fries. They have pretty good service. The line can be a little crazy during lunch so plan ahead
author: Michelle F.

description: Consistent food and service. Veggie burger is great and ice cream is awesome.
author: Mayur K.

description:
The fourth Super Duper location, located on Mission Street-side of the Meteron, has opened nearly four months now. When it comes to new burger places in San Francisco, I am usually there within a week. Maybe I am getting old and haven't been following what is going on.

The fourth location is much busier than the other locations including nearby the Market and 3rd Street location. This location also has the upper-level seating. 

On my debut of the fourth location came after spending three hours at the auto show on the other side of the Metreon (Howard Street). I got down and dirty and ordered the Super Duper Double Cheese Burger. For $6.75, the sandwich has two greasy patties, melted cheese, lettuce, tomato and onions on a sesame bun. For an additional $1.00, I also got a soft boiled egg in my burger. I also got a side of fries for $2.75. Also a pair of cute blondes were passing out coupons for a free fountain drink with your meal to hungry pups like Joe Cool. When it comes to burgers, especially Super Duper, I usually drink beer. But the free soda was good enough. (That coupon is valid at this location only).

The hefty sandwich was greasy and dripping down my sleeve (in a good way). And that greasy burger was yummy and satisfying.

My only question is: "Why did I wait this long to dine at the Metreon's Super Duper?"
author: Matt G.

description: I love all food at Super Duper but if you're looking for service as good as the food, I recommend another location.
author: Jessica P.

description:
Their menu reminded me of In 'N' Out's menu because it was concise and simple, BUT their burger, was*salivating* SO SAVORY!  

They have a different, unique taste to their beef patties and it tingles your taste buds!  My friend and I got their garlic fries topped with shredded cheese!  It was, undoubtedly, yummy as well!  

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/super-duper-san-francisco-3?select=CvVAjGJVGaIQ3H87XfveLQ#CvVAjGJVGaIQ3H87XfveLQ

They have an all you can eat pickle jar near the condiments area!  It definitely adds zest to the burger!

Super, duper burger joint - great for grabbing tasty, affordable burger during lunch hours!
author: Tiffany D.

description: Very good food. Beef is really flavorful vegetarian fed beef. Prices are fair. Crowd is medium to loud which is ok. Very busy spot. Good energy from patrons.
author: Brian R.

description:
I really try and stay away from fast food..but if I cave into my cravings this is my spot. I think their burgers are better than In-n-Out..with way more options on fixings. 
My go to is a mini burger with jalapenos and an egg on top. The egg is always perfect!

Their fries are crunchy delicious and who doesn't love all you can eat pickles??!
author: Mimi T.

description:
I'm a huge fan. 

I came to SF over the weekend with my boyfriend, and we decided to come to this place after seeing the incredibly long line for Lemonade next door (i didn't even see this place's sign, that's why, I promise!!). I had heard of Super Duper Burgers before, but never had the chance to try it out. 

The interior of this burger joint gave me a slight resemblance to Chipotle. The industrial-looking walls and decor, the divider that splits the line and the tables, etc. Of course, this place is nothing like Chipotle. There are only a couple of signature foods on the menu, which is fine by me! 

When I went up to order, I was originally going to the order the Chicken Sandwich. However, after chatting with the cashier and telling him that it was my first time, he recommended and I decided on the Mini Burger. But seriously. My cashier was so nice and so easy to talk to, and he really seemed to enjoy his job. Thank you for making me a happy customer and saving my lemonade from spilling! :) 

Now, about the food. The burger was REAAALLY good. I usually am not able to completely finish a burger, but I scarfed this burger down because it was so good without being too greasy or heavy. The Super Sauce is a beautiful oxymoron of a subtle yet flavorful taste. 

Overall, I really enjoyed the burger and would recommend getting it!! Next time I will definitely have to try the Chicken Sandwich. With the excellent customer service, delicious food, and nice environment, you got the whole package!
author: Lailinda X.

description:
The burger was good, but nothing special.  The buns are very good and light.  The fries were good, but nothing special and the portion was just average.

I think it is a little on the high side price wise and I don't have a strong urge to go back.  $11 something for a burger and fries with no toppings.  To clarify, no extra toppings.  You get lettuce, tomato, jalapenos, onion, grilled onions, and pickles on it for free if you want them.  Extra points for grilled onions.

The seating areas are nice and can accommodate big groups.  

They have house made pickles if that is your sort of thing.

They have beer on tap and milkshakes.  They also serve mini doughnuts.

This is not something that is in my regular rotation, but if you are in the fidi at lunch and you are looking to get a burger, go ahead and give them a try.
author: Ty C.

description:
Joining the likes of The Counter and Pearl's, Super Duper occupies this little niche between fast-food burger joints and restaurants that serve up quality burgers. While they don't offer as many options as the other two, what they do, they do very well.

The process is simple enough: pick your patty size, select your toppings (from a list of free basic topics, to premium ones like bacon, egg, and avocado that run about a buck each), grab a seat, and wait about 10 minutes for your buzzer to light up. Then proceed to bite into a deliciously juicy and flavorful burger, sandwiched between two lightly toasted and airy buns. If you order the way I do (double patty with everything, bacon, and egg), you'll probably be relegated to eating with the flimsy (compostable!) knife and fork they provide you.

Are there better/fancier burgers out there? Sure, the now-closed Thermidor was a great example. But, for the quality fast-food burger niche that Super Duper fills, they do a damned good job.

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - Considering this is a new restaurant in the Metreon complex, it should be no surprise that there aren't really any accessibility issues. While half the restaurant is bar seating, they do have a handful of standard tables, as well as lower bar counters that you can just roll into.

Bathroom - Didn't check them out, so I can't comment, but I don't imagine that they'd pose any issues.
author: Johnny W.

description:
Super Duper Burgers has consistently been great to me! I like the burgers here cause you can get many custom toppings to great combos too! I like how they offer a mini burger combo with fries and a drink without hurting your wallet or your stomach either. Pretty much all of their locations have been great and I hope to see more locations pop up beyond San Francisco. I love how they use Niman Ranch beef for their burgers and it does make it stand out in terms of flavor and texture. 

Get the garlic fries because you get a huge load of garlicky goodness! But if you don't like garlic, their plain fries is just as great. Super Duper Burgers is fast food but done right in a fresh and fast-casual setting. I don't recommend their brown sugar lemonade though as it tastes off to me every time I've had it. The Metreon location for me is the most accessible as I am always in the area and this is a great place to grab a quick bite whenever I am in the area. I also dig that they are open late and offer plenty of seating and even upstairs seating as well. Very helpful staff as well!
author: Danster L.

description: Cashier held up the line to talk to a friend for 10 minutes. I brought it up to management and they assisted me and corrected the matter. It is what makes this place great, the service first along with great food. I just tried the salad. You can eat healthy here too!
author: Adree L.

description: I went in just yesterday during my lunch hour, and was amazed at how efficient their line was. The woman at the front desk taking my order was very friendly and welcoming and who doesn't love that when you walk into a restaurant you're about to pay for to eat what they have to offer! That was already awesome, and then I ordered a mini burger with cheese and garlic fries. Ok now that was just BEYOND spectacular! The meat was tender perfectly cooked, the lettuce seemed fresh and the bread was so soft that it melted in your mouth. The garlic fries were delicious with just the right amount of garlic and salt, they also add a little cheese, but not enough to call it cheese fries, it's like enough sprinkling here and there, but it doesn't over power the garlic flavor. I will be back! Best burger I've had so far!
author: Evangelyn Sacha J.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here b/c we were staying at one of the hotels down the street and we got hungry after one of his business events. There weren't much options considering it was already past 10PM, so I looked on Yelp and found that this place was open until 11 on a weeknight. We decided to go and I'm really glad we did. This place was really good. I was surprised how many people were there at this time ordering food. I ordered the mini combo with a bacon cheeseburger and garlic fries. It took about 15 minutes to get it but we grabbed a table upstairs and ate our food. The burger was so good. It was cooked to a good medium well and it was delicious. It was also really filling considering it was the "mini" burger. I believe the bigger burger is two of the mini-patties. The fries on the other hand were a little much for me. They were good but I think I would've been okay with the normal fries. They put a ton of cheese on top to the point that it was too much. Some people probably like it this way, but it's just not my preference. Would've been better if it was melted or something instead of hard cheese. They also make their own mayo here as well and it tasted good. I really loved the ambiance of this place. It's a very hip burger joint with a cute theme through their store and food. The place also has an upper and lower portion to the store.

Overall, good food and it's worth your money. The next time I come here, I want to try their ice cream too!
author: Sofia A.

description: So much great food in SF, and burgers are no exception. This place is small, the one right across from the Union Mall. Very juicy, organic tasting burgers with yummy buns and amazing garlic cheese french fries. I like how a mini burger is very filling and pretty inexpensive ala carte or as a combo. They have home mad pickles which are so good, that even people walking in the street just come in to get. They have shakes and ice cream too. My total bill for a mini burger, garlic french fries and a drink was under $11.
author: Isabel S.

description: I am a super fan of self made pickles here. I am not a crazy fan for fries, but burger is the one really good here. It's juicy, huge and affordable.
author: Sue P.

description:
I have no idea wen this placed popped into the market - but HOLY COW!!!!!!! At first glance, it looks like any other greasy burger joint. Grab a tray, allow for a seat, wait for your number. That's all true. Then, you pick up your burger.. and well.... HOLY TOLEDO!!!!!! This was seriously one of the best burgers I have ever had. I don't eat a ton of meat, so I'm super picky (I always order the smallest one) - and it was OFF THE CHARTS. I layered on the house made pickles, and was in my own little lunch heaven.

Their name says it all - Super Duper Burgers.
author: Maureen B.

description:
Fat boy heaven!

That's what this place is to me, and I am hard pressed to 'walk on by', no matter what. And the what is what this place sells, which is called heavenly burgers, fries and oh those shakes...

and you can get all kinds of trimmings and they have the bestest pickles bar none and it's fast and hot and the juices are running in the paper lining and the chrome bag is so hot and the fries, oh my gosh the dipping sauces...

can't continue, must eat...
enjoy!!!!
author: William M.

description:
Decided to grab lunch here before flight out of SFO. Best decision ever! Forget the airport food and try this place. I had never heard of it before today.  Great burgers made of two thinner patties gives it a unique taste and texture. Garlic fries and homemade pickles made for great side. I regret not trying a milkshake. 

Nice and clean place. Friendly staff. Try it! 

They need these in Los Angeles!
author: Eric C.

description:
A picture is worth a thousand words, right?

I had to check out Super Duper Burgers after seeing other Yelpers' photos. How can a "fast food" burger look that juicy and well-prepared?

I had a great experience from start to finish. The staff was definitely on its A-game. Despite the long line, I barely had time to sit down before my buzzer went off. I went from back of the line to devouring my food in about 8 minutes. 

The food definitely didn't disappoint either. I ordered a Super Burger with avocado and cheese ($9.24). Somewhat expensive for fast food? Definitely. Delicious? You bet. Really liked the crisped bun and tender meat that literally melted in my mouth. The burger was decadent, but not too salty or greasy. The garlic fries ($2.75) were awesome as well. They had just the right amount of melted cheese and garlic. In other words, I didn't have that nasty fast food aftertaste.

Lots of interior seating- walk up to the second floor if you can't find seating on the first. Hungry while you're waiting? Snack on some pickles from the jars next to the condiments.
author: Dan D.

description:
Do you want a casual and quick dining option near downtown but are tired of the usual food court options? Then come to Super Duper! You can satisfy your inner carnivore (Mmm bacon cheeseburger) but veggie-minded patrons can also find something to enjoy (multiple salad options and veggie burgers).

I am a fan of the MINI BURGER option...which isn't very mini at all! It was the perfect size for me, especially when getting fries on the side. Do the combo meal and you pay a little over $10 for it all. Yes, it's a little pricier for "fast" food but I believe the quality is pretty worth it. The meat is cooked medium which leaves it juicy and the bacon pieces are very big and tender. I also love their freshly squeezed LEMONADE with brown sugar and homemade pickles.

Tips:
+ Say YES to bacon and cheese!
+ GARLIC FRIES are a must, even if it makes you a vampire repellent. Garlic and Parmesan cheese are the perfect combo over fries.

Things to note: 
- This location seems to be pretty popular on a weekend night, but the turnover rate is pretty quick (much faster than Shake Shack locations in NY!).
- Be prepared to share space at the communal long table with strangers. We were able to squeeze in a group of 5 with no problems 
- Grab extra napkins for the juicy burgers and greasy fries

There is another location by my office on Market St. and I will probably have to stop by on a break for more lemonade or a chocolate dipped ice cream cone!
author: Bonnie Z.

description:
Their burger is one of the most satisfying burgers I have ever eaten, there are many great places I have eaten in SF but this one.

The reason I say satisfying, caus here the burger patty has the perfectly cooked and the bun is also very good.
author: Karanveer B.

description: There was a long line at 12:45pm on a Saturday but the line went quickly and we were still able to grab four seats. The service was friendly though they aren't on it. No one cleans the tables.They didn't give us my wine and yes, I ordered a $6 wine to go with my bunless Mini 4oz Burger with a Fried Egg and the wine was actually decent. My burger was supposed to come wrapped with lettuce but instead, they gave me three pieces of lettuce with a dollop of their Special Sauce. Our other burgers with buns were prepared well. Everyone loved their juicy burgers and french fries plus all the free crunchy, delicious dill pickles you can have. The potatoes are cut larger than regular fries but not the size of steak fries. They had the perfect amount of salt and the texture was great. We also had a regular salad to get some greens and it was a fine $6 salad of green leaf lettuce, tomatoes, cucumbers and red onions. You can add stuff but it was good enough as is. I'm glad to have finally introduced my family to Super Duper because I think they have the best juicy medium burgers with fried egg!
author: Jen L.

description:
Ordered the mini combo consisting of a burger with a 4 oz. patty, fries and a soda. At $9.25 this would have been a better deal if everything was spot on. I loved the homemade pickles. Yummy and all-you-can-eat. The meat was good but I think this place is more about the presentation and hype. Two things brought the rating down a star.

The patty was as juicy as advertised but the bun was a tad dry. I don't care about it being artisanal if the quality isn't up to par. The skin-on fries were terrible. Maybe it was a mistake to order them plain. I heard the garlic version is super duper. The fries were cold, dry and slightly mealy. I had to eat them with a liberal dose of ketchup. 

My friend enjoyed the same mini combo but the burger was pumped up with avocado and bacon. The low price and good deal for the basic meal is deceptive if you need to add on extra ingredients to make it tasty. With add-on ingredients costing between $0.50 - $1.50, the price adds up quickly. 

I'll give SDB another try. Maybe it was off day because the staff are working off their new year hangovers?
author: Cece E.

description: The line that goes out the door at lunch hour moves fast and the table turnover is good too. If all seats are taken most likely this will change by the time you get your food. I tried their vege burger and it was delicious. The fries also are worth the calorie splurge. They have a good variety of beer on tap if you are looking to grab a beer and a burger. Again, don't be scared by the line and it is worth the wait.
author: Eileen H.

description:
I loved this burger joint and thought that the service was great, with great sourcing and environmental consciousness. 

The burgers were amazing, especially with the parmesan garlic fries! If you can appreciate a QUALITY burger spot, you must try this place!
author: Elise K.

description: I don't get the hype. Pretty bland and dry burger unless you slather it with ketchup or their "special sauce" (mine had like no sauce). Fries are nothing special. Maybe I'd have to retry for their chicken sammich and pickles but until then, I'll stick with In N Out or Five Guys.
author: Denise L.

description:
Very good food. Burgers are real and you can taste the burger. Buns are even great. I liked the special sauce too. The pint beer glasses for soda was a nice touch. 

The only downer was the place was unkempt and employees, like many places in this genre, are more concerned with being hip/cool than with the service and smiles. The order taker just assumed we were regulars and seemed annoyed when we had questions.  I don't want attitude when I'm ordering a burger. And after all that, my daughter got a very rare burger. We were fortunate enough to just swap with her and I ate it - simply because it wasn't worth waiting for them to get it right. 

So.. bottom line - Good food but service could be improved.
author: Mike B.

description:
Great place for a quick meal. If you are on-the-go or don't have much of a lunch break, this is one of the best places in SOMA/Financial District to grab food.

I got the mini burger combo, which includes a mini burger, fries, and a drink. The mini burger is not small by any means. I have a huge appetite and I was full after my meal. I also only finished half my fries! 

They have good customer service and it was overall a pleasant experience. Would recommend!
author: Hana K.

description:
The place is clean with an industrial vibe that make it feel cooler than a typical burger joint. The staff is friendly, and the lines move quickly.

The burger was fine, but oh man, the garlic fries are something else. They're basically garlic bread in fry form, which is fantasy-level awesome for me. The rest of my meal was okay if forgettable, but I'll definitely come back for the fries at some point!
author: Al I.

description:
I've heard that this places has really good burgers, and I'm always down for a good burger! I got the mini cheeseburger (with fries) which is the perfect size! I took it upstairs, took a bite and was sad to think that it was just okay. I don't know if if it's because I don't get any condiments on my burger (I usually don't) so the burger was kind of bland. I always think that if it's a really good burger though, it doesn't need much because the patty will carry the taste. The patty was nothing special and the fries were just okay. 

Overall, it was just an okay burger. I like the mini size though!
author: Sophia Y.

description:
Awesome food and great beer. Perfect for lunch! Prices aren't your typical BK or McD, but you pay for what you get! :)

*** Don't get distracted when you get there. There's this really buff pretty boy that works there. lol (pretty sure he wears contacts)
author: Pj A.

description: Hostess told me at least 3 times that my 3:75$ fries were cheaper than in-n-out in Los Angeles's where I'm from. Total bulls**t. I could get fries and a burger from la for 4$. Hate these scavenging people stop blowing smoke up my a**. That's more of what I'm sick of. Does anyone have any integrity or are they just trying to promote them themselves. Don't come here!!!! Go to in-n-out please for me and get played like I did.
author: Chris S.
