description: Good burgers and fries, but what I loved most were the all you can eat pickles! My husband had the garlic fries. They were good, but we preferred the regular fries. We also had a milkshake, which was delicious!
author: Jill S.

description:
No In-n-Out nearby? No problem. Not saying that In-n-Out has been replaced, but Super Duper is pretty darn good. 

It's grossly crowded during lunch time, as expected, but the line moves pretty fast. I ordered a mini combo (burger, fries, drink) with an egg and a cookies and cream super shake. She even offered me a glass cup for water. When my food came out, I was missing the fries and drink. I was told that I wasn't charged for the combo (the girl took my order wrong) but gave me fries anyway! 

So wow, messiest burger ever. The egg yolk broke as I put the bun on top and it just spilled everywhere. Spilled everywhere in a good way though. I probably looked disgusting eating that burger with it dripping all down my hands but I don't even care because good burger yolo haters gon hate. 

Oh, and the shake is better than Burger King's. That's saying a lot in my book.
author: Lani C.

description: Ok...so, I don't understand why there are 2 of these within blocks of each other.  But I'll take that as a win win for everyone.  I wish I had something more fun and creative to say in this review.  There's just nothing. All I can say is...if you like, then you better put an EGG on it!
author: Jonas S.

description:
This Super Duper Burger has a Super Duper small sign ! I've never felt like a tourists coming to SF before well trying to find the place I did ! I think I asked 3 people before I found it and my iPhone was telling me it was in front of Mel's Diners and that was way off. This is why 4 stars in my case.

Ok So Back to the food: It is one of those unique burger places that has its own special sauces and run it threw the garden techniques.... I got the medium burger with everything on it and it hit the spot  thinking of adding Avo or egg next time. Better than Five guys reminds me of Uhmami Burger with a more street casual place which I prefer...some say it's better than in & out maybe I live in and out. Haven't been here enough times to say so. I am deff coming back next time I am in SF!
author: Cecilia H.

description:
What a lovely burger for a reasonable price.

The ingredients were fresh and the meat was incredibly good.

You can get a fantastic tasting burger made how you want. Bloody and juicy.

I am heading there again soon. ;)
author: Steven W.

description: Decent burger spot, I have been to a couple of them now. The best option here is the salad with a burger and avocado on it. The burgers themselves aren't all that great. The fries are decent. It's cheap, fast, and efficient. This location is nearby my office and often my hotels.
author: Jonah K.

description: Great atmosphere! I really enjoyed my burger an the amazing milkshake!!!! I wish I lived in San Fran I'd be eating this place all the time! The wait wasn't really that long and I love the pickles! When I return to San Fran this will definitely be a go to place for great burgers! This Hawaii girl loved this place!
author: Tazialynn H.

description:
Fresh, tasty, and well crafted! The 4 times we've gone, the buns are always fresh, the patty is juicy, and the burgers taste like what burgers are supposed to taste like! 

We tried the spiked milkshake and it was delicious but for someone who enjoys a nice SPIKE, it wasn't there. Maybe a little booze next time? ;)

The cashiers are USUALLY nice. And the ambience is chill and San Franciscan. Must visit if you're in the city by the bay! They have close proximity locations, you can't miss em!
author: Arianne M.

description: Great tasting burger, garlic fries and shakes.  Definitely filling and at a good price!
author: Scott D.

description: I love places with simple menus. If given too many options i end up gawking at the menu and holding up the line. I wanted a bit of everything. I ordered the "mini" burger which in my mind meant more room for a milkshake and french fries! I didn't want a whole shake so they split the strawberry milkshake into two separate cups for my friend and I. Along with simplicity, i like convenience! The garlic fries are similar to Roam's (which are both delicious). You may need a breath mint though. The burger is much better than i expected. I made sure to pile on the free add on's plus some cheese and bacon. I do the same at Five Guy's and Super Duper wins by far in quality, taste and presentation. It's a good place for that "go to" burger and fries when In N Out is only located in a tourist trap or way out in Daly City.
author: Samantha L.

description: Terrible service. Lost our order. Didn't acknowledge or apologize. Disorder and chaos. No one in charge. Don't waste your time here.
author: Sam M.

description: Super Duper Burger is my favorite burger in the city. Consistently awesome. Do get the garlic fries. Don't kiss anyone afterwards. Do get a milkshake. Do add the booze.
author: Sean B.

description: My coworkers and I had 3 orders.  All three were wrong in one way or another.  They forgot my cheese which was an extra cost that I paid for.  They added my friend an extra patty which is a score for him but pissed me off even more, and they forgot jalapenos on the last order.  Did I complain? No, because it was a madhouse in there.  Thus here is a crappy review.  GET YOUR SHIT TOGETHER SUPER DUPER.
author: John B.

description:
Not sure I liked the burger quite as well as some other similar places I've been, which is the only reason for the lost star.

Garlic fries were fantastic, but you'd better like garlic! Milkshake was tasty and large. Homemade pickles on the burger were a nice touch.

I'd definitely come back.
author: Scott G.

description: The burgers were juicy and very tasty. I like the use of organic beef.  The French fries were hot and not too salty. We did not care for the format of the pickles. Finishing it off with a beer was great.
author: John C.

description:
The line in this location ain't that bad. It is close to the financial district where everyone's super busy. There were  definitely seats for a party of 2 both upstairs and downstairs. I saw a good number of people come, order, get food and go out elsewhere to eat. 

There are condiments on both floors. 

Our group ordered 2 combos, 3 double patty burger and 1 single patty burger. The orders were almost right. 1 double and 1 single patty asked for no onions but came with grilled onions. 

I'm not a fan of pickles but it's there on the side for you to get. 

There was a mess on our table when we got there. Watch out for other customers leaving a mess. They either probably don't know how to use the tray given to them, eat messy enough for it to be out of their tray, or just simply don't care. I've been to other places where customers don't leave as much behind.
author: Corie L.

description:
I make it a point to always go to Super Duper when I am in SF.

I've been to a couple of the locations now.
I came to this location twice on my last visit:

1) SHAKE! After a crazy 2 mile (haha) walk from our lunch spot, my group and I walked in here for a much deserved shake. Listen, that was the LONGEST 2 miles....of ALL TIME. So the shake was very much earned. I only had half and should of gone with the kids size like the others in my group. Not because it wasn't delicious - but because it was so massive.

2) AFTER WORK FUNCTION / LATENIGHTSOAKUPTHEBOOZEGRUB
Came with a totally different group for a late night bite before heading back to the hotel and crash. I had a burger and fries. I feel like burgers and fries are the ULTIMATE late night food. AmIright? The greasy, salty deliciousness. The bread/potatoes to soak up the liquids sitting in your tummy....perfect.

The staff has always been super friendly. The restaurants always been clean. And did I mention the pickles? They are homemade and amazing. 

I will see you next year Super Duper!
author: Blue A.

description: The burger was great - fresh and hot! We only got the mini burger - one party was more than enough! Garlic fries were over the top - I like garlic but these were spicy garlicky - next time I'll get regular fries.
author: Margot B.

description:
Filthy delicious greasy burgers to stuff your face with -- that is what you will find here at Super Duper Burgers. 

I should have known from the name not to order a DOUBLE super duper burger but I did anyway and could only eat half of it. What stuck out to me about this place was the crispiness of the burg. I loved how it was seared around the edges. I also loved the grilled bun. Super buttery and delicious. The lettuce and tomato were of good quality and the garlic fries were sent down from heaven by Zeus himself. A lightning bolt shock of flavor as they are smothered in garlic and parsley and seasoned to perfection. Deal with the small up-charge and go for the big guns on this one. You won't regret it. 

I am so happy we stumbled onto this place! If you are looking for a solid burg, this is your place!
author: Cindy G.

description:
This place is super.. duper!! :P I've had super duper a couple times, but last time I pigged out! Got their garlic fries, chocolate shake and a burger. :)

The fries are really good, generous amounts of garlic and lots of cheese. Definitely pack a mint if you're getting these. Totes worth it though, get it. 

The burgers are awesome too, everything is very fresh tasting. Ingredients are fresh and you can definitely taste the quality. Add whatever toppings you want, I did notice that they were not very consistent with their jalapenos addition. Mine had a crazy amount of jalapenos, and also not very evenly spread; while a friend almost none. Understandable, but just pretty funny b/c one of my bites was completely filled with jalapenos.. interesting surprise. 

Great burgers, they're also pretty fast too for quality fast food burgers. I feel like they're faster than In-N-Out, not to mention their fries are wayyy better (still love me some In-N-Out though!).
author: Teresa F.

description:
I was pretty impressed with this place. My burger was good and my garlic fries were delicious. I thought it was cool that they had three different dipping sauces, but the only downside is that you're only allowed to try two. If you want all three, there is a charge. Pretty lame. It's a little bit pricy for my liking, but I wouldn't mind coming here every now and then. I think it's a plus that they use organic products and what not. It makes me feel a little better about what I am eating. 

Overall, this is a pretty good burger place. It's nothing over the top that I would go out of my way for, but i would definitely come back if I was in the area.
author: Ariana T.

description:
Why oh why have I waited until now to try this place?! I've walked by this place so many times and boy have I been missing out.


Ok, so it's Lent ... 40 days and 40 nights of NO MEAT (beef, pork, chicken) basically only fish/seafood is okay. At least for me--- I opted to abstain from meat for the duration of lent instead of just Ash Wednesday and Fridays. A challenge for sure, trying things like veggie burgers and other vegan options.


It's Sunday evening and I'm starving after mass, where oh where should I eat? I happened to be walking by Super Duper and they have veggie burgers and GARLIC Fries! Yes, garlic fries. No meat in the garlic fries so you better believe I didn't miss out an opportunity to try them.


The cashier was very nice and their service is quick. They handed me a buzzer and I only waited about 5 minutes to get my order. I only had enough time to pick a place to sit and take a peak at what others ordered. A burger joint is so hard to come to when you can't eat meat, I definitely can't wait to come back and try a REAL burger. 

Anywho! The veggie burger was great! Perfectly cooked fresh veggie pattie with all the toppings as well as avocado and jack cheese between what a bun should be -- an equal number of soft and firm. This was so filling, but not too much that I felt overstuffed.

This was a great pair with the highly talked about garlic fries. If only there were a way to capture scent... Man! I wish you guys could smell these things and I mean that in a good way. The fries come with FRESH not powdered garlic like some places and topped with cheese.  And again, THE SMELL!!!! mmmmmmm ... So good... It's definitely too much for me, if your out with someone it would be good enough to share between two people. But maybe that's just my opinion. 

Oh and I also gave up soda for lent-- they have a delicious lemonade with brown sugar. 

Price wise... Yeah, they are a little pricey I ended up paying a little over $14 for my veggie burger, garlic fries and drink, but I don't mind paying for good food.


To sum it up: 

Veggie Burger: Super
Garlic Fries: Duper
Lemonade: Delightful

Thank you for a great Sunday night dinner (:
author: Clare C.

description: Perfect lunch joint. I go with about 10 of my friends, & because we all order & pay up front, there's no hassle at the end of the meal. Plus, the seating is so casual it's easy for us to all sit together. And the food is fantastic! The burgers are juicy, the chicken sandwich is surprisingly tender & amazing, & the veggie burger is pretty great too according to my vegetarian friends. And if you've packed a lunch but still want to hang out with your pals, this is the perfect place to buy a coke & pull out the sandwich you brought ;)
author: Sophia B.

description:
I typically hate grease. And my God did the burger drip with grease from the moment I first took a bite out of it. But I loved it. 

Excellent, juicy, and high-quality beef patties. I added avocado, cheese, bacon, red onions, grilled onions, jalapeños, pickles, and lettuce. I would never have imagined that I would love a burger this sloppy. You leave this place feeling like a caveman. Or maybe I'm just a messy eater? 

In any case, this place boasts a nice trendy-diner decor and is a small chain that cannot be missed in a visit to SF. I'm coming back here for lunch tomorrow.
author: Vaibhav V.

description:
I had a really bad experience with super duper the first time, but recently, my little brother has been asking me to look for new burger joints to try and I decided to give super duper a second shot. 

I got the mini burger with cheese, garlic fries and water. 
My brother got the mini burger with cheese, bacon and a chocolate milkshake. 

We killed it in 10 minutes. 
WE LOVED IT! We both think it's so much better than nations, in and out and any burger joint! 

It's way too expensive to get a regular burger, so get the mini combo! Trust me, I eat a lot and I still had half of my fries left. It'll save you a couple bucks! 

Most definitely coming back.
author: Tracy V.

description:
You need to come here for breakfast, lunch and dinner.

No, seriously. The overhype of burger places like in-and-out always made me question people's burger reviews. Being a Minnesota native, places like Newts, The Blue Door and Matt's Bar always tastes far superior to most over hyped west coast chains.

Super Duper Burger has it all. Amazing Breakfast Sandwiches, amazing Mini Doughnuts, amazing Burgers and amazing sides. I've never tasted this kind of perfection before.

I've been here twice during my short stay and plan on coming back again a third time. Yeah, it's that good.
author: Jacob G.

description:
I had a craving for a burger. I know, I had meatloaf last night and I need to cut back on my red meat, but I walked past this place the other day and had to give it a go. The menu indicated they serve beef from a local ranch and that it's cooked medium. Okay, the medium part really scared me, because I typically order my burgers well done. However, it was nice and juicy and lightly pink in the middle, and I didn't get the usual stomach ache I'm familiar with when I order up a burger at most other burger establishments. There's a lot to say about eating locally sourced food - it just tastes better.

I ordered a specialty four cheese burger that included blue cheese and an order of their natural cut fries and had some of those claim-to-fame homemade pickles. Great portion sizes, especially the fries. The pickles here are seasoned a bit on the spicy peppery side. Not for me. But the fries were salty and cooked just right - not too mushy or too crispy. I'm not a garlic fan, but they have garlic fries on the menu that certainly must be a favorite among non-vampires.

It's just a burger folks, but it's quality fast food just like they claim. Darn, why didn't I opt for one of those thick creamy shakes?
author: Angela S.

description: For friendly service $5 beer and free fries with your movie ticket, I give them 5 stars. For how overcooked and lacking in flavor my burger was, I take a star away.  I nearly took 2 away but the Racer 5 on tap is a good thing. Seriously though,  if I pay an extra $1.50 for blue cheese and bacon, I want it to count and not be an afterthought.  There was barely any blue cheese! That's criminal.
author: Tera K.

description: Amazing!!  Loved my Burger and my garlic fries. Every time we visit San Fran we get garlic fries and this Burger joint is so far the absolute best!!  Wish they had this restaurant back in my hometown!  But it's something I'll look forward to go eat when we come back to visit!
author: Kelsee W.

description: Best place to get burgers and fries. Came here many times and I finally writing a review for this place. Just for starters, get the mini combo. It's a great deal for pretty much the standard meal with hamburger, fries and soda. You have the option to change the fries into garlic fries which I insist of you getting. The garlic fries is a must to get.
author: Nick F.

description: After a long day traveling the kids, wife and I needed a quick and easy dinner. Chose to carry out and it was perfect. Guys were very helpful, they threw everything we needed into the bag and filled the order perfectly. Nice work! Right next to our hotel and busy with a nice crowd. Oh, and the burgers ... fantastic. Perfectly crispy fries were icing on the cake.
author: Charles S.

description:
Really friendly service, really tasty breakfast sandwich and housemade pickles (yes I had pickles with my breakfast sandwich, I love pickles), and if you believe the guys that work there, really delicious housemade donuts.

I'd love to come back for a mini burger with as many toppings as I can cram on, and hand dipped Strauss farms soft serve swirl.  ** drool **
author: Jennifer D.

description: made my taste buds flutter. I got their Mini burger (one patty) and fries. It's a lot of meat in a patty, so skip the double burger and just stick with the single. Their fries are standard, reminds me of The Habit. The onions in the burger are delicious and really compliment the meat. I'm typically not a burger person, but I looooOoOOved it.
author: Vanessa C.

description:
On the menu,
the burgers are categorized 
as either being
super or mini.

Do not be fooled by the diminutive name of the "mini".
It is simply a misnomer.
And please believe when I say
that little mofo packs one satiating punch.

But I guess it is understandable
why folks would go "super"
and opt for a secondary patty.

They're seriously tasty:
nicely seasoned beef
from Niman Ranch,
little charred on the outside
but moist and juicy on the inside.

Then you add some jalapenos
on them.

Hmmmmm.

The garlic fries
with aged cheddar 
is a winner.

And the shakes
would impress both 
Mia Wallace and Vincent Vega.

In short,
it really is a must go spot
if and went 
that burger crave hits.
author: Dan B.

description: Love when you can walk in and have your order taken directly usually it's a long line. I was lucky today can though the hostess was nice enough to offer me a cup of water declined cause I have other places to hit up. But there burgers are so juicy fries always fresh
author: Kentara W.

description:
Woah! I came here not really expecting to be blown away by a burger. I mean, c'mon, who calls their burger joint "Super Duper Burger"? It's like a name from the 90's... are you for realz?

Alas, I was absolutely blown away. They consistently have juicy burgers. Their patties cooked a little bit on the rare side of medium to come out with a delicious burger. The mini burger is 4oz and good enough for me!

Tips:
- I usually ask for everything, but everything doesn't come with ALL free stuff. You can get jalapenos and onions added to it without extra charge, but you'll have to ask.

- They can serve a japanese alcohol (don't think it's sake) in their milk shakes. I was taken a back at first when he asked if I wanted my milkshake spiked!

- Their fries are good, their garlic fries are better!

- Free pickles. If you want to try to take this to go, ask for a foil wrap (it's what they put the burger or fries in). They have trays by the pickle stand, fill one or two up with pickles, then stick them in a foil wrap, then wrap it shut and put it in your to go bag.

- Super friendly staff! Very very accommodating. 

- The bathrooms downstairs are both single person unisex bathrooms. 

Highly recommended and I'll be back.

**While this is slightly different taste than in-n-out, I love both. There's no innout in the area though (walking distance from work), so Super Duper Burger will do!
author: Kaje Y.

description: This place never gets old amazing fresh super duper good friendly staff nice clean atmosphere love this place on the list of good burger spots nd unlike most places their garlic fries are actually good
author: Sac M.

description:
Went on a thursday night at around 6 and it was busy. 

The super duper burger is insanely huge, no one needs that, get the mini burger. 

The burgers are soooooooo good, really filling, and really fresh. 

The dipped cone is also a MUST. I would go here just for the ice cream.
author: Molly S.

description:
Just another place to get a good burger.

I have to be honest though, I don't understand the reviews on the burger being huge.  I think the mini is...well, mini.  It's a small burger, and my first time here, I ordered that because reviews said it was filling.  Mistake, especially since I was still hungry but knew eating another burger would be too much food.  Even the Super Duper size with the fixings is just an average-sized burger to me, so expect to be satisfied but not bursting full at the end of your meal.  I usually get fries or a shake, or both if I'm really hungry to go with my meal.  I love their pickles, so don't forget to grab a few of those by the condiments.

I prefer this location because there's more seating and there's an upstairs part too.  It's a nice place to catch up with friends without breaking the bank.
author: Debra C.

description:
My friend and I ordered the exact same thing: mini burgers without onions with sauce. What we both received was: mini burgers with onions and had no sauce. The food was only alright, nothing spectacular (no In & Out or Smash Burger)

Granted the line to order went quickly, I am not too fond of the seating arrangements (I don't like high chairs with the tall tables, but I really appreciated the hooks underneath so I could hang my backpack). Because the tables and chairs were a metal color, it made the place feel cold and unwelcoming. 

However, I like that pickles had their own little self serving station next to the ketchup station. 

I'll probably be coming back in a few months just to give it another go. 

Oh, their garlic fries were good :D
author: Fanny W.

description:
Their burgers are incredibly delicious! Try vegan one! 

Not five stars because the dining area is dirty. But they have a tremendous traffic because their burgers are so good!
author: Taisiya P.

description:
Friendly staff, great little place to get a burger fast service food was yummy.  Seating was easy to find and test taunt had very pleasant feel
To it
author: Jonathan N.

description:
Need a quick, delicious burger? This is the SF answer to Shake Shack. Get a burger of your choice here with some garlic fries and your hunger pangs will surely depart. Quick, clean, and prompt ... Super Duper is the answer for those in need of a quick pit stop. Plus those free little homemade pickles are quite a delicious app to start.

I had a great service here that included a top off of beer and it was all just so pleasant. Super and duper indeed. A must for a quick SF peruse.
author: Joseph L.

description: The burger was good, the Fresh Strawberries Super Shake was great, and the Garlic Fries were awesome. But the Strauss Soft-Serve Ice Cream is what really won me over. It's kind of weird how hard it is to find soft-serve ice cream these days, so when a place can do burgers, fries, shakes, and soft-serve ice cream, we've got a REAL winner on our hands.
author: Mark C.

description:
I'm not sorry for saying this but is this the best burger that SF can offer? Really?!

I am beyond disappointed with their burger.
I had their Super Duper Burger with everything on it. 

-Cooked to medium? More like medium well.
-No seasoning at all on the burger. Please salt your burgers. 
-Special Sauce? No flavor.
-Tried my girlfriend's burger with the portobello mushroom, no flavor whatsoever on the mushroom. It was like eating a sponge with water.
-Honestly, it tasted like the Third Pounders at McDonald's but at least McDonald's knows how to season their damn burgers.

I am so disappointed that I'm still at the restaurant while doing this review. 

Only reason why I finished my burger because I was hungry and I was taught not to leave or throw away food. But believe me, it deserves to be dumped in the trash.
author: Mikey P.

description:
Came here for lunch with my BF on a Saturday afternoon.  The place was busy, but seating was still available.  We ordered a mini burger, a super burger, garlic fries, and a cookies and cream milkshake, and the total came out to be $24.

I thoroughtly enjoyed my burger and so did he.  The taste was there and the presentation was nice.  The garlic fries and milkshake were tasty as well.  I would definitely come back.
author: Samantha C.

description:
I finally had a chance to try Super Duper yesterday after so many pictures and raves floating around Facebook and Instagram and I was not disappointed.
I got the Mini-burger, which isn't really all that mini after adding cheese, bacon, grilled onions and jalapenos. And of course I also had to get garlic fries. My burger was dripping with juice, but at the same time didn't fall apart like some burgers tend to do. I was already full halfway through the burger, but I finished it anyway. It was thaat good. I didn't enjoy my fries as much though.. They were good, but just not "I have to have it" good. But then again, maybe it was because I was so stuffed with my burger I no longer wanted the fries. Haha either way, I'm a fan!
author: Athena L.

description:
Very good food, clean place, friendly service.

I got a mini burger with cheese and bacon, fries and an ice tea. Everything is made with high quality ingredients, the burger was cooked perfectly, fries were great. Really good food, a bit expensive, but worth it.
author: Brandi C.

description:
It was a tough choice between giving this place 3 stars or 4.

It was good but not amazing and realistically it's not somewhere I would go out of my way to eat at but if it was next to my house i'd be pretty happy :)

I assume this is a NorCal franchise as i've never seen it in SoCal.   The closest place I can compare this to is The Habit if you are from SoCal
author: Ben Y.

description:
The burgers: they're just okay.

But the garlic fries... I think I would steal for these. They aren't too thick or too thin, they're COVERED with fresh garlic, and then topped with shaved 6-month aged cheddar. The best part? They ring in at a criminally low $2.75.

I've also tried the chicken sandwich - admittedly, I can be weird about chicken and this particular grilled breast was a bit stringy. The memory has stayed with me and I haven't ordered it since.

This location tends to be a little less hectic than the Market St. eatery. Sure, you'll encounter a line but everything is made to order and the vibrating pagers make grabbing your food a breeze.
author: Jelena Z.

description:
One of the cleanest location in SF.

Mini burger + garlic fries + fountain drink = one happy tummy! 

Don't forget their awesome homemade pickles. I love pickles! 

That is all you need to know. Give it a try and enjoy! Cheers!
author: Owie N.

description:
So I ordered the super duper burger. The burger sure does live up to its name. The two patties that come with it are huge. The patties are so big that a lot of the bites I were taking, especially towards the end, were mostly meat. I like to have an even ratio of Veges patty and buns with my bite so I'll probably try and get the mini burger next time. 

Garlic fries were bomb. Their house made pickles were bomb. Overall pleasant experience!
author: Kevin C.

description:
My friend rave about this place, and told me it's better than in-n-out, so I need to come here to give it a try.  (I HEART BURGER!!!!!!)

On the day I went, I had been craving for in-n-out burger for days.  So I have very high expectation on Super Duper Burgers.  My friend and I ordered mini burger, right size for girls, garlic fries, and lemonade.  

Oh my!!!!!!!  I love the burger!  The sauce is phenomenal!!  The garlic fries, yes it makes your mouth stick, but why not treat yourself a delicious garlic fries once a while.  Lemonade, OH YEAH!!!!!!
author: Brandy C.

description: This place has the best breakfast sandwich and it's totes affordable. Come check it out
author: ER W.

description: Usually i get their ice cream at their other locations because of nice weather but its my first time getting their burger. You'll have to pay your food first at the cashier if you want to dine in. Got the mini combo...consist of 1 hamburger(the one with the single patty), french fries, and a drink. Cheese cost an extra $0.75 for the burger so it'll cost over $10 for the mini combo so it might be a little pricy but good enough for the downtown location: The burger was good and juicy. It was the perfect size for me. If i had the super, it'll go over board for me since i wasnt super hungry. The fries kinda cold when i got my food but it has an okay texture. Just wish it was hot enough to enjoy it. I got their coke. It looks and taste water down drink but it helps me drink down from the food i had. I still enjoy their food
author: Julie N.

description: If you're visiting and you're going to have one burger in San Francisco, this is it. Yes over InNout. Super Duper is around the same price point,and worth the couple extra dollars. A meal with fries and a drink will cost you just over $10. The milkshakes are also worth the indulgence, a kids size being the perfect amount so you can still finish your burger! The busiest time of the day for Super Duper is easily the 12-1 (11-2 to be safe). If you go at an 'off' time you can avoid the sometimes monstrous (resisted the urge to use a super duper pun there) line. Even if the line is out the door, they've mastered the art of the que and the turn around time is rather quick. Longest I've waited is about 20 minutes (line-order-food) and that was an exception. Highly recommend!
author: Abigail S.

description:
Yeah, my mom and I are addicted. I used to think Gordon Biercsh set the bar for garlic fries but then I had Super Duper's garlic fries and oh my goodness?!? Yup, new garlic fry bar is set, Super Duper is it.

Their burgers are super yummy (pun intended). Get your burger with the works- egg, cheese, jalapeño and all! You will not regret it. Oh, and get a shake with those fries. Every shake on their menu is amazing!!!!

I love that you can serve your own pickles. I love pickles. Their pickles are made in house. They are not as delish as my Uncle Paul's but they certainly are yummy.

Everyone I introduce to Super Duper begs to go back. Anytime I am near the Metreon I make it a point to stop by and have a burger and garlic fries. Even if I'm not hungry. Yup, their that good. Well, take this review as your guide and warning. Proceed with caution- this place is addicting!
author: Caro S.

description: Bit Pricy, but its downtown SF, the ingredients used are above avg, each burger is made fresh, The flavors were great and It filled me up. I was in town for a Conference and this hit the spot just right. I will be back when I am in the area. The burger flavor is on par if not better then Five Guys
author: Gabriel D.

description:
Super Duper is like the Shake Shack of SF.

Gourmet fast food burger, freshly ground organic beef with high quality buns, well-sourced vegetables. The garlic fries aren't shy with the garlic.

No complaints from me, Super Duper hits the nice spot between my wallet and quality. I'd come back if I was in the area and hankering for a quality, well-priced meal.
author: Michael C.

description:
Before you order a burger, do me a favor and order an Oreo milkshake. You will NOT regret it. 

What can I say about Super Duper that's not already been said on yelp? Nothing. It's definitely a great burger joint to check out if you're in the area. And if you're lucky like me, and work near it, it's a great lunch spot. The order might take awhile as they make the food fresh, so make sure you're not limited on time if you're going for a quick lunch break.

I've had both the burgers and the chicken sandwich and I recommend both. Get the chicken sandwich if you're feeling "health conscious", but if it's your first time, get a burger. With cheese (if you're not lactose intolerant) and bacon (because everything tastes better with bacon). I recommend the garlic fries. It's not like the garlic fries from the ballpark, but they mix it with parmesan cheese and it is oh so addictive. I also recommend that you slather some of those fries + garlic parmesan goodness into your burger.

And please, please, please get the Oreo milkshake. You won't regret it. Because... who doesn't like oreos or milkshakes?
author: Liezel D.

description:
My burger was cooked perfectly,  so juicy. I also loved my garlic fries and the self serve pickles. My chocolate shake however didn't really give me my chocolate fix  I was needing.  
Next time i got bring home a jar of they're homemade pickles
author: EmmettsGuRL C.

description:
They make awesome garlic fries!! Their veggie burger is also awesome, they'll also serve it in a lettuce wrap if you want. 

The only qualm I have about this particular branch, is that every single time I come in here, my order is wrong, they either forget something or mix my order up. 

Note: check your order and avoid peak times :)
author: Susana P.

description:
Only Super Duper Burger location in San Francisco that has happy hour! It's 5-7pm, everyday. Buy a beer, get free fries. Or upgrade to garlic fries for just 50 cents. 

I always get the mini burger with everything on it minus onions and add portobello (extra $1). Don't be fooled by the naming convention. Mini burger just means one patty, not a tiny burger. It's a pretty good, juicy burger and with little to no mess. To have "everything on it" is at no additional cost. You do pay for the other add-ons though, except for the pickles which are in a jar by the condiments.

The fries are crispy till the very end. Garlic fries are topped with shredded cheese. The serving of the fries seem small for the non-happy hour price but it's just the right amount to share between two people when you each have your own burger.

I always leave happily satisfied, whether it's with a beer during happy hour or not. I have yet to actually try the chocolate dipped ice cream....one day!
author: Sandy T.

description: I could eat their egg sandwich with avocado and tomato for breakfast every day for the rest of my life - so fresh and delicious! And the folks who work here are wonderful! Thank you, Super Duper!!
author: Bee G.

description:
Pros

Clean place
Food is fresh
Free pickles ate a dozen
Garlic fries are good
Nice workers

Cons

Crowded
Small burger, Almost slider size
Fries small portion

Try it once.
author: John L.

description: I was very impressed with a quick, simple menu for a nice lunch.  The lemonade was delicious and service was great!  First timers in San Francisco and so far we're loving the food!
author: LaShaunda J.

description: Great Eats all around!! Place was packed & was a line continuously following. Food worth the wait without breaking the bank!
author: Chow F.

description:
This isn't the best burger but the burgers are tasty. They also have spiked milkshakes! 

Prices here can get pricey. You can add different things to your burger, like an egg, bacon, cheese, and even blue cheese, but each addition can add an extra $1.50 each. I ended up with a single patty burger with bacon, egg, and blue cheese and a side or regular fries for about $13.

This is right next to Metreon and Target, so a great pit stop after shopping or before a movie. 

Overall, a good but pricey burger place in the Soma / Powell area. 

Pros:
-Spiked milkshakes 
-Egg and blue cheese options 

Cons:
-Pricey
author: Paul U.

description:
Super yum. 

Mostly went for the soft serve ice cream but figured I might as well get a mini burger and fries. You know, since I was there and all.

Hot darn, that ice cream is good. 

The mini burger was pretty good. Nice flavored meat with all the fixings one would typically enjoy. It was a bit too much for me (this is certainly not slider sized) so I ended up sharing it. The fries on the other hand (mmmm mmm mmm!), I did not share.

I didn't understand why I needed a pager thingy since they ended up calling out my name. It's a nice name though, isn't it?

Come hungry.
author: Loli L.

description:
Really good burgers, and the garlic fries are don't-miss.

SD burgers are made in the 'haute fast food' style:  relatively thin 4 oz patties made from organic Niman Ranch beef, packed with a very light hand so they aren't dense, then seared on the grill 'till they're crusty but still juicy.  Perfect execution of that particular style.  Other than the cheese (flavorful aged cheddar), the toppings aren't particularly notable, but the roll is:  a very fresh sesame roll, likely baked at a bakery earlier that day, with none of the artificialness that preservatives and other additives impart. 

If you at all like garlic, get the fries topped with garlic and shredded cheddar - they're very good.  

There's ample seating, but it does get packed, so if you plan to eat in, you might want to come off-peak.
author: Scott H.

description:
Starving after a late night out in the town, we decided to go to Super Duper before I took my Caltrain ride back home. I wasn't sure the next time I'd be here, so I seriously went all out. Super Burger with everything on it, plus added cheese and an egg. Then I realized there's no turning back so I also ordered a spiked cookies and cream milkshake plus an order of garlic fries. That may have been too much food, but I ate it all like a champ. 

The burger was great, but I didn't realize the difference between a super burger and mini burger was just 1 meat patty... so probably next time I'll turn in my man card and order the mini. The garlic fries had a fresh garlic taste to it, so I destroyed those pretty fast. The spiked shake did a great job of blending the taste of alcohol with it, so I didn't feel trashy drinking alcohol before noon.
author: Jay R.

description: When given a choice, I don't normally pick burgers, but OMGeeeee Super Duper Burgers has to be the yummiest burger I've ever had! I ordered the mini burger and it wasn't mini at all. The garlic fries....seriously best I've ever had! My daughter ordered a strawberry shake and that too was super-di-duper good! All organic and the taste is unbelievable! Place is clean, cute, and staff is very friendly. Will be coming back for sure.
author: Brigette B.

description: My first time here and wow, I was Amazed at how awesome the super burger was!!!! I inhaled it within seconds!! Hard to find a place that lacks a solid burger, this place nailed it!!
author: Nick T.

description:
Craving a tasty, quick meal in the city? Look no further! Super Duper is always my go to establishment for a burger fix. 

I always get the mini burger with everything on it and they nail it everytime. The burger is juicy (no this is not grease, it's burger juice!), sauce is a great touch, and nice sharp melted cheddar. Delicious! Fries are always crispy and salted just enough, and the shakes are so good. I've gone to the market st location as well but I prefer this location it's a bit more low key, well at least the times when I go. I'm sure during the lunch rush there's a line out the door, but it's well deserved. Service is always fantastic as well, in particular an associate there named Esther is extremely friendly and extends excellent customer service each time I go. 

Long story short, check out Super Duper when you get the chance. I'm a concierge and this is the place I always send my guests when I'm asked for a great burger joint, I'm pleased to report no complaints yet!
author: Evin C.

description: For this to be a fast food chain I must say it was very tasty and gave me a feel like I was In a hip restaurant. I ordered the double burger with cheese and a side of garlic fries. The fried were so tasty however they didn't have little chunks of garlic like I'm use to. They have house made pickles which was cool and set them aside form other burger joints. The chocolate milk shake was also tasty. I did notice the hamburger buns were very thick. My gf had the single burger and I noticed the bun overpowered the meat. So I would recommend the double bc the patties are fairly small. I will be back next time I'm hanging out in SF.
author: Shawneshia H.

description: Park at the 5th Street garage and walk towards the Metrion.  It's always packed so be ready to grab a seat anywhere u can.  Burgers are good, the shakes are awesome and the free pickles are great!
author: Bill S.

description:
Always heard about this place but never took the time to actually try it out! Luckily for me, my girlfriends wanted to set up a date and catchup w burgers and fries. Mind you, I haven't eaten meat in over two months so I didn't really know what to expect. 

We arrive around 630pm on a Thursday and found some seats upstairs. I ordered the super duper with everything except the super sauce and also added grilled onions w/ a side of garlic fries. While waiting we munched on some homemade pickles, I prefer my pickles to be on the sweeter side but they were good anyways. Btw, they're call you can eat so if you love pickles....

Our order came shortly after 8 minutes and smelled incredibly good. First bite in and it was heavenly. The fries were crispy and at the same time soft (just how I like it.) I could've used less cheese, but all in all - VERY SATISFYING. We also tried their organic soft serve swirl. Nothing major, but it was good.

Comparing all the burger joints I've been to, including in n out.... Super duper is the absolute BEST. Can't wait for more :-p
author: Charlene B.

description:
Food was tasty, but in-n-out is also super duper tasty - and they would've given me my fries. 

Ordered 3 combos to go and it came with zero fries. 

Nothing too special here, just well branded and well marketed in n out.
author: Kelly H.

description:
Went here for a quick lunch with a friend. It was actually pretty quick service. I liked how they had the buzzers for when your order was ready. Started buzzing and went up to the counter to pick up my order.
I got the Mini-burger with "everything on it" which is just the basics: lettuce, tomato, red onion, and sauce. The pickles are self-serve on the side. The burger came out pretty small. I hoped it would be a bit bigger. It's about the size of a Whopper Jr. 
The good part was the Garlic Fries. A good portion of fries sprinkled with garlic and cheese. I also got the "Three Dips" for an extra $1.50. I dont recommend it. It was just three super-small cups of three dipping sauces. Nothing special. 
This place does get crowded during lunch rush hour. We went at around 12pm, which happened to be right before.
author: Timothy J.

description:
Definitely give this place a shot if you're in the mood for good burgers! I'm usually picky when it comes to burgers because I hate it when restaurants try to make these super complex burgers that fall apart easily and are just dripping in grease. That being said, the burgers here are relatively simple and taste delicious!

There's always plenty of seating here and this place draws in a great crowd. Very fun for groups and overall a great place to chill.

Quick warning: I believe on their menu it says they cook all the burgers to medium. I had to request that mine be cooked well done.
author: Sylvia T.

description:
Oh dear what has happened to me? This establishment popped up on my radar (bookmarks obviously) for a good year already but why was did it take so long?

Its inconvenient. This location is next to the city Target at the Meteron, and couple that with traffic for ages on weekends and I have am 8-6 on Monday to Fridays. I don't get many opportunities to go.

Regardless after what felt like all of eternity of people taunting me with their Super Duper Burger pictures of their burger and garlic fries, I was granted the wonderful opportunity to attend this establishment. 

And I still wonder why I waited so long. 

Ordering is simple, it's a burger (2 patties) or a mini burger (1 patties), cheese and bacon is extra, so is a few other items like the sunny side egg and avocado for example. There are fries, garlic fries, drinks (yes they have beer), and dessert.

I wasn't aware of this but they give you an actual glass cup for the soda orders, what fast(er) food restaurant does that? The cashiers are I guess okay, but who am I kidding? I'm here for the food, plain as day. Or night when I came because there was free parking and I'm too cheap to park at the garage.

The burger, the fries, wait a picture first, smelled scrumptious. That first bite, you definitely know this is a burger you can't find at your local burger joint, its here and its pretty god dam affordable. The juiciness, the crispiness of the bacon, how the buns ever so complimented and put together the burger so well, it made me so happy. 

Did you notice that the bottom of the bun also had sesame seeds on it?

I asked my friends what they thought and they enjoyed it, which to my liking is a good thing. For some reason every time I try to bring friends to a restaurant that I like or never tried, it turns out as a disaster. 

Not here.

Them garlic fries though. Thoroughly seasoned with a potent garlic and aged cheddar smell that will blow you away. And its not just for looks and smell, it tastes, oh so amazing. 

That chocolate dipped soft serve ice cream though? Yes mine had a hole and the soft serve was oozing out in the photo, but it was pretty good. Not exactly worth 4 dollars but you gotta try it one day right? 

Regardless even if it isn't worth 4 dollars, it completed the meal very well.

Too long didn't read? Don't hesitate to come. It might as well be one of the best most affordable burger and garlic fries I've ever had. Maybe even better than some more expensive ones I've had. And trust me, I am no cheapo when it comes to food.
author: Harry P.

description: Great tasting food that's made quickly and for a reasonable price. The free donut was an added treat.
author: Naveen N.

description:
Truth in advertising. This place is super duper (much like Gary Cooper). I don't eat beef so, as a rule, I tend not to get excited about burger places. BUT when it's dinner time, you're staying in/around SOMA and you don't want to spend a lot of cash, a burger will get it done.

But not just any burger. This burger needs to be super duper... and vegetarian. As my colleague Elsa M has already pointed out, veggie burgers tend to vacillate between dry as sawdust and 'what is this supposed to be?' Not so at Super Duper. I suppose I shouldn't have been so surprised that San Franciscans have managed to perfect the veggie burger. With a locally-sourced organic patty (I'm trusting you, behind-the-counter guy) as the base, adding hummus, cucumber, avocado, lettuce, tomato, and onion to just about anything would be a combo made of win. Top it with a whole grain bun and we're in business.

But why stop there? There's garlic cheesfries to order! Now, don't expect rivers of bright yellow goo on top of your spuds. No. Expect freshly cut po-ta-toes (boil 'em, mash 'em, stick 'em in a stew) adorned with herbs, garlic and freshly grated cheese. It's not the Monsanto'ed comfort of your youth, but the grown-up you should appreciate them nevertheless. At this location, there's also two floors, an industrial feel and beer. All of these items add to the burger-for-dinner experience nicely. Knowing, however, that I had much boozing in my future, I opted for a strawberry milkshake. It was delectable. Thick, creamy and packed with berries, this shake was worth the (small) wait. Order one. If you can't shake the alcoholism shakes, you can order it spiked... but don't be that person. Have some self-control.
author: Johnny T.

description: Super duper are making a name for themselves in the Bay Area. But they're nowhere near In 'n out quality. The burgers here are just too greasy. But the garlic fries were quite good. Go here if you want a quick and greasy meal.
author: Ganesh K.

description: Best veggie burger I have ever had. The lemonade and milk shakes are amazing as well. I would definitely recommend
author: Megan C.

description:
No lie, the burgers were pretty tasty, but they were tiny as hell! Definitely not as super duper as they make it sound.

Yes, I did get a mini burger, but my guy friends got the regular burger. The only difference was that there was an extra patty inside. They were still so hungry afterwards that they resorted to eating the free pickles they provide LOL

Interesting how if you ask for a water cup, it's the same exact glass as a soda cup.

It gets pretty packed, so it might be a little tricky finding a place to sit down, but we got lucky!

I don't regret coming here, but I probably wouldn't come back again.
author: Lincy H.

description: One of the best burger chains in the bay area.... that's all u need to know. Just check it.
author: Richard G.

description: I really liked it but still prefer In N' Out. The mini burger was the perfect size for me; cheese was good but would have preferred it to be more melted. The homemade mayo tasted great, and the staff was friendly. I enjoyed eating lunch here and would come back if I were in the area again.
author: Rena M.

description:
Super Duper Burger was without a doubt Super Duper (I know this is very cheesy and probably overused, don't care)

The burger here is amazing! I ordered a Super Burger (2 patties) and added avocado and an organic egg. My meal was extremely messy with runny yolk, but I could care less as I feasted on this delicious burger. The garlic fries are a good accompaniment, but be warned that there is an intense amount of garlic in them. The cookies and cream shake is tasty, but honestly just tasted like I was drinking ice cream (may be a good thing?)

It was great to have a satisfying meal in SF for such a cheap price.
author: Ashwin S.

description: Best burgers in town!! It was perfect to grab a burger then head over to amc for a movie right around the corner! The garlic fries were awesome too! I never mention names but this time I have to make a shout out to Ollie one of the guys that works at this location. He went above and beyond to make our first experience here extra special and kept us laughing. So thank you again Ollie and the rest of the awesome staff here! Can't wait to come back to visit!
author: Mallory R.

description: The mini combo breakfast was simple yet delicious...a fresh egg with cheese on an English muffin, a homemade mini doughnut, and a good cup of coffee. All for $5.50.
author: Carolyn L.

description: Came in around 9:40 am with only 2-3 people ahead of us and expected to wait maybe 5-10 minutes. However, we waited over 25+ minutes for a breakfast sandwich and a donut! The coffee station wasn't refilled and I actually had to leave my guest I met up prior for breakfast for work! Total waste of my time.
author: Rj L.

description: Add the egg, you'll thank me. With a side of garlic fries. Fun fact, your can purchase the jars of homemade pickles you see near the condiments. They need to open more locations. Make a visit outside of the lunch crowd, if not, hope you have a long lunch break at work.
author: Robin L.

description: I guess this is a chain as there are every where . . . once I saw one I saw 5.  Not a beef eater so I got the chicken sammie.  It was pretty good.  They have free toppings and others they charge for.  I also got the garlic fries, they were yummo!  I did not have a cone or milkshake, but lots of ppl did and oh my, they looked good so much so that I thought of going back just for that reason.  They have beer on tap.  Enjoy!
author: Ali C.

description:
I was really excited that this place offered mini burgers.  Most places' burgers are ridiculously large and I have a difficult time finishing burgers.  The mini burger here is equivalent to Five Guys' little patty.  It's still large for someone like me who can't eat that much (and doesn't like burgers much to begin with) but it's a lot more manageable.

I would not recommend getting the cheese with the burger.  It's the orange American one and it just tastes like melted plastic.

The garlic fries are pretty good at the top of the pile, but once you get to the bottom of the fries pile, it starts to lose its flavor.  I guess you could try mixing up the garlic and cheese thoroughly but it's quite messy.  It smells so good though.

The milk shakes are pretty standard but pretty delicious.  You can even get a kids size one but note that it is rather small.  They should have an in-between size.
author: Danielle C.

description:
The cashier was completely unprofessional.  I asked for a mini burger with everything to go.  Unfortunately, I got a mini burger with just lettuce and tomato and nothing else!!!!
It was soggy and tasted bland.  I had been craving this burger for a while and it was utter disappointment.  I will stick with In-N-Out where the burger is not soggy and their secret sauce is amazing.
author: A D.

description: One of the best burgers I have ever had!!! Embrace the greasy goodness that a good old fashioned burger has. Got the mini and was definitely big enough to fill me up and I'm a big eater. Just got the regular fries, they were great, but was really regretting not getting garlic. Definitely recommend stopping if you're near one. It's a great cheap burger.
author: Abigail O.

description:
THIS BURGER IS SOOO GOOD!!

First off, this place is organic and makes the most delicious burgers and soft serve ice cream out there. My friend introduced me to this place and I am so thankful. This is like a gourmet fast food burger because it is more expensive than say In n Out but cheaper than the restaurant burgers.

WHAT I GOT
1) I got the mini burger with cheese and it is just the right size. In my opinion, the mini burger is like a regular size burger so I cant imagine how huge the super burger is. The meat is soooo tender and juicy and just tastes super delicious with the bread and cheese. My mouth is watery just thinking about it.
2) Garlic fries!! You must get the fries. They are so crispy and oily and the garlic and cheese topped off of it makes it one of the best garlic fries I have had. Gotta have fries with your meal!
3) I got the cookies and cream shake on another occasion and it was good but I would pass on it. It tastes like an average shake and I would much rather get the soft serve.
4) I got the soft serve on another occasion and it is as good as it looks. I think next time I will get the chocolate dipped soft serve because chocolate makes everything better :)

**TIPS**
1) Get the mini burger because it is the perfect size.
2) Get the garlic fries. You will not regret it!
3) Chocolate dipped vanilla soft serve FTW!
4) ENJOYYYY!
author: Amy H.

description:
I love you super duper
And no, this review isn't a blooper
I'm totally serious, just like a storm trooper
because this place is seriously super

The burgers are juicy as juicy can be
And their garlic fries with what? Cheese!
This place rocks and I love it a lot
Did you know you can also get egg on it?  please stop....

OK, so I found one of my favorite burger joints....ever!  Super Duper burgers are amazing!  Juicy, delicious, and their garlic fries?!  Yo, I usually don't like garlic fries, but this place makes them great!  Great!  

OK not much else to say but go here!  Been to both the Market and Mission ones and they're both the same, both delicious and both the place to go!  I heard from a friend that this one in particular is slightly less busy than the one on market.  plenty of seating before noon, but this place gets packed as well.
author: Dennis K.

description:
Similar to the idea that women save a special portion of their stomach for desert, I found myself in a similar situation with Super Duper.  SD has this ability to produce that feeling of "OMFG this is good. I want more but I don't know why; here is my money. I walked uphill for 16 blocks to get here." We had this place the first day we got to SF and I couldn't stop thinking about it. For crying out loud, I'm in LA right now and I still think about it. In SF, I recall any shortcomings in our itinerary were easily dismissed so long that I knew Super Duper would be there at the end of the day.

Super burger double patties + cheese + bacon (none of that punk b!tch sh!t) w/ everything on it) is absolute MAGIC the way the juice (and probably grease) explode into the cavity of your mouth. It just drips everywhere and is a mess for those without dexterity. Don't be an idiot like me and forget the free option of adding grilled onions, jalapenos, pickles. I've seen numerous people top their glorious creations with a fried egg. Don't be a moron like me and forget to add that too with the assumption that I'd be back in a couple of hours to redeem myself...only to find that the workers had a life too and the facility would be closed. I now sit in LA full of regrets and a stupid place called in-n-out. 

Garlic fries with three dipping sauces is a crown jewel here and must be taken seriously here.  I love the 'texture' of their fries; its a mix of crispy, soggy, and crispy-soggy (rare - savor these ones). You know they mean business when your breath is kickin' for the remainder of the day. But you know what? The moment a girl smells that garlic sting, they know you've been to Super Duper. You're a man in her eyes...or a woman in his eyes.
author: Wes W.

description:
I come here all the time, about 4 to 5 times a week. I was really hungry last week and ordered the usual Super Burger.  When I got my burger, it was a mini burger!

I quickly looked at my receipt to make sure that they did not charge me for a super burger and they did not. Now this was at 3pm and the place is not busy or loud. How can the cashier lady mistake  "SUPER" for "Mini"?  

I was really angry because I was really hungry and was having a bad day already.  My advice is to check your receipt every time and don't bother coming from 12 to 1pm because the line is out the door.
author: Gangsta G.

description:
Amazing burgers! The meat is so juicy and flavourful it will leave you wanting more. The garlic fries are a must try as well but be sure to have some gum and/or mints with you as your breath will kill vampires after eating them. 

Prices are decent for what you get and service is friendly and quick.
author: Derwei C.

description:
Eating a super duper burger next to a cute guy is probably the biggest mistake I can make when it comes to pretending to be a lady. Think about it, its juicy, its hot, there's all kinds of meat-sauce-toppings dripping down the corners of your mouth, chin, top of your nose, maybe down your arms... really, any crevice you can think of, has super duper burger juice. I swear that wasn't a pun.

So as you can imagine, i'm not good at eating a burger in a classy way. Luckily my burger was good enough that for a second (while I'm trying to unhinge my jaw and squish my buns together to fit it all in my mouth in one bite) I forgot about my lack of class. And then I ran in a panic and took like a 100 napkins for my entire body. Sweet.

Their pickles are probably some of the best I've ever had. Their spicy peppers.. whoa, those things mean serious business, so I suggest you be careful with that.. or at least try a tiny bit before eating a whole one. Your intestines will thank you later.

If I haven't grossed you enough with this experience, let me make sure I summarize this well enough: their burgers are tasty, their toppings are awesome. Their fries are worth getting and the no-thrills easy-going environment wins my vote. Go get some.
author: Emily G.

description: Good burger, moist, juicy and great flavor. Only con was .75 for one small slice of cheese.
author: steven p.

description:
Best customer service!! I had a difficult time hearing when placing my order, the cashier was so patient and kindly repeated his question until I understood! 

Best, fresh cheeseburger, especially when you add a fried egg!!
author: Susie S.

description: Always crowded but the cashier never rushes you. Juicy burgers always. Great pickle to boot too. Probably beats in n out even if it cost more. One only live once, let's not waste it eating in n out.
author: Han Teng W.

description:
I love Super Duper now. I admit, I've had a less-than-average burger at another location before...but now I realize that was one of the off experiences. Just look at the line at dinner time and you will know what I mean.

You don't need to go fancy. Just try a basic cheeseburger with everything on it, and grab some homemade pickles from the condiments counter. This should be enough to convince you. Plus, they also have good milkshakes and soft serve, so you can also grab a dessert to go with your meat as well.

The only problem I see is the line...it's hard to justify lining up twice, once for a burger and another time for a soft serve... I wish they are more efficient like in-n-out (and then in-n-out would have some serious competition!)
author: Alice C.

description:
Super Duper Burgers is, well, pretty super.

Be warned: Super Duper does not do gourmet burgers like Epic Roasthouse, Serpentine, or Mission Beach Café.  For a reasonable price, Super Duper just delivers a classic, juicy, messy, drippy, satisfying burger that tastes amazing.

The mini burger ($4.75) is not mini at all, rather it is a 4-ounce all natural beef patty with whatever toppings you want, including lettuce, tomato, red onions, super sauce, jalapeños, grilled onions, and pickles.  The super burger ($6.75) adds an additional yummy beef patty.   Each is mouth wateringly good--not too greasy, not too dry.

Covered with garlic, the garlic fries ($2.75) are to-die-for; neither too thick, nor too thin, they wonderfully crispy and topped with shaved aged cheddar cheese.  For the beef averse, Super Duper offers delicious organic veggie burgers, natural free range chicken breast sandwiches, and salads.

The service was fast and friendly.  Orders were taken quickly and delivered accurately.

For a quick way to end a burger craving, Super Duper Burgers is the place to go.
author: CJ G.

description:
Looking for a yummy, yet filling, yet quick dinner after a movie but before we were meeting friends & Super Duper was a beacon in the night

2 Veggie Burgers w/ Avocado & Cheese b/c it's the ONLY way to eat a veggie burger - the patty was consistent w/ other SD locations & there was a nice pristine veggie taste & no crossover from the meaty fry-ups

I like to think of their burger as homemade, even though it's preformed & fried up (I see rice & corn & something else green but can't way what it is).  This is a pick-it-up burger in that you can easily eat it w/ your hands & don't *have* to eat it w/ a knife & fork - but being a proper Southern Belle mandates that I do

Veggies on the burger were crisp & fresh

Paired w/ Garlic Fries - they were hot & cheesy & loaded w/ garlic.....we were stinky for the rest of the night & totally loving it!

Lots of space & tables were quickly turning over to allow the crowds to continue to find easy seating.....people must have been on the same timetables as we were

Thanks for giving us a phenomenal meal & getting us on our way.  It was just what we were looking for!!
author: Adrienne G.

description:
This place is a crowd-pleaser and a great choice when you're with a group for lunch. Anyone who works around here knows things can get crazy during lunch hours and if you have more than three people or so it can be a huge pain. But Super Duper offers plenty of seating, you pay at the counter so there's no need for confusing check-splitting, and there's something on the menu for everyone - even vegetarians! 

Though I love their burgers and especially love that they have a 'mini' version so you don't feel like death for the rest of the work day after consuming one, my surprise favorite is actually the chicken sandwich. I never, ever go for a chicken sandwich usually but the meat in this one is super juicy and flavorful and it's just a delightful choice. Pair it with garlic fries and a milkshake and you've got yourself an irresistably all-American meal! If you're going to go the burger route, I always recommend getting a fried egg in there. A runny egg yolk makes any burger better!

The table areas can get a teeny bit messy at busy times, and admittedly there aren't too  many super healthy options there (there is a salad available on the menu but I don't know anyone who's ever ordered it)... but other than that this is a stand-out place is an area crowded with lunch options and I highly recommend it. Oh, and don't forget an organic soft-serve for dessert.
author: Christina P.

description: Excellent burgers and fries, just okay chicken sandwich. Their ice cream is pretty great too. They make their own pickles too. All in all a great place for a quick casual meal.
author: Leah L.

description: Loved everything about Super Duper Burgers! Fresh, tasty, great service, clean....I'd recommend to anyone.
author: Lee Anne J.

description:
Line at the Vietnamese roll place was too long, so I rounded the corner and discovered Super Duper Burger. The line wasn't as long here and moved fast. Employees were friendly and the food was not too expensive. They use artisanal bread that's tender & tasty. Feeling healthy, I ordered the veggie burger which ran about $6. The cashier offered me a cup for water while i waited. How nice!

The burger wasn't like the usual freezer veggie burger (Gardenburger). Flavors were more pronounced. Exterior was nice and crispy, but it was moist on the inside. It was topped with a light tangy hummus sauce. Veggie patties look freshly made here - they contained real nuggets of plump golden corn, bits of broccoli, and grains that were not hard from spending an eternity in the freezer. Taste was mild, I'm sure, when compared to the meat one. But I didn't feel like a cow after consuming it. I got mine with tomatoes, lettuce, and thinly sliced onions. I'd happily eat one any day. :)

If only I wasn't watching my diet!  This place also has soft serve ice cream made from Straus Creamery milk & fries. Oooh. I'll take up marathon running, then come back here. :)
author: Kari C.

description: I liked this Super Duper. Service was good, quick and the burgers are delicious.
author: Will D.

description: We got their burgers... an overpriced tray of greasy meh. Fries were okay. Paid extra for tiny condiment cups, one of which was mayo. Really wants to be a Shake Shack or o Burger Fi, but it's not.
author: John D.

description:
As a burger enthusiast hailing from Los Angeles, I would love to have a Super Duper Burgers close to home. I had a double-patty bacon cheeseburger and garlic fries to-go. Ate in the hotel room with my wife and we enjoyed every bite. The food traveled well, the quality of the ingredients shined through, the garlic fries were legit (very garlicky and delicious), and the burger had a unique feel and flavor. My configuration placed the burger at restaurant pricing, but the quality is up there. Not a thing to complain about but I'm just not used to paying this much for take-out. 

An enthusiastic 4.5-stars.
author: Anthony A.

description:
I've been here a few times and have tried the Chicken Sandwich and a Super Burger and Fries. I can't explain it but I really liked eating here...there's a cool feeling to the place. Maybe it's the high ceilings and the second level seating area or the bar-stools. I also really like that you get a nice big, clean glass for your soda...a simple thing like that just feels more welcoming... like they want me to stay at enjoy my food!

Anyway, the food is great and I believe you get free fries if you show your ticket stub from the Metreon nearby! I love the fries here, skinny cut fries are the way to go. I haven't eaten a burger in a while so thinking back about this place is making my mouth water...
author: Daniel C.

description:
Best veggie burger! I'd strongly recommend :D And the garlic fries... hmmm so yummy 
Dips are also amazing
author: Joyce S.

description:
I was ravenous and in need of something hearty and saw the Super Duper sign from afar. After a quick check of the reviews on my handy Yelp app, I decided to pop in for some much needed sustenance. The space is great: nice and modern, bustling, and generally fun. Service at the register was super friendly, and the menu is well organized. My food took a little long to come out, but nothing too serious. 

I ordered the chicken sandwich + avocado and an order of the garlic fries. I just couldn't resist, regardless of how they might make my breath smell. I brought everything back to my hotel and scarfed it all down with the quickness. The chicken sandwich was big and flavorful with fresh ingredients. The garlic fries were all I'd hoped they'd be, although I forgot to pick up ketchup before I left the restaurant. Be sure to grab some if you're taking to go. 

I'd happily return to try the burger, no doubt. Oh, and a milkshake.
author: Kathleen M.

description:
Good juicy hamburger no doubt.  Well worth trying.

Garlic fries come with cheese and you can't get them without it so for me a huge failure.  I hate cheese.

Noise level is too loud so it kind of wrecks the meal.  They need to fix the noise level with some bunting hanging from the roof.
author: Smorga M.

description:
When you name your restaurant super duper burger you better be serving a pretty darn good burger. Super duper, if you will. Unfortunately my burger fell a little short of super duper status.

My boyfriend and I were looking for a quick bite and Super Duper Burger was close by. We each ordered a cheeseburger and got fries to share. The burger was good, but honestly I've had better. It was just kinda average. I was happy to see it was a Nieman Ranch burger though so they get points for that.

The fries were fine. Again, nothing outstanding but decent enough. The garlic fries may have been a better option.

I would go back, it's definitely a better option for a quick burger than typical fast food. I just know there are better burgers out there.
author: Holly R.

description:
Great burgers. GET THE CHEESE. Your burger will always be moister when you get it with cheese as it slows down cooking. Also consider their organic soft serve which is super tasty.

 If you find your burger not tasty, add some salt. They sometimes underseason which is probably better for your health and lets you control the flavor.

Love the self serve pickles. The staff is friendly and well trained for a "chain" and I always come here.

The fries here are my only pan. They are usually a little oily and not that crunchy. In N Out is similar, possibly one of the side effects of fresh potatoes? Golden arches excellent fries and we all know how good that is for you.
author: jeff l.

description: The burgers were pretty good. After reading rave reviews on the garlic fries we had to try them, bur we found them kind of overwhelming. You have to really LOVE garlic , and not mind smelling like it for the rest of the day. What we DID love were the MILKSHAKES! Made with organic milk, I couldn't get enough of them! We ended up going back the following day just for late night shakes to go!
author: Nicole B.

description:
Had the Super Duper Burger with organic egg - superb!

House made pickles were light (not too salty of a bribe, probably pickled only briefly) and delicious (and free!). 

The parties themselves were lightly seasoned, which is great if you want to be able to apply your own salt / pepper / ketchup so it's not overwhelmingly flavored.

I happened to be one of these folks, so I didn't mind at all :).
author: Ming L.

description:
I will start this off by saying I never ever ever eat beef. However, each and every time I am around Super Duper I make a small exception for this place!

Their burgers are the greatest thing on the planet! Seriously, I have never in my life had a better burger. I usually order a double, with garlic fries, brown sugar lemonade and make sure to grab a bunch of their homemade hot pickles. 

Their burgers are big, even if you order the smaller burger, its still BIG! Their juicy, medium rare is your only friend here and you will need a lot of napkins (on the wall). I usually get everything on it including the egg which creates an even bigger mess on my tray. Their fries? fresh, strong garlic, and a nice touch of parm cheese on top of it. One meal like this will run you easily $17 but it is by far the best meal of the day, and maybe the month (I don't go up to the city as often as I use to.) 

Seating is also at a premium here too. Finding something outside is usually a lot easier than the inside stuff. Sauces are also worth it as well too! 1.25 and you get to grab their "secret sauce" to dip your fries with to make them even better!
author: Jon G.

description:
Yes the burgers are that good!!  Would have been a five star rating but was a little disappointed in the fries. Especially when we asked for them well done/crispy. The burgers though!!  They are that good.  The place was super busy but that might explain the fry issue. But we were waiting anyway, so a few minutes would not have hurt us!

The service is top notch. The guy behind the counter was great and the lady who gave us our food was super nice!!  We will be going back again!  We want to try the shacks and dipped ice cream cones!
author: Rhett Y.

description:
Other than the fact that they completely messed up my order, this place was pretty good. 

The patties are big and meaty, the toppings are all fresh and the sauces compliment everything very well. 

I wish I had gotten to try the pickles but they forgot to put it in my bag. :( 

Overall, I was very disappointed with the service.. Everything I wanted on my burger wasn't on it and they messed up my friend's burger too but if you are in the area and don't mind paying $20 for 2 burgers, I think it's definitely worth trying out! Just make sure everything you ordered is in your bag before you go.
author: Emily N.

description:
My co-worker and I made a point to make our Tuesdays or Thursdays soft-serve days at Super Duper and are obsessed with their organic product. The kids size is more than enough, and the workers are generous with those cones :) It tastes a little like frozen yogurt, but who cares? YUM

It gets crazy during lunch hours, but they work fast! Burgers are consistently delicious, albeit oily, and their garlic fries are so satisfying.

Don't be afraid of ordering the mini versions - they are more than enough to keep you going. Ah, I'm already drooling.
author: Colleen M.

description: Came for $5 breakfast that comes with coffee, donut and egg cheese sandwich. Pretty good for a fast meal in the city on my walk to work. Next time I'll probably skip the donut.
author: Krystle L.

description:
Best burgers around. Real organic meat. Mini burgers are really juicy and filling. I had regular French fries and ketchup on the side. Simply delicious and satisfying. I ate two mini burgers for lunch and I was set for the rest of my day. 

I will definitely, come back. Love the location, too. Customer service was good. I had to speak slowly and repeat myself to the gal taking my order but she was trying, & they were all very helpful.
author: Ane T.

description: Their burgers are massive and delicious and will satisfy a burger craving. The last time I ate here I got indigestion but the food is still delicious. I guess I'm at an age where I cannot devour massive burgers like I used to. There are many options here to choose from and this is comfort food. I love the pickles, they are perfect and not too salty. The atmosphere and seating is quite good as well. I am a fan!
author: Julian I.

description: The name says it all, pretty much everything here is super duper. The burgers are of course delicious, but if you want to branch out the chicken sandwich is awesome as well.And don't pass up the garlic fries and their shakes. Lesser known is their breakfast, which is probably my favorite egg sandwich from anywhere resembling a fast food establishment.
author: Matt G.

description: Breakfast.  I was working at the Moscone Center after about three hours of sleep thanks to a delayed flight and needed a quick bite to eat.  I walked over to this place, after seeing the coffee shops on the way were super crowded. It was 8:30 AM and  little line.  The woman working the counter was pleasant, the coffee was fresh, and my egg and cheese sandwich had a lovely spicy chiptole aioli sauce and a perfectly slightly runny egg. Definitely recommend.
author: Amanda B.

description:
You know those urges you get? The one's for a tasty burger, sometimes in the middle of the night or for a naughty calorie-dense lunch in the midst of work meetings? Well, these burgers satisfied every bit of those impulses my body was calling for.

I ordered a double-decker with avocado. The meat was cooked to medium, as ordered and the sandwich was perfectly crafted in a bun that was lightly toasted. The avocado added a nice touch to the sandwich, although I couldn't taste it very well in the mix of all the other flavors: the onions and tomatoes really added a nice punch and were not those flavorless tomatoes, onions that one could get in some other places.

One of my coworkers had an incredible milkshake that I had the honor of trying. It was as spectacular and numbingly-food-coma inducing delightful as a milkshake could be. Their garlic fries were also some of the best I've ever had too. Why? Well, the fries were crispy to a point where eating them was savory and the garlic flavor was soaked into the fries.

The ambiance is nice as well. Spacious, dark colors and clean tables--lively and energetic. Great place to catch up with a friend or even grab lunch on your own.
author: Alex L.
