description: I went with the smaller burger and even as a fat man it was plenty. Good, thinner crispy fries. Yes eat that strawberry shake!  Burger was excellent and actually cooked medium.
author: Andy S.

description: Pretty delicious burgers and garlic friends, you really can't go wrong! Add those homemade pickles on top, and you got the makings of a great burger thats as fast as fast food!
author: Bryan M.

description: This place was recommended by a friend.  I was super hungry and this place was awesome.  Busy and usually a line but don't let that daunt you.  Line goes by smooth and the staff is friendly. Have a friend watch for a open table.  Burger is so good and garlic fries.  Double yum with a side of yum!
author: Ernest S.

description: I'm a fan of the burger. Super duper did not disappoint. Their house made pickles are a little bit strange but give them a try and see what you think (sweet and spicy). You must try the garlic fries. They'll leave you wanting more. If you're in town and looking for a great local eat with quick service and a small price tag, you just found lunch.
author: Nate S.

description:
I was finally able to try out Super Duper Burger and compare to it some of the other awesome burgers I've had in SF (Fish & Farm, Spruce, 4505 Meats), and it didn't disappoint! Although it wasn't my favorite (Fish & Farm), this was still a solid burger. We ordered:

-Mini Burger ($4.75) + Cheese ($0.50) + Egg ($1.50) + Avocado ($1.00) (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/super-duper-burger-san-francisco?select=_3R-5w4FljV7Or6WB0XgQQ#lGZ9rvJAGDftWLqi5Yfi7w): I liked that the grilled onion and jalapeno were complimentary to add to the burger. My burger was cooked a perfect medium, but still had a nice sear on the outside. It wasn't as big as I was expecting, and I wish I asked for additional sauce on the side, but it was still good. However, don't think I would add egg the next time around since it made it really messy to eat. 
-Garlic Fries (Fresh Garlic & 6 Month Aged Cheddar, $2.75, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/super-duper-burger-san-francisco?select=_3R-5w4FljV7Or6WB0XgQQ#d4vV1xxfSNKQeJjcIKAm6A): Pretty good! The fries were nice and crispy, and there was the perfect amount of garlic.  
-Double Chocolate & Chips Super Shake ($5.75, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/super-duper-burger-san-francisco?select=_3R-5w4FljV7Or6WB0XgQQ#_3R-5w4FljV7Or6WB0XgQQ): This shake was good, especially since it was made with Straus Organic Soft Serve. However, I couldn't take the chips, and it was on the pricey side for the amount of milk shake you get.
-Complimentary House Pickles (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/super-duper-burger-san-francisco?select=_3R-5w4FljV7Or6WB0XgQQ#4LPX_4q-RRlHGkIJOuaeWg): Good but not amazing. However, the pickles went really well when eaten with the burger.

Service was quick and efficient, and we got our burgers in less than 10 minutes. However, the restaurant wasn't very crowded so I'm not sure how long the food takes when its busy. The only annoying thing was I had to keep repeating my order to the cashier since it didn't seem like she was paying attention. Parking for this location is also tough, so you'll either have to pay to park in the garage (only a block away), or you'll have to walk a few blocks if you want to look for street parking.
author: Amy D.

description:
I've never actually had a chance to eat here, but I've definitely had take out from them quite a few times. (Thanks, boyfriend!) If you're looking for a burger that's a little more gourmet than "just a fast food burger," you've got Super Duper. In fact, I'd even venture on to saying that Super Duper could be a gourmet burger chain with the right prices and fast casual slingin'. I'd equate it to Smashburger, for those who haven't heard of it. Both are equally delicious and both make me feel like I'm going to have a heart attack after. I can feel my arteries clogging when I eat a Super Duper burger. (Not that that's quite a bad thing-- you're definitely satisfied.)

I believe most times I ask my boyfriend to pick up food from here, I get the Super burger with cheese, bacon, grilled onions and pickles. (What can I say? I like to keep my burger greasy?) The doneness of Super Duper's burgers are perfect. They're a perfect medium- thick, juicy and delicious. The garlic fries with all the dips are amazing, though I wish they offered different sizes of fries. And also, because I get them take out-- I wish they held up better for the wear and tear of a five minute walk because they were a little soggy by the time they got to me. (No matter, I still ate 'em up like there was no tomorrow!) The cookies and cream malt was thick and delicious, and by the time it got to me it was still thick and delicious. They keep the menu simple and clean and they do it up right. I don't eat burgers much, but when I do-- I make sure they're Super Duper. (Or In-N-Out, but whatever. This review is about Super Duper.)
author: Christa Lei S.

description: The mini burger is pretty tasty & super fresh....not so in love with the cheesy garlic fries...a little too much...I think I'd rather stick with the original.
author: Nicole E.

description: Pretty average. It's kinda greasy but I was okay with it. For it's price, it's worth it so im giving it 3 stars.
author: David-Allan H.

description:
GAAAAAAH I usually never crave burgers but when I do, it's always Super Duper.  Might be because of their garlic fries but damn that stuff is good (get the 3 extra dipping sauces...totally worth it!).  Their mini isn't so mini and you can add usual stuff like pickles, grilled onions, cheese, etc but also AN EGG!  sluuuuuuuuuuurp 

HH is 5-7PM and gets a free order of fries with a purchase of beer or wine.  Unfortunately you still have to pay regular price if you want garlic fries.  New Mission St. location next to Target is much cleaner than its Market St. counterpart a block away too.

P.S. Don't go here on a date or with a crush.  Your breath will stink and you're bound to get sloppy.
author: Jane N.

description:
It was my final evening in San Francisco and I was starving. My colleague wanted a burger, so I hopped on that train and pulled out my trusty Yelp app. Super Duper Burgers immediately jumped out, since it was a) only a few blocks away and b) 4 stars. Booya! Done and done.

Sure, it may seem like your typical sterile order-at-the-counter burger joint, but they also serve wine and beer (score!) AND the veggie burger is not your average burger. You order and pay, get a buzzer, stake your claim at a table, and return to the counter to fetch your food once that buzzer buzzes. Simple. Easy. Quick. 

Why's the veggie burger so delish? It's thick, flavorful and filling. Not too dry, not too boring (actually, not boring in the least) and topped with your choice of add-ons. I went with ketchup, mustard, cucumbers, jack cheese and avocado. I think it's usually served with hummus, but I opted to forgo the chickpeas in favor of my all-American condiments. I also indulged in some of the free pickles (offered at the condiment stand) and they were crispy and just what the burger doctor ordered.

Three of us also split an order of fries and we totally housed them. Not too soggy, not too crispy, not too thick, not too thin... get the picture? Yep, Super Duper Burgers done good for us.
author: Jamie D.

description:
I have eaten at Super Duper a bunch of times now and I am falling to the "familiarity breeds contempt" syndrome. I could not help notice that the mini burger for $5.50 is really mini. Don't get me wrong, it is still very good.  The fries were just OK and were lukewarm.

This location is a very short walk from their other location on Market and is right by Yerba Buena Gardens. It has 2 floors and it was cool to see an all woman crew when we were there.
author: Sunil R.

description: Loved this place. The burgers were cooked medium well and almost tasted like steak. It was delicious. I got the mini burger with everything on it and with fries. I would come back to this place again. The servers are very nice and outgoing and the service is fast, and the I liked the restaurant's vibe, you get the whole city vibe in there lol (can you tell I'm not from the city?)
author: Anna C.

description:
Stopped by here earlier this month after a entrepreneur party at Minna gallery and came back because we had tried a sample on the way to the gallery and they gave us some kinda coupon for free fries with a burger or something like that.  I'd have to say this is a perfect place to have a late night snack post drinking.  It is clean and has a very inviting atmosphere.  This is actually my first time trying it, and the quality of the beef is excellent and cooked just the way you order it.  I almost always go for mid-rare if possible. 

They have a very simple menu which makes ordering easy, not much customization needed.  We split the super burger with a side of free fries, simple goodness!  I'd recommend trying this place in the city if you haven't already.  I'll bring my other friends who haven't been yet. They now have multiple locations, I believe three now relatively close to one another.  Damn, I don't usually eat burgers often but when I do I'll be craving one from here!
author: Kenny P.

description: Pretty good burger place! It was pretty busy, so I knew it should be tasty. I ordered the mini meal with came with a cheeseburger, fries and a drink. It just the right amount of food. They had self serve to the ketchup, mustard and pickles--pretty good as well. I'll defiantly be back!
author: Joshua P.

description: Dopeness. Smooth ambience. Quick lines (even if it lines all the way out the door). Fantastic fries. Intense pickles. Amazing but messy burger though.
author: Hui L.

description: Busy place in the middle of lunch hour but well worth the "8 min from door" wait especially for the garlic fries. My husband got the double with bacon and I got the mini which is 1/4 pound burger. Burgers were tasty and made just how we like them...medium but closer to rare. The meat was seasoned but so much as to cover the flavor of the meat. We are staying at the Marriott Maquis across the street and went for lunch but I think I might sneak back over for another batch of those garlic fries! Might get more fries tomorrow too...and possibly the next day as well. :-) Oh, did I mention the garlic fries are fantastic?
author: Carie W.

description: Ate here on a Friday at 4pm. The service was good. I was surprised by the low prices and that they have beer on tap for $5. The burger was good and I also had garlic fries.which were okay. It looks like their breakfast is also a good deal.
author: Dwight S.

description: Super Duper Burgers are super duper greasy. Taste pretty good. Won't do it again. Stick with In-N-Out.
author: Qing L.

description:
Another day, another sheet of plastic in your Mini Burger. Sadly, i prefer my burgers sans choking material, thanks. 

Not surprising too. You get a whiff of the lack of care from staff as you look around. Smelly and NASTY drink glasses, stained and sticky serving trays, dirty tables, etc.. I don't believe anything is washed in here.

Do yourself a favor and avoid this spot, unless consuming plastic is your thing!

ZERO STARS.
author: Bader H.

description: As there weren't many places open we decided to pop in here for a quick meal after a concert.  Ordered the combo - the burger was juicy and flavorful although a little bit oily.  Fries were delicious as well. Next time I'll make sure to try the garlic fries and the pickles.
author: Lindsay C.

description: Good place for a quick, quality burger. All 3 times I hit up Super Duper burger on a recent trip was good (except for them forgetting to give me my garlic fries on one occasion, unfortunately they are really good and I didn't realize until I got back to my hotel). Fried egg is a winner. Pickles are free and fresh. Fairly priced for the neighborhood. If you like garlic, gotta go with the garlic fries. They were probably my favorite part about the place. Just be prepared to not want to have a convo with anyone until you've had a chance to brush your teeth a half dozen times. Definitely worth a visit if you are in the area and need a quick bite.
author: Craig R.

description: Good burgers, kind of greasy. Delicious cookies and cream milkshake! Pretty pricey for what it is
author: Michelle M.

description: Good lunch. The place sort of has the feel of Shake Shack. The breakfast is amazing. You get a breakfast sandwich (egg sandwich), mini donuts, and a coffee for $5. It's delicious. I would've eaten here everyday for breakfast (in addition to sometimes for lunch) if possible.
author: Arthur K.

description: Great food and music/atmosphere! Prices are resonable and staff is friendly and thorough, would recommend it highly! Also, no lines or waiting. Food was ready as soon as I got my drink! Delicious beer too!
author: J B.

description: This is the second time Super Duper has come to the rescue while I ws short on time and needed to get good. I was also craving burgers so this hit two birds at once. Super Duper Bacon cheeseburger to go hit the spot. Really messy while trying to get to the train but I think Ive somewhat mastered eating on the run now that I can polish one of these while walking. A solid burger in under 10 min, open late? Works ever ytime
author: Kim N.

description: Food was very good. Service was a little slow. But the killer was the shake... Don't know how you can mess up a shake. Very disappointing.
author: Ryan T.

description:
I've been wanting to try Super Duper for so long!  Finally got to try it a few weeks ago when I decided to meet my aunt for lunch.  The only thing I don't like about Super Duper is the seating.  The two-seater tables are too close to each other and everything else seems communal style.  But their burgers are delish...if you're like me & can get stuffed easily..get the mini (1 patty, 4 oz).   I liked how you can choose which toppings you want...especially the free grilled onions!  I added cheese on mine ($4.50+.50), and got my aunt a mini burger ($4.50), and we shared an order of regular fries ($2)  all for about $12..not too bad.  Super Duper is considered fast food, but wayy better quality, kinda like In-N-Out.  Our buzzer went off in about 5-7 minutes.  Our burgers were juicy & messy.  I liked the super sauce that comes in the burger.  It's a little like animal style sauce at In-N-Out, but not super rich like it and minus the chopped up pickles.  The fries were plentiful, hot & crispy & seasoned with the right amount of salt.  A few weeks prior I had some of the bf's leftover garlic fries from this Super Duper.  They were so good with lots of garlic & cheese.  However, there was so much garlic that the fries actually tasted spicy...garlic burn?  I'd get the garlic fries again if they toned down on the garlic!

All in all, Super Duper is a great choice for an affordable lunch when you're shopping at nearby Westfield.  They make a great burger and fries.  You can feel less guilty getting a burger and fries from here as opposed to your fast food favorite.
author: Cat C.

description: Great burger for the money. It practically melts in your mouth. We got the upgrade to garlic cheese fries which was pretty good also. You can also upgrade the order and get the sauces, one is chipotle with a very nice flavor. Also, their ketchup tasted fresher than the usual heinz.
author: Elana K.

description: Went here with my girlfriend and got the super and mini burgers. They were so good! Got some garlic fries in the side and  a bit of orange juice. Service was great and the cashier welcomed us after asking us if it was our first time there. The home made pickles were awesome! All and all a clean, nice little friendly restaurant with upstairs and downstairs sitting options!
author: Zanti R.

description: Stopped by for a quick lunch. Food and shakes were on point.
author: Andy G.

description:
Super Duper is well, super duper. I love coming here for lunch to get my burgers and fries fix. The food is delicious and you can't go wrong with anything you get. They also have free pickles!! It's also awesome to find one of the chili peppers in the pickle jar to put in your burger/sandwich.

Oddly enough, I never get the regular beef burger when I come. It's always the veggie burger or the chicken sandwich. Their veggie patty is awesome with the hummus and cucumbers. I tend to get it with everything on it (lettuce, tomato, red onions) along with jalapeños, grilled onions, and roasted portobello mushrooms ($1 extra).

The chicken sandwich is probably one of the best I've had. The chicken breast is moist and tender with a nice grilled taste to it and the chipotle aioli is great.

As for the other stuff, the fries (and garlic fries) are delicious, but their overpriced sauces are not worth it. Shakes are good as well, and you can even get it spiked (though I have yet to try it myself)!

I prefer this location to the one on Market that's only a block away. The layout is a bit nicer even if the amount of seating is about the same. You should definitely try out the food at either location though.
author: Vivian L.

description: I came into this with high expectations - the art on the walls, the descriptions they use, the overall presentation screams high quality. From what I expected and paid for, it left me wanting more.  It was cooked well and the ingredients were crisp and fresh, but I just didn't feel it was worth the nearly $10 I paid (I also added a $1 topping of portobello mushroom).  I should come back and also try the garlic fries, and i may edit my review after that.  For now it remains average in my book.
author: Ben K.

description:
Burgers are like my second favorite fatty food to pizza. No In-N-Out near where we were staying so we quickly looked a burger joint up on Yelp. A Super Duper Burger chain?!? I mean it MUST be good it says SUPER DUPER! Made our way into town dodging some sketchy people near the BART to have some burgers! Yay!

Walked in an ordered a Mini Burger. Normally I like to order more than I can eat but it was already 4 oz. That's a lot of meat for little ol' me. Added bacon on that bad boy. My husband had the same minus the bacon. Also shared a French fries with chipotle dip. Got a fresh lemonade and the cashier was nice enough to share that if we order a lemonade to-go, it's larger than the dining in cups. How nice of her!

Got our burgers and they look delish. Bit in to it and juices were running. Okay so my first juicy bites are okay. Then it just gets disgusting. I'm not sure if those were juices or tons of oil but it felt really, really oily. Still tasty though.

Overall prices were good and food was tasty. Liked the restaurant too. Lots of tables and you don't have to anxiously wait for an open one.
author: Cheryl K.

description: Went to Super Bowl City with my son to attend the Broncos rally. I asked some police officers where they recommend in the area for a place to eat, they recommend Super Duper Burgers. This restaurant wonderful and the burgers are AMAZING! This is the best burger I have ever had. The employees were very friendly, helpful and the food was delicious. We will definitely be back. Was a perfect evening for a wonderful day.
author: Susan J.

description: Really enjoyed the burgers here as well as the garlic fries. The Burger had really good flavor and the staff was pleasant. A good choice if you want to grab something quick.
author: Kyle M.

description: I use to work nearby downtown and this place was always my go to spot when I could not decide what to have for lunch. I would get a super burger with egg and fries on the side. It was always so fulling but delicious. One of my favorite burger places. They're service is always amazing and helpful. Mostly packed but so worth the trouble.
author: Crystal D.

description: Horrible service . They screwed up our order and never apologized for their mistake. They even charged us for to go and we dined in. Burgers over cooked and fries are over fried.
author: Pamela G.

description:
Super duper really is super duper! Came here for a quick lunch to take back to work. The line was short and moved fast. I wouldn't say they were overly crowded but there was a steady pace flowing. It took less then 10 minutes for me to get my veggie burger and fries. I looooove their veggie burger so much! Is not greasy and it's full of non-meaty goodness.

It's not often when i feel the need to feed on a burger, but when i do, i come here.  My only wish would be if they had a kid's size.  Either way, i'm still happy. :)
author: Char B.

description: Voted best burger in San Francisco three years in a row. Super duper burgers does not disappoint. Burgers and the garlic fries along with the soft serve ice cream.
author: Samuel L.

description:
Sent from my phone:

"Don't take this the wrong way, but I'd open mouth kiss the person who put the garlic cheddar fries on the Super Duper menu."

I wasn't sure Super Duper would be for me (not eating beef or chicken), but dug their slow food values. What gave me that shove through the door was a delirious hunger that comes from not eating all day. Even if I wasn't delirious, I think I would still be majorly crushing on the garlic cheddar fries.

I ordered the veggie burger sans hummus and added the fries as an afterthought. Ordering my burger was a little confusing because the menu seems to imply that it only comes with hummus and cucumber. Turns out it comes with that plus lettuce, tomato, onion and super sauce too. The burger was fine; it held together nicely and you could tell there were actual vegetables in it, but overall it didn't wow me. The fries were a different story.

Slathered in garlic with shredded aged white cheddar over the top, the fries were amazing. I intended to have one or two before digging into my burger, but before I knew it I was licking my fingers with gusto while staring at an empty plate where my fries once lay. Personally, I don't think there's a need for any of the dipping sauces; these are pretty fan-f*cking-tastic on their own.

If I lived in the area, this would be my go to place for fries and a veggie burger every now and again.
author: Mary T.

description:
I love this burger chain. The burgers are delicious. Juicy, cheesy, great meat-to-bun ratio. Absolutely great if you like burgers. The fries are good also. I have always loved chocolate malt shakes and have been a bit disappointed with the selection of chocolate malt shakes in the Bay Area.

Most places make their milkshakes too sweet or skimp on the malt. Super Duper just served me my favorite malted shake in the Bay Area! Seriously. I cannot express just how delicious it was! The chocolate ice cream was dark, thick, and not too sweet. The malt powder was, well, malty. But it also introduced a textural element to the beverage. While sipping the shake, I occasionally discovered flecks of the malt powder that provided a very nice counterpoint to the smooth velvety texture of the ice cream. Simply put, try their chocolate malt milkshake!
author: M T.

description:
You can't go wrong with Super Duper Burger. The Super Duper Burger w/ a fried egg on top is like no other burger I've had before. They have a certain way of cooking the burger where it comes out perfectly. Not too cooked, not too raw..just right. You know those chain burger joints where you might go to a different location and the food taste different? Not them! No matter which super duper you go to you can expect quality, damn good food.

Also make sure you try their Garlic Fries, and the Desert menu is good too. They even have mini donuts in the morning!
author: Allen K.

description:
So, here's the deal... Super Duper is the best mainstream burger joint I've ever been to; in '12 and '13 my mentor and I indulged here after our Tuesday night squat sessions, and I fed my swollen thighs and buttocks with the Super Duper + extra patty/French Fries and Vanilla Milkshake. 

Flew back to SF for the first time in over a year and met up with family for a late night bite... Had a job interview the next day, and, well, knew I needed to look as sharp as possible if I wanted to impress the San Francisco Tech Elites.  People often tell me I look like Tom Brady or Drago from Rocky IV, and the thing is that my face is extremely sensitive to sodium.  I knew I'd run the risk of showing up the next day looking like a stuffed ham instead of a rugged alpha sales killer, but, seeing as how I didn't really want the job that badly, I ordered that very staple of 12oz burger/French Fries and Vanilla milkshake, inhaled it, and bombed my interview, probably not evoking comparisons to either Tom or Ivan.  (The ironic mustache and comb over probably didn't help, either.) Glad I got the burger, though, then bookmarked my trip with a bite at El Farolito. #noregrets
author: Vlad G.

description:
I've been up since 3AM because I got E. Coli from Super Duper's super pink burger on Sunday. What's more frustrating is their customer service. Here's how my call went Tuesday at 11am:
E- "hi, I need to speak to a manager" 
S- "um ok buddy, hold on"
E- wait 10 mins, then the phone hangs up
E (calling back) - "Hi, I need to speak to a manager" 
S- "uh, the manager says he's busy"
E- "Ok, I need you to let him know- I got E. Coli from your burger on Sunday"
S- "Oh, our standard rule is we cook our burgers medium"
E- "Well I suggest you start cooking your burgers a little more"
S- "Ok, sorry. Is there anything else?"
E- *frustrated* "no" (hangup)


Thanks for my super diarrhea, super fever, and best of all- your super customer service. 

Anyone else experience the same? PM me.
author: Eric Y.

description:
When most people think of burger places in California, I imagine that a majority of Californians like myself will say, "Well, of course you've got to go to In-n-Out." While this is true, I have learned that you can actually go one step further when it comes to the fast food burger that isn't quite fast food, but is reasonably priced and immensely satisfying: Super Duper.

First off: fries. Oh my goodness. These fries. Oh my. So much goodness. These garlic fries are even better than the ones I had at the garlic festival, mainly because a plethora of sweaty drunkards and too-hot weather weren't involved. The other positive point to these fries is that they are covered in cheese, which makes it even more delicious. And there is garlic in every wonderful, beautiful bite. I mean, the fries were more of a highlight than the burger to me, and the burgers were pretty damn fantastic on their own.

The "mini" burgers are where it's at, starting at $5 for a quarter-pound of awesome. A super burger is this plus one more quarter-pound patty for $7. A mini was perfect for me, and they're cooked to a nice medium (I'd prefer them medium-rare, but this was still pretty tasty). You can add stuff to your burger according to their menu, and even if you add stuff, it's still probably going to come out to be cheaper than Roam (and definitely Umami).

If it matters, everything here is organic. You can even bring your veggie friends here, since they also make veggie burgers, which are apparently also quite delightful. They've got some housemade pickles (things I don't like, but the boyfriend says they are really excellent), and their ice creams and shakes are made with Strauss, which is one of the most legit still-in-a-glass-bottle milks you can find at places like Whole Foods. The shakes are basically levels of deliciousness that aren't even fair, and are thick, creamy, and still drinkable through a compostable straw.

Anyway, in terms of food, everything was delicious and of excellent quality. The burgers are a solid choice in the world of sandwiches with beef patties in between them; they are infinitely better than In-n-Out, in my opinion. But don't go expecting something that can compete with Roam and Umami. Roam beats SD out in terms of the dozens of things you can add to their burgers; Umami is king when it comes to burgers being made exquisitely. Super Duper is good when you don't want to seem overly-accidentally uppity, but still want to be the bearer of good food times. Plus, their fries are the best out of these three, anyway. I'm not overly fond of Roam's, and if I'm at Umami, I get their cheesy tots, so there you go.

To summarize, Super Duper is, in fact, super duper. Now that I know it's just about two blocks away from work, I know that I'll be going here for my burger cravings. Or, to be more accurate, my garlic fry cravings.
author: Robbin A.

description: Whenever you can't figure out what to eat, Super Duper is always a good bet. I find this one to be a little better than the one that's one block over on Market. Pretty sure they give hugs and kisses to their ingredients and piece them together with love. Their patties are juicier and have more taste, and it's usually not as busy. I would recommend coming at an odd time outside of the lunch/dinner rush because I always feel that they get a little bit sloppy when it's busy. Understandable, of course, but still. Love and hugs and kisses. Staff is always pleasant and accommodating, even when I do annoying things like ask for extra sauce on my burger a little too late.
author: Jennifer K.

description: Ordered a 4 ounce Mini Burger with cheese ($5.50) and Garlic Fries ($3.00).  The burger was cooked a little under medium for me, but was still very fresh and flavor-able.  If I return, I will request a well done burger.  The Garlic Fries were potent and did give me an upset stomach but were delicious.  Overall I think the establishment is certainly above par, it just wasn't my night.  Total price $9.24
author: Jeff W.

description:
Order: Mini burger w/ everything and bacon, garlic fries and a fresh strawberry milkshake. 

The mini burger was the perfect size for me and was deliciously juicy. If you get red onions on your burger, they are sliced super thin so you aren't getting these huge rings of onions to stank up your breath. Anyone you converse with after this meal will appreciate it.  The added bacon was a big plus. The garlic fries were garlicky, cheesy goodness. I suggest paying the extra 75 cents to get em. And the strawberry shake tasted just like ice cream (strawberry of course) as a good milkshake should. I also couldn't get enough of the pickles! You can grab as much as you want from the jars hangin out by the ketchup/mustard/utensils area. Plus, if you enjoy garlic, there are whole garlic cloves in the picking brine which you can pick out and eat too. Yummm.

With friendly cashiers and plenty of seating, if you're in the area, Super Duper is a must!
author: Maya S.

description:
I learned about this burger while looking for a place in San Francisco close to my hotel that served garlic fries. Woo-hoo! I hit the jackpot. Super Duper Burgers not only had great garlic fries that were full of that garlicky goodness but the burgers hit the spot -- especially after arriving from a long flight from the East Coast. 

It wasn't crowded and we received our food in a timely manner. I wish I'd tried the milkshakes because if they were as good as the burger and fries we missed out.
author: Lisa M.

description: Food was good    Servers were good all and all give it a try I think you'll like it good burgers good fries it's not home cooking but it's close what do you have to lose give it a shot.
author: Mike V.

description:
Would normally say positive things about this place - like their cheap yet tasty soft-serve ice-cream.

I wasn't feeling too hungry right before seeing a movie at the AMC theaters on the 3rd floor.  So  I decided to just get my "Free order of fries with ticket stub" - as the sign clearly states inside the Metreon food-court.

Needless to say, the cashier told me that their manager told her that I had to buy something - even though I explained to them what the sign said. 

Not cool. No fries.

Left, still hungry and went to go inside Metreon to Via Moto instead. Told the guy there about what happened at Super Duper. Showed my ticket stub, and got fantastic customer service including an extra drink.

So how difficult is it to simply honor "free fries"? If there's a catch - then please tell Metreon management to add that element of purchase to the sign, like the other restaurants did.

So next time I decide to get a burger at Metreon, I'll go to Buckhorn instead, where they DO honor all advertised discounts, including the one on Yelp. :)
author: Dale T.

description: I've been to many burger places that knock it out of the park with their vegetarian options.. This is not the place to go to if that's what your hoping for.. Veggie burger was very bland. That being said, I ordered it without the special sauce and hummus. Fries were average, nothing special. Nice inside.
author: Sarah S.

description: This place is awesome. All the staff is super nice and the food is great. Very fun environment. Will be back
author: Cathi S.

description:
Please tell me what all the hype is about. I had the double burger with cheese and lettuce, and it was OK. The fries were just OK. 

It was Shake Shack priced, and not close to its quality. 

It took a while to get my order, and not really worth waiting for.
author: Rich D.

description:
My wife and I split on this one and she is looking over my shoulder as I write this. Shakes - Great! Fries- get the Garlic because the plain are a little too plain. Burgers- wonderful...messy...cheesy...but, according to my wife "too big to comfortably fit in my mouth". That is what she said. If you don't like a lot of beef then get the mini because the Super is just two patties and the mini is one. 

Eat here. The pickles are unique and a nice touch.
author: Phillip N.

description:
Was in town for Oracle OpenWorld, looking for a burger for lunch. Super Duper definitely fit the bill. Loved all the complimentary burger toppings, including the jalapenos. Got garlic fries, they were slammmin. I'm glad I was traveling alone though ;) 


I wish they would make the burgers medium rare, but I've noticed a lot of places say they only cook burgers medium. (Not sure if that's a city thing?) 

The line was long but it moved quickly, got the food fast.
author: Amanda T.

description:
Two weeks ago about 8:30pm my husband & I were really hungry. I've been to other Super Duper places so I know what their burgers are like. Our burgers where SO VERY GREASY on the verge of awful but it's that late and you need to eat. You EAT!  I also think the quality of meat has gone to the toilet - did you use Neiman Ranch meat before?  I'd say I would have think twice about eating here again. Sad because I love their ice cream cones also.

Cashier was helpful and had good customer service skills.  Guy cleaning tables his rags where disgusting.
author: SP G.

description:
-- 3.5 STARS --

Ambience:
Walking into this store feels like walking into a casual lunch place in LA. Everyone's chatting away animatedly along long wooden tables or cozied up in deep conversation at quaint side tables for two. The decor is slightly reminiscent of family owned diners, but with a polished twist.

The Wait & Tips:
My friend and I walked in around 12:30 on a Wednesday &  only had to wait about 3-5 minutes before we were served. Shortly after however, a HUGE lunch rush came in, so fair warning, be prepared to wait 10-15 minutes if you come on a busier day!  Seating's also somewhat limited too, but luckily there's an upstairs portion!  If you're coming here with a group, I would suggest either coming at off hours or taking your food to go. 

The Food:
Finally, it's the moment you've been waiting for - how was the FOOD? 

I ordered a mini burger with bacon, cheese and portobello mushrooms, which came out to around $7.75. My friend ordered a veggie burger and garlic fries, which came out to around $10.

Overall, the burger was "okay". I would've preferred crisper bacon, although the burger patty was incredible. On top of that, I thought my mushrooms were a tad rubbery. I still kind of prefer Bongo Burger in Berkeley. 

The garlic fries though? GLORIOUS. Quite easily the BEST garlic fries I've had in years, plus they came topped with some absolutely delicious cheese. Definitely a must-eat, so an extra half star to you, Super Duper! 

Tl;Dr okay burger, great ambience, YOU MUST GET THE GARLIC FRIES
author: Lucy C.

description: Super Duper makes some solid $6-7 burgers. I typically order a mini (with cheese) + garlic fries which comes out to be around ~$9 and get pretty full off the burger and half of the fries. The meat tastes really good along with the sauce they use; however, I think they can toast the buns a bit more. I LOVE the unlimited pickles jar. If you come here around lunch time during the weekday the line is usually out the door, but the line moves pretty quickly and can get to the cashier in 5 minutes.
author: Cindy A.

description:
I was in town for business.  Some friends from high school and college wanted to meet up.  They asked if I've been here.  I said nope.  They opted to take me to a good burger place.  Wait.  What?  Of course!

I ordered a mini burger with cheese, grilled onions, a fried egg and jalapenos.  Apparently, you can even order your burger medium rare.  I found out about this after I already bit into my burger.

Minus one star because they didn't add jalapenos.  Otherwise, this is a good place for some grub.  They close at 11, so if your night is ending early after a nigh of drinking, go here.

Burger tasted fresh.  The mini was just enough to satisfy your burger craving.  The size after that seemed a bit too much for me at that time.  They also spread their special sauce on it.  Veggie toppings tasted crisp and fresh too.  The egg is a sunny side up egg.  If you don't like runny eggs, this may not be for you.  It added a whole different dimension.  A delicious dimension!

Do they have this in Southern California?  If they do, why haven't I heard of it?!
author: Sedine S.

description:
Best 7$ +tax burgers I have ever had. 
Garlic fries are a must have. 
Homemade pickles just fill the whole picture of a place, where owners care about their customers.  Serving food that they would LOVE to eat.
author: Radoslaw D.

description: What's not to like about a $5 breakfast combo downtown from a non chain restaurant! ? I had the egg and cheese muffin with a cinnamon donut and orange juice. The English muffin was crispy and the fried egg was just right. I definitely recommend this gem.
author: Michele J.

description: Garlic fries are great - there's a lot of garlic on them. I wish the beef patties had more seasoning. Their milkshakes are thick, which I like.
author: Theresa M.

description:
I have never been a beef or a burger person, but the burgers here may have converted me. 

The mini burger was just right to fill me up! The patty is juicy and flavorful, but not in a way that is overly heavy or greasy. The sesame bun is toasted to the right amount of crunch, and all the veggies you can add to it are a refreshing contrast to the meat. The special sauce is perfect combined with the super hot jalapeno peppers. I would definitely come back when the rare burger craving hits me again!
author: Ashley T.

description:
Probably... the best burger I've ever had.

A bit greasy?  Yeah... but... the flavors were perfect and what I want from a good burger.  Properly balanced with a good grilled layer on the patty.  Fries were simple and fresh.  Soda was good too haha.
author: Shawn M.

description:
This place did not disappoint! Simply put, my burger was juicy, moist, tender. It's probably one of the best counter burgers for this price range. 

The meat is just about twice as thick as in-out-out (but the price is twice as much or more so let's not compare). 

I had a mini burger and it was actually a perfectly normal size burger. It had fresh tomato, super thin sliced red onion, and all you can grab pickles AND pickled garlic cloves in a jar! The garlic was actually pretty yummy! 

The only star missing is for the fries and coke - they weren't fresh as they are suppose to be. But over all its a great fast lunch spot!
author: Cartman P.

description:
A mini burger combo with cheddar and garlic fries for $10.73. This meal was ridiculous.

Meat was juicy, greasy, and feels like it just dissolves in your mouth. The buns were fluffy and soft. It's unreal. Then you have the side of garlic fries: thick cut and dense with shredded parmesan and fresh garlic. 

It's a super carby, greasy and delicious meal that you'll need all your self control to make yourself stop. (That is, if you want to stop and be able to leave the table at a state of comfort)

Note: Lines were crazy at Market St location at 1pm on a Friday. Came here and got served immediately.
author: Joanna H.

description: I'm not sure what makes this place so great, close to gourmet burger prices but served like in and out. They do have wine and softserve ice cream...
author: Tiff W.

description:
Best cheeseburger I have ever devoured. You know they are serious when their mini burger is 1/4 pound. Don't try to add up the calories though. 

The black pepper spiced meat was cooked all the way through and was still sizzling before being put on a crisp yet fresh heavily sesame seeded bun. Great special sauce and many free toppings plus extras like avocado, bacon, mushrooms, and peppers. 

Delicious fries--regular and garlic. 

A swirled soft ice cream finished the amazing meal. 

Bonus:  disco music. Ha.
author: Shauna S.

description:
Went here because was seeing a movie at the Metreon at 9:20PM and everything else in area was closed at 8. Oh my god. Not a huge burger fan, but everything about this place ruled. The mini burger with everything and the free additional toppings was one of the best burgers I've ever had! And for $5! My dining companion got a chicken sandwich with garlic fries, and the garlic fries were so good I wish I had gotten my own order. And the pickles! I must've had 10 of their delicious homemade pickles! Just self serve sitting next to the condiments. 

Definition of hidden gem - delicious, fast and fresh. Will make a point to come here again. I live pretty close to the one on chestnut street, but that one only has a 3.5 star yelp review.. I wonder what the difference is. I will have to eat there and see for myself!
author: Sarah B.

description:
Loved this place. My friend and I came across it when we got hungry while shopping in Union Square. I loved the decor of the restaurant so I looked like a loser taking random pictures of everything to Instagram later. I didn't want something toooo greasy and heavy so I figured I might as well order a chicken sandwich. I was happily surprised when I found out they served grilled chicken and not fried chicken like most burger joints. The burger was delicious. Not to mention their homemade pickles.. I couldn't get enough. My friend got a super duper burger and garlic fries and she enjoyed them as well. 


My only complaints are about the size of the food for the price. Could be a little bigger or a little cheaper
author: Estelle C.

description: I don't get why this gets 4 stars... Nothing is good here. Is SF people really that deprived from in-n-out burger or what? Ordered a burger, taste like an upscale Burger King. Ordered garlic fries, taste like oil with garlic with a side of fries. I don't understand...
author: Nit A.

description: This was my second time eating Super Duper! I didn't like it a lot. I liked the first time better. The ketchup tasted like hot sauce. I wish the burger was better and the fries as well. Hopefully when I eat Super Duper again it'll be much better than the last time.
author: R C.

description: GREASEY GOOEY GORGEOUS GOOD GRACIOUS FUN.  Had the basic burger and mozzerella fries.  Holy cow.  Very busy but worth every calorie
author: joe j.

description:
I love burgers!!!!! This was no exception!  We also ordered the garlic fries and it was superrrr garlicky.

Their pickles have a watermelon jolly rancher aftertaste.  I swear!!!
author: Sarah L.

description: Oh wow... great burgers done JUST right and the garlic fries, well, just heavenly! We need a Super Duper in Holland!
author: Ron V.

description: One thing I love about California is the abundance of organic food establishments. Even their burger chains are organic and all natural. Which of course results in really tasty burgers. The burgers here are definitely one of the best chain burgers I've had. Better than bare burger in NY. And their shakes are awesome too!
author: Ryna D.

description: Damn good burger!  It's SF pricing, so beware: burger, fries and a beer will run you $20.  And there is no parking, you have to use the lot on Mission and 4th, or you might win the lottery and find street parking on 3rd.  So add $3 to the price of your meal to cover parking.  Other than those issues- it would be 5 stars.  Counter service is OK - line moves pretty fast, even with people who can't figure out what they want while still in line.  The burgers are top notch - big and juicy.  No need for the Super Duper burger - it's a double patty.  The single is fine.  Beer on tap and fresh pickles!
author: Ken P.

description: Super duper burgers are amazing but the service in this specific location is shitty. I ordered one drink and one of the girls behind the counter poured the drink then proceeded to  chit-chat with some dude with greased up hair for 5 minutes and then after that she still didn't give me my order...the other girl did who called me "Bernard"...I wasn't opposed to increased minimum wage for food service people but it goes to show that we really need to pay people just what they're due--if you can't read or if you have terrible customer service skills why pay you more?? Def gonna get my super duper fix elsewhere not in this location.
author: Berna V.

description:
Comparing this to the one in Market street, I like Market more.  Just like my previous stop at Super Duper in Market, I just ordered the garlic fries.  The garlic fries in Market had more of that rich, garlicy, good flavor.  I think they put less cheese and garlic in the Mission compared to Market or it's not as fresh.

 One good pro about the Mission Super Duper is that they have more than just pickles in the pickle jar and there's more outdoor seating.  The cons would be theres no second floor, the pickle jars aren't that big and it feels smaller than Market.  The price of garlic fries increased to 3.25 in the Mission and you will get charged the 10 cent bag fee if you get it to go.

Overall, Market is better than Mission for garlic fries.
author: Rob C.

description: Pretty good garlic fries and veggie burgers. They also serve Strauss ice cream which was very delicious. You order up front and seat your self. The place is usually crowded but we managed to find a seat.
author: George L.

description: I had a mini burger without cheese and the garlic fries.  Everything was delicious.  I Love that they serve organic free range chicken.  It was juicy, fresh and very good.  I wish we had a Super Duper burgers back home
author: Joann M.

description:
The best (delicious) burger bang for the buck! 

I believe the secret to their simple, delicious fast food concept is the Niman Ranch beef, organic soft serves and milkshakes, and free range poultry. Even their pickles and cookies are homemade and homebaked!

Pros:
Delicious, juicy, meaty, not-so-greasy burgers
Garlic fries
Thick, frosty milkshakes
Homemade pickles
Rustic Cookies

Cons:
Garlic (fries) breath might deter friendly conversations
author: Grace G.

description:
It's right at Yerba Buena Center.  It should be really good, right?  

Yes, mostly.  I showed up at about 1:30 pm.  The dining area was packed.  There were 5 people behind the counter and 4 people in the kitchen.  Pickles in jars on the condiment stand, mustard and ketchup with cups that sealed to go.  This was good. 

I ordered a Super Duper Burger, medium, with cheese and bacon to go, and that's what I got.  This might have been a 1/2-lb. burger, for $9.62 + tip.  It was huge.  And juicy. When I got back to the company break room, I could hardly hold it together to the last bite.  Well, the lettuce helped hold it together.   There was a little gristle in it, but not enough to turn me against it.  

I'd go back.
author: David D.

description:
This is one of the best places downtown to grab a juicy burger. I normally order the bacon cheeseburger and garlic fries. The burger is juicy and the bacon is hearty. The staff is always friendly and upbeat. 

The customer service there is great. One time they forgot to include the bacon in two of my burgers. I called them and told them the bacon was missing. They told me to bring the receipt back and ask for the manager on my next visit. They took care of me the next time that I went in. I was not expecting anything and hey did not have to go out of their way to do anything for me. They gave me two bacon burgers back! What great and unexpected service from them.

The pickles are awesome, so make sure to grab a few before you leave. The next time I go back, I am going to try the chocolate shake or soft serve cone. I am a big fan of his place.
author: Marty M.

description:
Double patty burger w/cheese 4/5
Fries 4/5
Garlic Fries (DON'T get these if you're going on a date!)

Wow, what a nice surprise. While these little patties look dry and well charred, this is one of the most juicy burgers I've had in recent memory.  On the surface, these burgers look similar to In-n-Out's, but it was night and day difference. Do wish the soda fountain selection could be better. How about more diet and non-caffeine options?  Get with the times people!
author: John H.

description:
Free fries with purchase of alcohol between 5p-7p daily.

I finally got a chance to try the burgers here.  Every time I've walked by a Super Duper the lines have been horrendous.  So today I went around 10:45am and was able to walk right up to the counter to place my order. You're given a pager.  Get your paper napkins and condiments and find a seat.  Seating street level and upstairs. 

My Order  = mini 4oz burger with cheese (extra $0.50.). I got my burger with everything on it, lettuce, tomato, red onion, and special sauce. Side order of fries for $2.00.  The burger was on a toasty sesame bun.

I especially enjoyed the fresh ground beef patty.  Perfectly grilled.  I'm not a huge fan of Bermuda onions, but this was thinly sliced. 

$7.50 inc tax.
author: Shirley N.

description: This burger restaurant is AMAZING. The meat is cooked well and gives you a taste-bud-tingling sensation as you bite into the burger. The service is wonderful-- the cashiers interact with you and brighten your day. The food is ready in no time, regardless of which "Rush time" it is. I will definitely be back here!
author: Jeanie P.

description:
When I first experienced Super Duper I was pretty happy, but over time I've come to lose enthusiasm for this place and all of the new breed of burger places that aim to replace fast food burger joints. These places are hella expensive if you compare them to McDonald's, but yeah we get it. It's a better burger. However, today after paying $28 for two burgers and one order of fries (and two requested water glasses that never materialized), I kind of came to the conclusion that I may be done with this business model. It's just not worth it. 

I think there are three things that these places have to do, and they have to do them all well each time you visit or the experience completely falls apart: food quality, customer service, and unique offerings. The quality is always pretty good here. Organic and everything. Service sometimes isn't, but usually it is. They have a solid cooking line, but it's still pretty crazy in there and mistakes can happen. Today, I went there and the gratis pickles were gone. A unique offering. Everyone asked, "Where are the pickles?" And the poor girl whose job it was to tell everyone said again and again, "The pickles taste like cucumbers because they're not done yet." Just tell everyone you ran out of pickles, and for god sakes pull those giant display jars of pickles down and put up a sign so every single person won't ask you about pickles until you want to quit this job. The pickles are the one thing I truly come here for, and I eat a lot of those delicious pickles. Frankly, I'd rather just buy a jar of the pickles and skip the burger. I know not everyone likes pickles, but it's an important unique offering. Just like their chicken sandwich for non-beef eaters (pretty tasty) and their salad for vegetarians and vegans (I assume it's good but haven't had it), the pickles are pretty important. Did I mention that I like pickles? I do. And these guys make really, really good pickles. Just typing out these words conjures up a Proustian moment in my mind. Only my madeleine is a pickle. With a lot of garlic and spice.  

A lot of chain restaurants have one or two gratis or unique things that make you smile. Remember La Boulange? It was great because they had all those cornichons (a pickle!) and jams and fancy spreads you could put on your bread and stuff. Chipotle has familiar hot sauces in bottles. And lemons. Taco Bell has a big grab bag of hot sauce packets and they don't give a !@#$ how many you take home. Five Guys = free peanuts. In N Out? Secret menu. From high-brow to low-down, all of the truly successful chains have experiential details that make them loved by their fans. But inevitably all of these new burger places have to scale, which means they have to slowly cut back on gratis stuff and unique offerings until you're begging them for a packet of ketchup at the counter after they've pushed you onto the exit ramp. Le sigh.  

In short: Where are the !@#$-ing pickles, bro?
author: Casey C.

description: I had the super duper with cheese and avocado cooked medium. I also tried the regular and garlic fries. All of the items were cooked perfectly and the burger was juicy. The chipotle sauce was a great add to the other condiments. The pickles were amazing just the right amount of sweetness!!
author: David M.

description:
Good burger, try their pickles!
Best burger I've had in my life. Its worth to go their even I live pretty far away
author: Hanh N.

description:
If you don't know where to eat and you spent hours at the museum come here for a tasty burger and fries!

They have a Happy Hour special too.

SWEET!  There's no extra charge for making your burger decked out, only if you want an egger or avocado you must pay extra for.

PICKLES. PICKLES. NOM NOM NOM. They have huge jars of pickles for everyone to take advantage of... I at least did, probably ate more pickles than fries! They have a sorta sweet taste to them which I usually don't prefer, but these were too crunchy, zesty, and mouth watering to pass up. 

Garlic fries with cheese- These were good, but next time i'll prob just get the regular ones.

Chocolate shake- for the size and taste this is worth getting!  

BEERS ON TAP!TAP!TAP!

You're better off getting the super duper burger (2patties) verse mini, but the mini is still decent size... Overall the burgers aren't as big as what I'm use to, but the meat is of higher quality than most too :()RGANIC 

THEY HAVE VEGGIE BURGERS!!!!!
author: Malisa D.

description:
TIP #1: The "mini" burger is a regular-sized burger. "Super" gets you a second patty.

TIP #2: The kids' size soft serve is more than enough, even for adults!

Super Duper has the beefiest-tasting burger in the Bay, and at a competitive price. Where else can you find a Niman Ranch burger for less than five bucks? (There's an option to order a portabello burger, too.) The patty is nice and juicy and *beefy*. The garlic fries are really garlicky too. They're big on being true to flavors.

I recommend ordering soft serve and eating it at Yerba Buena Park, which is on the same block. It's extra creamy, considering it's Straus, and extra milky, considering it's organic. I've yet to try their spiked milkshakes, but I'm looking forward to it.

Quality over quantity, in the form of burgers, fries, and soft serve.
author: A.L. H.

description: Best burger I have ever had! Seriously! My friend got the veggie burger, just as delicious.
author: Eliza W.

description: Stopped in for a late dinner. Got a mini burger since they were out of chicken and an order of fries. Burger was well cooked and delicious, and the fries were good as well. Bit packed and hard to come by a seat, but is expected on a Friday night. Would order some extra sauce with the burger next time.
author: Brad S.

description:
This place is alright. Kind of like an in and out but slightly different style. The meat is a step up in quality. 

Its still fast food though and taste as such. Priced right. Id eat here again, without too much excitement.
author: H K.

description: Went there for the first time and absolutely loved it! Great food and service. It was one of the best burgers I have ever had. I will definitely be gong back.
author: Tricia A.

description:
To eat here, you have to roll your sleeves or take off your coats and enjoy the burger.

You can eat as much as you want of their homemade pickles, a good accompaniment with the juicy burger. The menu is easy to comprehend and service is great. Expect a que out the door during lunch time and dinner.

No need for ketchup except for the potato fries.
author: Miel M.

description: Meh.   The locals seemed to love it.   I was less impressed.  Seemed like overpriced fast food
author: T F.

description: The burgers here are definitely in my top five list of best burgers in the bay. So good!! They have the best garlic fries too, covered in tons of garlic and Parmesan cheese. You'll have garlic breath for days. I love their homemade pickles too :)
author: Krizia M.

description: Very good burgers with a host of great topping options.  The shakes and malts are old school fantastic.  Expect to wait in line, though it's well above average so worth the wait.
author: Jason B.

description: Tried a mini burger and the garlic fries. Incredible!  The burger was absolutely perfect.  The bun was toasted and it tasted like a burger from home.  The garlic fries were also amazing too.  Service was quick,  and they give you a buzzer for when your order is ready.  There is also room upstairs with even more tables.  Terrific burger joint.
author: Travis I.

description: Industrial modern decor meets burger joint. Sort of a Chipotle meets In-n-Out, without the well scrubbed white employees, or the fresh cut fries. No white uniforms either.
author: Wanugee N.

description: We came from New Jersey to visit San Francisco and this place was on the top of our list! We stopped into this location and the staff was very friendly and welcoming. Since this was put first time there, the staff was patient and explained the menu options to us. This was probably the best burger I have ever had! The burger was cooked perfectly and the sauce and the roll were awesome! Also, a must-have item is the the garlic fries....these were incredible! If we ever make a trip back to San Francisco, this is the first place we are going to go! They need more locations....come to New Jersey, please!
author: Katie K.

description:
Great burgers! I was in SF for the day looking for a nice little burger place then I came across this place! To me, it's a hole in the wall which means it's burgers are either really good or really bad.

This place was very packed, so I figured it was good! I ordered a shake, fries and a burger. I was not to impressed buy the food, it was good - great, not superb. 

The shake was ok, for the price I payed I was hoping for the best shake in the world, fries were good, and the burger was good! Very greasy though.

I always use restrooms after eating to wash off my hands. When a place serves messy food, I expect the sinks to have good water pressure in order to clean up. This place failed to have good water pressure. Now, I'm just being picky, but if my hands are messy I have to clean then some how.

All in all, I still recommend dining here. It is good food that will not disappoint you.
author: Nicholas L.

description: Wow this place was fast, courteous, and tasty. I only ordered garlic fries to go; though the turn around was less than a minute. Place looked busy-- I want to try their super duper burger!
author: Alexander T.

description:
They ain't lyin'. It is both super and duper. We are talking garlic fries, here, people. We are talking cloudy lemonade made with brown sugar. We are talking mmm mmm chicken sandwich, and a nifty buzzer so you know when to collect your food, and some damn fine looking shakes.

Popping in here with some Yelp folks after a crayzay party tonight, I was delighted to find it was clean, spacious, and far from full up. The gentleman at the till who took my order was also extremely nice about the fact that I was really struggling to hear/understand him and that I needed to hear everything about three times. His patience was great.

This is a real step up from the typical fast food joint but it's still fast and it's still food, of the edible variety rather than of the "why did I do this to myself?" variety. Bravo.
author: Cressida F.

description: Good cheeseburgers, easy menu! I love their milkshakes!! They also serve beer, chicken sandwiches, and vegetarian burgers. Quick, easy, and tasty. This location is near a lot of great shops that are easily accessible by foot.
author: Belia P.

description: Best garlic fries we've ever has with parm cheese.  You can actually taste the freshness of the beef.  Very savory and flavorful.  The quality is excellent.  Quick service.  What more could you ask for from a burger joint.
author: Lori T.

description: Saw other reviews and didn't want to overpay for a burger at my hotel again.  Staff was very polite, service was quick, and the hamburger really was a great burger.  I also had a chocolate shake.  So many places, even restaurants, have shakes that taste...fake / funny / not quite that rich.  I was pleasantly surprised when their shake tasted like a truly good shake made from real ingredients.
author: John M.

description:
It's amazing how there's TWO of these within a 2 block radius.  

Burgers are good, shakes are good, and service is good.  

You will for a fact get a huge burger and I highly recommend adding the egg.  I think the fries are just okay, but it's still pretty good.  I'm fairly unimpressed with the sizing of the shakes.  For a large shake, it's a pretty small cup granted that it's a very good shake.  For that price, I think they should increase the volume and contents of the cup a little.  There's a decent amount of seating but when you come around during lunch or dinner hours, it may be a bit more challenging to grab a seat. Give yourself ample amount of time to place your order as you may need to wait a little.   Price can get fairly up there if you choose to purchase a lot of add ons on your burger, sides, or a beverage.  Definitely worth a try!
author: Bernie C.

description: Had their super burger with portabello mushroom, very day-lee-cious! They sliced the portabello into thin slices and placed them between the patties which was awesome cuz I got to taste the mushroom in every single bite. The buns are nice and crispy. Beef patties are very juicy, very tender. Their Garlic fries are DA BOMB! Boo and I love it so much we fought for the last piece of garlic on the plate, which clearly I won! lol We also got their strawberry shakes which is very smooth, very creamy and cool for the summer time. Great location compared to the other ones close to Montgomery. A little bit more classy location perfect for a quick lunch and their happy hours are great too! Will def come back when I'm in the area!
author: Alisa H.

description:
EXCELLENT inexpensive burger joint just steps from home.  

Love - burger with cheese, garlic fries & chocolate shake.  YUM!
author: Kate G.

description:
This place is freaking incredible.  Why was I not told of this joint before?  Went yesterday with two work buddies.  The place was very crowded but a little sign told us our wait time to order was 5-8 minutes from that point and it was exactly 6:29 so don't let the crowd fool you if you go.

I had the standard Supder Duper burger with cheese and everything on it and that sucker was phenomenal.  Make sure you get extra napkins because the cheese and the Super Duper sauce gets all over you.
author: Jonathan A.

description: May look small for its size but it's great in flavor and value.The super burger prepared medium with cheese for the win. The home made pickles were also a nice touch. The lemonade is not so good, and at $3.26 it left a bad taste in my mouth. But overall a good place.
author: Paul S.

description:
Good location! Great customer service. Burgers are delicious! Be careful tho, they can get greasy and messy. I ruined a pair of pants when I wasn't paying attention to the amount of grease that drips out of the burgers. 

My last visit I saw burgers with a fried egg on top, that's what I'm getting next time! 

I recommend for tasty burgers!
author: Justin C.

description:
Free fries with a drink during happy hour!! WOOHOOO!

LOVE those oily fries and the burger was pretty decent! I liked it how the portion fits a normal human being not the oversized portions in other restaurants.
author: Shirley F.

description: Really good burgers! Love that you can add avocado and jalapeños and that you can choose a smaller size. Wish the fries were of the skinny sort, but that's a minor detail.
author: Sharon Y.

description:
FINALLY had Super Duper last night! To me, fast food is lazy/convenient food, so if it's not on my way, I typically won't get it. However, after getting home from a weekend trip and realizing I didn't have much food in the fridge, I decided it was the perfect opportunity to try this place.

Service: At about 8:15pm on a Sunday night, there was a pretty good crowd inside and a slight line at the register. I didn't have to wait more than a few minutes before ordering. After I placed my order, I waited probably about 5 minutes or less and my food was all ready to go!

Food: I ordered a mini burger with bacon (if you're going to do it, go all out, right?) and garlic fries (when there's the option, regular fries never cut it). I'll admit, in an IN 'N OUT vs. Five Guys burger rally, I'd be rooting for team IN 'N OUT. So, there should be no surprise when I compared this burger to IN 'N OUT with each bite. The bun was solid. It was soft and held it's own when faced with potential sogginess from the juicy burger and special sauce. Heck, it even had sesame seeds. The lettuce was also good -- nice and fresh. I ordered my burger with everything, including jalapeño peppers, grilled onions, and pickles. They offer everything, but they're not very generous with their toppings. I think I only got one bite of each throughout my burger. The super sauce is okay. It adds a little something to the burger, but it isn't overbearing. The burger itself was juicy and you could taste the quality of the meat. The mini 4 oz burger was perfect for me, leaving me enough room for my garlic fries, but also still satisfied with my burger experience. The garlic fries were also topped with aged cheddar. Typically the addition of garlic adds some oil to the fries, so it made them slightly more soggy, especially towards the end. However, they were pretty good. There wasn't much of a garlic flavor to them (but I might be spoiled by the ones at AT&T Park). A good dip in the ketchup and I was a happy camper.

Restaurant: There's plenty of seating around (upstairs and downstairs). The line moves efficiently. There's a self serve soda fountain, pumps for your ketchup and mustard, plastic to-go containers, and tiny troughs for those taking the dip to eat-in.

Cost: My order came out to be $9.75(?) Definitely on the pricey side, but I think I paid near that for an IN 'N OUT single burger and Animal Style fries. 

I might come back, but there's more burger places in the city I still need to try!
author: Leana L.

description:
They changed something critical- The Grass Fed Beef that so many people love and have yelped about. 

When I went in for my burger I noticed the menu now stated "All our beef is humanely-raised, 100% vegetarian-fed and ground fresh daily." Vegetarian-fed, well that's cool you're not feeding your beef other animals but that isn't a unique quality since McDonald's says the same thing. 

We loved Grass Fed because it has health and environmental upsides to corn fed (which is basically what it is). I asked the server who called over the manager and they assured me it was still Grass Fed. Listen in this day and age if you're using a premium product you're going to advertise it as such not some shady-vegetarian-fed line. I did contact them through the website for calcification but didn't hear back. 

They make a tasty burger but but don't be fooled by their history and the previous reviews.
author: Andrew C.

description:
I enjoyed my meal so much more than I thought I would, that I had to post a review.

This place was close to my hotel. I was traveling for business and after a particularly long night, I wanted something quick but not a chain, as I had been really enjoying all of my meals in SF thus far. Not that I don't love McMeals, but I digress.. Most places were closed but this was still opened so I figured, what the heck. 

SO glad I tried it. I got their small, 4oz burger with a side of garlic & parmesan fries and the trio of dips. It was amazing. For those of you who have had Burger's Priest in Toronto, it tasted similar to that, with the onion-y beef patty, soft, white bun, and heaps of toppings. My only complaint is that the side of fries was pretty small, compared to what every other place gives you, but I think this was actually a good, healthy size. They were just so good that I wanted more!!! I used the trio of dips for the fries, and the burger, and loved them!

Also, they are quite greasy (like Burger's Priest), but they do a good job of wrapping it up so the mess was minimal.
author: H D.

description:
TWO WORDS: HOMEMADE PICKLES.

I came here with my friends on Saturday evening, as we tried to find a quick bite to eat before heading on back to my place. I grabbed myself a normal burger (1 patty) with bacon, onions, lettuce, and tomatoes. Burger was okay. PROTIP: Get a beer between 5-7 PM, and you get free fries.

My friends had ordered the garlic fries, which I was indifferent about. It was good, but I could've done without.

However, HOMEMADE PICKLES. Man, I could've just sat there and ate all the pickles. ALL THE PICKLES. I think next time I go, I'm going to see if I can buy a jar of them.
author: Joanne W.

description: Great location right off of market and next to target. I usually go eat first and then do some shopping. Their burgers are a greasy delicious mess and their milkshakes (cookies &a cream) are to die for. Oh and don't forget their staff...so fun and friendly people.
author: Tré S.

description:
I can't help but be mildly concerned for those who believe Super Duper to have the best burger in town. 

Yes, their ambiance and service surpass that of your average burger joint however,  I really could have done without all of those extra ounces of grease . 

There are other sando/burger places in the area that make a much better patty and serve it up sans a plateful of drippings. 

Unfortunately, I've tried Super Duper more than once and my conclusion is this: why eat something that doesn't actually taste good and that (most likely) isn't very good for you?
author: Liz W.

description:
Fast service. I like it how the restaurant gives timers to individuals so one knows exactly when the burger is ready as it rings. 
I m not a fan of the sweet pickles. The burgers are super yummy and juicy. Lots of options to add jalapenios, mushrooms, etc. 
All you can drink refillable soda fountain - me like. :) overall - a clean fast place to grab quality fast food.
author: Zita M.

description:
If you are craving a burger then go here.  They have good burgers, plenty of toppings, and all at a reasonable price.  Definitely go here over most other establishments when I am craving a burger and fries.

Also, don't miss their specially made pickles.
author: Dan C.

description:
One of the best burgers I've ever had, and the person with me was drooling throughout his meal as well. The garlic fries were the single greatest order I've ever made - they weren't greasy, they had cheese on them, and you didn't leave with a strong garlic aftertaste.

Prices are worth it, but perhaps not for the dipped ice cream cone. Otherwise, I'm a huge fan and will search far and wide for any new locations.
author: Elizabeth O.

description: Probably my favorite place to get a fast quick no hassle burger. It reminds me a bit like In-N-Out because the burgers are fresh and not complicated, or can be if you like that kind of thing. I also enjoy snacking on their homemade pickles with mustard while I wait for my burger. The garlic fries are so good, once you pop you can't stop. I've had the garden burger which is really good, I don't eat them anywhere else but here. The chicken burger is also very delicious and big. I usually to get a beef burger but I've tried my husbands and it's also very tasty. Juicy good clean burgers! Salads are decent but nothing to rave about. The service is always good, like INO.
author: Annette S.

description: I love this place for their burgers and fires. The hamburgers are good, no fuss. A meal here is only a few bucks more than fast food joint and far superior.
author: Kristan B.

description: garlic fries and great, lemonade is sour but hits the spot. got there for lunch before the crowd (the line heads out the door). but had a double patty hamburger w/bacon, sooo good. cant say anything else but the place is good, would like the head back if im in the area and im hungry for a burger
author: Debby D.

description: I ordered a burger with cheese but I doubted they actually put it in. When I asked their staff, it was like I was asking something outrageous. One star because of the service.
author: Han Y.

description:
I stopped in with one of my favorite foodie friends in hopes of getting a really good burger. We were not disappointed.

I got a super burger with cheese and an egg, garlic fries, and a chocolate malt. My wallet winced a little bit.

The food actually came out really quickly, and I was drooling as I carried it back to my seat. Immediately, I dug in.

The burger was perfectly cooked, the egg was awesome, and the cheese was delicious. There was literally nothing wrong with my burgers. Amazing. And the garlic fries had a ton of garlic, the cheese was melted over it, and the fries weren't too thick, which I adore. The chocolate malt was perfect as well.

There is nothing wrong with Super Duper. Except for the price when you start adding on, but it is worth every single penny.
author: Christina S.

description: This place is DOPE! Being from the east coast, it's legitimately hard to come across a freakin awesome burger joint. Super Duper they are not. Got the Super Burger, garlic fried, and chocolate shake, had to go all out. #foodporn at its best. Must go and must try.
author: AJ L.

description: super dupes burgers not as good as in n out burgers but definitely take second place. i get em with an egg inside and it is dripping w yolk into my tummy. i get oreo shake and normally this is late at night so it tastes real good mhm
author: Jay S.

description:
The Burgers here are soooo tasty. 

I don't know why I always forget this, garlic makes your breathe stink.

Do not encourage girlfriends to eat garlic friends if she's going to sleep over.
author: Song Z.

description:
Waited in line on a Tuesday afternoon, but it was worth it. Nice sit down fast food joint, good music, all natural ingredients, and unlimited soda fountain. Mmmmm Diet Coke.
I had a Chicken sandwich on Ciabatta with added bacon and pepperjack cheese. Additioanlly, I tried the Garlic cheddar fries as they were frequently quoted on the most lovely Yelp. The chicken burger was really good - mix of chicken, cheese, thick bacon, and sauce was great. The fries were fine - I like 'em crispy and since these were covered in garlic and cheese, they were not crispy. That said, everything covered in garlic and cheese is good. Though I was actually surprised by how little garlic and cheese they used.
I'd go back
author: Corey L.

description: Pretty bomb burgers and fries, even the veggie burgers are hella good. The garlic fries are pretty tasty as well but hella oily
author: Aaron D.

description: My first time going to any Super Duper Burger location and it delivered on a lot of different levels. This location was in great location to Moscone West and the food here is on a whole different level what you can find in the Metreon food court across the street from the Moscone West center. A mini burger, couple of pickles (yes they're free), and a side of garlic fries is all you need. You have got to be hungry to get one of the larger burgers in my opinion if you're going to do a side of garlic fries. The mini burger was cooked to a nice medium with some pinkness in the middle. The milkshake was ok but nothing to rave about and a bit too sweet. I actually enjoyed Super Duper so much I actually came back twice in the same day!
author: Albie F.

description:
Dont understand why this will get a rating lower than five stars.

Everything here is great. Best garlic fries, juicy tasty burgers. Excellent value for money!

Milkshake and soft serve ice cream are alright.
author: Chino L.

description: Late lunch-doesn't seem that high quality to me.  Fries are a bit doughy.  Nothing special.
author: R G.

description: Super Duper Burger rocks. This is as good as it gets. Just remember to order extra of everything. This is USA delivering at the top of what is possible. The beer was Amazing and the french fries are almost worth to kill for. The only bad part I can say about it is that I guess it's not the most healthy choice you can make. So don't forget to burn your calories cause it's so worth it.
author: Magnus B.

description: I was not impressed with the taste of burger due to high expectations and hype. I had better burgers from dozens of places in San Francisco alone. It is not in my Top 10 of burgers. The restaurant lay out  was not too comfortable either.Maybe I need to try this place a 5th time.
author: Juan V.

description: Great customer service and great food. It's 9:30 PM and this place is PACKED. I didn't think it would be good at first, or at least not really good, because I thought it would be just a regular burger joint, but boy, was I wrong. Their garlic fries and pickles are ON POINT. Their burgers are delicious too. Hope to come here more often. :)
author: Vicky L.

description:
NOMS!  A foodie friend spoke highly of the burgers here and she wasn't kidding.  The pair of patties were mad juicy and the side of delicious house-made pickles provided great acid to cut the fatty awesome.  Not that there's anything wrong with fatty awesome.

Admittedly though, the star of the meal turned out to be my vanilla choco-dipped soft serve cone.  My goodness that chocolate and Strauss organic soft serve were addicting.  Inhaled.
