Easily one of the best non-gourmet burgers I've had the pleasure of tasting.  Better than In-N-Out (for the premium you pay, it should be!), on par with Shake Shake and just a shade beneath Trueburger in terms of sheer ingredient quality and seasoning.
author: Eric F.

description:
Mmmmm.... how I love burgers!
In my opinion, there are three tiers of burger places in the city.
Tier 1:  Burger King / In & Out (In & Out being better of course!)
Tier 2:  Super Duper Burgers
Tier 3:  Roam (AMAZING burgers)
Roam is my favorite burger place in the city - gourmet burgers and great options, but you pay for it!! Maybe... $25 or so per person! Burger King and In & Out you can get something for around $5-7
Meet Super Duper Burgers!
I think they have a great happy medium of amazing burgers and a good price!  You'll pay around $15 for your meal and get some great choices like adding bacon or egg to your burger (I usually do both!)
They have a nice brown sugar lemonade, some shake options, and I love the fries!  They serve alcohol too!
Minus 1 star for the food being greasy, but.. it's a burger place so... what would you expect!
author: Jordan M.

description:
How could one resist fatty burgers? (Okay, maybe if you're a vegetarian)

Super duper is one those greasy burger joints that satisfies your food needs when you're in a rush and feel like getting fat. Their burgers, garlic fries, and shakes are pretty good, comes at the speed of any fast food place, but at much higher quality. Although it's usually full of people, the line moves really quickly and, most of the time, you can be in and out in a jiffy. 

The place is pretty clean and well decorated. It's got that modern-ish look befitting of SOMA.
author: Don L.

description:
(In my best Samuel Jackson voice)
Hmm! This IS a tasty burger!

I needed a burger tonight, and I wanted to find something new. A few Yelp searches & I stumbled on Super Duper Burger. Now as a rule of thumb, I am wary of anything calling itself "super duper," because it is often neither super, nor duper. However, pictures & descriptions looked good, so I gave it a shot.

They grind the meat fresh at the restaurant daily, and it really does make a difference you can taste. Garlic fries had some cheese on top, very good. They make their own pickles - the waiter explained it takes a day to make them. I liked these a lot. You can buy a jar of pickles for $20, and if you bring the jar back you get $10 back. Those are really good.

The Oreo cookie malt was very good, with a healthy spoonful of malt right on the top. Needs a maraschino cherry on top tho.

It's amazing how reasonable all their prices sound, until you place the order for what you actually wanted. Before you know it, you're close to $20. But is it worth it? I have to say, this is one of the best burgers I've had anywhere. It's worth it.

- Adam
author: Adam M.

description:
I've been to this location a few times and the food is always good and the employees very friendly and welcoming. 

This is the best place for a burger in the area and although this chain has grown substantially over the past few years the food quality is always spot on. 

Even if you don't like pickles like me try one, there really good.
author: Justin S.

description: I checked out the Super Duper Burgers location on Mission Street after it was recommended to me by a friend who lives in San Francisco. I got the Super Burger with cheese, and added tomato, lettuce, and onions. No fries, no drink. The only thing I didn't like was that the guy ringing me out at the cashier kept trying to sell me on the fries or a drink, after I had already told him I wanted just the hamburger. I get that they're trying to make money, but if the customer says that's all they want, then that's all they want. Although more pricey than your average burger, this was delicious! Dripping with cheese and grease and tasty goodness. The best part about Super Duper Burgers is the free, all you can eat pickles. With three locations across the city, you definitely have to check out Super Duper Burgers.
author: Matt P.

description:
I am a sucker for aesthetics. I can definitely appreciate the modern, industrial design of Super Duper. From the colorful waxed paper, metal trays, and homey bar tables - I was diggin' the interior design. 

The food was good, not great.
The excess oil in both the burger and the fries was really apparent from the second I touched the food...it was all over my hands.  The burger was not memorable for me, but I did enjoy the fries. Tons of garlic and Parmesan cheese. 

They also have a neat HAPPY HOUR deal. If you buy a beer, you're fries are free. Had decent beers on tap for 4$. 

Take advantage of the jalapeno & grilled onion toppings - these are complementary but you need to ask for them.
author: Nina M.

description:
This may not be an In-N-Out, but that's a good thing! The Super Burger is starting to climb up on my list of favorite burgers. The Super Burger comes with two freshly grilled ground beef patties, lettuce, tomatoes, red onions, and the special Super Sauce. There are options to add other toppings such as cheese, jalepenos, and grilled onions. Their homemade pickles are also conveniently available at their condiment area, which I highly recommend to eat with your burger. Beware though...it can be messy!

I also had an order of the garlic fries and I have to say that they are the best garlic fries I have ever tried. The well-cooked fries are topped with plenty of garlic goodness and lots of 6 month aged cheddar. Don't miss out on them!
author: Jason A.

description: I really like this new burger bar addition to the Metreon.  They have great fresh tasting burgers from Niman Ranch beef.   The mini burger combo with fries is not mini and is all you need and you can dress it up how you like including slaping an egg on it.  Upgrade your combo from a soda to a beer or shake, and you will have a nice smile on your face.  They have Racer 5 IPA.... score !!!!
author: Dan M.

description:
Truly heaven for your taste buds! My boyfriend and I usually go to the one on Market Street but it's a bit small and seating can be hard to come by. When we met up with friends this past weekend, they took us to this location and there were plenty of open seats both upstairs and downstairs. 

There were about four people in line in front of us, but the wait was very short (under two minutes). Our cashier was super friendly and quick to take our order. 

My boyfriend and I each ordered garlic fries and burgers. After seeing photos on Yelp showing burgers with a sunny side up egg on top, I knew I had to try it. Not surprisingly, it's REALLY messy to eat but also completely delicious, especially with bacon. Add the garlic fries and a lemonade, and your taste buds will do the happy dance!

The next time we're in the city, we'll definitely be going to this location instead of the one on Market. Equally yummy food but more seating, and it's just a coupe of blocks away.
author: Lisa B.

description:
The cashier people were so nice and kind. It was my first time ordering here and the people at the register helped me pick out a great meal. The service was quick and the cookies are only a dollar. I got a vegetarian burger that was really good. 

This place is great for quick and easy dinner.
author: Julia Q.

description:
In town for a conference, a group of us went to grab a late night bite and a brew. The line moved relatively fast and the prices were shockingly reasonable. One of my chief complaints when going to fast food burger joints are that they will not cook your burger the way you want and me being a rare to medium rare girl, I usually end up with a hard overcooked dried piece of meat between a bun.  Not this place! You want it rare to medium rare you can get it that way. Nice and juicy! It isn't a fancy place but it is a reasonably priced meal that is hard to find in this town. On a side note my order was not correct and when I mentioned this they fixed it immediately and gave me free fries. Great servers and customer service at this place.

It was so good I went back the next morning for breakfast. Got the egg with cheese and sausage organic muffin and it was pretty tasty. They don't have a bunch of condiments which I would have liked to have, but the flavor overall was still good.  Wish they had one of these in SoCal where I live. Not quite as tasty as In-n-Out but wayyyyy better than Five Guys.

The one downside is they do not have Wi-Fi here, but it did give me a chance to just sit back enjoy my meal and not feel tied to my phone or iPad.
author: Leilani O.

description:
Great burgers and garlic fries are delish!
I got a mini burger with garlic fries and a beer and I was beyond full. I also opted for the grilled onions and jalapeños which really added just the right amount if kick. Kid friendly and near shopping and Metreon.  Great place for a quick filling bite.
author: Anthony L.

description:
The burgers don't seem big but they WILL fill you up. I ordered the super duper combo for $10.50 that comes with a burger (you can add whatever you want inside with additional charges), French fries, and a drink. I'd say it's pretty worth it but not for the price. 

In my opinion, it tastes a lot like In N Out. For the same exact thing at In N out, it is exactly half the price. 

I would definitely come back but for the price, I'm not sure. But overall, the place has a very chill vibe and good food :)
author: Vernice T.

description:
I love this place. I really do. I try to stop by every time I'm in the area because it's just my absolute favorite spot... for a chicken sandwich. Yeah, yeah, I know, it's called Super Duper BURGER, but I'm seriously partial to it (and I'm known in my family as the annoying kid who will demand to know where the red meat is if it's not clearly visible in huge chunks of steak type form on the dinner table). 

There's just something perfect about their combination of char-grilled chicken, light amounts of salad greens, chipotle aioli sauce, fried egg, and ciabatta bun. The sauce and egg are add-ons with a cost of something like $.50 and $1.50, but they're definitely worth if if you enjoy mouthwatering sauce with a kick that will return to you in your dreams and prematurely murdered spawn of chicken. Just kidding, I'm sorry for saying that. But seriously, the combination is just amazing, and if you're into chicken sandwiches, get it.

Their garlic fries are also to die for. I typically get a cookies 'n cream milkshake on the side too, but their double chocolate and chocolate strawberry flavors are great as well. My sister likes getting the ice cream cone dipped in chocolate, which is pretty standard.

One note - be prepared to walk out of there with a major food baby and a complete lack of desire to move or consume anything else in the near future. My friend and I recently went, and we forced ourselves to walk in circles around Union Square and then all the way to City Hall, at which point we only felt slightly better. I still couldn't eat breakfast or lunch the next day though.
author: Emily H.

description: Super Duper Burgers makes one of the best Veggie burgers in San Francisco - and their fries are awesome as well. I can't decide which one is best though - theirs or Pearls Burger... hm..
author: Marie V.

description:
Last night was my second visit to Super Duper. Their Super Burger was very good and fairly priced. My favorite part was their brioche bun. It didn't taste like the cheap hamburger buns that you find in grocery stores. The reason why I am giving it a 3 star because they did not offer enough flexibility. My boyfriend is vegetarian and a single patty Veggie Burger is very small. We tried asking if they could make a Super Veggie Burger by simply adding another patty (of course not for free), but the answer was no. This is not a very complex request. This is not a deal breaker for visiting again, but certainly disappointed.

Also, we got the Veggie Burger with cheese, but they forgot the cheese. By the time we realized that the cheese was missing, only a quarter of the burger was left, so we didn't bother.
author: Victoria T.

description: A name like Super Duper Burgers would set up a business for a fall if the burgers were less than super. I came here on a busy Friday night in search of a quick meal. I ordered the regular hamburger with fries which was less than $10. I was really impressed with the quality of the meat which can be lost in a big chain of restaurants. I'll definitely try and come back here.
author: Matt B.

description: I have to admit, these burgers are pretty damn delicious for a chain restaurant. I've had burgers ranging from $7-$20, yeah no kidding, and for the price, I think it's comparable to higher end burgers like hog n rocks mission bowling. And they whip em out super quick, bonus of a chain line. They're smaller than your average high end burger but tasty all the same. Do it, get one.
author: Elton F.

description: Gotta be one of my favorite burgers!  Gotta go super,  get the pickles,  indulge and enjoy! Love it
author: Alvin P.

description: Passing through and thought I'd try this place since Yelp had some good reviews. The thought of a good burger and garlic fries really had my taste buds going.  I tried the fries first and was a bit disappointed.  I don't see the hype for these.  If these are the best, this city is missing out. They weren't bad, but not even close to the best I've ever had. I added cheese and bacon to my super and it was pretty good, but very greasy.  I was eating it down and had about two bits left and found a long black hair in the burger...that was the end for me. On my way out, I let the manager know and she attempted to give me a gift card to fix the issue, but since I was just passing through I told her no thanks.  Without the hair part, I'd probably only go back if someone really wanted to go there. If that was the case, I'd order the super again, but no way on the fries.
author: Randy S.

description: Greasy goodness, always chipper staff, get the fries extra crispy!
author: Doug M.

description:
I was told this place can rival In N Out Burgers - so I came here for a second dinner (you read it right) and it did not disappoint.

Considering most people can get sick thinking about second dinner (I had limited time in SF to try things), I ordered a mini burger loaded with avocado, fried eggs, and toppings.  The damage came out to be about $9+tax, and it was fairly filling and tasty.  

It's not quite fast food, as you don't get your food out until a few minutes later (there could be a wait), but certainly it's decorated that way.  I didn't try the fries (come on! second dinner already!) but I see many patrons ordered them.  

Overall it's worth to try it once, as long as you don't compare it to a real restaurant gourmet burger, but more of a fancy BK/Wendy's burger.
author: Sam L.

description: Delicious, quick and so satisfying. The garlic fries are awesome, definitely recommend them!!
author: Alexis N.

description:
Double Burgers
Garlic fries 
It was 7:00 pm but we all got so sleepy midway!  We ended up laying down on the benches. (See uploaded photo) 
Groups of four all super satisfied with the food. 

The slogan should be:

"Burgers so good they knock you out!"
author: Taste F.

description:
After posting my review about my recent experience at Super Duper (read below), I actually received a message from the manager thanking me for my review. I mean, I don't think my review added that much value to its overall rating/reputation since there are so many other reviews commenting on their strengths (at all their locations)... but it really shows how much management values its customers and truly devotes its time to satisfy its customers. Yelp is like an instant source of feedback, and I'm really glad that some restaurants utilize this as a way to keep improving.

Good job, Super Duper! See you soon! :)
author: Michelle L.

description:
Super duper burger (double pattie) with everything. 4 yelp burgers not as large as Five guys.
Fries 3 yelp small portions
Not as good as Five guys but better than Mickie D.
It gets busy so beat the rush and go just before lunch or dinner.
author: Ed D.

description: Burgers are cooked to perfection with a flavor and taste that is unforgettable! Fries are crispy but soft inside & the garlic fries toppings are delicious! Chocolate shake is smooth and creamy. Organic pickles that you can help yourself to are crunchy and the perfect accompaniment to an awesome burger. Best. Burger. Ever.
author: Roxanne W.

description:
What a fantastic burger. Had the mini burger combo with everything on it. Delicious. Pickles were great and love the fact you can order a kid size milkshake. Will definitely visit this place when in town again. 

Don't be afraid of the line when you arrive. It goes very fast. Seating is somewhat limited but people are courteous and don't linger around once they finish eating.
author: Wendy S.

description: Super Duper is like the west coast Shake Shack. Meaning, it's fast food without being too much like a McDonalds or Burger King. It's trendy and hip enough, but is still economical. Burgers here are solid and tasty, but not gourmet nor are they at gourmet prices. I'm a fan. It's like a happy medium, which is why they've become so popular and expanding its locations. This one attached to the Metreon and is as roomy as the location on Market in Downtown. It has two floors. I think this location takes some of the load off of the Market location. Overall, it's a solid place to get a relatively fast lunch or dinner that is not overpriced, which is especially convienent when trying to make it to a movie on time.
author: Jennifer W.

description: burgers are no doubt good along with fries and there homemade pickles plus staff is cool. All they miss is better ambience... too noisy at times.
author: Nikhil M.

description: I know this is just super duper but it's my favorite guilty pleasure joint. The garlic fries and burger are overly greasy but oh so delicious. The staff is always super nice. I like that this location is next to the metreon as we often run by here before catching a movie. Or eat it in the movie. Whatever.
author: Dani T.

description: Disgusting. Left after a few hopeful bites. Knew they would do a lettuce wrap instead of bread, looked forward to a burger.  The guy at the counter couldn't answer my questions about what kind of beef it was (I asked if it was Angus and he said it was beef) and he didn't know if the veggie burger was gluten free (it's not, his manager confirmed). What I got was a very fatty, tasteless, greasy burger with a bit of chewy gristle. Regular fries were tasteless and bland. I felt queasy and left.
author: FoodGirl G.

description:
I had the mini burger with everything on top with cheese and garlic fries. THe burger is small, but it's fulling. The garlic fries are soggy and not that great and is really greasy. I think I still like In n Out burger more. The fries are just more crisp and fresh. The burger also taste better. Though super duper burger is ok in terms of the size of the patty. I didn't get the pickle or whatever because I thought it came in my bag. No napkins? Blah, whatever, I had it to go, and figure they would include it in there, but nope! 

Took awhile to get the food, maybe I'll try the shake or soft serve, but I don't see what the rave about this burger joint is all about....I had better burgers seriously..
author: Minerva L.

description: Good, fast, cheap. I wouldn't say the burgers were made with love, but not a bad place to grab a burger and beer on the cheap.
author: Ben H.

description:
Not a bad place to get burgers. They're not the best, but they're better than most fast food places. The burgers are kind of expensive for the amount you get, but the quality is good.
You have to pay for cheese, but there's unlimited pickles.
You can check the menu on the website.
The place gets pretty crowded around 11-2. Seating is hard to get, but the service is quick. 
Super Duper is a 3.5/5.
author: M P.

description: There is another Super Duper on Market street not very far, but we like this Super Duper as it is a bit more mellow, less crazed and crowded.  Like it.
author: Maile N.

description: These burgers are simple and delicious. Extremely juicy and tender as if it melts in your mouth. The fries are very crispy but soft on the inside, exactly what you'd want in a fry. Laid back atmosphere adds to the great food. If I came back to San Fransisco and was in the area and wanted a casual meal, I'd definitely head here.
author: Alex M.

description:
I will just say WOW! Coming from a city like Chicago where the burgers a delicacy, Super Duper definitely is up there in the ranks! Sure the food was greasy, but hats what makes it good. I still have a grease stain on the sleeve of my jacket that I can't seem to get out! Totally worth get.

Upgrade your combo to the garlic fries. Simply a can't-miss.
author: Tim H.

description: Super yummy burgers, better than In and Out. Good portions. Awesome staff, very helpful. The organic ice cream is soo good!
author: Liv G.

description:
Oh man was that a good burger! Nice and juicy and love the sauce. 

I also love the awesome packaging! 

The employees are pretty awesome too!
author: Mimi P.

description: The prices are pretty good for what you get but not the best burger not the worse. The ice cream cone is a good treat and the kids size is pretty big!
author: Elmira Z.

description:
About two months ago, I left a bag here. The first time I called, whoever answered immediately told me they hadn't found anything. I figured they might be too busy to check, so I called back a few hours later and someone much more attentive said that yes, they had indeed found a bag the night before. After picking it up I realized my wallet was missing, so I called again AND went in person to ask if it might've fallen out and was still in their office. Both times they said no, so I cancelled my cards and went to the DMV.

Two months later, the receptionist at my work tells me Super Duper left a message saying they've had my wallet for a while if I wanted to pick it up.

Three stars because I realize they're running a restaurant and not a lost and found service. The food is good, but come on.
author: tianyu l.

description: Very friendly staff at this location. I highly recommend ordering their garlic fries... they are the best!!
author: Kevin S.

description:
This Super Duper is super crowded. It's also the biggest of the locations I've been to. 

I love the super burger. The patties are perfect. Medium rare and juicy, seared and crispy on the outside. My mouth is watering. I'm a fan of their homemade pickles, which are pretty mild as pickles go (so don't expect a mouth puckering experience). I would prefer American cheese to cheddar though, but that is literally not even a big deal. 

This location has the crispiest fries. I've been disappointed at some of the other spots,  but here I basically inhaled these delicious little crunchy potato friends. Also had the spiked milkshake for the first time. It was not very spiked. It tasted like a milkshake. There is no loss there. 

I like that for efficiency's sake at lunch time, they have a combo posted. Smarties. 

Card as well as cash.
author: Dorothy Y.

description: This place is truly a gem. Staff was Very pleasant. For being a "fast-food" restaurant the facility was very clean. I had the chicken sandwich and fries. The chicken is organic free range which is pretty important to me. My husband had the mini burger and fries. All of our food was prepared quickly and was delicious. The chipotle sauce on the sandwiches is great!
author: Amina F.

description: The burgers were amazing and the garlic fries were top shelf. The garlic with the cheese added to it put in a whole different level. Then the cookies and cream milkshake was one of the best I've ever had. I highly recommend this place
author: Brandon S.

description:
Super super place! Got the garlic fries and chocolate shake also. Fries are tasty and not too garlicky. The shake was also not too overpowering. 

Service is fast and they have a great combo for $8.50 which is fires drink and a burger. If you just want a snack go with the mini burger. It's 4oz if goodness!
author: Darryl S.

description:
This place has become the standard where I measure a good burger!!!  THAT says a lot about this burger!!!  Yes, it's *THAT* good!!!  Juicy, lots of good fresh beef with grilled onion flavor!!!  NO CHEESE!!!  It stands up on its own in flavor!!!  :)  

Super Sauce is definitely better than ketchup for dipping the fries!!!  And there is a jar of pickles for snacking while you wait for your burger to be done.

Thank you, Super Duper for saving my Foodie rep when I had to take an out of town visitor and she trusts me to pick a good place.  I'm glad I steered her here instead of the place I originally was gonna take her.  She was in burger heaven too!!!
author: Joanna R.

description: I'm beginning to believe that my first one or two visits here were flukes. I have recently been much more impressed with the quality and taste of the burgers here. The garlic fries are also just amazing. In my mind, it easily ranks as the best fast food burger joint in the U.S., and in my top ten for best in general.
author: Michael H.

description: This was a tasty burger.  Among the better ones I have had in the bay area.  I also got the garlic fries and a shake.  All of which were absolutely excellent.  If I'm in the area I won't hesitate to stop there again.
author: Corey S.

description:
Not the best burger or fries I've had, but did a good job hitting the burger craving spot.  Ordered two minis with cheese, bacon, 1 beer, 1 fries.  $21.xx

There wasn't anything that stuck out as out of this world or unique, but was definitely a good burger, quick and fast.

Plenty of seating, super nice folks.
author: L Z.

description:
Delicious going down, but slow to digest. 
I had a mini burger with no cheese or bacon and it's still making me feel really full after three hours. What's in that stuff?
Probably the cheapest burger thats not GMO in SF.
author: Nan L.

description:
I want one of these in Chicago!  I stopped in here for lunch last week and it was a great, healthier-feeling burger than 5 Guys.  

I got the burger patty on a salad, with avocado.  Amazing and very filling.  I also loved the free pickles!  

Facility was clean, busy & full of light!
author: Lauren W.

description: I had high hopes for this place but I would say it was just super and NOT duper. Burger was kind of greasy but tasted okay - bread god very soggy really fast from the grease. Fries were sub par - McDonalds fries are much better. It was very busy when I went and I had expected some better food.
author: Heather G.

description: Good burgers overall, good prices, and friendly staff. Sadly my veggie burger is cold almost every time I'm here. Tired of complaining. Meat eaters will love it. Veggie/vegans move along.  The veggie burger is an after thought.
author: Mark Q.

description:
Organic milkshakes for five bucks. Kid size soft-serve for three big ones. Keeps me coming back. Do your research and you'll find that Super Duper is one of the few places in SF that use organic milk and ice cream.

The burgers and fries are good too, tho I'm not a huge burger fan. I wish they had onion rings.

The line at this location is much shorter than Market Street and worth walking the extra block from work.
author: Jeanne C.

description: Everyone says that they make a great burger, yet they still are unable to cook a medium burger. It is what you advertise, live up to it!
author: Nic T.

description: We ordered two mini burgers with cheese, ordered grilled onions on one & they didn't put them on. The chocolate milkshake was pretty good, but we weren't that big of a fan of the lemonade- the brown sugar in it is a little strange for my taste. The garlic fries were pretty delish.
author: Lindsay A.

description: Happy hour draft IPA + fries for $5.44. Not much else to say than that. It was crowded, but the line moved quickly, and the service was fast and friendly. I would definitely return. I didn't get a chance to try a burger, but I will happily return for another visit to give those a shot.
author: Leslie H.

description:
I like Super Duper. It's not the best burger I have ever had, but it's tasty and they cook it like I ask each time. The fries are good, too. I also like the chicken sandwich. It's a good place if you're in a bit of a hurry, but not a McDonald's type of hurry. 

Never had a bad experience. It's my go to place for lunch when I'm nearby.
author: Angela L.

description:
I came here for the first time with a friend and decided to get the Mini Combo, but substituting the regular fries with their garlic fries. The wait was a little long, but nothing to fuss about.

Their burgers were good, but it reminded me too much of my family's homemade burgers. I felt like it was something I could have easily whipped up at home. Their garlic fries were tasty, but some were too salty. So, I had to keep dipping them in the ketchup. I loved their pickles though!

I think I would come here again, but only to try their 'shakes' and 'cones' because they look really good.
author: Krystal C.

description:
I got a mini burger ($4.75) with cheese ($0.50) and bacon ($1.00) so the total, after tax, was $6.80.  The burger was amazing and super yummy!!  It was the perfect amount of food.  The sauce on the burger was excellent.

My friends got the chicken sandwich and the veggie burger with an egg on it.  My friend's fries were thin (which, in my opinion, makes them good) and the homemade pickles are excellent as well!  I would definitely eat here again.
author: Sydney W.

description: Just got done eating here today we got our burgers.. My friend took a bite and his meat was pink like not cooked at all we took it back and said please can we get another one... They got us another burger he took a bite again and it was red again!!! I was irritated brought it back and he apologized now come on 3rd time that's pure laziness! Took a bite and it was still pink! If you know a costumer is very strict on not having pink meat and you messed up twice wouldn't you think to be more careful and make sure the last is well done nope too lazy. I will not come back to this location!
author: Jenny T.

description: On this night, it was not a good night. The Super burger was very greasy, the garlic fries were cold, I returned them they gave me warm replacements. The spiked shake was good, you could taste the alcohol, watch out, its rich. A nice atmosphere, good service and expensive. The pickles are the best. I probably won't try it again.
author: Rich L.

description:
Stopped into Super Duper Burgers to get a quick meal before heading off into the night.  After doing some research, it appears to be a chain local to the bay area featuring fresh ingredients and quick service.  I'll attest to both as we were able to drop in and drop out around 6 pm and moderate traffic coming and going.  

The burger was juicy, flavorful, and was definitely one I'd go back for.  The best burger I've ever had? Well, if you read my reviews you know that A) I eat a lot of burgers, and B) I'm going to die before most of you.  That said, for the price and for the convenience, you're probably not going to find a better burger in the bay area.  I only stopped in once, but I would even go as far as saying that Super Duper would rival east coast favorite (yet rapidly expanding) Five Guys.  

The fries were tasty too, nothing special, but definitely something I would order again if I were to stop back by.  

Super Duper earned it's name for sure, and if I'm on the run in the Bay Area I'd definitely go there again.
author: Cliff W.

description: Is it weird that I prefer their milkshakes over their burgers? Their burgers are good, but they are a little greasier than I'd prefer. I could go without their fries, they aren't all that solid and they are kinda chewy; crunchier the better if I'm being real.
author: Bradley C.

description: Best burger and garlic fries in SF. I only say in SF because I'm a SoCal girl and in n out will always have my heart. But this place def gives them a run for their money. And they sell beer and ice cream! Yum.
author: Lisette C.

description:
Super Duper Burgers to the rescue! 

Amazing burger place! Amazing burgers, amazing fries, amazing...pickles?! Yes the pickles here are amazing. Made exclusively from super duper and plus they're free sides to compliment your meal. A little spicy but still all that great. I ordered the super burger meal and loved every bite of it. The burger itself was somewhat small but that's fine as the meat was cooked good and did not fall apart. The fries were normal fries but they did not give a lot but it's whatever. A little thick cut. I think I would have been better off ordering the garlic fries cause those looked amazing. 

The interior of the place is really nice, clean, and roomy. There are some stool seating as well as table seating. The place does get pretty crowded during peak hours so be prepared for a line. Luckily for use we ate just before dinner hours so we were fine. Over all the meal was great and the price was fair so super duper is definitely a chain to look out for.
author: Andre W.

description: Burger was way too greasy. Fries good, but pricey.
author: Donna L.

description:
My veggie burger was on pooooooooooiiiiiinnnnt!

Seriously - I wasn't excited to go to Super Duper Burgers. This might be TMI, but lately after eating a lot of meat, my tummy has felt quite uncomfortable, so, for now, I am sticking to only fruits, veggies, and seafood.  So, when my buddies suggested we go here for dinner, I grumbled, but didn't want to be the spoil sport. Low and behold: the veggie burger...

Now: this was not the typical "I wish this were just a real burger" veggie burger.  Nor was it "How dry can this thing get" veggie burger.  It was a "perfectly moist, perfectly made" veggie burger with all the fixings. Ketchup, mustard, a pickle, a whole-grain bun.... yum!

Service with a smile?  Why yes: they serve that up too. Open late?  You betcha!  As far as fast food goes, I am Super Duper is in fact, super duper!
author: Elsa M.

description:
4 Stars in it's class of burgers.  Burgers are good and so are the garlic fries.  Not the best in it's class (mid-range burgers, like $4-7), but solid and one of the best in the city for this range aside from Roam on Union.  The burger is soft, moist, and juicy and the sesame bun is good along with the thousand dressing like sauce.  The best mid-range I've eaten would go to Pier Burger on the Santa Monica Pier and Shake Shack in NYC.  Best fast food In N Out.  Best burger would be at Clock Tower Bar at the Westin St Francis... totally worth $20.

Hamburgers!
author: Angelique B.

description:
This place is awesome.  I love that they serve GOOD beer (microbrews) and the burgers are made with quality meat and fresh produce.  They also have smaller patties in case you don't want a huge burger and are just looking for a small meal/snack.  You won't be disappointed in their shakes either.  Very good.  Note that they don't serve you here.  You order your food and then when your buzzer goes off you go pick it up at the counter so it's pretty casual.  Only con is that it's a little pricey and the seating is not very comfortable (steal chairs and tables).  

They do have high chairs but no changing station in the bathroom for kids.
author: Nicole B.

description: Whats up with the weird pickles? They were NOT good. The burger was fresh, but to me it could have been a little more flavorful. Something was off. It wasn't a bad burger by any stretch, but I guess it just wasn't for me. Staff was nice and the place was clean. Prices were decent for San Francisco. I'd go again if friends or family wanted to eat there.
author: Drew B.

description:
I LOVE burgers, and I love dropping by Super Duper next to Metreon and La Boulange, or in between. I am allergic to beef so I always get the chicken sandwich, and if it weren't that spicy, I would enjoy it 100%. The chicken breast is cooked not too well done so that there's flavour and moisture, and the buns are yummy. I understand their special sauce is meant to be spicy but if in the future they can create a non-spicy type I'd love that. I'd then give them a 5/5. 

If only I had a tolerance for spicy food! So unfortunate. They play their music very loud and I can't hear when talking to people and it's kind of disturbing.
author: Natalie Charlotte W.

description: We found this place after a long day of wondering around the city. The super duper burger was pretty tasty, especially with all the free toppings. The cheese is worth the addition! Kudos for using free range chicken, farm-fed beef and homemade pickles.
author: MM M.

description: Very decent burgers and fries, tasty and rich despite the omnipresent green/sustainable/organic BS. Not a religious experience but probably the best fast food burger you can eat in downtown SF. It's busy at all times and downright packed during peak times so reserve enough time for your visit.
author: Blazej K.

description:
Ok place. Was crowded when we went. Food was good. A little pricey for a burger. Silly me forgot to take picture of food. 

Not a big fan of the close seating. Long bar Style. Seating on both sides of the bar. So u have people sitting right In front of u while you're eating.  
But. I Would go again if I come back. Check it out.
author: Jacquie J.

description: Yowza! Niman Ranch to perfection. Their burgers are comforting and go great with a side of their garlic fries and pickles. Tip: Great pre-game meal before heading to a Giants game.
author: Briget P.

description: Super Duper Burger has a very similar vibe to Shake Shack in New York and Little Burger in Portland. They are all popular local chains that serve things like "homemade pickles" and "artisanal buns." I got the vegetarian burger and regular fries for close to $10; tastes great but incredibly pricey! But those homemade pickles are admittedly delicious, and you can get all that you want on the side.
author: Yuri H.

description: Today was my first, and possibly last, attempt at a chocolate dipped cone from Super Duper burgers. I went in because of the large organic ice cream cone advertised at the door. After ordering the cone and a burger, I was later called back to receive my child sized cup with soft serve and chocolate dip poured on top. No cone. Instead of offering me a refund, that's what they had for me instead (see photos). Seeing my frown, they told me the soft serve was too soft for a cone. :( Too bad. The burger was alright (comparable to five guys and in n out, but not as good), better because I added an egg! Worse because of my disappointing lack of cone and dry bun. Anyway, I recommend the egg addition. Yum. Think Vietnamese sandwiches with egg, but instead of lunchmeat, with beef and a (sadly dry) bun.
author: David L.

description: Stopped by Saturday 3/14/15 for the first time, and ordered the Super Burger. To my surprise, and disappointment, both patties were very crunchy. They also forgot to put the egg on the burger. Wasn't tasty at all. Not at all impressed. More work can make this place great. Will only continue to go until my gift card runs out. The Garlic Fries are good.
author: Terrence P.

description: delicious burgers   garlic fries are a must have .Best  chocolate shake I ever had
author: Drew D.

description:
I love their burgers. They're fat, fat, fat, I guess that's why they're so good.
If you eat there, they'll give you a little device that bips when your order is ready. Don't use it if you have cardiac issues. I nearly die every time I go there. But it's totally worth it. One of the best burger joints in town.
author: Sarah B.

description: I've eaten at another location and it was extremely better. So, at this one, my patties had no flavor. I feel that was messed up to have a cow slaughtered for the patty and then don't even season that thang. Annnddd it was too greasy
author: Elease T.

description: Needless to say, Super Duper Burgers is delicious! I've had their burger, fries (garlic and regular), ice cream, and lemonade in the past, and it was all very good! I recommend this location over the one at Union Square because the line is shorter, but it's still probably not the best idea to walk over there and order food during a 30 minute lunch break at work. Oh well.
author: Allyson G.

description:
People watching at Super Duper is always really interesting. It's a simple burger joint, but it seems to attract all walks of life. Teenagers, working professionals, ladies who lunch types, *dudes*, foreigners, and more. The food is just really satisfying and that's why people come.

I feel bad saying this, but I do like it more than In-N-Out. Yep, I said it! Let that just sit with you for a bit.

... 

Are you appalled that I said that? Fine, go try it out. Get the cheeseburger and garlic fries. Share a milkshake and tell me that it is not a close contender at least In-N-Out devotees.
author: Patricia Q.

description: OMG what an amazing burger.  The meat was juicy, and don't get me started on the shake.  It's actually relatively hard to find a great shake.  They can be too heavy, or too sweet, but the ones here are fabulous.  Even the pickles are great! OMG how did I not know you can add an egg to your burger.  Definitely need to venture back and try that.  I'm told egg and avocado are the way to go.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Great spot for a quick lunch in SOMA! Quick, cheap, and delicious.

I tend to like the basic burger (buns, beef patty, and cheese) so this place tops my list. The patty is never over-cooked and also not overly salted. The buns are average, but it's the home-made pickles that make this place special.

Service is quick and friendly. I've noticed that they recently started asking for your name for a more customer-oriented service (possibly?). But they use a buzzer system to call you when your order is ready. So I've never heard my name actually used... good try though.
author: Nancy H.

description:
-----------LUNCH ONLY---------
I like a nice, clean restaurant. Service was very friendly. This place gets so much raves that I figured it'd be a hit. But I'm not just feeling that way. 

The mini burger? I'm on the fence. For the first half of the burger, I thought it tasted dry and kind of meh. However, my husband, who ordered the same thing, really enjoyed his. It wasn't until I got to the last 2-3 bites of the burger when it finally tasted really good. Maybe it was just an off day? I'm not sure what happened there. Maybe the burger wasn't assembled proportionately so I didn't actually enjoy the burger until the very end. Whatever the case is, I probably wouldn't head back to see if the burger will taste good for every bite.
author: Diana Y.

description: Bacon cheeseburger and garlic fries with the sauce trio was the perfect combination, bacon was awesome and delicious! One of my best burgers ever!
author: Amanda B.

description: Best buger ever eat in my life they got best veggie burger and garlic frys are so good went there 1st time with my gf it's worth to spend money there I would definitely come back
author: Gurbhej B.

description:
I really wanted to love Super Duper as much as I love In n Out and Umami Burger since my coworkers had been raving about it for a while. 

I wouldn't necessarily say I was disappointed but I certainly wasn't left astounded. 

Here's the breakdown: 

Cookies and Cream Milkshake: 5 stars. If this place was solely reviewed based on the milkshake, it would be quite amazing. It's semi-sweet and thick and creamy without being overbearing

Garlic Fries: I know everyone seems to love this order here but I simply wasn't impressed. The fries were very average - the ones towards the top were fluffy and crisp but as I worked my way towards the bottom, they became soggy and completely soaked with garlic. I almost couldn't taste the potatoes anymore. 

Mini Burger with Egg, Cheese and the basic stuff: Good but not great. The burger was  indeed juicy but it lacked the unique flavor that I'm used to experiencing at other burger joints. I think it's definitely a notch below the burgers from Barney's or the Counter. 

So although I enjoyed my shake, I was left a bit indifferent to the garlic fries and mini burger. I probably won't come back unless I was at the Metreon for a movie and had an intense craving for burgers. It's located right next to the movie theater.
author: Priya S.

description: Super Duper Burgers are just that - super duper! The burgers here are amazing, cooked medium and to your liking with a plethora of fixin' choices. And you must grab some of their homemade pickles from the condiment bar. My burger was so good that once I touched it, I couldn't put it down to take a photo (it's like realizing you locked your keys in the car right after slamming the door) I did take a picture of the garlic fries, which were equally, insanely good. My only beef (no pun intended) with this joint is what they charge for their super duper ice cream cone. $4.00 for a hand dipped cone. yeah, I understand the whole 'milk from organic cows' cost more, but we live in California and 'Happy Cows come from California' , so use milk from happy cows and charge less for your dang ice cream cones =)
author: Mike L.

description:
Carnivores - this is your type of place!

After working late and wanting a quick meal, I picked up a Super Duper burger to take back to my hotel.  This is my first time eating here, and will definitely go back, because it shows promise, but my burger this night did not knock my socks off.

I ordered a super duper burger with cheese, "with everything" and jalapenos.  I did not order fries but I have to say they looked pretty good.

The burger patties (this comes standard with a double patty) were juicy and messy.  Definately a 4 napkin burger.  Normally this would get at least a 4 star rating from me.  But all I could taste was the meat.  I like other flavors to come through when eating my burgers and even the jalapenos were overwhelmed by the meat.

My next visit will try some other toppings to see if they help. 

If you want a burger with lots of burger taste, this is your place.
author: John F.

description:
Why go all the way to Fisherman's Wharf for In-and-Out when this is ten times better and still reasonably priced? I crave their chicken sandwiches and garlic fries. In fact I'm drooling all over my keyboard at 2:30 AM as I type this. 

My friend and I treat this place like a bar. 4.50 for a beer- it's probably the cheapest place in that area for one. They've only got a few selections but they are GREAT selections-- Scrimshaw Pilsner, Racer 5 IPA, Great White, and Lagunitas, I believe. Hit me!

There is the occasional bum. However unlike any other establishment I've been in, they tend to get the winners. These are some of the most aggressive, most out-of-it homeless people I have ever seen. And I'm sure I see at least one every time I go in. And each time one of their gallant and courageous male workers swoops in and gets them out before they do any damage. Swoon!

In sum; great food, great beer, dreamy employees.
author: Raquel R.

description: I really like a good burger and Super Duper Burger has it! I like how they have burger size options too. Been here a couple of times and I never get disappointed. The vibe is pretty simple and casual. Few months ago too, during the 2014 World Series, I was watching an interview with Ryan Vogelsong, a pitcher of the SF Giants, mentioned that he gets his burgers here too. I'm nit surprised because I knew their burgers are good! Oh and you can get a side of peppers too! And we never have a problem with parking (since paid public parking is just right next to it), and no problems with seating either every time we go there. I'm drooling right now just thinking about their burgers. Wish I have one right now as I write this.
author: Cindy S.

description: With all the burger options in San Francisco, it's saying something that Super Duper is still pretty high on my list of best burgers in the city. They also have chicken sandos, but how can you resist that grass fed beef on a bun?! The fries are pretty money too. Get the sauce trio for an extra shot of flavor. I like this place as an unconventional happy hour choice. Small but decent beer selection, a good amount of seating, and great location downtown. Service is fast and friendly.
author: Rachel Y.

description:
Super Duper... what an appropriate name for a super burger. Super Duper Burger is a high quality fast food burger (think In-N-Out) with an above average fast-food price (think 5 Guys). The restaurant itself has a very casual environment which reminds me very much of how Chipotle restaurants look and feel.

The Food:
Super Duper Burger (double) with Cheese, bacon, and egg - If you're going to ruin your diet you might as well do it right. When this burger comes out it looks like the burgers you see in commercials, all fat and perfect. The egg is an element all burger places should really utilize as it adds such a nice balance to the burger. The meat is juicy and the cheese gooey but make sure to grab a lot of napkins as this thing drips with oil and can get very messy.

Garlic Fries - The garlic fries are DE-LI-CIOUS and never soggy. If you're a garlic lover definitely give these fries a try. My one concern would be that there are just too little fries, especially for what you pay. I always find that my fries are gone before I'm more than 1/2 way done with my burger.

I still think In-N-Out has the better burger, never the less Super Duper Burger is packed with flavor and is sure to leave any hungry burger patron satisfied.
author: Eddie K.

description:
The burgers are a little greasy but it's good.

The best thing about this place is their homemade pickles and malt soft served ice creams!
author: Anna C.

description:
Listen fools: this review is for Super Duper's dairy products, namely the soft serve ice cream and milk shakes. Yeah, yeah, they serve burgers here and they're great. But can we focus for a minute? Please?

Anyone with half a brain knows that the only ice cream worth eating is soft-serve, and the stuff at Super Duper is super duper. It's made from 100% organic cow-juice from the Straus Dairy in Petaluma. The family-owned creamery has four out of five cows from the Cornucopia institute. I really don't know what this means, but it sounds like they know from udders. Four cows!

I had a cookies 'n' creme milkshake here and it was one of the greatest things I have ever put in my mouth, and I'm from Canada. (I don't really know what this means.)

The swirled cones are fun to make mouth-love to too, ESPECIALLY if you get that sucker chocolate dipped. The dipping chocolate is dark (i.e., not overly sweet), which is is just how I like it. And at the risk of sounding like a pederast, I can attest that the Kiddie-sized cone is sufficient for my tastes. I'd better quit now.

Obligatory Title Pun: Have a COW man, OR: DAIR to be different.

Menu Readability: Folksy and fun.

Need to mention: Super Duper also serves delicious burgers.

What this place teaches me about myself: Dark, soft and kiddie-sized is the only way to go.
author: Vivek S.

description:
Same amazing burgers as the one located on Market and even closer to my main shopping area! 

Really don't know what else to say about Super Duper but the fact that I love it :) 

oh and if you love eggs, always grab that extra egg! Although your hands are going to be drenched in the yolk gooeyness, imagine devouring that delicious gooeyness in your burger.
author: Harriet W.

description:
Man, those super duper burgers are somethin'. Walked in, it was packed, and I wasn't sure I'd find a spot to sit. Ordered the super duper burger with everything and garlic fries. Found a nice spot near the chefs. A window blocks me from the action. After a few minutes, I get my food - looks beautiful. Tried the garlic fries; good.. reeeaaaal good. Moved on to the burger.. whew, MA GOODNESS! That's a burger!! Flavorful, juicy, and a perfectly cooked hamburger patty. Definitely coming back for more.

Heard good things about the milkshakes, but didn't order it this go around.

Highly recommend stopping in this burger joint.
author: Andrew B.

description:
Mini Burger (cheddar cheese)
+
Fries
+
Chocolate and Strawberry Shake
--------------------------------------------

JOY


Organic, local ingredients, what's not to love? I will admit, it reminds me of a certain joint in NY. Good burger, good shakes, easy ordering, and delicious.  Try making yourself something unique and pick up a pickle.
author: Flor D.

description:
Had my first super duper experience and I would call it a "fancier" or dressier burger. What most people may ask first is:  super duper vs. in&out vs. 5 guys... But overall they just hit different taste buds and moods.

Mini Burger ($4.50) + grilled onions +jalopenos +cheese 0.50 + avocado/mushrooms - $1.00 each + combo fries drink + a pile of pickles enough for a pregnant woman for free.99 = $11 for dinner.  Not bad at all! Verdict - fulfilling, ridiculously messy and juiiiiiiiiiicccccccy burger meat [we're talking like 7 napkins messy], delicious and definitely did not taste like most fast food burgers at all. 

They also have a lot of variety: salads, chicken, veggie burger (veggie patti, cucumber, hummus), milk shakes, soft serve, beer, so you're set eve if you don't like hamburgers. 

Some other perks =  you get a little pager to let you know when your food is ready, and the turn around time I would say is no more than 10 minutes. There's ample seating in the main dining room or upstairs.

Some bummers = in the hustle bustle of the downtown area, don't leave your stuff hanging around. One of the cashiers came up to me and told me to put my phone away because they've had incidents where people's personal belongings have gotten swiped!
author: Christine B.

description:
Not a 5-star burger, but a satisfying burger indeed!

The first time I came here I got the single burger - not good. It was just way too thin and overdone and all I could taste was the bread.

The second time, however, I opted for the double burger - much better! You can actually taste the burger and it's flavorful and fulfilling. The chicken sandwich is also very good. Garlic fries are great, as are their regular fries.

I'd say go for the double burger - it's a great burger for a fast food joint and not fast food tasting at all! 

Also a plus is they have pickles on the side and a napkin dispensary for messy eaters such as myself.
author: Junel S.

description:
Great burgers here a bit messy but they're just wonderful I can't wait to eat gere again this will surely become my new favorite place.

Decently priced too
author: Jose D.

description: Sorry to disagree with the other reviewers.  They claim to cook hamburgers "medium".  Mine came with two layers of charcoal (top and bottom).  If I were not hurrying back to Moscone for the trade show, I would have sent it back.  Had potential, but this was a miss.
author: Roger M.

description: As an east coaster I must say I am shocked these are 4 stars.  Burgers were flavorless, and not juicy.  Fries decent, shakes good.  Maybe we are spoiled on the east, but this place is a dime a dozen kind of spot back home
author: Brian L.

description:
Highlights: 
- Fresh burgers: various sizes (super or mini), various options (chicken, beef, veggie), so many add on options. 
-Salad: their salads are simple, but really yummy dressing and I normally add chicken = so good! 
- Yummy fries (reg or garlic)
- Spiked milkshakes (need I say more?)
- Ice cream cones

Improvements: 
- I can't say that I have any.  This is probably a larger location than the market street one and it can get pretty crowded during lunch time with shoppers from the nearby Metreon/Westfield mall, people from conventions (if any) at the Moscone center, and people that work nearby. 

Tip: Feelin' like you don't want meat? Veggie burger and garlic fries. That's what's up!
author: Tracy T.

description: Okay, this is by far my favorite burger joint in SF! I mean c'mon, they serve ORGANIC Milkshakes!!! But of course, their burgers are way better than Umami burger. (I'm entitled to address my opinion, sorry I'm not sorry lol) Prices are unquestionably reasonable for the quality of their burgers and to be honest, I don't mind paying extra! I wish they would open one up north, or at least in Berkeley. This place is definitely worth the hype! Keep it up!
author: Kat N.

description: I had better burgers at hole in the wall places in the east bay. Skip the special sauce.
author: Kiran B.

description:
In fairness, I've only been here once. But I see these glowing reviews throughout Yelp for all 5 of their locations, and I wonder if I ate at the same place.

I wasn't super hungry when I came here, so I went for just the Super Burger with cheese. No fries, no drink, just the burger. It was decent. A little dry. Nice gaminess with the grass-fed beef (not so much to be overpowering, but definitely not your grain-finished McDonald's schlop).

But I don't get the hub-bub. I'd rather have paid significantly less and gone to In-n-Out, paid significant more and gone to Nopa or Umami, or have gone to Roam in the same price range. It was okay, but nothing special for a $6+ burger.

I'll give it another shot at some point, and it's possible I just got a rare lemon, but I wasn't impressed.
author: David C.

description: Glad to have tried the veggie burger today. I skipped the cheese, but added avocado, and it was wonderful. I was very happy with the flavor and did I mention the service from Ollie at the front register today was excellent.
author: Eli S.

description:
My husband, brother, and I were need for nourishment and decided to give Super Duper Burger a try.
We ordered 2 Super Burgers, 1 Chicken Sandwich, French Fries, and a Cookies and Cream Milkshake.
I loved my burger! The 100% all natural ground beef patty was juicy and cooked to perfection. I couldn't care less for the French fries and shake. 
I will be back!
author: Angie R.

description:
I met Brad at Super Duper Burgers because he owed me a free meal. I'd actually given some feedback on a project, so I wasn't mooching dinner or anything. I'm making a struggling professor's wage these days, so I certainly can't turn down a free meal. Anyway...

It's a compact space with a small counter and then two separate dining areas that are both a little cramped depending on the crowd. It was pretty busy while we were there. Probably due to President's Day. If you're single, you might be able to sit down and accidentally hit the elbow of an attractive boy or girl sitting near you! I think I saw Brad pull this move. Anyway...

I got a chicken sandwich and it was super good. The bread was yummy, there was some sort of spicy Thousand Island sauce, a flattened chicken breast, tomato, and avocado. OK. I'm getting hungry again. Brad got a cheeseburger and fries. He finished both of them, so I'm assuming he thought it was good too!

I wish they'd let me do half stars here because this place would be a 4.5. There was a weird elevator door in the bathroom that looked through to the dining area. It was ajar and wouldn't shut. Somebody might see you using the bathroom! Lol!
author: Jason W.

description:
Good place to get a fresh and juicy burger. Make sure to get the bacon and egg on your burger. 
Cashier forgot my order of fries. But the manager gave them to me for free. 5-star service.
author: An N.

description:
This place happened to be around the corner from my hotel while I was in San Francisco on a business trip. I hadn't had a quality burger in over a year, and according to Yelp, this place was the bomb diggity. So I gave it a shot. Yelpers, you didn't let me down.

Ugh, what a fabulous burger. Loads of flavor, though a little more grease than I'd have liked -- but hey, I hadn't had a burger in over a year. A little grease wasn't about to stop me. Fresh lemonade topped the meal off nicely. The atmosphere was busy and friendly, upstairs and downstairs, with plenty of seating of all sorts, people coming and going and freeing up spots. Lighting was low and the music was too.

I brought SDB up to a co-worker of mine the next day, and the response I got was, "Oh man, that place is awesome. Did you try one of their spiked milkshakes?"  Cue me having a conniption fit, because missing anything that combines ice cream and alcohol is a straight-up travesty in my book.

I went back the following night and got a spiked chocolate shake along with my burger, and man, that is the JOINT right there. Definitely something I'm gonna remember and replicate on my own back home.

The fact that I went to this place twice during a four-night business trip goes beyond convenience and a milkshake, though. As far as burgers go, this is one of the best I've had. Absolutely worth a try.
author: Nikki D.

description:
Super duper burger, you were pretty super duper good! 

For those newbies who have never been to Super Duper Burgers, prepare yourself with some maternity pants or stick with a "mini" burger. I'm not sure why they call it mini because it was still too big for me. I felt a food baby bump after finishing the mini! A regular burger consists of two patties. Fatty McGee for sure! 

Don't forget to get a side of garlic fries! It just makes your day that much better! Minus the garlic breath of course...
author: Jeanette Y.

description: Friendly service, amazing burgers, wish I had gotten the vanilla malt shake though #foodenvy
author: Mark P.

description:
After a second visit, I can say the food is not as greasy as I first said it was. The fries are exactly where you want them to be, and the amount of oil is necessary for the touch they want to add to them. The Veggie Burger is not as greasy as the other burgers I've seen: I recently ordered mine without cheese nor avocado and enjoyed a nice meal. There are better options of course, but if all you want is a burger, I've seen much worse.

The chocolate milkshake is still good, and yes $15 is good enough value for a decent dinner.
author: Dinesh H.

description: Jesus this is a good burger. 2 patties plus bacon and cheese on a crispy bun for 9 dollars. My mouth is watering just thinking about it. It's not the best value burger but it is so good and filling. Plus, free pickles! Those patties, mmmmmm. So juicy and only a little greasy.
author: Ruobin W.

description:
Super Duper burger, add cheese, add egg.

Too bad I got carbonate water instead of Sprite (someone forget to add the flavoring)? I drank it anyways, thirsty trump complaint.
author: qirk z.

description:
I was coming here with super high expectations, walked around the city in high heels too after an interview hoping to get a super amazing burger. But then I guess I was expecting way too much. 

Okayyyy, the burger wasn't horrible, it was just alright. Just that my ex said that it was the most amazing burger he's had and so I'm thinking omgosh must try this out. Maybe, I shouldn't have put so much trust in an ex...anywho, it was not bad, better than fast food burgers for sure (probably not better than In-n-Out though). For me, it was the sauce that threw me off a little because I was not expecting it. However, the meat was good, not super juicy like other burger places but yummy and everything in it was good. The fries were probably my favorite! I got garlic fries and that was flavorful.

Overall, it's a nice place to get a burger, just not the very best. I think I preferred the new Super Duper at the Valley Fair Mall when I had it with my sister.
author: Cynthia B.

description:
I don't really like American food, but their burgers, fries, and shakes are delicious. 

The mini burger can fill you up if your appetite is small to normal. The super burger is for those with a whale of a stomach. 

I like getting it with cheese and avocado. :)

And get the shake (any flavor is good) with malt. It's like unicorns flying over double rainbows in your mouth. 

I like this location because they make their shakes thick - just the way I like it!
author: Belyn L.

description: Very modern look, I love that the food has organic ingredients. Not very expensive at all. I did have to wait a bit but I mean the place was very busy. The burgers are juicy and fries are different. I will be back next time I'm in the city!
author: Kevin N.

description: This place was very tasty. I could definitely tell that all the ingredients were freshly made. On top of that, the service was excellent!  when they incorrectly cooked my husbands bacon they quickly, happily corrected the situation and gave us free fries. I wouldn't drive from San Carlos all the way to San Francisco just eat here but if I was nearby I would definitely stop in again.
author: Cathy B.

description:
Just look at the pictures ! I mean come on!
I don't even know how it took me so long to try this place, but now I try to avoid walking by so that I do not indulge myself in it's oh so goodness....

The burgers are cooked on point, and I thought "a mini burger, who the hell wants a burger mini?!" but no it was perfect! Fries are also just as delicious!

As many people have mentioned, they make their own pickles! For goodness sakes they MAKE THEIR OWN PICKLES! I literally ate more pickles in that moment then I had in a year!
So good!

You can also add more awesome to your burger like a fried egg. Super Duper you are the best!
It's clean, it is delicious and I am all for it!
author: Jessica S.

description:
Best burger in San Francisco. Hands down. Absolutely-freggin-delicious! Perfectly seasoned and cooked.  Garlic fries knock it out of the park.  Want a cold brew? They got you covered.  Interested in a thick milkshake? Got that for ya too. All served on biodegradable plates, with recycled napkins. (god bless you san Francisco). 

Will I return? Probably every time I'm within a quarter mile of this restaurant. 

What will I order? Everything. Without guilt.
author: Gardner H.

description:
I was in SF this past weekend for the grand opening of Uniqlo and fleet week so I decided to try this hot spot because I was in town, and Super Duper did not disappoint!

The line looked intimidating and long but it didn't take us long to order our food. There is plenty of seating everywhere and since it's fast food there will be a place for you to sit. They also have pickles they make themselves for your enjoyment while you're waiting for your order. 

I ordered the super burger with everything (free) on it and a slice of pepper jack cheese. The burger was awesome! All the toppings tasted really fresh and the meat was very juicy and tender. The only downside with the Super burger was that the patty was huge. I assumed it would be like any other burger joint, where they would have pre-made patties and then threw them on the grill. But at Super Duper, they have them rolled up in balls and then flatten them right on the grill. So with a super burger, it came with two patties and they essentially flattened two patties on top of each other. So next time I'll get the single.
author: Andy H.

description: Been there twice this week.  Both chicken sandwich and mini burger combos rock.  Fast getting through the lines despite the length.  Try an egg on the burger.  Good eats!
author: Rob G.

description: Super super yummy!
author: Veronica R.

description:
Super juicy burgers, super fries, and super shakes.  Yeah, it's a good fatty meal in this place.  

It gets crowded though and it's not the most comfortable place to sit and eat so it would be nice if they had more tables and chairs.  Then again, it would be nice if I won the lottery and that's not gonna happen either.  4 stars.
author: Mark J.

description:
Either I was starving or that burger rocked it!

Tasty, juicy, yummy.  Go eat...have a burgerlicious of a treat!  Oh and try the pickles they are tasty too!
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Why lie? You know you want a Burger instead of a Salad...especially after playing bumper carts in Target with the rest of the Target Shoppers. 

Luckily right downstairs is one of the City's finest burger establishments. Super Duper is a small chain, but one of the good ones...and they make the best, juiciest burgers....really, like 5 napkins required. 

Garlic fires, dipping sauces and a thick adult milkshake...and you have yourself a winning combination.

The manager here is really friendly, remembers your name and makes you feel like you are eating in his kitchen (that would be weird though, right?)

About $12 for one for lunch.
author: Sarah M.

description: Good burger. We also got the garlic fries with ranch on the side. We didn't really care for the garlic fries. I think I may just be a fries purist! Also, there is a deal if you go to the movies next door at AMC, you can get a free fries!
author: Kathy S.

description: Had the veggie burger.  Very well done-thin sliced cukes on it were excellent.  Garlic fries were great; reminds me of Smashburger's garlic fries.  Shakes were superior and bacon on other burgers was praised.  Two story facility; nice and clean.
author: Nancy T.

description:
I'm all about this place.
SF local burger spot? And it's actually delicious -- and they cook their patties medium!!! BRILLIANT.

First of all, SF isn't exactly a place that is known for great burgers, so when I stumbled upon this gem with my boyf, I was stoked.

Tried their Super Burger (2 patties, with everything -- lettuce, tomato, red onions, super sauce, jalapenos, grilled onions, and pickles) and the garlic fries.

UMM -- delicious. I would definitely recommend the 2 patty deal, their patties are on the small side but it was definitely filling with two patties. the garlic fries are what I imagine the garlic fries at AT&T Park taste on a sober pallet -- delicious. And it is a little messy to eat, but the mess is worth it.

(I am an onion LOVER, but I'm probably going to pass on the grilled onions next time I come. Only because they are awesome and they give you a lot of grilled onions, but they're sweet flavor is a tad bit strong for my liking on a burger.)

The girl who took our order was friendly and told the boyf and I about how they're a SF burger spot.

This location is super cute and two stories.
We enjoyed sitting facing the windows and people watching while enjoying our burgers.

Oh and...the restrooms are clean.
Oh and they provide freshmade pickles the same way that 5 Guys provides free peanuts.

Overall, I loved everything about this place.
author: Riana C.

description: I really enjoy the burgers here! They're so juicy and flavorful. Their fries and shakes are bomb, too. I love coming here with my babe while we enjoy heavenly burgers.
author: Mariah O.

description:
Super Duper Burger is a fun lunch spot during the work week. Lines were crazy long when it first opened, but have recently gotten better. 

I like the veggie burger with everything plus a fried egg. Messy, but delicious!

Splurge on the Oreo milkshake. It won't disappoint.
author: Rebecca G.

description:
Decided to drop in for a  few burgers with my hubby this saturday afternoon and so glad I did.


We placed an order of 2 super duper burger, which consist of 2 patties + garlic fries and a salad. Everything was fresh and super delicious and all for under $24.00.

This place is perfect if your wanting to get a quick bite in a casual atmosphere. The place was packed but we still found seating and everything was better than we expected.

The service was fast, friendly and accurate and the food was fresh and delicious. I'll definitely be coming back.

Hooray for SDB!!!
author: V W.

description:
Mini burger w/ cheddar, grilled onions, jalapenos, and avocado = NOMM
Super burger w/ blue cheese, grilled onions, and bacon = NOM NOM
Mini burger w/ cheddar, grilled onions, a sunny up egg = NOM NOM NOM

Pretty much any way you do it, it tastes so good! It's probably the sauce...but I even like their fries even though I prefer thinner ones. 

GET THEIR PICKLES! They aren't super sour, but they aren't sweet (yuck) either. They're right in the middle and they are perfect. 

Will be back to try their shakes, they all sound so good! I just wasn't in the mood to be a fatty.
author: Christine B.

description:
Came here for the first time with some new intern friends on a Friday evening. Superbly quick service for a rush hour night!

The burgers are inexpensive and fairly tasty. First timers:  the regular 'super' option is actually two patties, so if you want to minimize your red meat intake or just can't handle two patties, go for the 'mini' option. I ordered only a mini burger for around $5 and it was perfect for my appetite (I usually eat one entire In-N-Out burger at the same appetite level) so the entire deal was a total steal for me. 

Tasty? Yes. The best burger I've ever had? No. The beef patty is a little too squishy/soft and the secret sauce did not have enough ketchup for my liking. Additionally, the bun was quite oily. BUT GET THE PICKLES. They are good stuff. 

4 stars for the quick service and super low-priced yet satisfyingly large enough 'mini burger.' Still had an "I wish this was In-n-out" moment
author: Arushi S.

description:
I was never much of a burger girl until I found Super Duper, which is probably bad news for my health but I don't even care because they're so, so good, and also all the pickles I eat from their endless pickle jar must negate the fat anyway right? Right? Because that's how stuff like this works. 

Anyway, there's nothing left to say about the delicious burgers + yummy fries + godly shakes that hasn't already been said, so I'm just gonna wax weirdly poetic about my favorite thing here -- 

the pickles. The motherffffffnnhggn unlimited pickles. Crunchy, tangy, spicy, perfect. Apparently you can buy their jars of pickles for $30 each, but if you bring back the empty jar they refund $10 of that so it's really just $20 for you to get your snooki on oh god did I really type that yes I did there's no going back let's just roll with it

moving on now

I love you, Super Duper.
author: Angela N.

description:
Came here for lunch with co-workers, was advised to get the veggie burger because the regular burger was too greasy. 

Got a chicken sandwich. The chicken was way undercooked, raw on the inside. It is not difficult to properly cook chicken. Will not be back.
author: Brad J.

description:
OH MAMA! If you're looking for a savory & delicious food coma, be sure to stop by this great place right inside the Metreon for a great burger!

Super Duper is a great spot to get your heavy food grub on. The place reminds me of a Chipotle in terms of the industrial interior feel to the design.

There isn't anything super special about Super Duper, but they execute an American classic very well.  My personal fav is the single cheeseburger with bacon, lettuce, tomato, onions and pickles. Add on a chocolate shake for that extra gut busting satisfaction and you'll be heading towards a killer food coma that will please anyone.

For an additional treat, get the garlic fries, which will blow your mind!

Bacon Cheeseburger + Garlic Fries + Choc Shake = Awesome-sauce
author: Justin O.

description: We got there about 9pm and this place was still hoppin'!  The seating is a bit limited but it does not take long for seats to become free.  The burger was fantastic.  And they are made to order.  We all got the mini burger which was perfect.  The garlic fries are a garlic lovers dream!!  And you can order extra sauces for dipping.
author: Andrea L.

description: Delicious! Perfect for a quick lunch in the city.  I got a mini burger with garlic fries and it was definitely enough.  Will be checking out the one in South Bay soon!
author: Ingrid L.

description:
Surprisingly amazing veggie burger. 

I am pretty picky about vegetarian burgers. Mostly because I am typically against super processed food. Which is what most vegetarian patties are. And then many of them just end up tasting bland and non refreshing. 

Not at Super Duper burger. Their veggie burger was refreshingly good. They even had corn thrown in the mix. It came with avocado and cheese. And a very tasty sauce that I don't remember. I decided to go all out and get the garlic fries. Which were also pretty good. The mini burger combo deal ends up being good value for your money. My friend had a beef burger (didn't pay attention to which one), which he also enjoyed a lot. We both cleaned off our plates quickly. 

This is not the healthiest place to eat for the health conscious. It is still burgers and fries. (And a coke). But it is wonderfully good burgers and fries. And life is too short to count calories anyways so go in and enjoy a meal with no regrets!

Oh. And get the garlic fries!
author: Dee O.

description: I ordered the mini burger combo. I guess I expected more because of the name "super duper burger". It was ok. I would say the burger and garlic fries were pretty bland and not super duper. However, the service was great.
author: Mellowdee P.

description:
"One of the best burgers I've ever had."

Quote came from my father. Namesake burger came from the newest Super Duper.

Visits to other locations (http://www.yelp.com/biz/super-duper-burgers-san-francisco#hrid:XxqicDikcUM7Z_qV-F5XyQ and http://www.yelp.com/biz/super-duper-san-francisco#hrid:70Nf4bhUDFJ3YG2eJC7HzA) always seemed to lack something.

Not this time.

Veggie burger had that something extra. Might have been the great service, awesome hummus or the free toppings like grilled onions.

Or perhaps what has been missing all along was simply sharing a burger with my Dad. Both try hard to be super duper. Tonight they each succeeded.
author: Jason B.

description: Best burger place in SF but doesn't have Wi-Fi. Cool they have beer on tap. Their cashiers are rude if you don't give a tip. They have complained before to my colleague that he didn't tip. Other than that this place is bomb.
author: Teddy K.

description: I'm from out of town and needed something filling, good, and not too intimidating!  Super Duper hit the spot.  The veggie burger is really, really good!  The employees are kind and helpful and don't be afraid if you ever see a line - service is pretty quick.
author: Taylor G.

description: Very good food! On the pricy side but at least it's what you pay for. Got the veggie burger with cheesy fries and a lemonade, veggie burger was good and lemonade was delicious! But cheese on fries wasn't even melted all the way. Overall pretty good and nice restaurant love the looks w the stainless steel and wooden countertops in there. Also good food presentation
author: Theresia B.

description: Cool place, a little hard to find.  Good burger and  fries, but a bit greasy. Fantastic all you can eat fresh pickles and they do serve beer which is a plus in a burger joint.  Price was fair and cashier was friendly and helpful.  If your in the area and in the mood for a burger  this is a good choice.
author: Todd M.

description: Best burger I've had in a long time! The chicken sandwich is bomb also! Good shakes too!
author: Edele O.

description: Great place to get a quick burger and fries. I like how the burgers are so juicy and tasty. I always get the free pickles to compliment the taste of the fries.
