The burgers also seem to be cooked just the way I like. The prices are reasonable and definitely better than the fast food joints.
author: Paul V.

description: Still awesome. Love the veggie burger. Love the fried egg option. Fries are good too. And pickles, yay!
author: Sherry L.

description: Omg this place is awesome. I am a vegetarian and getting a good delicious burger can be a bit of challenge sometimes. This place serves the best veggie burger in town, in my opinion. I always add avocados, they charge extra for it but totally worth it. The beer is yum and their normal and garlic fries are to die for. Must try for people who are vegetarians and looking for a great burger.
author: Madhuri D.

description:
These burgers are delicious for a quick service restaurant. The meat, cheese and bun are all made out of quality ingredients. I was happy that the cheese wasn't american cheese. :) I got avocado on my burger and I was happy that it wasn't a small portion of avocado. It was a good wide slice of fresh green avocado. 

The burger and fries had some grease but it wasn't bad. For how delicious the food was, I was able to overlook a little bit of grease.

The restaurant was busy but we were able to order fairly quickly and our food took only about 5 minutes to be ready. I will definitely be back!
author: Michelle K.

description: I really like the burgers here. I ordered the double cheese burger and I would describe it as a compact and dense burger that is juicy and full of flavor. I also ordered the garlic fries and they too were pretty good. The fries were crispy and not soggy as mentioned previously. Everything tastes best when hot. I would definitely come here again.
author: Richie C.

description:
Super Duper.
your name does not lie.

fantastic burgers (dare i say the best in the city?) - especially with cambozola, bacon and jalapeno peppers

reasonable prices

garlic fries that make me possessive (don't touch my garlic fries!) when I don't even normally like garlic fries.  I think it's the cheese.

did i mention the shakes?  chocolate strawberry - you make me happy.


they have a pickle bar (said in the quizno's pepper bar voice)

I like their font/logo  - i don't know why but it matters.

and the check out guy asked me about my plans for the weekend.  slightly awkward but a nice touch.  i think they have to do that, which kinda makes you feel cheap later when you find out your friend got asked how his day was going.. but whatever.

only criticism i can think of is that i am annoyed that you charge for your fry dips.


anyway super duper, I think you should have a cape.
you are that super
author: Meredith K.

description:
Make it gluten free without the bun and special sauce. 

These are a great burger not just for a fast food place but for an ordinary burger joint. Granted its close to where I stay in Union square but I have to say its reliable, quick and always good. 

The downside is a lot of people know about it and there is generally a queue. But don't let this throw you off. The line moves quickly and it's definitely worth the wait.
author: Pilar M.

description:
For the convenient location (downtown) and price ($10/meal), this restaurant is a pretty chill place to grab a quick burger. You order at the counter, they hand you a buzzer, grab your drink, look for a table, and boom! -within ten minutes of ordering, your food will be ready! 

Super Duper Burger + swiss + avocado ($6.00 for the single patty): It was definitely smaller than I had expected but enough to keep me full for a few hours. Meat? meh, nothing too juicy or amazing but it's better than your average fast-food or diner-styl restaurant with respect to quality. They don't ask you how you'd like it cooked so expect it to be very well-done. 

fries + garlic and parmesan ($2.75): taste a lot better than my plain-regular fries ($2.00). I'd definitely get this fry option over the regular fries at my next visit.

This restaurant probably gets pretty packed during lunch/dinner but I think it's equivalent to a "fancy" in-and-out so people tend to go in and out relatively quickly as well! We didn't have to wait for a table despite our big group so definitely check this place out if you're in the area and craving a quick burger.
author: Patricia K.

description: Very good for a fast food place. Really tasty and fresh meet, I hope. Toppings are amazing too. Fries was made to perfection, you can make it really unique by adding cheese and garlic.
author: Mohammad H.

description: I LOVE everything there!  If you cater super duper, every burger will be in an aluminum foil bag to contain heat. Superb! I personally dont like eating burgers for obvious reasons. But Im willing to break the rule for super duper. The fries there are so unique and it isn't oily at all. For price-wise, I'd say it's decent. It's only a couple of bucks more than what you'd pay at in-n-out. I'd definitely go back there if I crave for burgers again.
author: Fong C.

description: Quick check out service and quick pick up service too. I had the chicken sandwich with bacon and avocado..yum! I love that they have a pickle bar...some places are stingy with their pickles, but no holds pickle bar. My sister enjoyed her burger but could have used a better bun..hers got all soggy so I gave her my ciabatta like buns to hold her burger together. Fries were good too! All that came out to like $20 with a drink. Not bad. We sat upstairs away from the madness.
author: Holla F.

description:
We loved it.  Burgers were fantastic the garlic & cheese fries spectacular and the chocolate shake wonderful.  Highly recommend it!

Hey Ryan - I got your email - you guys are just awesome - totally 5 star all the way!

I'll be back soon!
author: Jeffrey D.

description:
These burgers are legendary! No seriously, they're so good you should really give it a try whenever you're near Market Street. Just grab a menu with fries on the side and a soda, wait a bit till they prepare that meaty goodness and enjoy! 

The place clearly has a hipster atmosphere about it, but sometimes I think you just have to ignore that and just give it a go... a man just needs his hamburger every once in a while after all...
author: Nicolas S.

description:
The burgers here are definitely good, but are SMALLLLLLLLLLLLLLL, NOT SUPER DUPER -___________-

that should be false advertising, lol

the only difference form the regular burger and super are one little patty, I wasnt impressed.

They do have good pickles though lol

Can't say I'll be dying to come back, for the price, you might as well go to in n out and get a 5x5 and it'd be cheaper and taste about the same lol
author: Timothy N.

description:
This place is really good! Not that crowded during the lunch rush, and queue was well managed thanks to them using those electronic beeper things to let you when your order is ready!
Their veggie burger (with all the advertised extensions) is really good, and their garlic fries are pretty epic! Burger is pretty messy to eat, so make sure to get lots of napkins!
All in all a pretty greasy but delicious lunch place!
author: Aditya M.

description: I'm not much of a burger fan, so I am giving Super Duper 5 stars for their soft serve ice cream!  It's hard to resist the creamy treat as you walk by the 5 foot tall ice cream sign out front.  I always get the chocolate/vanilla swirl, and you can get your cone dipped in chocolate too.  What a treat on those rare hot days in SF!
author: Erin S.

description:
Pretty good burger -- juicy and dripping with fat, just the way a burger should be. The fries are addictive and had me grinning like a fat kid in front of cake (or a super duper burger for that matter). 

A burger + fries was $10 with tax which seems to me to be a little too high. I could go to 5 Guys for less and get more food. And yes, I think 5 guys is on par with SDB. 
Nonetheless, if you're here to catch a movie and wanting a burger, Super Duper is your place. It's loud, crowded, and you might have to fight for seating but the meal is worth it.
author: Nene K.

description:
I would have to rate Super Duper Burgers as good, adequate if you're after a decent burger fast... Is it the best burger I've ever had? No.

But it's good for the speed. You'll find the burgers greasier than most, and a little higher priced as well but the quality trade off is worth it.

I've been to this location more than once and they're always friendly and speedy.

Garlic fries are pretty delicious too, but also greasy and pretty bad for you... Just don't plan on kissing anyone after eating them, unless you're sharing...
author: Brett H.

description: Mini burger, fries, ice tea, and homemade pickles. Delish!
author: Rebekah B.

description: I'm a fan of their chicken sandwich with bacon, cheese, and chipotli aioli sauce. I think that's what gives the chicken sandwich its flavor. I hear getting an egg on top of a burger is great so I'll be sure to try that the next time I visit and maybe try out a vodka infused milkshake as that sounds like an interesting combo. Even though there's a line at almost any Super Duper location, the cashiers are fast and friendly. You won't be waiting to long for your order to come out.
author: Gerard Y.

description:
It was good!  Was in search of a quick meal on a late night after a long day...Super Duper Burgers was right across the road from the Marriott where I was staying.

I had a plain mini-burger, no frills.  Just the patty and the bun, with a side of fries.  it was all very good.  Meat was tender and tasty, well-seasoned.  Fries were fresh and crisp. 

This was a busy location but they moved quickly behind the counter.  I took my food to-go, had a seat while waiting and there was ample dining space here.

Nothing was too greasy, all was good quality.  Overall good experience.
author: Irene Z.

description: Great tasting burgers and malt shakes. Well seasoned beef and garlic fries. Your bill here can get high very quickly (around 15 dollars for a burger, fries and drink) so I'd watch what I add to the meal next time.
author: J S.

description: Will always be one of my favorite burger spot, burgers are full of flavor and buns are amazing. But they just couldn't get the fries right, a bit too greasy.
author: Jane B.

description:
Not the most amazing burger or fries I've ever had.
We actually just came in because there was supposed to be a deal about free fries with your ticket stub from the movies upstairs.
I hand over our ticket stubs and told the cashier I saw posters about their deal with the movie theater. He smugly tells me that I have to purchase burgers to get that deal. I just roll my eyes...of course...the catch. Nowhere in the posters did it say anything about that of course. But fine. We've never been to this place anyway. Seems like worth a try. We like burgers.
Wasn't worth it. We should have left when the cashier burst our bubble.
author: Avril N.

description:
Great Yelp reviews brought us here...  & the fact that we were intoxicated & in need of a comforting drunchie meal, also played a roll in it... 

 It's a great 2 story burger joint with fresh ingredients & over all clean environment. 
It's a stand up order type of restaurant... then you pick up your food from the front counter when your order is ready.. 

But i'm not sure why it's called "Super Duper Bugers" it's more like a In-N-Out "double double", ifff that....  

Came for the hype, enjoyed it... but if you're a big burger condenseur, you'll be disappointed in their portions & will have to make your way back to the counter & maybe order a second burger..
author: Brandon M.

description:
Super Duper is basically a fancier In-n-out. The burgers are made with similar small patties (though a bit bigger than the In-n-out variety), but are usually cooked a little closer to medium, rather than the In-n-out well-done-ness.
The sauce is good stuff, and the burgers are very flavorful, and super juicy. You WILL make a mess. The house pickles are also quite tasty, and pretty subtle.
There are a few beers on tap, and even 2 wines, but the selection is small.
Also, the shakes are excellent, and thankfully not absurdly enormous.

This instance of the chain is plenty big, with some upstairs seating as well, and makes a good alternative to the places in the Metreon if you're feeling like a pre- or post-movie burger.
author: Don H.

description:
I've written a review for the Castro Super Duper already. This one is the newest to open in SF, on Mission by La Boulange, just a block away from the one on Market. 

If you've been to other Super Dupers, this one is what you'd expect.  Fries tend to be crispier here, for some reason. 

If you haven't been to Super Duper, here's the scoop: these are very tasty, consistent, above-average quality "smashed" fast-food style burgers. "Smashed" means they start with a ball of beef and smash it down while grilling, which leads to lots of nooks and crannies in the meat.  I'm personally a fan because it ensures a) never frozen beef, b) cheese gets all up ins, and c) each burger is made to order.  "Fast food style" means it's a classic American cheeseburger, nothing fancy or elaborate.

Lettuce, cheese, bun, etc. are all above average.  Fries are great.  Garlic fries are SUPER GREAT.  Shakes are made with soft serve, not ice cream, so be aware of that.  House-made pickles.  

This is a great burger place if you're looking for a greasy, heart-attack style cheeseburger.  You'd be hard pressed to find a better burger downtown.
author: Jace P.

description: I like that they have a mini burger for smaller appetites. it is a clean and well lit place, but the machine to dry your hands in the restroom is too fa from the sink!  Dripping water means slick floor which is a tort waiting to happen.  Other than that, great experience!
author: Leslie K.

description:
Went there today (Sunday night), quarter to nine. Place didn't have more than 15 people, a lot of space to sit down. I wanted take-out, so I ordered a Super Burger (8oz, 2 patties) with cheese and bacon, plus a serving of garlic fries. Both were wrapped tight, and were still warm even after a 10 minute walk back to the hotel in the rain. Juicy, very tasty burger, and great garlic fries. All the veggies in the burger were fresh, the patties were cooked just right to be juicy.

Hands down, one of the best burgers I've ever had. Will definitely visit again.
author: Eleftherios A.

description:
A bigger burger is NOT better.  

I've been to a few of the Super Duper's in the city and this one has been the better of the lot.  I've gone in being really hungry and ordered a Super burger.  It was just too much meat ... I can't believe I said that.  I've found that a smaller, Mini at 1/4 pound was just right.  With the garlic fries, it was a good meal.

Burgers are topped with lettuce, onion and Super Sauce.  Also tried the Spiked Milkshake.  It was good, but couldn't finish it.  Guess I have to share it if I want it.

They may not replace my favorite Mission Bowling Club, but it's a good burger, with plenty of other options, including veggie.
author: Michael M.

description: Their burgers are amazing! The beef and all the ingredients are just so flavorful. The fries are also delicious. There's generally a long line here, but it's worth the wait! I don't have anything to recommend, because everything I've tried so far have all been very delicious.
author: John D.

description:
this milkshake was just squeezed out of the teats of a strawberry cow.

also, the burger patty has the most delicious peppery crust. mmm crust.
author: Lianne Z.

description:
Super Duper Burgers has super duper burgers! Extremely juicy, flavorful with the right spices, on a very tasty bun. Move over, In-N-Out. 

I do wish they had onion rings, though. I'm not a fan of fries.
author: K. E.

description: Good burgers but way overpriced 50 bucks for 3 burgers come on rip.Ill go to the store and make my own for a dollar
author: Mike H.

description:
Wow! That was a helluva burger! YUM! And garlic fries with parmesan - f*ck yeah! And a cold refreshing pilsner - yes please! And homemade pickles - well OK, twist my arm. This placed kicked ass! There was a long line to order when we came in, but they are quick and efficient with taking/filling orders, and they give you one of those vibrating pager things so you know when your food is ready. It's a good system -  you can enjoy your conversation without having to listen for them to call your name over the clamor of a busy burger joint. 

Oh, and did I mention Happy Hour? Yes, 50 cent fries during happy hour, and I think we got a deal on the beer too. Our bill was $32 for two tall pilsners, two super-duper burgers (double patties) with added bacon and cheese, and two orders of garlic fries. Sounds like a bargain to me. 

This place is conveniently located off Union Square, so I suspect it is busy at all hours of the day and night, but there still appears to be plenty of seating and quick service. I ordered my burger with EVERYTHING and added bacon, cheese, jalapenos, and grilled onions. It was perfectly spicy, juicy, and delicious when I was SO TOTALLY in the mood for a good burger - HIT THE SPOT!

If this place was in my East Bay neighborhood, I would go here all the time, but I will definitely hit it again next time I'm in the Union Square area. If you are in the mood for an awesome burger on my side of the bay - try Grazzy Burger and Albany Tap Room - it beats out Super Duper, but only by the slimmest margin...and probably because it's walking distance from my house and once I've walked home from there, I feel slightly less guilty about slamming down more than 1500 calories worth of red meat and beer in a single sitting.

PS - After dinner we did a little post-holiday shopping and then traveled home to watch a movie on HBO. Halfway through the aforementioned movie, the leftover half of my burger mysteriously made its way out of its fancy foil bag and down my gullet. I couldn't help myself.
author: Rebecca D.

description:
Almost lost my appetite when I saw someone walk by the window all bloodied. I hope he's ok...

Delicious burger. You really only need the mini-burger (with cheese). Fries were also fresh-cut excellent too!
author: Jason S.

description: Very good taste,  taste like fresh however I feel like they could be a little bit bigger to be completely satisfying.  The price is quite alright although once again I feel they are an little bit small.
author: Marcos R.

description: Meal for champs: mini burger (1 patty instead of the usual 2 in the super burger) with everything + cheese, grilled onions, and jalapenos; order of garlic fries; a side of their fresh homemade pickles; chocolate shake if you're feeling ambitious. Warning: you will feel like an utter fat ass after consuming said meal, but it'll be worth it cuz it's so wonderfully delicious.
author: Will Z.

description: Was in the mood for a hamburger and checked this place out.  Good, fresh food!  Pickles are like no others and could have just eaten them but I would have missed out on the perfectly cooked burger
author: Shaun M.

description: Awesome burger but  the service is hit or miss sometimes. I know im a pain in the ass with the plain burger and all... but they do screw the order up from time to time so be sure to check.
author: Phillip J F.

description: Super duper burger, what can I say. The staff was super duper friendly. The food was super duper amazing. The price was super duper reasonable. The ambiance is super duper chill. Honestly, it's always a great time here. Livin life to the super duper fullest! :-)
author: Mayra M.

description: Got a mini combo menu + cheddar cheese for 9.75$. The hamburger was amazing and I could not finish all fries! The only negative aspect: there is not wi-fi!
author: Marica C.

description: I have to rave about the Garlic Fries!! They are so good! The mini burger was just right for me great flavor. My Partner have the Vegi-Burger and loved it and herb Tea for under $10 each.
author: Christopher S.

description:
I got a very hipster vibe when I walked into this place.  I should've heeded my instincts and left, but I was hungry.  I got a double with cheese, fries, and a milkshake.  The burger was pretty small! :-(  Maybe I was hungry, but I ate everything and thought about ordering another tiny $7 burger...  I raided my snack drawer at work instead.  The shake was nothing memorable.  

As much as I thought I'd never return, I met up with an friend here while he was in town for business.  I again got a burger that I again thought was too small.  This time, I got a soda with the burger.  The guy at the register rang up french fries ($2.00) instead of the soda ($2.00).  While waiting, I noticed my receipt was incorrect.  I brought it to his attention, and three other people working back there quipped back that they were both the same price, and one handed me a cup.  Look, I may have gone to college, and I may work in an office, but yes, I too can do math.  I wasn't trying to raise hell, I just wanted a drink, not fries.  Thank you all for chiming in.  

For the price, I'd rather deal with the Market St. element and grab a burger from Pearls.
author: ROB L.

description: Not so impressed.  Been here a couple times.  This time the bun was stale.  Pricey.  Too much garlic on fries.  And I love garlic.  Pickles are good.
author: Jay W.

description: Honestly I was really surprised with this place it was a lot better then I expected!! I got the bacon cheese burger and the garlic fries the burger was big and juicy and the fries were crisp and full of flavor besides the crazy homeless dude who came in and started to shout out how much of a dumb ass me and the others who were waiting in line were just because we were waiting in line for a burger... Lol yeah it made the experience that much better because I thought it was hilarious. This burger is welll worth the price spend the extra for the cheese and the bacon it's well worth it ! I will most definitely be back!
author: Samuel R.

description: I'm a super duper fan. I love their burgers at Super Duper. Eaten here a couple times. We like the one at the Marina district too. The burgers are delicious! I don't know what they put in it but it's very tasty & greasy-licious! From the bun, beef, condiments to the sauce. Yum! Love it. Will definitely eat here when craving for burgers.
author: Amy H.

description:
Food here was pretty good. I ordered a chicken sandwich with "everything" on it (lettuce, tomato, onions, sauce), and garlic fries. The sandwich was a little bit small, but the chicken was tender, and the chipotle sauce was tasty. The garlic fries were good (not too much garlic), but they were extremely greasy.

The line was long, almost out the door, but it moved quickly. The interior was also pretty big, and I was able to find a seat easily.
author: Varun N.

description:
Enjoyable burgers.  A bit expensive, coming in at like $10 for the burger/fries/drink.  The meat was well seasoned and the fries were good too.  Everything seemed really fresh and of good quality.   Good drink selection too. 

A welcome addition to the new Metreon area.
author: Dan G.

description: Like the Market location, outstanding and even better is that the line mid-week for lunch is usually not as bad as the one on Market.  Great Super burger with cheese today, though still think the beef-to-bun ratio needs to be worked on for the 1/2 pounder with them switching to a single large patty on a larger circumference bun vs. the stacking method, though those looking to limit carbs would like the current arrangement.
author: Marc S.

description:
I know burgers are fattening. Guilty as charged...BUT you need some grease in your system and this is where I get mine.

Wine and Super Duper burger with fries on the side please :)
author: Rio S.

description: These burgers were Damn Good. That means a lot coming from me.  A True Burger Connisour!
author: Caligula J.

description: Awesomesauce! Definitely on the greasier side, but if you're hungering for a real burger this is the place to go. They have jars of pickles at the condiments/drinks stand that compliments the greasiness of the burger well.
author: Thomas C.

description:
So, so great. I'd easily rank it one of my top five burgers (and I eat a lot of burgers.)

I tend to be indecisive about burger toppings and end up with at least five different things on it - and Super Duper was no exception. I got their "everything on it" toppings (lettuce, tomato, red onions, Super Sauce) as well as avocado, bacon, and a fried egg. The fried egg was fried over easy, which I sort of which they'd given me a heads up about - I'm not a huge fan of runny egg yolk, but it wasn't that big of a deal. Everything else was delicious; despite the fact that I'd put around 70% of the toppings they offer on it, the beef patty still held its own and was memorable in its own right.

The garlic fries were also great - perhaps a little salty toward the bottom, when you get to the fries that are soaking in the garlic and oil - but a nice alternative to standard-issue fries, and topped with cheese to boot.

You can't go wrong. If they had one of these where I live, I'd be back every week. In fact, it's probably better that they don't...
author: Cat G.

description:
Some people have an insatiable lust for meat. The meat here is salty, juicy, slightly firm, and oozes in your mouth. Get your mind out of the gutter. I got my Super burger with grilled portabellos, grilled onions, and loaded on the homemade pickles.

If burgers were graded on a scale of Gandhi to Arnold in meatiness, this burger would be a solid Vin Diesel.

Not as keen on the overly greasy garlic fries, however.
author: Ben T.

description: Best burgers in the financial district / union square area, milkshakes here are awesome thick and very cold!!
author: N A.

description:
good business as always and be patient waiting in line and for the food :)
reasonable priced and the veggie burger is tasteful. so does the strawberry shake! must try!
author: Freya-Loki O.

description:
I was a little underwhelmed with this place having a 4.5 rating, but it was pretty good. 

I had a super burger with cheese and bacon, garlic fries, and a strawberry shake, came out to $18 :(.

Burger: 4 stars
The burger was meaty and juicy and I like the super sauce that they put on it. I don't know what it is about Niman Ranch beef but it has this different taste to it, and I'm not sure how I feel about it, but that's a Niman Ranch thing and not a Super Duper thing. They put a generous amount of cheese on the burger. My only complaint about the burger was the bacon. I found myself halfway through the burger and didn't remember tasting any bacon. There wasn't much bacon on the burger and the flavor of the bacon that was there just didn't go through

Garlic fries: 4.5 stars
The fries themselves are pretty good but with the garlic and parmesan really make the fries very good.  Along with the 3 dipping sauces, the fries were the highlight of the meal.

Strawberry shake: 2.5 stars
Very average and for $6, I would never get it again. It was more liquidy than creamy and just didn't have much flavor, I hardly tasted any strawberries.

Overall, the food here is 4 stars, but for the money I think its more like 3.5 stars.
author: Keith R.

description:
After watching the awesomeness that is Pacific Rim IMAX, we decided to come here due to good ratings and free fries with movie tickets. 
Ordered the Super Duper burger, which is basically double patties, with bacon and cheese. "Everything on it", which don't really include everything, plus grilled onion. 

The free fries from movie ticket shows up as $2.25 discount so I think you can pick garlic fries instead with extra 50c. 

The patties were very juicy and tasty, slightly to the salty side but still yummy. The bread was unremarkable.. meaning it's not bad or particularly good. The toppings were fresh and went well with the burger, except the bacon. It didn't add anything so I will pass it next time.

The fries were good and it's better with garlic and cheese, not particularly remarkable though.
author: Agustinus T.

description: I loved it here! The burgers are really juicy and deliciously made. The fries are perfectly crisp and their pickles are so great. I have yet to try their other items but I really liked it here. I definitely would try their burgers again!
author: Natalie M.

description:
Sometimes the burgers are awesome, sometimes its dry and overcooked...
And I saw the food handler snag a couple of my fries while i was walking up to get my burger :-(
author: Harold W.

description: I was getting hangry and needed something quick, not entirely fast food and delicious. We ordered a super duper burger, chicken sandwich with jack cheese, garlic fries and a fresh strawberry super shake. It was all pretty darn good! Although not listed on their menus, they sell beer - which would've been nice to know because I would've gotten one.
author: Christian D.

description:
Apathetic "I hate my job" counter service = lame, frustrating meal.

I cannot tell you how excited I was to see this restaurant open at the "new" Metreon only to see my hopes come crashing down to one lame-brained woman.

Let's face it, the "old" Meteron sucked so bad in so many ways that we all know that this re-birth is actually exciting. Most importantly a diverse array of new restaurants has arrived so we have real fast options before or after a movie. To my knowledge this is the only place open until 11pm on a Saturday night so we planned our post-movie meal around this schedule.

To my surprise arriving at 10:15pm the place was completely empty -- devoid of all customers except for the staff to serve us -- just us!

So you know when when you go to McDonalds and the beat-down employees just stare blankly past you, no greeting and roboticized responses? Yeah, not too fun. SO WE CAME TO YOUR RESTAURANT SPECIFICALLY TO AVOID THIS TYPE OF NON-INTERACTION. YOU FAILED US SUPER DUPER.

As we approached our apathetic, listless female cashier I knew we were in trouble. Instead of greeting us I could see she mentally planning her next trip to Hot Topic and reminiscing about past Sevendust concerts.

So after visiting another branch of this restaurant we knew the drill and ordered our burgers. How hard is this? Order burgers and tell them what you want on them.

Yeah, they fucked it up. So apparently you cannot get what you want. Counter-intuitively you automatically get "everything" and then have to deduct from it. Both me and my girlfriend made specific requests as to what we wanted on our burgers. To our disappointment we were not served what we ordered. Instead we both got everything and our requests were ignored.

When I tried to engage our cashier about this she just blankly looked on and a manager intervened and tried to explain how burgers come with everything and she offered to cook us new ones.

NO NO NO. Just listen to your customers the first time! Don't make us "do it your way". This is so stupid.

Oh, and the fries were way over-cooked. Nice job Super Duper and good luck keeping this charade going.

PS-- try putting real, round pickles on the burgers too, not the sliced pickles. Duh alert!
author: Dave B.

description:
I had a burger here before and it was good, but it was dripping with grease and I had to literally mop up after the burger. It even dripped on my coat as I was biting it.

The five stars are for the Swirl Cone. I love soft-serve cone and this place has the tastiest, creamiest soft-serve cone ever, and they have the Swirl which is my favorite ever.

The soft-serve tastes sooo good and it's not too sweet. It's definitely not cheap - $3.75 for a cone. However, it is like a tower of creamy yum-yum, so it is a well-deserved price. Even McD's cones are now more than a dollar and they are not as big or half as good as these ones.

Oh, and they use organic milk.
author: July N.

description:
One of the greatest burgers ever. This place never disappoints. A mini-burger (with one patty), grilled onions and jalapenos is my go-to item. Food is quick, you get unlimited pickles and the garlic fries aren't bad either. 

I also love the eco-friendly atmosphere this place has to offer - everything's compostable! I've gone here time and time again and will keep coming!
author: Mimi V.

description: This was my first time eating at this location. It was around 6pm and pretty busy. I ordered a super burger with cheese and bacon. When I got it I started eating it and it seemed extra raw as if it wasn't even cooked. So I examined it and notice that one of the patties was extremely undercooked and the other was eatable but still pretty nauseating. I took a photo just in case I got sick from eating it.
author: Eskay E.

description:
Expensive. The burgers are fine. The fries are tasty (especially those garlic fries). I enjoyed their lemonade but...

Can the management at this location please, PLEASE try to teach the employees how to swirl an ice cream cone? The two times I've bought their super duper organic chocolate dipped lalala ice cream from happily raised cow (jk), it has turned into a mess. It's not a nice tall cone, it's a blob of ice cream about to fall off a too-small cone. I would *like* to actually enjoy the ice cream instead of eating it like a maniac to avoid it dripping all over my hands and the ground. For a cone that costs flippin' $4, I expect better. McDonald's is pwning you guys in this department. SAD.
author: Miffy Y.

description:
Very good burgers and quick service. My favorite is a Super Burger with a fried egg and cambozola blue.

But extremely noisy and crowded so as conducive to conversation as some other lunch spots in the area.
author: Labs P.

description:
My first experience here left something to be desired.  I got a veggie burger and added on a side of fries.  The burger sounded appetizing and included hummus and I was excited to try it out.  Sadly, the burger was a let-down.  The hummus had virtually no flavor, and the burger was so greasy that it dripped everywhere.  The bun was one of those flavorless white buns.  Fries were soggy with oil and tasteless.

I did enjoy their selection of unique drinks and the atmosphere.  Unfortunately, I would not return for their less-than-flavorful veggie burger.  Maybe the beef is better?

The staff are quite personable and nice.
author: Christina S.

description:
Maybe biting into a burger at Super Duper causes amnesia, but I really can't remember tasting a better burger anywhere else! I mean, I love In'n'Out, Nations,  and plenty of other burger joints, but seriously, my most recent trip to Super Duper had me thinking it was the best burger I've ever put in my face. 

They've got tons of options to customize your burger and your meal. You can even add a fried egg on top! I've always wanted to, but keep forgetting when I go up to order. NEXT TIME.     :-)  

If you're a milkshake lover, you'll love Super Duper even more. I recently had a strawberry shake (with REAL strawberries) and I was in heaven for the whole 10 minutes or less that it took me to down the delicious treat. 

Here's why it's not 5 star for me. Everyone talks about their pickles. And I LOVE pickles. Dill in particular. When I first heard about Super Duper and that they make their own pickles, I was really excited! But you know what? They're not good. I'm sorry. I've tried them every time I go and they just plain taste WEIRD. It must be in the brine they use or something, but it's just a disappointment every time. Bummer to an otherwise amazing meal.
author: Meredith S.

description:
(Metaissue: my first review was deleted.  Why, Yelp?  Curiously, Ed O., the manager messaged me having seen my disapproval. Is this a case of Yelp making reviews disappear?  I didn't even get an email about it.  Lame.)

I came here last Saturday at the behest of a band mate who swore by the burgers.  Despite the three of us ordering back-to-back-to-back, my number never got called.  Ten minutes later after they got their food, I had to ask the counter people what happened to mine.  Turns out it was sitting right there, they just ignored or forgot about it.  My first review read "I've received better service at McDonald's" or something to that effect.  I believe this is an honest criticism of this place.

OK, so maybe my review got flagged for it being one line?  First off, brevity/minimalism is the goal of both art and engineering.  If you can do beauty or efficiency with little, you're seen as a genius.  (Example: the riff that defines Beethoven's 5th.)  But you want more?  OK, let me review the burger.

The burger wasn't bad, but it wasn't the best thing in the world.  I actually don't mind that it was insanely greasy, I quite like that, actually.  But it just wasn't worth the price I paid.

So, between the barrel bottom service and the OK burger, 1 star, Yelp's "Eek! Methinks not." certainly applies here.
author: Jim S.

description: Amazing!!! One of the best burgers I've ever had and the garlic fries are fraggin amazing!
author: Mark H.

description:
The menu offers their burgers cooked medium, but I discovered that if you ask the staff to have them prepared 'well done' you will end up with a much nicer flavor & much less grease.  They have managed to make the ordinary burger & fries menu enticing--stressing quality & making a point to use organic & sustainable products.  Doing comparison shopping, there really is a nice taste difference.  The designers have created an ambiance that is upbeat with coup de chapeau to retro looks of the Late 19th Century signage style.  The look is simple, paired down, so that the focus in on the food.  Using the smaller sized aluminum serving trays adds a visual plus--along with the paper lining that comes with each tray.  They stress that their disposable materials are compostable.  They seem to have managed to engage the giants (Burger King, McDonalds) by offering the same products that just taste better with a flair that enhances the atmosphere without the overkill of Mel's Diner.  Her Imperial Highness, The Princess Meltia Bonaparte, 
wishes to add Super Duper to her Empire.  She wishes to have Cartier create a "Burgers With A Flair" medal for the Knighthood she wishes to establish for them.  


I hope, unlike so many other places, that they do NOT add a television. Who needs to be hooked up with that stuff 24/7?

The designers of the  location near the Metreon, 783 MIssion Street-San Francisco, anticipated  the space needs of San Francisco-based patrons & out of city tourist guests by having hooks specifically designed to bear the weight of a back pack.  These have been inconspicuously yet perfectly placed underneath the table tops of the dining area. This is a very thoughtful plus on the part of the Super Duper design team!
author: Thomas O.

description:
I don't know... Maybe it's been too long since I've had a fast-food tasting burger but this one tasted extremely salty and was very greasy. It was good for a few bites but then you get overwhelmed by it. 
I would rather pay an extra dollar or two and go to Roam Burger, which has high quality meat that speaks for itself and doesn't need to be doused in sugar and dripping grease... But that's just me.
Their garlic fries were good, they reminded me of the ones I used to get at A's games.
author: Kristen R.

description:
The burger was good, but nothing earth shattering or drastically different than what I've had from other places.  It was juicy and cooked to the perfect temperature.  The spiked milkshake was not good at all, and I don't think I would order it again.  The alcohol was not detectable from a potency standpoint, but added a weird flavor to it.

I would come here again, but not frequent this place
author: Kenyon S.

description:
Chipotle:Taco Bell as Super Duper Burger: In-N-Out. 
So, yeah. It's awesome. 
Even the veggie burger is amazing. 


Rating Scale:
1 Star: Avoid the town in which this place is located just to be safe.  
2 Star: With so many great places to choose from, why risk this one?
3 Star: I'll try it again or consume here in a pinch.
4 Star: I go here regularly if financially and/or calorically feasible.
5 Star: I look forward to taking my wife or friends here.
author: Michael T.

description:
This aptly named burger joint does not disappoint. As a somewhat recent NYC transplant, I liken Super Duper to Shake Shack (http://www.shakeshack.com/), one of my NYC favorite burger joints. The burgers are similarly simple, fresh, juicy, and satisfying, but Super Duper has distinctively San Francisco touches with its Niman Ranch beef patties, compostable packaging, garlic fries, and Straus dairy products. But great ingredients don't guarantee great food; fortunately, Super Duper's execution is nearly flawless.   

To top it off, the menu is reasonably priced and the restaurant spotless.  They also have high chairs.
author: Chris T.

description: The food was really good but it was the service that made this place spectacular. I was riding solo with my two daughters (3 & 5) and it was a bit stressful since they were low blood sugar (as was I) and the line was out the door. To my surprise the line moved really quickly and when I got to the front the cashier was really understanding of the meltdown my one daughter was having in the corner. The manager fixed a mistake on my receipt without any hassle. And when my other daughter spilled her entire lemonade, they were on top of it and not a single eye roll in the house. They actually has more patience with my kids than I did. I would definitely come back.
author: Michael K.

description:
EVIL! THIS PLACE IS EVIL! YOU'VE BEEN WARNED! 

We came here today for the fifth time and we both had our usual: the "mini burger" (a standard single anywhere else) with cheese, sautéd onions, jalapeños and bacon. At the urging of our Korean friend Todd, we tried it with a fried egg on top. 

My god! My god! It was the missing ingredient! 

Egg on a burger sounds out of place. Hell, it even sounds a little gross. But it's SO NOT! The egg yolk adds a richness and moistness to the burger - it's like yet another sauce on the burger. It was a little messy to eat, but... oh my... so worth the mess. 

Somebody back there in the kitchen sold his soul to the devil in exchange for the ability to cook the most ungodly delicious burgers this side of everywhere. They put something in them whereby, once eaten, you will crave it even in your sleep!  If you're near a Super Duper, all other lunch options fade into obscurity. 

Evil, I tell ya! EVIL!

Three words: 

GET. THE. EGG.

---

BTW - make sure the yolk is runny or it is not nearly as good. Unlike mine, which was perfect, my S.O's egg was well-done and he said it made the burger a little bland. I's a delicate dance of textures and flavors and it doesn't work if the egg yolk is fully cooked. Check the egg right when you get it and make sure to break it right away so it flows over the meat. If it's fully cooked, send it back.
author: Tim W.

description:
This place has the freshest burgers around. They use all natural Niman Ranch beef and the patty is really tender. You can definitely taste the freshness in the meat. In fact, all the ingredients taste fresh. One of their selling points is their slow food values, which I feel, pays off.

The super burger with everything is the way to go. It does cause somewhat of a mess, though. If you're afraid of getting your hands dirty, I don't recommend eating here. The burgers are kind of greasy, but it's definitely worth it. I haven't taken the leap and ordered a fried egg on my burger yet, but I love that I have the option! Also, definitely try their garlic fries if you don't want to socialize for a while. They are super garlicky and cheesy. Delicious!

I still prefer In-n-Out's burgers, but this is definitely an excellent burger choice.
author: Vince L.

description:
I've been here several times and it's always a win. They have 2 sizes of burgers, and if you don't have a huge appetite the smaller of the two with a side of fries is more than enough. This place is great to hit up before you walk practically next door to the movies at the Metreon. 

Like others have said, the burgers are always juicy and flavorful -- not like the hockey pucks you'll get at McDonald's. Everything is super fresh and service is quick. I am never disappointed when I eat here.
author: Lori M.

description:
I loved this burger. It is far better than any burger I've ever attempted to grill myself or had at another restaurant.

I've eaten at a lot of specialty burger joints (i.e. 5 Guys, Backyard Burger, Fuddruckers, etc), but Super Duper Burger caught me totally by surprise. It was basically the best burger ever. Yeah, that is saying a lot, but I wouldn't say it if I didn't feel it were true. 

The burger was juicy and delicious. I was a bit disconcerted by the pink inside the burger, but the signs clearly state that they grind their own meat fresh, so it may be pink (i.e. rare). Frankly, I think having the burger rare is what makes it so good, but I wouldn't trust it from any other burger joint. 

I also had the garlic fries. They were good, but I had dragon-breath for hours afterwards. I only discovered later that garlic fries are a San Francisco thing and everybody sells them. They were okay.

I would go back to San Francisco just to eat this burger alone!
author: Mach S.

description:
Super Duper burgers is a solid staple of a lunch joint.  The burgers are tasty and juicy, although they do shade a bit too much on the salty side for my tastes.  

Aside from that, there are really no other serious knocks on Super Duper. The food comes out quick, and a lunch there will only run you about 8 bucks, so it won't put a serious dent in your wallet.

I wouldn't travel from far away to grab lunch here, but if you're in the area you will  not be disappointed if you dine here.
author: Jonathan M.

description: This burger joint is THE place to go when you crave for good burgers and you don't care about your diet.  The burgers are so juicy and cooked to perfection, I always get mine with eggs & jalapenos.  It's amazing!!!
author: Katie N.

description:
Garlic fries. Had to get a second order because I just couldn't have enough!

The cheese and garlic go really well together and the fries are perfectly crispy.
author: Jason M.

description:
The trend of overpriced gourmet burgers, I guess, will stay with us for little while longer. Most of these burger places produce a "good" burger, but the prices are a little outrageous. 

SDB is a perfect example of this trend. The service was great, restaurant was clean and the burger was ok. The only issue is I paid $9.50 for a burger and a soda. For that much money I want a memorable burger experience. To compare apples to apples, Phil's Sliders in Berkeley is much more expensive, the burgers are smaller and the service was so-so. Yet I want to go back to Phil's Sliders. That small little burger was amazing and the vanilla shake and tater tots were equal in quality to the burger.  I feel SBD doesn't stack up to Phil's in terms of taste and uniqueness of the menu. 

SDB really isn't much different than all the chain "gourmet" places like smash burger and shake shack. Afterwards, I had to walk off the rock in my stomach...the burger was a bit too greasy and too expensive for the quality.

I give it a very weak 3 stars.
author: Rob B.

description:
LOVE THIS PLACE. 

Delicious burgers. This location is bigger than the one on Market but it also gets busy. They do move the line quickly though.  

If you get the Super Duper, get it with an egg. You will have tons of protein but I do feel I am eating a heart attack... And the garlic fries are delicious!
author: Rob L.

description:
Super Duper never disappoints. 

Came shortly after the lunch rush - so I was expecting a messy lobby, tired workers (aka subpar food and poor service), and a shortage of pickles/napkins/lemons. This was not the case! Most of the seats were taken, but everyone looked genuinely happy with their food. The pickle/condiment bar was fully stocked and there was no giant pile of dishes to be seen. 

We ordered and the gals were friendly and got our orders right. I had a super burger with everything and jalapenos. The rest of the group also had burgers - one lettuce wrapped, fries, and lemonade. The lemonade here is GREAT! Not sure if it's fresh-squeezed, but if they told me it was, I would surely believe it. The fries were piping hot and crispy - not very greasy to the touch. The burgers were done medium (perfect!) and juicy. The patty here is always well seasoned and highlights the beefy goodness. The veggies on the burger were nice and fresh, and the jalapenos made me sweat (literally). As Connie S. put it as she inhaled her burger -"this place is hella nom nom!"

I was going to give this place four stars - and then out of the corner of my eye, I see the gal that gave us our burgers. She was going around to the tables to check in with them to see how their meal was. She genuinely wanted to know how their team was doing. She made it to us and we happily gave our opinion. That's AWESOME service!
author: Mar A.

description: Super duper's burger was good but is not as tasty as In-N-Out in my opinion. The quality of the beef is top notch and their home made pickles are delicious.  I don't know why the bottom of my burger was soggy by the time I got it (I thought each burger was made to order).  The service is very friendly.
author: Kai C.

description:
Finally a place that is quick on the go if need be and can find a healthy choice! I only tried one item here, but what I did try I was pleasantly surprised..It was a nice healthy chicken sandwhich...The chicken was a real unbreaded chicken breast they cook as you order..They dont let it sit under lights.  The bun was a nice wheat bun...With all the fixings of lettece tomatos and homemade pickles which was a nice touch..

I am glad they offer healthy selections when people are rushing and on the go! I will return.
author: Vivian R.

description:
Food Quality - Excellent.
Food Taste - Excellent.
Food Originality - Good.
Price - Excellent
Customer Service - Excellent.

Best Burger, and Shakes Ever. This has become a weekly addiction.
author: Vibhor C.

description:
As far as take-away, fast food burgers go, this is one of the best.

Fresh, hand made burgers. not Much else to add that it was great.
author: Ben M.

description: Great name, great place and a great burger. A touch on the salty side - but not enough for me to remove a star. Very friendly service, excellent fries and shakes too!
author: Erika E.

description:
Mmhmm! The bf and I stopped by for lunch after roaming the MOMA and downtown yesterday. We decided to share a double cheeseburger with everything + blue cheese + egg and the garlic fries + 3 sauces since we weren't too hungry yet. Yes, it gets kind of pricey to eat here ($15 for what we ordered), but it's good stuff. I'm normally not a burger type of girl but I like the burgers at Super Duper. They're juicy and flavorful and never dry! Service was fairly quick yesterday, just about as soon as we grabbed a seat and filled our water cups, the beeper went off and the bf went to grab the food. The patrons sitting next to us caught a big whiff of the garlic fries we ordered and were immediately disappointed they only ordered regular fries. 

While I'm not as blown away as the first time I had Super Duper last summer, they still make pretty super duper burgers in my books!
author: Sarah L.

description: d-licious burgers! (wished they had Gluten-free buns...)
author: Brad N.

description:
Super Duper Burger is at the Metreon, but the entrance is outside of it. The place is pretty big and there's quite a lot of communal tables with bag hooks underneath them.

== Food ==

Mini cheese burger. Added cheese. The burger comes medium cooked with choice of condiments and toppings. The beef is quite juicy and the toppings are fresh. It's quite a solid burger.

Garlic fries are quite delicious here. Quite the garlic flavor. They don't skimp on the amount of garlic they toss on this. There's a quite a bit of cheese on top also.

Grab some housemade pickles while you're there! They're awesome.

== Service ==

Quick service. The burgers are made to order and takes around 5-10 minutes for them to be ready.

== Overall ==

Solid burger. The garlic fries are delicious. Quick service.
author: Steven B.

description: A solid 3.5 stars.  The food was pretty good! I devoured my fries and some of the hub's.  The soft serve cones were okay.  It's probs more on par with a four but it just seemed a little messy behind the counter. Get the fries!!!
author: Cassie P.

description: It's like an In-n-Out burger, but with a higher quality meat patty.  They have a wide selection on the menu, including ice cream.  It's a little on the pricey side, but fairly typical if not cheap for the city.
author: Patrick R.

description: My favorite burger in town doesn't come with table service. It comes with a self-service pickle jar packed with house-made goodness.
author: David S.

description:
kinda like shake shack, but 4/5 stars lol sorry! i got the mini with the fixins and geoff got his usual just cheese, ketchup and mayo

however, their garlic fries are AMAZING so back up to 5 stars

chocolate milkshake is great.

great place overall for a quick lunch or dinner
author: Diana P.

description:
O.
M.
G.

I think this place is going onto my list as my second favourite burger place *EVER*. I'm also super happy it's right near my workplace (unlike my first favourite, located in North Beach).

I'd been to the location on Market but it's been awhile and I forgot what it was like. We came in last week for lunch and I ordered the veggie burger while my coworker got the cheeseburger and we split a side of fries. 

Fair warning, the burgers are small, they almost feel like sliders given their size, but they pack a lot of flavour and toppings inside. I needed a fork towards the end, given how much of it was falling out. 

Fries are crispy and delicious and there's a lot of options if you want something more than just plain fries. 

Help yourself to the free homemade pickles, they're absolutely amazing. Next time I might try actually getting them onto the burger instead of eating a dozen straight up. 

This is one of the few places that has a vegetable patty that I actually really like (I'm more partial to soy patties that have a more meaty texture instead of grains and legumes and corn). 

It's a bit on the pricy side, especially if you get one of the shakes. I'd like to try one at some point, but given the price of a burger and fry and a regular drink, plus the sheer volume of calories, I think I'll hold off on the shake and leave it for a dessert run through some other day.
author: Cassandra J.

description:
*plain great burger without feeling like a fat ass*
#cookedperfectly 
#yumbuns

My boss is a picky eater, so after stopping by a cafe, and Jimmy John's, I knew he'd like a burger and quickly yelped a place. This place jumped out and was very close to our next appointment. WOW, totally caught off guard by this place. Way bigger with plenty of sitting on the inside with a top floor. I'm sure it gets busy in the peak of lunch hour, but seemed to have a perfect flow of traffic when we went. 

They seem to take a page from the In n' Out menu and provide a very simple menu with a burger and a double patty as your main choices. They do it way better than In N' Out which I still don't understand the infatuation people have with the place. The order didn't take more than 10 minutes. GLASS CUPS for our beverages which is...unheard of and adds a simple amount of class to a place. 

The burger simply, surprised the shit out of me (well...maybe a few hours later), but it really was delicious, cooked perfectly medium as advertised, and the bun was toastedly buttered to a crispy and great degree. The fries were a great portion and smaller than the average fat american portion of fries. 

I was just really impressed at how good an 8.50 single patti, french fry, and drink combo was on a whim. Well worth every penny.
author: Kevin T.

description: Ok so here is the deal, i love super duper but this particular location is unable to make a decent swirl cone (50% chocolate, 50% vanilla) because their soft serve machine is apparently broken (or so I've heard from the staff) so it ends up being 90% chocolate / 10% vanilla. This has been going on for at least 6 months like it's nothing (I go to that particular location about every other week). I have reported the issue to the otherwise very friendly staff several times, they don't seem to give a sh**.
author: Greg U.

description: If you're gonna have a burger, you should have a juicy one with a side of fries, and a beer. Even though I don't have the beer all the time, their burgers are great. I especially enjoy the house made pickles!
author: Theresa D.

description: They completed messed up with my simple order of mini combo .   Well that was fine but I Asked for veggie and provided beef :(
author: abhishek s.

description:
I originally passed by this place wanting to try the organic soft-serve ice cream. I came here with a friend for dinner and boy, eating here made me feel like a fatty - in a good way.

I got the Mini burger combo (a Mini burger with fries and a drink) and a small soft-served ice cream cone.. The combo came with a fairly large amount of fries (of which, I should've done without). A Mini burger is enough to fill you - the only difference between the Mini and the Regular is the number of patties in the hamburger (one vs two). The burger itself was pretty good - a bit more on the greasy side, no doubt, but tasty! Especially with their homemade, complimentary pickles :)
And the ice cream? It was exactly what I wanted. Definitely a difference between this stuff and your regular soft-serve. I thoroughly enjoyed the vanilla flavor.

This place left a good impression on me. Good casual dinner hangout :)
author: Ann V.

description:
"Super" is definitely the correct term for these burgers. The patties are SUPER!! It's bigger than the size of the bun. Imagine that with the rest of the toppings in it. Now that makes it "Super Duper" indeed.

I love the idea of creating your own burger on what you would like to put in it. In my case, everything in it with cheese, bacon and an egg. I'd stack with avocados too! Countless possibilities :)

I can say the burgers are sloppy-good when the egg yolk oozes out. It comes to a point where I'm eating the burger in a 360 degree motion (no joke). You'll find yourself finishing the top bun with the bottom still fully in tack, and constantly pushing your patties back in. Oh yes... as long as it ends up in your belly!

Another reason for 5 stars is their unlimited homemade pickles!!! It's so delicious, I wish they can sell me a jar. Or can they?

Garlic fries definitely gives your breath the garlic kick. They add aged cheese to it as well which made it really good.

Overall, this place is full of awesome!
author: Nancy N.

description:
Stopped by here to get a late lunch bite.  Everything is made fresh and they warn you at the queue line that no matter what you order, expect about a 10-minute wait from this point.  Nice that they set expectations.

What I really enjoyed was that they offered smaller portion sizes for the burgers and shakes.  I'm not a kid, I don't want to order off the kid's menu, but dangit sometimes I just don't want so much food, and they accommodate!

I had the mini-burger with garlic fries, they even have a combo deal with that which includes a drink for I think it was like $8 (but I don't do sodas personally).  I was really tempted to opt-in for their delicious-looking organic ice cream shakes but next time.

The burger was nice and juicy, and the garlic fries were pretty good too.  4 stars for the service, the tasty burger, the smaller portion options, and the convenience of how late they open and how many locations they have.

Would eat here again!
author: Steve L.

description: Not great service - feels like you're bring pushed through a fast food machine. The burgers are tasty though. Better than fast food!
author: Genevieve J.

description:
Does Super Duper live up to its name? I would say so.

Went here for the first time with coworkers last Friday. Our group of five rolled in a little after noon and we found a line of about eight people ahead of us. While we waited, a server walked by and offered samples of fries and different sauces. Free samples always win points in my book.

The line was fairly quick. I ordered a mini burger (only one patty) with mushrooms (extra $1), a chocolate milk shake and added malt (extra $.50). It set me back about $12. The cashier was a super mellow but friendly guy. He offered me a free cup of water without me having to ask, which was nice. Some places make you feel like the biggest moocher if you dare ask for a cup of water.

I only had to wait about five min. for my food, which was rather speedy. There's plenty of seating and turnover is pretty quick. 

The burger itself was tasty! Juicy burgers cooked medium well, with delicious condiments and a slightly sweet bun. The portion size was decent too. Think of a slightly heftier In-N-Out burger.

I'll definitely be back.
author: Teresa G.

description: One of my top 3 burger spots! I love adding cheese and jalapeño peppers in mine. Be careful because it's juicy and so messy that you need 5+ napkins to eat it.  But it is so worth it.
author: Kristina N.

description:
I've had Super Duper before, but that's when I was on a budget, but time to try it again at a new location with my family (I had the one on Market in an earlier review).

After the tree lighting on black friday, we were expecting the other location to be packed, so we headed down the street to this location, judging by reviews, I guess this one is pretty new. It's not too different from the other location down the street, this includes upper-level seating as well.

This brings me to the part of why my review isn't 5 stars, the seating is sort of limited. There are a lot of seats though, but because of high traffic most of the time, there isn't much room to sit. In addition, the seating is more geared to ______ (okay, I tried remembering the exact name, but let's just say that there are long tables that seats a lot of people) type seating). But ya, if you try sitting in groups, it does get tough to find seats together. The seating arrangement that I awkwardly described above certainly invades private space that most americans certainly aren't used to.

Besides the seating layout, when you get over that, the food is still absolutely good. I was able to buy a Super Duper burger with bacon and everything with a beer. The organic ingredients certainly taste good. Again with my previous review though, the reason for making both of these reviews 4 stars, it is a bit greasy and expensive for what it's worth. The price is leaning towards sit-down restaurant prices, but I can compare this to other "medium" priced/quality places that cost a bit less for the same quality. My sister and mom may have been commenting that there is a lot of meat, but being a carnivore that I am, I didn't mind at all.

Again, I highly recommend eating here, but if you're on a college diet like me, eating here every so often is cool too lol.
author: Robert O.

description: An amazing burger! Finally somewhere that cooks hamburger medium as a rule, the way God intended. You really can't go wrong here. It is not the cheapest burger but everything was cooked excellent. I got my burger with an egg and it was one of the best sunny side up eggs I gave ever seen.
author: John P.

description: Just too good. Great service and pretty hip ambience. Overall great food and well deserved 5 star. Also a quick grab before the movies. Amc is right up.
author: Abhinav K.

description: Pics & smells better than taste...maybe improper execution? Beef no crust, build that BEEF taste, maybe busy & rushed order for us, rather wait longer for better. Maybe, maybe will try again if craving & nearby.
author: Burger B.

description: Mmmm, the veggie burger is perfect. Perfect bun with a smear of hummus and a nicely crisped patty. Get everything on it but sub out red onions for grilled onions (you'll thank me!). I haven't tried the fries, but the garlic ones smell heavenly. Definitely get a milkshake! The strawberry is my favorite. Craving this right now.
author: Diana C.

description:
Just got a message forwarded to my email from someone who suggested my Yelp reviews reminded them of some drunkard named Dad Boner on Twitter. That was pretty funny cause back when I started writing these reviews I don't think Twitter was a big thing yet. 

Super Duper Burger didn't exist back then, either. And I only saw a little bit of San Francisco proper on my way off the train and all. Now we work here full time and have cut down on the boozing, but my favorite part of Super Duper is still that they have a combo of burger, fries, and a drink and they will totally let you upgrade to a sweet Racer 5 IPA. 

I don't need two patties so I get the little "mini" one and the total with beer is $11-something. This location has the best people-watching; I get a seat up front and watch the world go by. You can also go shopping at the City Target afterward. 

I might like pickles as much as beer. These are pretty good ones and they are free or as I like to say "all-you-can eat". They also have some heat to them, which reminds me of this wing place I used to go to on all-you-can-eat Wing Wednesdays and they would cut their losses by making the wings so spicy on those nights that it was an effort to eat 6 of them. For $9.99. I don't think Super Duper is this devious, but going overboard on the pickles can make you hurt later. Word to the wise.
author: Caltrain D.

description: I like the burgers here.  Recently went right about noon and the line was not that long, was able to find seating, and order was available quickly.  All the pickles you can eat.
author: Michael P.

description:
Burgers made to order. 
The ingredients actually taste like them came from the supermarket and not some factory.  (Confirmed by a message i received from Super Duper)

Tastes way better than other fast food burgers.
Supposedly they have organic everything.

I dunno how i didn't know about this place earlier.  Dare i say it tastes better than In-n-Out-??  It at least tasted less heavy and greasy, but still tasted like a great burger.

First time?
Go for the burger, it's what they are there for.  Expand horizons on visit #2.

Note: Burgers are about the size of a In-n-out burger.
author: Steven F.

description: get the super burger with garlic fries, you wont regret it. its kind of a fast food restaurant and you wont wait a lot.
author: Iman B.

description:
This place serves a pretty damn tasty burger. 

I've come here a few times to grab dinner with friends, and each time it hasn't disappointed! The burger seems to be made fresh by hand, and grilled to order.  Fries here are good, and they serve beer here on tap! Semi-pricey (not going to beat In-n-Out prices) but not bad for San Francisco.  Think of this place as the West coast Shake Shack!

I would recommend the regular sized burger with everything on it, and make it a combo for 2.99!
author: Austin R.

description: Great food but it's overpriced and the customer service sucks.  The guy taking my order always rushes me,  anticipates what I want,  then fucks it up.  So after waiting forever and spending a ton,  I can't eat it,  have to send it back,  wait again, then get glared at as if I'm making up that they gave me the wrong burger.
author: Brandon N.

description:
Great tasting and quality burgers! The home cooked chocolate cookies and soft serve ice cream are an added bonus. 

The cost of quality food is the wait. Usually a long wait but if you have the time it's worth it.
author: Casey M.

description:
I don't know what to say but this is a good Burger place.

Love their pickles. 
malt shakes are amazing. but expensive.
author: Erica L.

description: Usually with a name like "Super Duper" you'd think the place has some hubris, but in this case, they live up to their name. Fantastic and quick burger. Like a Five Guys crossed with the aesthetic of a Chipotle, with an even simpler menu. Don't come in expecting to super-customize your burger - they have a just a few options, but they're good ones. Our burgers were flavorful and hot, the lettuce crisp, and the tomatoes fresh. If you like garlic, try the garlic fries, but make sure your dining companions have them too - they're strong and you'll relive them the rest of the day. hastag: worthit
author: Chelsea L.

description:
Super Duper occupies a prime location, and it's very well managed. I come here often for hang over food or if I've been eating salads for too long - it's the perfect fatty cure. 

The last time I was here, I got their veggie burger and garlic fries - perfectly heart-clogging in the best way possible. The place is well-operated, somewhat more slightly upscale than your average fast food, and you really feel like you are eating what you pay for.
author: Nancy L.

description:
Had a veggie burger and it was one of the best I have ever had! As others have mentioned, it wasn't really greasy as usual burgers and the patty tasted good as well. I had ordered garlic fries with no cheese but I think they served me usual fries with cheese. It wasn't really that big an issue though.

I would surely check it out again if I am in the area!
author: Sam B.

description:
OMG, a high-end In N' Out!

Don't get me wrong, I love In N' Out, but it's a bit plain and boring. These burgers remind me of the deluxe burgers in Tokyo, Japan, where you can add extra ingredients. I added avocado and fried egg and cheese, it was a lovely mess (something like that in Tokyo would cost double the price than what you're paying in SF.)

I also loved the garlic cheese fries. The garlic fries have 2 evil things on it  -- garlic AND cheese. One is great, two is divine! 

I am so excited about this place -- you can really fill up for $10.
author: Paula N.

description:
Where has this place been my whole life? This place pretty much has everything I want in a hamburger joint. For the quality and taste, these burgers are not that expensive. They taste like the sort of burgers you'd pay $12 for at some upscale restaurant. The pickles are absolutely delicious. They have garlic fries. This location had Racer 5 on tap (don't know about the other ones). Aaand they have a happy hour special where you get free fries (or cheap garlic fries) with an order of beer. What? Have you been reading my heart's desires Super Duper? 

The burgers are so good that I'll even forgive the fact that their "mini" burgers are the size of a regular burger.
author: Alea G.

description: If you're in San Francisco and you like burger and fries, you should definitely try this place; Fantastic burger, awesome garlic fries and the BEST chocolate shake!
author: M A.

description: Very good food! I had the double burger, fully dressed with cheese, chicken sandwich, and garlic fries. Chicken sandwich was spicy but I liked it. If going during lunch try to get there early to beat the crowd. Lines were out the door which is a testament on how good the food is.
author: Cecil B.

description: Great burgers + awesome garlic fries + beer = super duper indeed!
author: Kelly T.

description: Bobbed and weaved through traffic from the wharf and RAN a block like track stars after work with my boo thang to grab some burgers. The hunger was real. It was 1 minute to closing and the lovely staff members were extremely kind and understood the server struggle and made sure we were fed.
author: Orlando D.

description: Bawmbbbbb cool ass place great vibe and awesome seating. Quick service too. The burgers cooked perfectly. Try their garlic fries
author: Sophia L.

description: My first experience with a super duper burger was in mill valley and the burgers were delicious. I was pleased to hear there was a super duper right across the SF Marriott off of Mission and was super duper excited to have my dinner there. As usual, service was great and the homemade pickles perfectly complimented my burger. The only thing I was disappointed about was my mini burger. The burger itself "looked" so scrumptious but as soon as I took a bite into the burger, it was red. Keep in mind, super duper in no way uses frozen burgers, this is the real deal, grass feed fresh beef. I knew the burger was still good to eat but medium rare burgers are not my preference. I could have returned the mini burger but was almost 90% done with it. Would be super duper nice if super duper asked their customers how they want their burgers done.
author: Jocelyn T.

description:
I chose to review this location since it's typically less busy in the evenings than the one on Market & 3rd, but I love ALL Super Duper's equally! 

They have a small, simple menu so I've tried everything! 

*Burger - ok, so maybe their burger is what they're popular for but it's usually a hit or miss for me. A lot of times, my burger patty will lack flavor or is dry so I'm kind of disappointed in that. I know for sure that there's been at least 3 times where my burger tasted really good, but ive had too many average tasting burgers that I forgot what they tasted like when I actually liked it. I'll order it anyway when I crave red meat.

*Chicken sandwich - awesome! The meat is nicely seasoned and the Chipotle aoli adds that nice kick to it. I frequent the chx sammie. 

*Veggie burger - I've never had a veggie burger until Super Duper and I absolutely love theirs!  Whenever I think about ordering a burger, I sometimes will get this instead. With bacon ;)

*Fries/Garlic fries - nothing special but not bad at all. I like the garlic fries though.  Tasty with the parmasan cheese. The serving size is small but it's just enough. 

*Super Salad - the first time I ordered it, my impression was that it looked like it would taste like a basic, boring salad, something you get from a cafeteria.  I was wrong. The dressing was amazing, and the cucmbers added a nice, crisp crunch to it! Add chicken, and/or bacon, and/or cheese=even more amazing!!! 

*Shakes - love the shakes! They don't make me feel sick afterwards. Also, I tried a spiked chocolate shake and it was sinfully delicious.  If I had no self control, I'd order that every damn day!

*Cones- I've only had it one time when they first opened- vanilla flavored with chocolate coating.  Though I lovethe shakes, I didn't really care much for this. Will try again later.
author: Mila B.

description:
As suggested by its name, this place is super duper. Just steps away from, well, everything downtown (MoMA, Bloomies, West Field, Metreon, Yerba Buena), Super Duper Burgers offers a nice, cheap, and delicious alternative to all the ubiquitous chain restaurants in its surroundings. As a plus, it's open until 11pm--perfect for grabbing a late bite after shopping or visiting the museums. The fresh strawberry shake was creamy and smooth, perfect for satisfying that late night sweet tooth. The garlic fries really packed a punch, super garlic-y and fragrant. Yum. 
Unfortunately I wasn't hungry enough to try the burger, but I'm definitely looking forward to next time!
author: Alice L.

description: Beware! This Super Duper steals your money. I've been to this location twice. Both times, they managed to screw me over. My first time there I added an egg to my burger, had it to go and went back to the office to find my burger without the egg or bacon.  This time, I'm looking through my bank statement and see that the cashiers gave themselves a tip. This is FRAUD. What right do they have to do that??
author: Ray C.

description:
Wow. OK, even though I wondered about these guys right off the bat thanks to their questionable decision to open two branches within a block of each other, they make a damn fine burger. Cooked medium, with a good bun and top-notch ingredients all around, this is what it's all about.

Their 5-7pm "happy hour" with free fries with the purchase of beer/wine - and the fact that they even sell alcohol - score them a few more points. As does the fact that their employees really try their best, as opposed to being your typical minimum-wage fast-food types.

This particular branch deserves a little extra kudos, because of its seating facing a window on Mission St. with prime people-watching, as well as (sort of) being part of the rejuvenated Metreon.

Next step: EAST BAY and SOUTH BAY BRANCHES, people. The rest of the Bay Area hopes you'll spread like a virus - the good kind. Put "The Counter" and all other mediocre wanna-bes out of business!
author: S R.

description:
Super Duper is DE-LISH. 

I love the Chicken Sandwich. It has a great spicy aioli that can't be beat, especially when followed up with a vanilla ice cream cone! Yum!

Good Price Point. Good Fun Atmoshpere! Not a lot of seating so have someone scout for a table while someone else is in line. It is competative!
author: Katie K.

description: honestly one of the best burgers I've ever had. so good. people were so friendly. it's crowded, but sooo worth it.
author: Hannah W.

description: i love super duper, but this location is the worst one.  For some reason they always overcook the burgers and they are sometimes even burnt.  I love the medium burgers the other super duper locations produce, I'm not sure why this location hasn't been able to replicate that... :(  It's extra disappointing when you know how good it tastes at other locations.
author: Kevin M.

description: First time dining at super duper in San Francisco and I love it!!! The burger is perfect in size and super delicious. Though this place is always pack but service is quick. I like the fact that I didn't have to wait for more than 10 minutes for my food. I also tried their strawberry milkshake and it's the best shake I've ever had. Too bad this store is not available near Davis or Sacramento area. Otherwise, I would become a regular diner :)
author: Sarah T.

description:
It's a high quality fast food. We tried the burgers for the first time last week and will be definitely going back.
It's very quick, tasty and well priced. They also have all these cool toppings for your burgers like mushrooms, avocado, grilled onions, etc.
The personnel were very nice, they walked around to make sure we're doing ok and if we need  anything else.
author: Haleh H.

description:
Good burger.... Not really juicy, if that matters.
Don't order the Lemonade without ice. The pickles are, surprisingly, spicy.  My feeling was that the burgers are on par with In and Out.  My buddies with me said Five Guys is better.  (I kind of think it comes down to decent burgers, so who cares?)

The shkes are like drinking chocolate ice cream.

Garlic fries are perfect ending to a bad date.  (Which is to say: if you like garlic as I do, or you are on a bad date, this works out well.)
author: James L.

description:
Salad with a burger pattie, dressing on the side, for that guilt-free low-card meal.
Add bacon and a fried egg if you deserve it.
Service is generally fast and friendly.
Even when crowded, the line moves, orders come out quickly, and can generally find a seat. Have some pickles while you wait.
A totally reasonable lunch deal; filling and delicious for the price.
author: Renfield K.

description:
