Love Super Duper burgers!  Pearl's used to be my favorite spot for burgers, but I think I love Super Duper more. (Note - I haven't been to Umami yet). 

I get the mini burger with cheese, "everything on it," and add jalapeños. Their burgers are fresh, the meat is of high quality, well-seasoned and super juicy.  Try their garlic fries with cheese - super garlicky and really good.  They also have homemade pickles, which are delicious (sometimes you can find a spicy pepper in there)! As a plus, the food is prepared pretty quickly. 

Right after I ordered my burger, I noticed that they have a few new special menu items!  I think they are only listed on small menus near the registers.  In particular, I remember seeing a Philly which sounded delicious (and I was told that this was the best of the new items). I'm definitely going back to try that!
author: Nadia S.

description:
Arrived here after a long day in the city.  First off, the venue is pretty simple, modern, and hip. Had it's fair share of seating indoor and out but with the rain drizzling, indoor was the practical option. They definitely emphasized the farm freshness in their ingredients throughout their retro artwork and nostalgic posters thoroughly placed on their walls. But it's it all up to taste.

So couple friends and I tried it out and ordered a Super Combo. We decided to go with that since after scoping out the place from what others ordered, the Mini Combo wasn't for us. Basically, two guys and a girl, who just had a tiresome day Friday at work in addition to walking to the place. So might as well end the weekday here.

The burger was definitely juicy and on point. I'd recommend sticking with the burger being cooked to medium if you want that melt-in-your-mouth type of feeling. Didn't add anything extra to it just kept it simple and that's all it needed. The fries were great. Lightly salted and just plain crisp. The only thing I wish I did try was their milkshake. The next time I visit I'm definitely getting a taste of that, what turned me off was the price of it. From what I saw the amount you got for a milkshake was definitely overpriced. Maybe the taste could justify the cost but volume does matter as well.

The combo was about $10 + tax, which for a fast-food joint is reaching borderline pricey. Perhaps the fact that it's farm fresh was the added bonus, but still it's a reach for something of a fast food burger joint. The spot is worth a try.
author: Michael B.

description: Super good.... We ate there twice. The garlic fries are good. However, don't get them to-go. They will get very soggy within minutes. Overall soooooo good. And the pickles are very crunchy and tasty.
author: Monica S.

description: I came here with my coworkers for lunch because the one nearest was too busy. There is never a time where the food wasn't satisfying. But the reason why I'm writing this review is because of the service. The cashier has bad attitude and it didn't look like she wanted to be there. I can understand that it gets very hectic and crazy during lunch hours, but she's probably new and inexperienced. Super duper near Montgomery has better service.
author: Cindy L.

description:
Tuesday, 8:30PM.

Quickie:
+Great burgers
+Good service
+Clean
+Spacious
+Sustainable products (ie. ingredients, containers)
+Many options to add

Suggestions:
*Add a TV
*Wi-fi couldn't hurt either

And then...?
Winner winner, chicken dinner.

**********
Stuffed my face in:

1. Chicken sandwich: +Jack cheese, +egg
     +No excessive charring of the meat, grilled right
     +Egg's ooze contrasted the cheese well
author: Chuck N.

description:
Delicious gourmet-style burgers but served as fast food. Burgers and fries are yummy and you can even eat all the pickles you could possibly eat. They have nice sauces, but you have to pay for them...come on!

I see many people comparing them to In n Out, but I'm not sure how that's a fair comparison since the menu offerings are totally different. In n Out does classic burgers and classic fast food well (and they don't bother with salads).
author: Eric L.

description: The first time I went, I was blown away. The second time, my hamburger just seemed kind of gross, greasy, and maybe a little undercooked. Milkshake was great. Fries are pretty good. Make sure you're in the mood for a nice sloppy burger.
author: A. Wolfram K.

description: I wanted to like this place, because the staff was so friendly. They were super busy with the lunch rush but still took the time to be kind and cheerful. The strawberry milkshake was pretty fantastic. The fries were good. But the burger was super greasy, and hard to eat because of it. And I don't mean just that it was messy (it was, but the best things in life are messy), it was literally hard to eat that much grease. I felt gross after I ate it, to the point that it made me want a salad.  IT MADE ME WANT A SALAD.
author: Laura H.

description:
My experience at Super Duper Burger was average.
I did not have an awesome meal (can you at a burger anyway?)
And the team was OK.
The good point was that i didn't have to wait, since there was nobody (2.00pm)
author: Oleg K.

description: Very first time!! Read others reviews before making a move. I would say worth a shot here. Tried chicken sandwich and yummy garlic fries, just awesome!! Would definitely recommend others!!
author: Manoj M.

description:
The Cheeseburger was delicious. So was the chicken sandwich. 
Mexican Coke made with cane sugar (in the glass bottle) is also avaiable.
Has soft serve ice cream and free pickles! (^_^)
author: Jonathan M.

description:
As a vegetarian, I couldn't find a better veggie burger when you don't have time look for some vegan/vegetarian restaurants and fast-food!
I'm not a fan of burgers so Super Duper clearly deserved a review from me !
author: Khaloud D.

description:
A great burger! Extra $1 for toppings 
One of the best burgers in town.

The shake was weak and watery.
The garlic fries were amazing too- cheese and garlic!
author: Formicas F.

description:
Happened to walk by, starving after a later morning IMAX movie.  

For $6.50, we each got a super burger -  two 4 oz patties of grass fed beef, cooked medium, with "everything on it" (lettuce, tomatoes, red onions, and super sauce!).  Delicious tasty, perfectly cooked juicy burger patties with the perfect bun to patty ratio.  

For $10, you can get a combo with fries and a soda.  Fries (normally $2), are quite blah, limp, and soggy and a teeny tiny portion for the price.  I appreciated the glass cups instead of paper - makes the ice water with lemon taste classy-restaurant-like.  The decor reminded me of Chipotle - minimalistic and clean.
author: Heather s.

description: I really can't complain - these burgers really were super. And free pickles! Plenty of seating with an upstairs eating area.
author: Carly J.

description:
On a Tuesday afternoon, looking for some lunch, my boyfriend and I strolled in here and decided to give it a shot. I've heard this place described as a glorified, over priced 'In & Out' burger joint. Umm, the menu is a little complicated with all the extras you can add for $1 a piece. We ordered two burgers (one with bacon), garlic and regular fries, and milkshakes (vanilla). The total bill was $32! The burgers were good, but that is a little too pricey for a Tuesday afternoon. The garlic fries were ok, not as good as the ones at the Giants stadium that's for sure. They also gave us 3 different kinds of dipping sauces, which cost extra, those were good. 

If you come here with a companion, no need to order two orders of fries, the portions are huge. 

Just a note: the Vanilla shake was by far the best milkshake I have ever tasted!! Don't miss out on it. 

The food was good, just a little pricey for my taste. In a pinch, yes I would eat here again. With a choice, I would rather eat at Pearl's despite the high cost.
author: Pam N.

description: Soooooooo delicious and such great service! We ordered the super burger with a chocolate milkshake and although they got the burger order wrong because they included onions. They quickly fixed the burger, hand delivered it to my table, and gave me complimentary fries for the mix-up. The burger was INCREDIBLE! I love their open pickle and condiment bar! They pickle their own cucumbers!! The patty was incredibly juicy and the milkshake was soooo ....fresh (Idk any other way to describe it).
author: Soleana D.

description:
fast. delicious. finger-lickin amazing. cheap.

got a super burger (which I now know a mini would have been plenty). this burger was just insanely juicy and flavorful. I had high hopes and it surpassed all of them. rating this as my #1 so far in the city. I've had great burgers else where, but factor in the cost and timing, this is number 1.

this burger was so good..I was trying to not share with my bf. it made me greedy. but, I did save him a bite or two ;)

and currently craving another.. next time, will have to try out the fries, and Straus soft serve cone
author: Abigail W.

description:
review: tasty and affordable, and messy to boot

these burgers are really tasty. simple, juicy, meaty, not sure how else to describe them. the bun was soft and didn't turn mushy like most buns do. i opted to add garlic fries, which are much, much better than regular fries. condiments are plentiful are also located in the upper seating area. make sure to grab plenty of napkins as this one of the messiest burgers i've had in a while. am looking forward to visiting the super duper in the south bay.
author: Aaron T.

description:
Decided to try out the new location of Super Duper (located about a block and half away from the old location) since the one on Market is always way too crowded.

Best decision ever. First off, I was greeted by a girl standing outside with french fry samples (which are actually different from the one on Market!). If I chose how I can be greeted at any restaurant, it would be with someone handing me french fries! Dream come true!

No line, super empty. Unlike Market St. where a woman was watching me eat and as soon as I took the last bite of my burger, she ran up to my table asking if I'm done so she can have it. And continued to stand there until I cleaned my hands and grabbed my stuff. Rude!

The food came out quick, was delicious of course, and the manager (I think) came up to the second floor to ask how everything was. So attentive! For that they deserve 5 stars alone!

Definitely coming to this Super Duper from now on!
author: Sarah H.

description: We were recommended here by a local, and they were right! They have probably the juiciest burger I have ever had! I ordered a meal and it came to just over $10. The fried were good, but my friends got the garlic fries and those smelled amazing! Just don't order them if you are on a date! I would be back anytime I am craving a good and quick burger.
author: Michelle P.

description: My boyfriend and I love to eat here especially before we go to a movie at the Metreon. The taste is super yummy and the price is spot on but the best part are the dang pickles!! So so so so good. So why 4 stars? as yummy as I say this place is it is unfortunately not always consistent. I sometimes have to send my order back because they add something I didn't ask for or they sometimes skimp me on my Bleu Cheese... come on now! When I order a bleu cheese burger I better taste that deliciousness on there. Other than that the location is rad, staff friendly, decor simple and facility is 90% clean most of the time with the exception of some days when the place gets swamped with convention folks visiting Moscone Center for lunch or dinner.
author: Ashley T.

description:
...Not Good. My wife and I went here for a late burger. I got a super burger with all the free stuff and my wife got a veggie burger. Both were exceedingly bland and ultimately a total waste of what was not a cheap meal. 

If you can avoid, I recommend the Habit or In And Out. They are a way better value!
author: Jordan M.

description: Excellent burgers and fries, at a reasonable price. Upstairs they could do with a hand washing station and another soda machine, to save you going back downstairs.
author: Sally-Ash S.

description: Super burger is not big, but very juicy. Super salad is big but if you don't put chicken or something else in it, it is just cucumbers and green salad. The service is fast. The place looks usually, as a typical fast-food corner, without any distinguishing features.
author: Lyuba F.

description: Burgers are good and the price is right. But one thing that can turn me off is chewing on unexpected crunchy cartilage or bone. One in every three bites had a small shard of bone or cartilage. Not going back.
author: E R.

description: The burger my boyfriend got was amazing. The chicken sandwich I got was scrumptious. This place is fantastic! The chicken was moist and flavorful and it came with a chipotle aoli that had great flavor. I will definitely be returning!
author: Jessica N.

description: I ordered the super burger combo and it was delicious! The burger patties were not over done or over salted and the meat was juicy and flavorful without being greasy. The fries were very good, and I usually dislike french fries. Large portion of fries and they were very hot, which is imperative for good fries. The homemade pickles were a nice addition to the burger, being just sour enough. Overall for the price, the quantity as well as quality of food is great. I will definitely return, but next time get a single patty burger. I would rank this place above in-n-out, five guys, and the habit.
author: C K.

description: Burgers and Fries Deluxe! This is my favorite eat and go burger joint in the Yerba Buena area. The Burgers with the works are the way to go and the homemade pickles are so juicy and tasty like the burgers. Their garlic fries should be their co-sig because they are the bomb! Also the fries are good also. There is nothing like a fresh hot burger and fries coming out at all times, deeelish.
author: Ahrmon R.

description: Another option for eats in SOMA and perfect if you want something quick before or after a movie, performance, or a museum event. The burgers are okay but nothing to write home about and Niman Ranch doesn't mean much to me given the founder, Bill Niman, is no longer part of NR and quality has subsided since his departure. The mini burger gets you one patty and the super gets you two patties. You can dress the burgers with various toppings and they offer complimentary house made pickles. But I have had far better burgers elsewhere and would come by only if I was on the go to/from a performance in the area and wanted something fast. The fries are a bit mushy and not crispy enough for me, but that's a personal preference as I like extra crispy fries. The plus to Super Duper is they have Straus soft serve. Now that's worth getting!
author: Grayson E.

description: Super Duper Burgers was indeed super duper!  The ambiance, for me, is very reminiscent of Shake Shack.  The burgers are yummy and well-made;  you can definitely taste the quality in the ingredients.  Love that they have garlic fries here, and the milkshakes are the perfect ending to a greasy meal of burgers and fries.
author: Thi D.

description: Just had the milkshakes.  Super Duper.  The burgers looked great.  Will try them next time.  Nice spot if you are staying at the Marriott across the street.
author: Joseph C.

description: Another cool SD joint in Yerba Buena, fulfilled my inner-moo with their great super burgers. Crafted well, they are usually splashy and juicy. I am (by accident) a messy eater...sorta like a Curb-Your-Enthusiasm moment set to food. I have greasy ties to prove it. My last creation involved avocado and jalapenos (plenty). This place is spacious but not as big as the Market Street temple. They have outdoor seating with overhanging heat-lamps. Lots of conventioneers (sp?) the last time I went. They never remove their name-tags from their laynards.
author: Derek N.

description: a good plain burger. nothing special. a bit on the pricy side for something average overall. garlic fries were ok, a bit dry.
author: Zou Z.

description: Cute, little, casual burger place in San Fran! My boyfriend and I each ordered the mini burger . Mine with cheese and sauce only and his was a mini with everything . We got an order of French fries and a coke and the total came to 15.50. Pretty good . We will be back when we come to visit!!
author: Rach S.

description: I think this is what Five Guys is supposed to be. Needless to mention, Super Duper Burgers are quite a bit better. The meat has great flavor and the fries are cooked properly. I rarely like pickles at a burger joint, but the ones here are actually very good. Perhaps most surprising are the buns. The buns here are legitimately good! Prices are reasonable, especially if you stick with the mini burgers (perhaps more appropriately described as "single" burgers).
author: Joel R.

description: Great burgers for a reasonable price. They consistently make a burger that hits the spot.
author: Brian S.

description: Killer. Will definitely be back. Burgers are excellent and the chocolate shake will be my downfall while I'm in SF for the next week.
author: Brad T.

description: Excellent burgers- the food is great and the price is right. This place is always crowded and it's because the burgers are awesome. The Cookies and Cream shakes are killer as well!
author: Steph P.

description: This is a very good burger joint.  The buns (one of the most important elements to any sandwich) are delicious and hold nicely.  The meat is hand patties of quality beef.  Nice house made mayo and sauces.  Easily my favorite sub-$6 burger in SF.  Oh, and the fries are fresh and tasty too.  The house pickles are great too.  If you are looking for a high quality and not too expensive burger this is the place.
author: Eric S.

description: I was expecting a juicy yummy burger like I've had in the past. Today I got a over cooked dry burger patty very sad. I ordered my burger Togo and it came out fast. Within 5 minutes I got my garlic fries and mini burger with cheese. I know for sure that burger patty is not freshly made. Bummer! But my fries were good.
author: Karen T.

description: Gotta add that egg! BEST FAST FOOD BURGER EVER! The burger was delicious and a gourmet burger taste to it! Also try the choco-dippe cone!
author: Jeffrey S.

description: I am not a burger person, but my boyfriend is so he made me go here when we were in San Fran.  I was very pleasantly surprised.  For the price you cant beat this place! I had the veggie burger and it was definitely the best veggie burger that I have ever had! It had a nice crisp to it, and the flavor was great! I cleaned my plate.  The fries are the bomb.com and the sauces were on point! Next time I'm in San Fran I will definitely hit up Super Duper Burger again!!
author: Samantha K.

description: Damn you, you're making fat! This place is right by my job and we go here on occasion for lunch and I have yet to have a bad burger here. They know how to do a classic burger. Juicy, messy and tastes so good. Menu is simple and limited cuz they do what they do well. Fries are always nice and crispy and the food comes out quick. There's a reason why this place is always busy.
author: Hyung L.

description: Pretty enjoyable smashed burger.  Nothing extraordinary for what you are paying for, and it made me long for wasting the gut bomb on a in-n-out double double.  Service was great, the place was clean, and the fact that it was by my hotel, made the convenience great for visitors to Moscone.
author: Steven T.

description:
it's always SUPER duper!  

I usually order a regular burger, no cheese and grilled onions  
LOVE the pickles!!! :)

good solid burger place, great for after the movies or when you just wanna snack on something yummy!

I would come here for the pickles alone!!! YUM
author: Jen L.

description: The burgers are amazingly good. The patty was nice and juicy, lettuce was crisp, cheese was melted and onions nicely grilled. I got my burger with Garlic fries, its hard to find garlic fries that im pleased with, but NOT HERE... i was satisfied with every fry as no fry went without no flavor, nicely topped with parmesan cheese garlic olive oil and cilantro. One of my favorite burger joints!
author: Cheryllyn L.

description: I come to this place to eat their garlic fries, its just fantastic.  Their milkshakes are good too. Lines are usually long but i try to ignore it  looking forward to eat my garlic fries.
author: Kelly R.

description:
I like super duper, but the front staff at this location seem pretty unprofessional. I stood in an empty line waiting for someone to come to the front, while noticing the cooks in the back glancing around for someone to help me. After someone finally took my order, I waited an unusually long time for my to go order, while two of the girls in the front were leaned over the counter in the middle of a private Spanish conversation, their purses and personal belongings strewn on the counter, ignoring when the food was ready. I saw the one girl who was working the register glance over in annoyance as no one else seemed to be working and putting food out. The manager was clearly not in that day. I'm not a snob, I'd just like some semblance of professionalism in a business. A customer also came in with her dog, and was given a water cup for the dog to drink from. Last I checked, animals aren't allowed in restaurants. And they're definitely not allowed to walk halfway into the kitchen before the owner pulled it away. Of course, no one said a thing.

I sat outside in the park to enjoy by burger, but the meat was overly salty and they forgot the onions when I had asked for everything on it.
author: Sophie P.

description: Hot n crispy garlic glory.  "Coke tastes better out of a glass."  Shouldn't save sesame.  But holy cow, supersaucy and super sacred.
author: Eric V.

description:
Highly disappointed. 

The 1st time I went to Super Duper burger. I had a shake which was OK. However, a guy in my group ended up waiting twenty minutes for his food. His pager never went off and his food had been sitting and getting cold at the counter all that time. 

I thought that maybe that was a fluke and decided go a 2nd time for lunch to try their combo. Well this time, I ended up waiting almost twenty minutes. When I went to the counter, I find out that my food had been ready a long time ago and my pager never went off. Instead of apologizing (a simple sorry would have been sufficient), the girl at the counter got an attitude and told me that they called my number. 

How am I supposed to know to wait at the counter to hear my "number" if you hand me a pager??? On top of that, the cold burger I got was dripping with cheese, which would have been fine if I had ordered cheese. But I specifically told the cashier that I did not want cheese. The burger was also very greasy. I think they decided to add a cup of oil on top of the meat. 

If you like cold greasy burgers with bad service please try this place.
author: C G.

description: The service was good. The counter guy was friendly and super enthusiastic compared to what you usually expect in that kind of busy "never ending" line environment. The burger was SUPER GREASY, like it was deep-fried or smth. It was also relatively undercooked and pinky inside (like medium instead of normal medium-well).
author: Allie D.

description: Best patties. Good pickled garlics. Awesome garlic fries. 1 star was cut for the sauce. Maybe bbq sauce will work better?
author: James S.

description:
I don't understand the love. There's a ton better burgers in the Bay Area (True, 510, Spruce, Marlowe, etc.) and if you add in chains like In-n-Out and Five Guys, I don't see a lot of reason to come here.

The burger is really no different than what I can make on my back patio (and frankly my was quite a bit overcooked).
author: Alan G.

description:
If I'd tasted the burger first....
-the burger WAS good- juicy, good flavor(although not grilled), toppings and bun were fresh and yummy. I guess I was surprised because I munched on the garlic fries first - don't bother- they weren't even cooked! The garlic and cheese were great but topped raw and cold potatoes - and "comes with 3 sauces"- really? Where? The girl knew I was a first timer but didn't tell me - was I sposed to ask for sauces? Get them myself? Didn't matter cuz the fries were inedible.
I'm from San Diego and usually stop at Perrys, didn't go Embarcadero burger places because of prices, but with tip Super Duper prices were not that great ($15.00) for a relatively small burger and a small order of fries - and I'm not a big eater. Add a $5.00 shake? No thanks. 
- no denying - a good SMALL burger, but great? No, and a staff that doesn't pay enough attention to even cook the fries? I'll pass next time.
author: Shannon C.

description: When ordering a customer burger to go with Avocado and Mushrooms I really do expect you to be able to remember to add both custom ingredients after you charged me $1 each for them. No excuse for not properly making the order. Aside from that nothing special about this burger.
author: Nigel F.

description: The fries are super duper and nothing short of a happy meal. Wine and Beer on tap help draw a large crowd around lunch and dinner times which is subdued by a quick working, friendly staff. Sadly the burgers are out-and-out just a cut above In And Out, and 2 men short of 5 Guys. Great for a convenient bite, but not a place to go out of the way for.
author: George K.

description: I never leave Cali without getting in and out...until now. This place was awesome! Totally went with the garlic fry recommendation and no regrets! Grab some of those homemade pickles as well. This burger really hit the spot.
author: Marina S.

description: I love Super Duper!  I really like that they have a mini burger option.  I always hated ordering burgers because they usually end up being the size of my face and I wanna roll over and die after eating it.  I always order their mini burger with avocado and a side order of fries and it ends up being the perfect amount for me.  Their homemade pickles are defiantly a plus.  However, I noticed in this location they put it near the bathrooms.  Open lid of containers near two single bathrooms that are constantly opening and closing.  Hmmm... Yup.  I always try to dig for the pickles at the bottom.
author: Lynn L.

description: Food is good, burgers & fries. This review is the for the staff at this specific location. I know not to expect 5 star service at a pay at the counter place, but playing tug-of-war with me on the food that I already payed for, when the cashier already got my order wrong once and the food was sitting on the pass counter due to an employee not serving in chronological order? No thanks. Go to the Market St. location, I have always gotten a friendly smile & never had an issue with the staff.
author: Lily R.

description: Ordered the mini (medium rare) burger with portobello, garlic fries, and a strawberry milkshake. All was not too bad.  The milkshake was watery and didn't taste like a strawberry milkshake at all. I had better tasty burgers else though. Loved the garlic fries though!
author: Terrell L.

description: Burgerssssssss! I was starving after going to a convention.  The normal burger and strawberry shake hit the spot.  +1 for being open much later than the surrounding store.
author: Jessica P.

description: Best burgers ever! Everything is fresh, organic, and healthy as far as burgers go. It's a lot like In-N-Out but slightly more high end given that it is slightly more pricey. Their garlic fries are also very on point. The service is fast and the dining area is clean. I always stop by whenever I'm in the financial district.
author: Blair W.

description: Great burger! It's a bit smaller than what I'm used to getting at a restaurant. Their garlic fries are also really delicious.
author: amber h.

description: I'm not much of a red meat eater, but this place is pretty good patties taste fresh, and place seems clean. It's a little loud and I hate that but I enjoyed the burger. Shakes are really good too. Oh they have veggie burgers too.
author: Jenny G.

description: It's tough for me to review burger joints, because I believe you can only screw up a burger... you can't make it much better. That said, the burgers were excellent. I especially liked the bun, which was heartier (and thus kept its integrity better) than other places. The vibe was cool, the choices were nice, and I none of us had any complaints.
author: Benny L.

description: These burgers are delish!! The garlic fries are so yummy!! I would say that these burgers are one of the best! I will have to try their milkshakes next time. Highly recommend.
author: arlene d.

description: This place is awesome.  Great, simple burgers that are juicy and high-quality.  They have few items on the menu but give off the impression that they do everything well with sustainable, wholesome ingredients.  They also have fresh pickles--all you can eat--and this is a boon for people who are pickle addicts.  My wife is Korean and she can eat her body weight in pickles.  I like the no-nonsensey way the business is set up.  And the price point:  perfect.
author: Spunky M.

description: Good place and I'm a regular for sure.  For me, sometimes too saucy so I ask them to keep it light.  It's conveniently located and the price is not so bad, plus I can have a beer with a really good burger.  Overall a good place and I recommend it.
author: Chris W.

description: This place had one of the best veggie burgers I have had the pleasure of enjoying......also have great dill pickles for the taking.  I villllll be baaackkk.
author: Laura C.

description: I have since gone back and tried the chicken sandwich and its amazing.  Its as good as a chicken sandwich gets.  The fries are good as well.  Definitely one of my regular places to go for lunch.
author: Craig N.

description: Effin' dericious cheeseburger. Blows in-n-out out off the bay!
author: Pickle R.

description:
really good veggie burger!
great garlic fries
nice decor
author: Deka M.

description:
we came here really late last night, and i'm glad they open until 11.  hubby and i each got a veg burger (his w/ cheese, mine w/ added avocado) with caramelized onions, jalapenos and the other toppings.  we also shared an order of garlic fries and a chocolate milkshake.  this was a ton of food, but it was so good, and i was so hungry that i just kept eating.  the veg burger was delicious, and i love how they put cucumbers in it.  i also loved all the free pickles that you can take.  

garlic fries were definitely potent, so bring some gum or breath mints!  the shake was super thick too, and the server was so nice.  she saw us struggling to suck it up w/ our straws and offered us a spoon.
author: Helen T.

description: Super duper! Really. I think it's because the burgers are so small they keep you wanting more. I ordered a mini burger with everything in it and jalapeno peppers (free add on). I don't normally like burgers -- but this burger was so juicy and...good.  Like, quality, good. You could taste that something was different: grass-fed? gluten-free? chakra-calming? free-range? antioxidant-laden? Probably none of these buzzwords apply, but it definitely was a clean burger taste without any old grease residue and the juiciness wasn't overly beefy. As a non-burger eater, I am obviously not finding the right words. But it was good. It was fast food. It was relatively cheap ($5 for a smallish burger). It was located right next to the Metreon. It had free pickles (if you're into that kind of thing).
author: Vida V.

description: Burgers are on the small side, but the condiment additions are spot on.  The quality of meat is actually very good.  Big fan of the pickle here.
author: Mot Y.

description: love these burgers. gourmet taste even though it's not really. just wish it was closer to my office.
author: Wilson L.

description: I've been here twice now and both of my experiences have been great. I get the (you guessed it) veggie burger and it comes with hummus!! The hummus definitely adds that extra bit of flavor. I also add avocado and jack cheese to the burger to make it that more amazing. The veggie burger here is really good here (much better than most of the frozen ones at the store). I've gotten the regular and garlic fries and both are good. Overall, really good place for (vegetarian) burgers and fries.
author: Krishna S.

description: Me and my babe had lunch here today, the burger was so good and so was the garlic fries.. We will return!!;)
author: Mae D.

description:
- the meat is hard and hurts eating.
- the fries are hard and taste like cardboard.

not a pleasurable experience.
author: Razmig M.

description: Super busy during dinner time. Everything on the menu is as healthy as it gets for a burger place. The meat is organic and all of the vegetables are organic. Ordered the super duper burger which had the two 4 ounce patties with all of the vegetables on it. The burger is very juicy and tasty. Also ordered the garlic fries and they were on point. The sliced pickles on the side are a refreshing part of this dining experience. Highly recommend to anybody who likes burgers.
author: Thien-Tu T.

description: Glad to report that they are back to where they were before the slip up and have the juiciest burger in town at that price.
author: Jared C.

description: super duper burger totally exceeded my expectation. i guess the name "super duper" made me think it was going to be the opposite or something. My bacon cheeseburger was very tasty and juicy with just the right amount of toppings and sauce. The garlic fries were also cooked perfectly! the cheese on top tasted great with the fries. Unlimited pickles too! Don't let the long line scare you! It moves quickly and the food is worth it!
author: Clarice C.

description: Had a mini burger, fries and a chocolate shake! ALL AMAZING. The burger and milkshake were the best I've ever had. :)
author: Brittany H.

description: This place is ok. The burgers are pretty juicy. If you really need a burger this spots good but I can think of several other places I would rather go to first.
author: Bantu Z.

description: The burgers here are OK.  I thought by the way it was crowded they would be better but not too bad, just nothing great.  The burgers were smaller overall than I expected, but I think I am spoiled somewhat by so many burger options in Las Vegas.  They did have some really good ice cream options here.  I also feel like the price was a little high especially considering the size of the burgers.
author: Jesse C.

description: I think they have the best Burger, I ever had. Its very juicy, very fresh, and the price is reasonable.  Love it.
author: Henry H.

description: Best veggie burger I've had and the garlic fries blew my mind. Love the vibe and really fast service too.
author: Wehuns T.

description: Fries were really good, but the veggie burger was bland, dry, and unmanageable. Meat-eaters have at it. Veggies, steer your friends away from here for group outings, or just get fries and ice cream (a pretty awesome combination in and of itself anyways).
author: Claire G.

description: Oreo Shake is amazing!!! Loved it! Their Burgers are super duper indeed! Garlic Fries are the bomb get this over their regular fries they got a kick to it so maybe not suitable for children. The place had high chairs and there is both outdoor and indoor seating. The food comes out pretty fast but lines can get long for ordering. Worth the wait! We love this place. I haven't taken my husband to Umami yet but I think these two are at par.
author: Idiosyncratic G.

description: Good burger, the one patty was plenty for me. Fries were good especially the garlic ones. Nice restaurant feel, and good selection of drinks. Great pickles!!
author: Claudia W.

description: So much for a light lunch but boy was it worth it. My friend and I both got the mini with everything but swapped out the red onions for grilled and added the jalapeños. Friend thought they were too spicy but I thought it was perfect. We also shared some fries which was large enough for the both of us.  The pickle tasted weird according to my friend so I skipped it all together.  If you can manage to keep the paper wrapped around the burger you can save your hands from smelling like meat.  I have to say this was a decent experience and I would like to come back again. :)
author: Rosalind S.

description: High quality ingredients and top notch service. Ed helped out when a cashier messed up my order with the kind of customer service you'd expect from Virgin or Nordstoms. Love this spot.
author: Cory Z.

description: Good solid veggie burgers!  They are more like a falafal, than a meat imintation burger (which I like).  Love the pickle bar (all flavors and pretty tasty).   Got the veggie wrapped in lettuce with peppers... Have gone back twice, and would do so again!
author: Sheetal P.

description: Super duper burgers: I go their a lot i order the two patty burger and garlic fries. the food is so great their i cannot get enough of this place . after i am done eating i go and order more food and take it back home and relax. great environment and very friendly staff. You cant go wrong here you really cant its a must to go their.
author: Bryson F.

description: Delicious burger. The beef patty is well cook and moist and crisp veggies and bacon make it perfect!  The garlic fries is my favourite. It is a must try one.
author: Oline T.

description: It's an understatement, but I have to say, "This place rocks!" I always love stopping by when I'm in the city. Go big or go home!
author: Sean O.

description: I think this must be the McDonald's of higher priced burgers. The only good thing was the chocolate dipped soft serve.
author: Denis Y.

description: Really? This is a really crappy version of Shake Shack ( For you non NYers Shake Shack rocks). The meat is chewy and lacks flavor. I'm guessing a blend of chuck and chuck. The bread is dry and has way to many sesame seeds. The fries were pretty good but not any reason to come here. Ooh I get to choose my on pickles. None of which are cut to go on a hamburger and all of which are gross. This seems to be on of those San Francisco things were you put up with crap. Pretty much the story of San Fran.
author: Corey Jace W.

description: I'm sold! Quality and local meat, cheese and potatoes! Tasty and all natural. damn those garlic fries!
author: Brent W.

description: I am pretty much a Super Duper fan anyway, but this location seems to be just a little bit better than the others.  No idea why, everything looks the same.  Glad to have a quick burger option by the theaters.
author: Robert M.

description: Super Duper totally redeemed themselves and the poor service that I had during my only experience here. After I left my previous review, voicing my concerns, I was immediately contacted by management to resolve the issue. Management went above and beyond to resolve the issue, and the apology was sincere and very amicable. I felt like the apology was humble and without agenda. Thanks for the fast turn around and genuine concern Patrick!
author: L B.

description: Delicious. The burgers are fresh and tasty. I feel terribly fat after the grease and fries. But it may have been totally worth it.
author: Christopher W.

description: Yums!  The burgers are really good here. The staff is friendly and helpful in helping to decide on your burger choice.  I stopped by during dinner time and they were pretty business.  They serve beer there too so it's a good place to grab a burger and a cold one.
author: James Y.

description: How do people not only like but rave about this place??? Admitingly so, I ordered a veggie burger but still, I've had some awesome ones in the past elsewhere.  It was nothing special in my book. I would have rather have tried just about any other food in San Francisco.
author: Angela S.

description:
Had the mini with bacon and cheese and it was delish!! It's a buttery tasting burger/bun and the bun was slightly dense and delicious. This was my first Super Duper burger but it won't be my last. When you have a burger craving, this will satisfy it.
Btw, the chicken sandwich and veggie burger looked delicious too!
Wish they would not put the pickles where it seemed very unsanitary by the restroom on a dirty table where it was self serve.
Garlic fries were ok- nothing special. The fries are nothing special but the garlic flavor made them taste pretty good.
No fancy burger recipes- just burger then add cheese or bacon. Other optional toppings lettuce, red onion, special sauce, jalapeños, grilled onions, and for extra charge: avocado, blue cheese crumbles, Portobella mushroom.
Super duper is 8 oz (two patties)
mini is single patty (4 oz)
No nutritional info available upon request... Which was probably a good thing!
author: Piper W.

description: Now that's a burger.  Adriano has done it again.  Juicy burger with good flavor, and wonderful topped on a brioche-y bun.  The home made pickles add a homey touch.  Shakes are amazing and the choc dipped soft serve looks even more amazing.  My go to place for a good burger.
author: E K.

description: Solid burgers, fries, and shakes keep me coming back to Super Duper.
author: Dan W.

description: Burgers, fries and shakes. How could you mess that up? This place is legit. Not quite an in n out or five guys burger but still a contender. Definitely try the shakes.
author: Jeremy S.

description: HELLA good burgers, affordable and fast service! Love it!! I like this Super Duper more than the one on Market for some reason.
author: Ruhjeenuh Z.

description:
Had the Super burger with nothing extra with garlic fries. 

It was delicious. I'll be back again :-)
author: John N.

description: This place is amazing! The burger was the best I've had and the service is top notch. And the garlic fries. I would eat a mountain of those things and die happy. Just go here and see for yourself.
author: Matt L.

description: I LOVE LOVE LOVE Super Duper Burger.  The burgers are SO AMAZINGLY good and I LOVE LOVE LOVE their Strawberry Chocolate shakes.  Seriously the best thing ever.  The fries are alright/normal, but if you're looking for quick burger and shake-this is the place to go!
author: Aly A.

description: Good burger!  It is the coarsely ground meat and bun that make it.
author: Matt C.

description: Great Burger Spot!  The pickles are okay.  I wasn't a huge fan of the pickles but the rest was great!  Would come back and visit if we have the chance.
author: Gloria M.

description: The cheese burgher is pretty good although the price is a little bit high. The homemade pickles and milk shake are impressive. Also the garlic french fries and the homemade lemonade seem worth a try.
author: Tongchuan G.

description: These are some awesome burgers. Sadly I have only been here once and I don't know the next time I'll be able to come back.  Great atmosphere, beers on tap. Burgers were wonderful.  You can tell that they are hand made patty's that are from fresh beef.
author: Chris B.

description: A Super Duper with a second story?!?  Sign me up.  Same amazing burgers.  I still think their fries are mediocre.
author: Jeremy G.

description: Amazing burgers! Way better than In N Out. The burgers are juicy, fresh, and tasty. You have a choice of regular or garlic fries. Also, they have amazing homemade milkshakes. My personal favorite; cookies and cream milkshake. Very cool atmosphere. Upbeat music for any generation is always playing. And if you don't want to sit on the first floor, there is a balcony section above the kitchen area.
author: Eric M.

description:
Pass by this place everything see it busy. Decide to go their see why it always busy. Went here on Saturday for dinner with my girl friend. Order a burger meal. Small burger but when bite to burger the quality of beef was tasty,juicy,melt in mouth like home cooking. Sauce great combination. Also fresh cut fries.
Little price but worth it for the quality of food. Would recommend it and go back their again.
author: Gruber T.

description: Great, sustainable, juicy burgers.  Not classic like Jeffrey's, but still delicious.  House sauce is nice and tangy without taking over the natural flavors, and the patties have a nice crust to them.
author: Yen T.

description: a bellhop recommended this place to me... and IT was PHENOMENAL!  Chocolate shake and burger were amazing!  I would urge anyone to go there... friendly service and fast.
author: Brianna R.

description: I've eaten enough burgers in my life to tell between the great and mediocre, but its hard to describe exactly in words what makes places like Super Duper so tasty. Maybe it's their toasty buns, the sauce, or maybe just the quality of the meat alone that makes it so good. It's also pretty affordable for high-quality burgers. Employees are pretty friendly too.
author: Efrain T.

description: I really don't see the hype.  I had a mini burger with cheese (great size for my appetite), and it was just so-so - not nearly as good as In N Out.  The fries were also mediocre.
author: B. Y.

description: I've been here a few times now, and each time the food is consistently good. Yes, it's a good burger, but there's more here. I like the choice of a smaller burger for portion control. However, the milkshakes: they offer a spiked version. Cookies and cream milk shake with some vodka you say? They will hook you up. Also, the pickles are really good and you get as many as you want. Ohhhhhh, and they serve coke zero, so they have my vote. Solid place for a burger that won't leave you feeling heavy.
author: gabby m.

description: WOW these burgers blow my mind!!!!! What the heck! Why are they so good!!! All I have to say is if you are thinking of getting a burger and fries this is 100% the place to go in the whole city!!! This exact place on Mission street! WOW I mean Wow!
author: Vanessa C.

description: I wish this place would stop being so delicious and so close to my work. The Burger's are the best i've had in San Francisco, the garlic fries are pretty good too. And if you're getting their milkshake add malt to make it even better. Definitely have to try one of their spots at least once!
author: Terry S.

description: This is one of the best burger I've ever eaten.  I like my burger places to give me something good, big juicy burger that I can customize and Super Duper does just that.  Their fries are awesome.  If you have room try a real ice cream shake.  The place is usually crowded but if you wait a few minutes the turnover is high so you can grab a seat.  The food tastes and looks fresh and it will fill you up so be ready for the food coma.  I visited SF for a week and ate here 3 times.
author: Paul G.

description: Mini burger combo with grilled onions and a fried egg - soooo goood !
author: Millie C.

description: Holy crap. This place is heaven. They literally have the tastiest, juiciest burgers I've ever eaten. Their fries are awesome and their shakes are even more so. I work literally a minute away from here and it is always tempting to come here on my lunch breaks.
author: Keenan M.

description: Great burgers!, but wish there was more of a selection on condiments. Milk shakes in a glass?...CLASSY!
author: Dan P.

description: Awesome!  Was walking around San Francisco looking for a burger joint and found this one.  Fast and friendly service...the Super Burger with bacon and cheddar cheese was incredible!  Super fresh...tasty!  The piece de' resistance....the garlic fries!!!  UNBELIEVABLE!!!  A must get for any garlic fanatic!
author: Joe L.

description: I don't get the hype.  The only thing super duper about this place is the price.  I'd rank the burger slightly above Burger King and well below a burger at Five Guys.  The beef flavor is average, the toppings are average, the bun is average.
author: Derek H.

description: I got a veggie burger and fries.  The veggie burger was well put together, but the patty was disappointing. It seems to be a deep fried potato-based patty with some pieces of veg in it. The fries are tasty though.
author: Gary M.

description: Super Duper does get super busy during lunch hours, but the line usually eases up after 1:30 pm. Good sized juicy burgers, but I felt that the hamburger bun was a bit mushy. I would have enjoyed my burger more if the bun weren't so soggy, and if it were a bit hotter in temperature. The good thing about this place is that you won't have a weird meat aftertaste after eating a burger.
author: Mars F.

description: Nice juicy burger.  Had the double cheese with bacon.  Bacon was good but not needed as the beef was top quality.  Fries were perfect although it's not worth it for the dipping sauce.
author: Mike C.

description: We were looking for a quick, cheap bite before jetting off to the airport, and stumbled upon Super Duper Burgers. The Super Burger (half pound!) was simple, but amazing. I'm not sure how they prepared the beef patty (flat grill w/butter?) but it was one of the best I've had. The garlic fries were a little overwhelming, but good. I'm definitely going back, but next time I intend on getting regular fries and a milkshake!
author: Eric C.

description: The latest reason I'll be falling asleep in movies at the Metreon again. Thank you for bringing your awesome burger wonderfulness to this key downtown location. Just. So. Good!
author: Aaron L.

description: Like the other Super Duper Burgers they make a great chicken sandwich. Although they are expensive, the milkshakes are also very good. The burgers are a different story, they are dripping balls of grease. I also enjoy the free homemade style pickles. Fries are average.
author: Robert H.

description: It was ok. Burger was thick and juicy, but the meat itself didn't jump out at me. Slightly above average. If I could I would give it a 3.5/5, but system wouldnt allow.
author: Gilbert L.

description: Strangely enough, the text in the front of the storefront looks like a popular burger joint in NYC.  But, the Super Burger with bacon and cheese is vastly superior to the NYC counterpart.  Larger patties, better seasoning, delicious bacon, toasted bun.  Not to mention the garlic fries topped with cheese are a great side.
author: Kris B.

description: Good burgers!  I had a single patty (all cooked medium) with the fixes and add an egg.  They offer unlimited pickles at the condiment bar.  There is also three dips available for your fries.  I enjoyed the chipotle sauce the most, the others I can do without.  The lay out is a bit odd, but you can eat in, in the back, or outside, or on top.  The customer service was good with two cashiers who move quickly and you get a buzzer so you can sit and relax until the food is ready.
author: Neville B.

description: For the same price point, In-N-Out has nothing on this place.  Amazingly delicious burger and garlic fries.  Pickles are also great.
author: Shawn M.

description: Best burgers in this part of town. Great price for the quality and free pickle slices!!! Service was awesome too. Will be going back post haste
author: Marc M.

description: I typically go to Super Duper on market street, but when this one at the metreon opened, I wanted to give it a try.  Their menu selection seems to be smaller than the market street one, but seating was definitely easier to find - check out the upper level which also has it's own pickle and condiment bar. This location seems larger than the market street one.   I got the veggie burger (yum!) and garlic fries, which also had aged cheese on it.  I wanted to get the soft serve organic ice cream too but I was too full - that will have to wait for next time.  I'm glad I tried this location out, but will probably revert back to the market street location since it's closer to my office, and the menu selection seems larger.
author: Bebe W.

description: Got a burger and garlic fries. It was really good especially if you love garlic! The burger was pretty dang good also.
author: Jay W.

description: The veggie burger is fantastic. It is not very large but paired with the garlic fries makes a perfect meal.
author: Joseph D.

description:
Maybe the best burger I have ever put in my body. I fantasize about it.
Keep in mind, it is a greezy, fast-food burger not a gourmet burger. But by that standard, it is perfect.
author: Matt B.

description: SUPER DEE DUPER!!! That was an awesome burger! Got the mini (which is not mini by any stretch-it's a 1/4 pounder) with cheese and bacon and all sides including the super sauce. Dude that is seriously a great burger. Get the garlic fries with aged cheddar, those are the best garlic fries I've ever had, no ifs ands or buts about it!
author: Steve B.

description: First time here.  The burger is really juicy and has a quality taste to it.  Garlic fries are quite good too, but on the smaller portion.  Chocolate shake was excellent.  Overall pretty damn good.
author: Allen M.

description: Was craving a burger in the SoMa are and found this spot right down the street. The strong rating and $ fit my budget so i decided to check it out. The very nice girl working the register recommended the Mini Burger w an Egg and Bacon. The Filipino in me said "Hmm, fried egg and salty pork strips? Don't mind if I do!" she even sweetened the deal w comp fries and a drink. This really made day and now I'm FULLY satisfied. If you're lookin for a tasty burger and friendly staff in SoMa, hit up Super Duper Burger next to the Metreon. No WiFi, but who the heck needs it when the food is this good! Don't forget the garlic fries! Mmmm...
author: George L.

description: Super Duper Burgers?.......... Yeah. That about sums it up. I ordered the super duper burger with bacon, jalapeños, and cheese. It was absolutely delicious! The garlic fries were just as amazing. What surprised me was the speed. How such  great burgers and fries can be made in such short time! Average waiting time seemed about 3-5 minutes for the burger (Average out of 6 people). To me this seemed like a premium burger meets fast food. The place is very clean and the staff is very friendly. Next time I'm in San Francisco I am definitely coming back here again, as are all my friends..... Screw it, I'll come back in 5hrs. I'm getting this for dinner as well. Lol.
author: Victor C.

description: Burger was excellent! Garlic fries were incredible as well. The meats are farm raised and you can really taste the fresh ingredients. Definitely on my top 5 burger list. It was nice to enjoy a beer with the meal as well. The restaurant itself is nice and clean however the chairs are not very comfortable otherwise I would give it 5 stars. Oh and the pickles are extremely good too.
author: Tommy F.

description: Not the easiest to find parking but you could always go in the mall garage.  Hardest working staff in the biz- super friendly - 5 stars for all of them.  Only reason one star was docked was for the burgers - not quite In - n - Out or Umami but maybe that's a reach cause nothing can beat those. Also you can get a beer on tap or wine. Pickle bar is a great touch. My favorite (as always) were the french fries.  Garlic fries were so good, i got out of kissing ma boo goodnight!
author: Ally Y.

description: Food was not bad but not particularly memorable. Prices are a little high but I suppose average for San Francisco. The burgers are good but very reminiscent of a plain good burger done at a backyard BBQ. My friend described it as pedestrian and I would agree. The chocolate shake with strawberries was a little better but for $5.50 I don't think it was worth it. Definitely not very thick. I say this place is worth a try but don't get pulled into the hype.
author: John N.

description: This has been one of the best burgers I have since moving to Northern CA. They cook all burgers to Medium. I had the mini burger which is one patty. It was so juicy and so good. The fries were nice and crispy. It's a little on the pricey side the reason I did't give 5 stars, but will eat here again.
author: Yvonne P.

description: Excellent staff and excellent garlic fries. While walking on Market St, we checked out the menu thinking it was another gimmicky burger joint. A guy eating ice cream next to the door told us that "it's real good," and to order fries. Took his word for it and the entire group ended up happy with this decision vs going to the Ferry building for some street food. According to my grandparents, the burgers were fantastic. I only had the fries myself, but as a lover of garlic, I was over the moon.
author: Anne M.

description: This is now my favorite burger place in the world outside of Southern California (In n Out and Tommy's are hard to beat).  It even rivals those SoCal favorites when taking into account the extra attention to details such as sourcing of ingredients, health and freshness.   The menu was diversified for a burger joint and they even offer beer on tap.  Further, the staff was awesome as were the Garlic Fries.  Lastly, I would be remiss if I didn't specifically mention that the burger (double with cheese) was hot, fresh, mouthwatering and sooooo delicious.   You must try this place.  I can't wait to go back.  Please come to L.A.....Pleasel!!!!!!
author: Michael H.

description:
Went to the Metreon for a movie and saw a sign saying "show you movie ticket and get free fries @ Super Duper Burger".

Ordered the Super Burger (2 8oz patties) for $6.75.  Very juicy and not engulfed by a huge bun.  Fries were great... and free.

Also noticed that you can get free fries during happy hour if you purchase beer or wine.

Took about 10 minutes for the food.  Not bad, considering it was made to order.

Will definitely be back.
author: Steve L.

description: After hunting around for food in San Francisco for food I remember that Super Duper Burgers was around the corner from where we were standing. This place is always busy and finding a table is difficult however the patience and wait time is worth the taste of the burgers.
author: Andy M.

description: This Super Duper's newest location--on Mission St @ 4th St--next to the entrance of the new City Target. Super Duper is reliable- it's quick, it's very good, plus they offer two burger sizes; 4oz or 8oz. During the week, to beat the lunch crowd, be here no later than 11:40am or come after 1pm. Good overall burger, and an even better chicken sandwich--and it's moist, not dry. I've been to all the SF locations, this one is blocks away from my office, so it's the one I go to at least once a week.
author: Al G.

description: I think for a burger place this place is too expensive for what you get.  Compared to the Habit or In-N-Out, I don't think the burgers here compare.  Partially because they char the outside, and I don't really enjoy eating burnt burger, and the overal flavor didn't really hit the spot.  The garlic fries were amazing, and I'd say only one of the dipping sauces was that great.  I think it's overpriced, and I don't generally complain, but a shake is 4.50 and a cone is 2.50?  Maybe it's because I thought this place was more fast-food, but it generally tastes fast food for non fast food prices.  I also felt the inside of the place wasn't that clean or set up well, there were a lot of people milling about in the front where you're supposed to wait for your food and get your condiments, water etc so it gets crowded and overall wasn't that enjoyable of an experience.
author: Sophia D.

description: The burgers here are pretty good. The mini burger is about the size of a standard burger. What I do love here are the garlic fries! I like my fries cheesy and crispy and thats how they make it. I also tried the veggie burger with egg which I personally like better than the regular burger. Don't get me wrong the burgers are good, I'm just very particular with how I like my burger meat. I will always come back back here! Friendly staff!
author: Brigitte M.

description: These were the best burgers I had ever had, with the juiciest meat. Truly amazing. The fries are great! Staff are nice and polite. Super duper burgers all right. Craving a burger? This is an excellent choice!!!!!!!!!
author: Sarah E.

description: Super duper greasy.  The grease will soak through the burger wrapper and the bag they put it in.  But, the burger tastes good.  Although I did get a raw burger from them last time I went.  The ice cream and pickles are great.  But for the raw burger I got once, I'd probably give 4 stars. Also, very friendly service.
author: Caleb A.

description: if 10 stars were available YOU would get it!  My local SF self stumbled into my 1st Super Duper today after Target grand slam opening - feeling weary, worn out from Target check out lines and hungry. Kudos to Manager Ed and Assistant Natalie - you all made my 1st Super Duper a sooper dooper experience! Thanks for gifting me with the fries (my Weight Watchers points were used up but worth it!). This place is immaculate - the burger is steaming hot, quality quality quality meat and oh man let's talk about the pickles! If you're from NYC you're gonna think you're back home in the pickle district! I may have to pop for a few of those pickle jars as Christmas gifts! I'll be baaaack and on countdown  to bring along some SF pals too. Thank YOU for creating 'slow food' in a great fast way.
author: Judi B.

description: Great burger place and it's closer to work than the one on market street. Perfectly positioned for take-out in yerba buena gardens.
author: Daniel V.

description: My mini burger was delicious. Had cheese and bacon on it of course! The best part of my experience was the free homemade pickles! yum yum! Very fast service.
author: Charmaine T.

description: An awesome burger. It was everything I could hope for. Unusually moist and delicious. Their home made pickles are crisp and a perfect addition to the burger. Loved the garlic cheese fries too.
author: Chico L.

description: Loved the juicy chicken and the chipotle sauce. The garlic fries topped it off great. So tempting to get their delicious looking soft serve cones
author: Mehul M.

description: Super Duper burgers is one of my favorite burger joint in San Francisco. Their vegetarian burger with garlic fries and soda (I usually go for combo meal) is just amazing. Normally cost around 12 dollars but its definitely worth it. Their veggie burger comes with veggie patty which tastes fresh and great along with other vegetables, avocado and jack cheese. I highly recommend this place!
author: Prateek G.

description: I ordered the mini burger and a side order of fries. It was a good size burger for me especially since I usually can't finish a regular size one. The fries were nothing special. I would come back again for the burger. Next time I will make sure to remember to add a fried egg.
author: Ka L.

description: There are quite a few of these restaurants popping up around San Francisco, and I'm loving it. Had a burger with avocado and fries, and it was pretty delicious. The burgers were very much in the style of a 50's diner in the sense that they were smaller and didn't look frozen or processed. I've heard the shakes are good too although I didn't have one this time around. The service was fairly quick. The only reason I gave it 4 stars was because their menu isn't that extensive. However, the simplicity is good for a burger focused restaurant.
author: Amanda R.

description: Delicious! I like that they slice red onions super thin so you can enjoy the taste, not be overwhelmed by it. The soft serve was also delicious. Can't wait to come back.
author: Lida M.

description: Not totally sure what all the hyper over Super Duper is, but this is the first time I've actually eaten food at one (I have a lot of friends who like to drag me here for their munchies (drunchies??)). It's just okay. I got the kid's size burger and it was oily/drippy so it was messy to eat. My fries were way oversalted and I couldn't even finish them. They also have really weak glassware...which makes me worried for people who become aggressive when drunk. When I was bussing my tray away, I put my cup in the cup section and that force actually broke a beer glass! Eee.
author: Melody L.

description: Second time at this place, a MASSIVE burger. Not sure what they're doing, but something is going on this place that is very consistent.
author: Phill B.

description:
I ordered the Super Burger.  It was one of the tastiest burgers I've had, juicy the way I like them!  (They use Niman Ranch beef.)  Wanted more!

I suggest not using ketchup and mustard, which would mask the excellent taste.  The pickles were good too.

Super Duper failed to include the sauteed onions that I requested in my order.  I went back and got it on the side.  Unfortunately, it was slightly bitter.  I've had better in many other burger joints.  Because of this, if I could, I would have given Super Duper 4.5 stars.
author: East Bay R.

description: I got here just in time, there was no line when I walked in. Then about 5 people followed shortly after me, probably because they were handing out free fries outside. :) I I got the chicken sandwich combo to go ($13 with tip). I think they changed the bun since the last time I ate there. It is now served on this super tasty bread, ciabatta maybe? Whatever it was it was delicious and just what I was craving.
author: Christy Z.

description:
Great burger joint

Look and feel it is very similar to a Chipolte with modern stainless minimalistic interior 

Order at the front and they give you a notifier style ordering. 

The burger was good (nice to have a place that knows how to put a good tasty crust on the outside without overcooking the interior) warning they do serve it dripping it is a messy meal!

Garlic fries were good a bit on the strong side but that's totally on me ordering something that by its very nature is supposed to be strong flavored. 

I would go back!
author: Jered R.

description: Good burgers, but i dont get the hype?
author: Carolyn D.

description:
3.5 stars?! burger was decent. shake was good. like the option of a smaller burger and adding the egg (egg was fried just the way i like it :D).

i got a mini burger (4 ounce) + egg ($1) + free toppings (lettuce, grilled onions, tomato, and "super sauce"). the bun was toasted. egg was over easy/medium (it was good). the sauce was unmemorable, though. i don't recall how the meat was like... my bad. but i think it was decent enough.

shared an Oreo shake, too. i liked it better than Holy Grill's, though not the best. 

didn't get any fries though :(
author: Diana C.

description: Great chicken sandwich and all the pickles you can eat!
author: John D.

description:
The hamburger heavens opened up and this restaurant was plopped down onto earth to give us humans a taste of the holiness. I got a cheeseburger when I came here. After filling my burger with the free and delicious pickles I literally lifted my head, opened my mouth and shoved this burger down my throat. Every taste bud in my mouth was instantly made happy and I experienced a food high that neared nirvana. 

When it came to the garlic French fries, I stretched my mouth way beyond its normal capacity and shoved as many fries as I could in. As I started to suffocate, I remembered to breathe and eat my food more slowly, because dying of suffocation would probably ruin my meal.  I washed everything down with a delicious beer and proceeded to go into a food coma with a permanent grin on my face because of the yummy food and my heavy pocket. One of the best burgers I have had in SF for the price. Please eat here. It is amazing.
author: Farien F.

description: Im only reviewing the soft serve.  For $3.25 for a soft serve ice cream cone, it better be amazing! I definitely could tell there was a difference in taste versus McDonald's soft serve since it was "organic" but I'd still go for McDonald's soft serve. I got the chocolate and vanilla cone swirl and the consistency was pretty thick. It didn't melt immediately or make a huge mess.  I didn't give the cone 5 stars because of the price.
author: Jeena L.

description: Great restaurant! It was my frist time with some friends and we all loved the place. The waiter was very helpful!
author: Sirasit S.

description: Got a burger and fries, everything was cooked perfectly and tasted wonderful; really fresh. This place is great after a movie since it's located in the Metreon, must remember to order a Super Burger next time instead since the mini was small like the name suggests.
author: Timothy K.

description: I think this an example of a good idea gone bad.  I went to the original (I think it was the original) in the Castro and it was great good burger good service loved it.  I just went to this one and it was OK.  The burger was dry nowhere near Medium like the sign says.  I asked for blue cheese and I think I got a teaspoon. As I ate the burger I tasted in in maybe 3 bites.  I asked for the fries well done and got what I would consider regular no real crunch.  Ice Tea is OK Service was quick but since the food wasn't that great I'd rather wait and get it right so I'm not counting that as a plus.  Also the music was too loud.  It is bad enough this place is packed at lunch time turn the music down a little! I hope they fix this or they will go the way of most chains!
author: Kevin C.

description: Bigger size with blue cheese, bacon and an egg. Best burger I've ever had.
author: Elliott S.

description: Have been here a few times.  the burgers are good but a bit greasy.  From a quality standpoint it is decent (to me, the Counter is a bit better) but this place is great for a quick bite out at lunch time.  The employees are friendly and the service is quick.  Fantastic shakes.
author: Rob K.

description: This location is poorly run. It just feels like a lesser super duper experience. Slower greasier, and overall ruder. Weird. Best go to the one on market instead.
author: Noza C.

description: Shitty experience tonight. My cashier was doing two things at once and I could barely understand his mumbling. But that was only the beginning of my awesome dining. 10 minutes pass and I'm curious why my 1 chicken sandwich is not up. I was the only person in line when I entered. 12 minutes pass I approach the counter steady knowing my ticket was lost. I say.. Its been longer than it should be for my food. And I get the response with an attitude that chicken takes longer than burgers. Had handed her my receipt to confirm.. She handed it back. I want and sat down for another 5 minutes and then I was pissed when I still did not see my food and the chefs had no tickets hanging. I go up and say my where is my food. She goes and confirms that my ticket was lost. Then she comes back and says "they lost the ticket, do you want your money back.." Are you fucking serious. Is said, "no I came here to eat and I have already been here 25 minutes. She takes my ticket which I know does not have the stuff I asked them to not put on my sandwich and brings it to the chefs. I asked her about my changes and she said I assumed you didn't change anything. So bad. Please fire this girl. I wait another 8 minutes and I get my sloppily made sandwich. It was fine.  Service was fucking horrific start to finish. I hate eating angry. Get your shit together. Cheers
author: Zac W.

description: Would have given it zero stars if I could.  Definitely nothing super about it.  The taste of my burger was off.  I took a bite and left the burger (as well as that bite) on the plate.
author: Aviel U.

description: Love love love this spot! The food is delicious and I never feel full and weighed down with "unclean" ingredients. I first tried this place with my son on New Years Day. It was open late and the reviews were all great. They're organic shakes and burgers are deelish!
author: N L.

description: Amazing chicken sandwich! Their chipotle aioli is insanely good. Located in a good area of SF. Mini burgers are super tiny but the flavor of the meat is really delicious. Everything is tender and juicy. Chicken is free range and the buns are freshly baked. Ingredients are really good quality. And the fries are great! This place is delicious all around. Highly recommend.
author: Alina B.

description: The best burger I've ever had.  Perfectly cooked, pink in the middle, fresh toppings, and friendly service.  My new place for a quality burger.
author: Orry M.

description: Best place ever! If I could eat here every day I would, but then I would get fat, and probably have liver damage because their spiked shakes are the shizz!
author: Erin H.

description: This was one of the best burgers ever!  I was shopping in the city with sis and we wanted to have a quick fabulous lunch. We almost didn't come here as we read its always crowded. It was, but by the time the food was ready we had a seat. We both had a mini burger ( which was big enough for us) and shared fries which were delicious. I will definitely make this a regular stop for me when I'm in the city!
author: Shelli K.

description: These burgers were indeed super duper...as was the resulting food coma. Seriously I INHALED a single-patty burger with everything on it, a huge order of Garlic Fries and, of course, a Fresh Strawberry Shake, and if I wasn't rendered speechless via caloric intake, I probably could have thrown on a poodle skirt and sock hopped around the building in pure, unadulterated burger joy. The fare here is classic American, and they execute it perfectly without too many bells and whistles. The burgers are cooked Medium and have the oh, so desirable char-grilled flavor complemented perfectly by fresh juicy toppings. The Garlic Fries are a decadence on all on their own, and one that 100% requires a post-consumption piece of gum to kick the garlic, fire breath. My favorite part just may have been the shake though. So fresh I was worried about picking strawberries seeds out of my teeth! I wasn't expecting to get down on a burger and fries in the Mission, but ecstatic that I did. Thanks Super Duper, and hey, keep up the super-duper-ness.
author: Katie C.

description: I love this place. Perfectly juicy burgers, and their cookies & cream shake is dangerously addictive. The garlic fries are no joke, so be warned.
author: Greg H.

description: Absolutely love the Super burgers and garlic fries.. could do with more seating though.. I always have to wait in line for 30-40 mins.. but its ALL worth it for these awesome.. mouthwatering.. juicy burgers and sinfully delicious fries.
author: Geetanjali G.

description: This place is right next to my gym so it's pretty convient.  The good news is you can tell the meat is pretty fresh and not full of fillers.  It tastes like hamburgers I'd make myself.  That's the good part, the bad part is that I make slightly above average hamburgers.  It a  good place though.
author: Byron W.

description: Everything was quite good and reasonably priced. Burger was juicy and the fries were good. I liked their pickles as well. A nice reasonably priced and not too greasy burger option for lunch.
author: Ben L.

description: I love to eat burgers and I have to say this are one of the best!! The place is fine.  the only reason I give it a 4 stars is because they are a little to small.  But the taste is great.  will come back
author: Lorena R.

description: Ok burger, fries were disappointing.  It came out quicker than expected given the signs and reviews, but it wasn't too busy.  Overall, not a bad place if you want a quick burger and you're in the area.
author: Mike M.

description: Don't eat here!!!! I have never had food poisoning until I ate here and I have eaten in some pretty sketchy places in India and Egypt. I ate here and got sick.  The worst part was I had a flight in the morning so I was throwing up all night and in the airport and in the plane. Needless to say, I won't be eating here again.
author: Sarah G.

description: Burger was awesome, fries hot n fresh, ambience was good, service was great, and prices weren't too bad considering this is San Francisco. I'll definitely eat here again since it is not too far from my work. Only thing is I wish they had more seating as we had to wait a bit for a table to open up for our party of five.
author: T J.

description:
charred on the outside, juicy on the inside.  beats five guys, hands down.

this is one great burger, using free range beef.
author: Victory P.

description: OMG! Super delicious, really fresh tasting burgers! Absolutely stop by and try this place!
author: Heather P.

description: Pretty good quick burger place next to the new Shitty Target. The one patty burger is enough for me, some free toppings and you're good to go. The fries are pretty good and I like the three dips option. Been here three times; pretty consistently good.
author: Walter P.

description: Dang! I fell for the mini burger combo! Don't do it! You will have wished you just went to Burger King and got something with a classic taste. The regular fries...no flavor unless you like oil flavor... kinda lame. Also, what's up with the pickles? These garlic cloves taste like water and so do the chili peppers. These are not real pickles. I'm sure there are better options on the menu! There is nothing spicy here. Also I do not recommend the ice tea...it doesn't go with burgers...don't know why I ventured to it. This place reminds me of a sad and dreary Fuddruckers. However, there may be hope if you just order something different than what I did and steer clear of the pickles and ice tea.
author: Wanjiru K.

description: the smell when u walk in? makes u want to get more than 1 burger.  they have the super with 2 pattys ior the mini 1 patty. just had the 1 patty, was not that hungry this time, but MAN! it was deeeeelish! must get the super next time for sure. garlic fries weren't bad, alil soggy but good. definetly a fan!
author: Ray E.

description: niman ranch beef, BEST garlic fries, chocolate dipped soft serve, house pickles!!
author: Matt Z.

description: Very Juicy! Remind me of the burger i had at Sausalito! Garlic french fries are tasty too. But should not eat before going back to work!
author: Le A.

description:
BLEH! this place looks good and the prices are decent, but let me warn you - i got the chicken sandwich, which was decent, in fact a little too salty. BUT this is the cherry on top, my brother's girlfriend ordered a salad, which she couldn't finish, so my brother decided to finish it off. lo and behold, a DEAD LADYBUG AT THE BOTTOM OF THE SALAD!!! BLEHHHHH!!!!! YUCK! talk about a little too freaking fresh! man. gross. we complained and the server asked if she could get us something else. we said no obviously. we got our money back, but she joked "hey, extra protein!" ummm...why don't you eat the ladybug then? not going back.
* Update: just received an email from the manager, which was very nice and reassuring. I originally gave them 1 star, but I will boost it to 3. I still stick by saying that their food is decent, albeit a little greasy. And I didn't enjoy the worker's sarcasm. I appreciate the apology from the manager.
author: Jay E.

description: tied for my favorite place in the city to get a burger (that's affordable). the burgers are huge, the flavor is fantastic.. and the special sauce. can't go wrong with that! house made pickles are always a hit and the fries are good too. and who can turn down a spiked milkshake? (assuming one has room, that is...).
author: laura f.

description: In town on business and stumbled into super duper. The burger was just that - super! Fresh and juicy burger with a wide variety of fresh toppings. The fries were good. The staff was friendly and Natalie the manager took the time to tell me the history of SDB.  No wonder I returned the next day for the chicken sandwich (excellent sandwich and on great bread) and shake. Oh, did I mention that you can get a beer with your burger! Thank you Natalie for your hospitality....next time in town, I"ll be back!
author: Doug B.

description: Their veggie burger and fries are fabulous.  The burger is messy, though, so be prepared to keep putting it back together as the bun falls apart.  Also note that there are onions on the veggie burger and it doesn't mention them on the menu, so if like me you would rather not have onions, tell them when you are ordering. Also. I didn't love the sauce option for the fries.  Save the extra dollar, the fries are great without condiments.
author: Whatsnext M.

description: I love the setting and the atmosphere- it's like a classy burger joint.  I found the staff to be very kind and welcoming. The burger itself, however, was nothing exceptional. I think my biggest complaint was that the bun was extremely soggy.  Also, the burger was missing flavor.
author: Anna P.

description: mmmmmmmmm.....I have been to multiple locations and have been surprised at the overall consistent level of quality in both food and service. If you want an awesome, juicy buger, this is your place. The regular (one patty) burger is plenty food for me and I highly recommend the garlic fries on the side. I love that they provide all the homemade pickles you can eat and the ambiance is clean and accomodating.
author: Lindsay G.

description: the host really ruined my super duper experience. i ordered my super duper w/ garlic fries hoping to get a "super" meal for lunch at work. usually at the other super duper location in downtown, i'd be able to order and finish my meal at location on time to get back to work. but at this location, i guess they would rather get all the orders that has garlic fries and call them all at once rather then serving their customers in timely fashion. so this really stalled me. i wouldnt think i;d have enough time to finish my meal so i asked for it to go but the host wanted to ring up the bag for 10 cents but i didnt want the hassle so i told her ill just eat it in. instead of giving me my super duper, she gave me a mini burger. i knew something was up when her coworker tried to intervene to tell her shes serving the wrong order to me. before i realized this, i had already taken a bite of the burger. i was in a rush so i didnt even bother bringing my order back. there's two locations downtown, i hope they keep the employees, at least the hostess with short dark hair in her place.
author: Johnny T.
